name: Woody Woodpecker wird gejagt
description:
One player (Woody Woodpecker) starts at the red center space. The other players start at the corners of their color. Movement is determined by a die. Woody Woodpecker may move in any direction, the hunters may only move forward. They are only allowed to use the blue dots if they are on a rectangular blue space and roll a 1 or a 6. If a hunter player catches Woody Woodpecker, he gets a chip and changes the roles with the Woody Woodpecker player. Woody Woodpecker continues to play, while the hunters have to roll a 6 to continue their hunt.
The player who has the most chips after an agreed on amount of time wins the game.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Neocity 2081
description:
This game was attached to the ioGioco 7 magazine.

The evil boss Karl Blueyes organizes illegal futuristic motorcycle races every Saturday night, thus fueling his profitable round of illegal business. In the improvised arena that uses city streets, the champions of the two most feared urban gangs, the Wheels of Judgment and the Gods of Atomic Speed, face off. During the race, the two drivers try to put the opposing motorcycle at gunpoint using the light tracer. Who at the end of the race will have scored more tracers on the other bike will be the winner!

To move his motorcycle, the player plays one of his numbered cards. At the end of the turn, a tracer can also play in the space provided. If a player plays a card to move, the value of which is equal to that of a tracer already played, this tracer is activated and the motorcycle behind (to understand who it is, you need to determine the shorter arc that separates the two motorcycles) can shoot, taking by the tracer card. On the tracer cards there are the symbols of the hits, whoever has collected the most hits at the end of the race wins.

—user summary

name: Dirty Highlights
description:
This game was attached to the ioGioco 8 magazine.

The race has just ended but some fraudulent directors are not interested in telling the truth. Everyone is in the pay of a different team and tries, with still images, forward and rewind, to mount a summary of the race that gives greater visibility to the team for which he works in secret.

The game board represents the last section of the circuit, and is divided into squares. The cars are three-dimensional and are moved in turn by each player following precise rules (the machines move one or two squares only orthogonally and pushing each other), five times before determining the end of the lap. Thanks to special cards ("Freeze", "Skip" and "Prev & Play") it is possible to influence the sequence of movements.

—user summary

name: Bacchematica
description:
This game was attached to issue 11 of the ioGioco magazine.

The forest is full of juicy berries and fragrant fruits. Each animal, sniffing the air, listening to the rustle of the leaves and calculating the best routes, tries to reach the richest bushes. But other gluttons target the same succulent fruits. We must hurry, before someone faster blows us under the nose, or better to say under the muzzle, our favorite acorns or the red strawberries.

Each turn you draw a bush tile characterized by a value (its position in the woods) and two mathematical operations. Then you turn a "track" piece, which indicates numerical values corresponding to colored positions. The player tries to use the numerical values together with the operations, putting them in the right order on his board to reach a number as close as possible to that of the bush.

—user summary

name: Glass Bead
description:
Glass Bead is a territory game for two players: Red and Blue. It is played on the spaces of an initially empty square board. Recommended sizes are between 7x7 and 10x10 spaces. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.

An empty space is controlled by the player with more stones adjacent to it. Diagonal adjacencies also count. A space occupied by a stone is controlled by the owner of that stone.

Red plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, you must place a stone of your color on a empty space that is not controlled by either player.

The game ends when no more placements are possible. The player who controls more spaces in the final position wins.

According to the designer, this game, later reworked into Kuzushi, suffers from a huge first-player advantage. It is suggested to use komi (compensation points for the second player) to solve this issue.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition

name: Legends of Destiny
description:
Legends of Destiny is a wild west board game for 1 to 4 players taking about 1.5 to 2 hours. You and your friends are competing to be the biggest legends of the town of Destiny. Track your character's assets and abilities on role playing style character sheets. Each turn, players will move and draw one destiny card and play one card. All interactions in the game are dictated by the play of your destiny cards. Purchase better weapons, boots, a new hat or a horse. Visit the doctor or buy some snake oil. Gamble or buy whiskey at the local saloons. Gunfights will occur and and law will issue wanted posters for gunmen. The player who completes six missions first is the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Role Playing

name: You are the ghost
description:
A prentender game: One player is the pretender (in this game "ghost")and try to pass as a "normal" player:
Everyone except the pretender is hearing the same sound via a smart device and then picks a card and explains why this card fits to the sound. The pretender still as to pick a card and bluff. At the end everyone tries to find the pretender.
Points are awarded for correctly guessing the pretender and for the pertender if he gets annoticed or, if he is caught, can guess which sound the other players have heard

name: Trailer Truckin'
description:
Players start with one Semi and two trailers and $4000. Each player rolls the dice to determine where on the game board the player’s trailers are to be placed . Each location has a money amount which the player will earn by retrieving the trailer and bringing it to the terminal. The trailer is placed in a new random location every time it is brought back to the terminal. Players roll dice to move their Semis on the game board in turn. Players will encounter event spaces, penalties, and bonuses along the way. The first player to return to the terminal with both trailers and a predetermined amount of cash is the winner.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Set-up

name: Secret Sinners
description:
Secret Sinners is a turn-based strategic card game where each player must fight in a King of the Hill-esque setting to earn the only spot through the gates of heaven. Hide your past sins carefully and accuse others of being evil to send them straight down the fiery depths of hell!

Each player’s character card is randomly placed in a vertical line formation, between heaven and hell, to create the play area.

The goal: Be the first player to enter Heaven with the help of the only Heaven’s Bell card, by being the last player in the line when all others have fallen into Hell or by confessing all your sins.

Players take turns playing different Action cards. Use these cards to scheme diabolical strategies, affecting the character line in various ways. Betray, steal and “sin” your way to victory!

As the game progresses, players will accumulate Sin cards. Discuss amongst yourselves to flesh these players out! Hide your sins carefully, for any suspicious player might accuse you and mark you as an evil player. On the other hand, if you manage to go unnoticed and accumulate enough sin cards, you can confess all your sins and win the game!

There are multiple Hell’s Bell cards and one single Heaven’s Bell card that players will draw as the game progresses. These cards stay in play and are activated at the end of the player’s turn, either granting victory to the player closest to heaven or severely punishing the player in front of hell.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, King of the Hill, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Buy Peace With None: Six Scenarios for Whuppin' Jonathon
description:
Buy peace with none.

Six ready to go scenarios enabling you to refight some of the most iconic battles of the struggle.
Each has a map, full orders of battle, special rules and explanations, and a brief historical summary.
Designed for use with Whuppin’ Jonathon, Vandering Publication’s wargames rules for recreating land warfare in the War of 1812, but capable of being adapted for any ruleset.

The scenarios are:

Queenston Heights - the first real battle of the war of 1812. The British are hopelessly outnumbered but have a good defensive position against an overwhelming number of decidedly indifferent American militia. It’s a race against time for the Americans to land enough troops to overwhelm the defenders before more British troops arrive.
Frenchtown (from the British version of the rules Whuppin’ Jonathon). An attack upon a defended position with very nearly equal numbers of troops.
Stoney creek - a desperate surprise night attack by a small British force against a much larger American one. The attackers have only a few turns to win before they are overwhelmed.
Chippewa - one the largest set piece battles of the war. It is the basis for two scenarios. The first is an epic struggle in occluded terrain between opposing light infantry forces. The second is a full scale “knock-em” out massed musketry duel.
Lundy’s Lane - the most even large scale battle of the war. The British have the numbers and a good defensive position, the Americans are more concentrated and, overall, have better quality troops and equipment.


This is the AMERICAN version of this scenario book, featuring US spelling, priority, and letter format. The UK version is A smell of Gunpowder.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: A Smell of Gunpowder: Six War of 1812 Scenarios for use with Whuppin' Jonathon
description:
A smell of gunpowder

Six ready to go scenarios enabling you to refight some of the most iconic battles of the struggle.
Each has a map, full orders of battle, special rules and explanations, and a brief historical summary.
Designed for use with Whuppin’ Jonathon, Vandering Publication’s wargames rules for recreating land warfare in the War of 1812, but capable of being adapted for any ruleset.

The scenarios are:

Queenston Heights - the first real battle of the war of 1812. The British are hopelessly outnumbered but have a good defensive position against an overwhelming number of decidedly indifferent American militia. It’s a race against time for the Americans to land enough troops to overwhelm the defenders before more British troops arrive.
Stoney creek - a desperate surprise night attack by a small British force against a much larger American one. The attackers have only a few turns to win before they are overwhelmed.
Chippewa - one the largest set piece battles of the war. It is the basis for two scenarios. The first is an epic struggle in occluded terrain between opposing light infantry forces. The second is a full scale “knock-em” out massed musketry duel.
Lundy’s Lane - the most even large scale battle of the war. The British have the numbers and a good defensive position, the Americans are more concentrated and, overall, have better quality troops and equipment.
Malcolm Mills (from the American version of the rules “Whuppin’ John Bull”). A superior American force tries to rout a smaller British one in a good defensive position before reinforcements arrive.


This is the BRITISH version of this scenario book, featuring anglicised spelling, priority and A5 format.
The US version is "Buy peace with none".

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: El Palé: TelePizza
description: El Palé is a Spanish game very similar to Monopoly. The standard El Palé had a square board with 11 spaces on each side. The TelePizza promotional version (released as a marketing campaign for the large Spanish pizza chain, co-sponsored by Coca-Cola) had a smaller, rectangular board, with 9 spaces on the longer sides and 7 spaces on the shorter sides. Instead of the standard version's streets of Madrid, the properties in this version are city names from throughout Spain, as well as TelePizza factory locations and methods of delivery transportation. The currency was redesigned to feature a pizza chef silhouette in the middle, and says it is from "Banco Telepizza". The Suerte (Luck) cards have the TelePizza logo on the back, and the Sorpresa (Surprise) cards have the Coca-Cola logo on the back.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Veggie Loto
description: Oh my! The fruits and vegetables have escaped from the basket! To recover them, you must roll the best dice combinations to win counters. The first player to place all their counters on their lotto card is declared the winner. The ideal game to boost concentration and develop strategic thinking.

name: Star Battle 2275 AD
description:
Star Battle 2275 AD is a free PNP solitaire hex-based space combat simulator wargame for 1 player. Use your fleet of fighters to attack and destroy the enemy fleet. But watch out for fighters, cruisers, battle stations and asteroids. Can also be played by 2 players, with one player replacing the AI.

You will need:
This rule set
2 pages of Command Cards and counters (14 cards, 17 counters)
4 hex map pages (or you can use any printed one-inch hex map)
1 6d
colored beads or cubes as markers

In 2-player play, both fleets should be chosen so that their total number of Shield points, added together, is roughly equal. For solo play, give the AI side a 25-50% advantage. Solitaire players can play either fleet, and use the AI system to determine the opponent’s movements.

For small fleets with no more than 2 or 3 ships per side, two Hex Map boards should provide sufficient space. Larger fleets may require all four Hex Map boards for sufficient room.

Each turn, the Players move the ships in their fleet. In solo play, an AI dice table determines the opponent's moves. Ships maneuver to get within firing range of their opponent's ships. Combat is resolved by dice throw.

The difficulty level of Star Battle 2275 AD can be adjusted by varying the number and type of ships in each fleet. The game can also be made more difficult by adding navigational hazards such as Asteroids, which block line of sight and prevent travel within the hexes they cover.

Players win by destroying the opponent fleet.

—description from the designer

name: Steampunk Rules!
description:
Steampunk Rules!
A set of rules for fantastical skirmish games in the late Victorian era, each player usually has a force of 5-10 28mm figures.
Ideal for multi-player games with an umpire to create a scenario to play.

Comes with some example forces to use or as a guide to creating your own and also a multi-player scenario.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Stars and Steel: Fate and Glory
description:
Fate and Glory

Card based Stars and Steel module adding the random in-game events.

Includes one page of rules and 48 event cards for double-side printing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Hostile Environment: Walk – Mech Skirmish Rules
description:
In 2042, the world has entered a state of Total Anarchy.

P68P, an airborne poisonous pollen has wiped out 20% of the Earth’s population with no answer in sight. The United States has broken apart into a civil war, while a World War wages on in the East. Walks, giant war machines clash across the lands burying their enemies in their dust.

Hostile Environment: Walk is a fast-playing tactical miniatures wargame for 1-4 players.

It is played on hex maps with 1/285th scale miniatures. It uses a chit-pull system to keep opponents on their toes. Each round is broken into four action phases for each squad. Players may activate any single unit, or they may roll dice in an attempt to activate extra units.

Once activated, a unit uses Action Points to flank its enemies and unleash Hell. The action is fast and vicious.

Chain guns, rail guns, lasers, missiles, rockets, toxic smoke, and fire rip through armor leaving death in its wake.

Each unit comes with a card to track its ammo, heat, special abilities, and hit points. With an array of over 10 different weapon systems and hardpoints, players can create the Walk of their dreams.

Players form their crews with Walks, tanks, artillery, and other post-modern war machines, then battle over different scenarios for victory.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Civil War, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Skirmish Elite: Normandy '44 – Falaise Firestorm
description:
Skirmish Elite: Normandy ’44- Falaise is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the fierce fighting to close the Falaise Gap in August 1944.

The book features the Allied 90th U.S. Infantry, 4th Canadian Armoured and 1st Polish Armoured Divisions trying to prevent the escape of the German 2nd Panzer and 3rd Parachute Divisions.
Simultaneously, the 2nd SS Panzer Division is attacking into the pocket to aid the escape.
The book includes ten scenarios that can be played alone or together in three linked campaigns.

Maximum Replayability: the Skirmish Elite system features a realistic variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book contains a unit-by-unit day-by-day account of the chaotic fighting.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Skirmish Elite: Aussies at Bardia
description:
SKIRMISH ELITE: Aussies at Bardia 1941

This is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the 6th Australian Division’s struggle in North Africa to capture the fortress of Bardia from four Italian divisions in January of 1941.
The book includes eight scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of two campaigns.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information and two maps on the campaign for Bardia.

Includes:

8 Scenarios,
2 Campaigns


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Skirmish Elite: Combat Jump – Sicily
description:
Skirmish Elite: Combat Jump - Sicily

WW2: The 82nd Airborne vs the Herman Goring Division
(8) scenarios and (2) campaigns.

A complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the 82nd Airborne Division’s capture of the strategic road junction “Objective Y” on the first day of the invasion of Sicily in 1943

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Skirmish Ragers: Medieval Mayhem – Medieval  Funfair
description:
Medieval Mayhem is the first supplement to Skirmish RAGERS, and has been completed in collaboration with Studio Miniatures.

Medieval Mayhem adds a different dimension to the core rules. The tourists in the Medieval Mayhem Medieval Funfair were expecting entertainment, valiant knights, humble peasants and damsels in distress. Instead, they got the outbreak of a zombie apocalypse. While not the best place to find ones self when the zombie horde surface it was far from the worst. The knights may be fake, but at least their weapons are sharp(ish), and of course the armour offers some form of protection!

Do you have what it takes to gain a position at the round table, or even just a seat at Ye Olde Pub...

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, Zombies

name: Arlequin
description:
Arlequin is a chess variant played on an 8x8 board colored in a pattern of red, yellow and blue squares. Pieces (except for the king) are translucent tiles of yellow and blue plastic, with different colored markings on them showing parts of chess pieces. When the piece moves to a different colored square, different markings blend into the background color and a different piece type becomes visible.

The object, as in chess, is to checkmate the opposing king.

—user summary

name: SkirmishCampaigns: France '40 – Withdrawal to Dunkirk
description:
SkirmishCampaigns France '40 – Withdrawal to Dunkirk is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the last days of fighting around the Dunkirk perimeter in May 1940.

The book includes twelve scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of five campaigns.

This book is fully compatible with the other three books in the SkirmishCampaigns France ’40 series (Battles for the Meuse, The Ghost Division, and Hunters of the Ardennes).

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information and history on the campaign near Dunkirk. This book also features a bibliography of sources.

Includes:

12 Scenarios,
5 Campaigns


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: In Mort Veritas
description:
These are a set of fairly simple and somewhat light-hearted wargame rules for the “Ancient” period, which I am treating as post-Biblical to circa 1000 AD; beyond this point the rise of the Feudal knight changes both the nature and tempo of warfare, which I feel is better represented as a separate sub-period covering 1000-1500 AD (discuss). These rules largely stem from discussions held between myself (Martin Clark) and Dan Cunliffe, with “constructive input” from Jim Graham and Iain Law (and you thought it was just idle bickering).

—description from the designer

name: David Coulthard's Kartzee
description:
David Coulthard's Kartzee is a fun fast racing game where players have to manage their dice and tactics to be the first player to get both of their teams cars ahead of DC.

Designed by David J. Mortimer as a commission for Cooper Tires as a promotional item in the line of their Ambassador David Coulthard merchandise.

A game is played over rounds until one player ends their turn with both their cards in front of DC. At the start of a round DC moves at his current speed, which will change during the game.

Each player in turn order then performs their turn by rolling 3 dice, they must pick 1 dice for each car and then the third is used as a special tactic for one car to slip stream from a distance, overtake a car in front, nail the corners this move or to collect tactic cubes depending on what has been rolled. Tactic cubes let players manipulate the rolls on future turns. At the end of a turn the players cars will cruise up behind a car in front of them.

Managing these rolls and the numbers used for cars verses tactics is critical to success because if you enter a corner too fast you'll skid to a halt and lose your momentum and if you can get ne of your cars to punch a hole in the air for their team mate you speed will increase.

A game quick enough that you can learn to play and finish a game whilst your tires are fitted!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Outlands Mission: I've Soiled My Plants
description:
I've Soiled My Plants is an OUTLANDS mission where both players have to 'sow' a seed in a patch of 'Spice Enriched Soil', wait for the seed to germinate and then take the Sapling back to Prof. Maria Topaisz.
A little spot of gardening never hurt anyone...its the bullets whizzing past your ears that cause the damage.

So a reasonable simple and straight forward mission that experienced players shouldn't have a problem completing on the 2nd or 3rd attempt.
That's why I've Soiled my Plants has 3 levels of difficultly with better rewards for completing each increasingly difficult mission. This is a new method that adds some goals to a standard mission.

The three levels are Normal, Heroic and Master.


Normal Level:- Is the base mission. This has already been described above.
Heroic Level:- Has the same basic outline of the Normal Mission but now the players will need to harvest the Saplings before the harsh environment of the badlands kills the plants.
Master Level:- Taking Normal and Heroic levels. With the added bonus of getting the 'Harvest Saplings' of the game table in a certain amount of ACTIONS.


Each 'Level' offers new and existing OUTLAND Players a different challenge. Of course the rewards for completing each 'Level' have been increased to match the mission type.

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: SkirmishCampaigns: Normandy '44 – Monty's EPSOM
description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Normandy '44 Monty's EPSOM
This SkirmishCampaigns book is the first British-oriented book in the Normandy series and follows the British EPSOM offensive and the counter-attack by German 1st and 2nd SS Panzer Corps.
It is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the British EPSOM offensive and the counter-attacks by the German 1st and 2nd SS Panzer Corps in Normandy from 26 June to 1 July 1944.
The book includes twelve scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of four campaigns.
The book is fully compatible with its sister volumes Normandy-First Hours and Normandy-Heroes of Omaha and Panzer Lehr.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the British EPSOM Offensive in Normandy. This book also features an annotated bibliography of sources.

Includes:

12 Scenarios,
4 Campaigns


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: アニマルオークション (Animal Auction)
description:
鳥獣競売 (Choju-Okushon) アニマルオークション (ANIMAL AUCTION) is a Japanese card game with an unusual auction.

Bidding, card drafting, and set collection!!!

Make a successful bid for slightly rare animal at a bit of a curious auction!!

Each player participates in a total of eight auctions during a single session, and collects animals that has its own victory point by bidding with each other.

Players may obtain honorable titles when they collect up certain set of animals according to their requirement.

A mechanic in this game which worthy of special mention is the moneys players bid are spent immediately and will not go back to the bidder. Each player decides their bidding price secretly, and reveals at the same time. Then, each player but the lowest-bidding player will take one card from the auction lot.

The lowest-bidding player cannot take any card from this lot, but instead they take all of the money spent in that bidding!

What a bizarre auction!

Ladies and gentlemen, please try this peculiar auction by yourself!

競り×ドラフト×バッティング×セットコレクション！！！

ちょっと不思議なオークションで、ちょっと珍しい動物を競り落とそう！！

このゲームは全８回のオークションを行います。

そこで得点の記された動物を競り、集めます。

特定の動物を集めると、名誉ある称号が与えられます。

このオークションで特筆すべきは、握った金は全て手元から消えてなくなってしまうことです。なんと戻ってきません！

そして、そのオークションで最もやる気のない（出した金が少ない）人が消えたお金を総取りできてしまうのです！

なんて奇妙なオークション！

是非、皆さんもこの癖のあるオークションにチャレンジしてみてください！
publisher's summary
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: SkirmishCampaigns: Normandy '44 – Red Devils of the Orne
description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Normandy '44 - Red Devils of the Orne

This is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the the fighting of the paratroops from the 9th Parachute Battalion (British) and 1st Canadian Parachute Battalions, 6th Airborne Division east of the Orne River in early June 1944.

The book includes twelve scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of three campaigns.

This book is fully compatible with the other four books in the SkirmishCampaigns Normandy series (First Hours, Heroes of Omaha and Panzer Lehr and Monty's EPSOM).

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information and a map on the campaign east of the Orne River. This book also features an annotated bibliography of sources.

Includes:

12 Scenarios,
3 Campaigns


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Larvapocalypse: Flesh Pit Expansion
description:
The Flesh Pit Expansion features the 2" Immortal Flesh Pit Monster and a 4x4 Bloody Flesh board tile. The Immortal Monster awakens at the sound of combat and poses a deadly threat to any who enter the Flesh Pit.

This is the first Larvapocalypse expansion to feature new gameplay mechanics, and the Immortal Monster figure is the first 2" figure released for the game.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Skirmish '90: Modern Wargames Rules 1915-2005
description:
Rules designed to deal with small unit actions between 1915 and 1995.
Aimed at Platoon or company level with limited air and armour support.
They use non-linear ground scale, varying from 1:400 at short distances to 1:2000 at the maximum envisaged distance. In effect accentuating the role of small-arms & other infantry weapons.
Turns are simultaneous and in general the order set out in the Bound should be followed.
Reaction rolls are there to make the unit leaders the centre of the game.
Allow hidden movements in the presence of an empire
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Gaugameles: Le jeu de simulation tactique au temps d'Alexandre Le Grand
description:
Large scale tactical level Miniature Wargame rules in the times of Alexander the Great. in French

Minis: 28mm (recommended)

Règle de jeu pour reproduire les batailles de masse au temps d'Alexandre le Grand.

name: Marathon: Le Jeu de Simulation Tactique au Temps de la Grèce Antique
description:
Large scale tactical level Miniature Wargame rules in Ancient Greece. in French

Minis: 28mm (recommended)

règle de jeu tactique avec figurines simulant les batailles de la Grèce antique.

name: Alpina
description:
Each player has a tourist and a party of 3 guides and 7 shooters. There is also a poacher and a stage coach for each player. The goal of the game is for the tourists to reach one of two summits in enemy territory. The task of the party is to help their own tourist and prevent the opponent tourist to reach his goal.

The different game pieces have different methods to move or to take prisoners:

Tourist: move and take: 1 step in any direction. If the Tourist is threatened, he may take the place of one of his guides or shooters 1 step away from him. The guide or shooter is eliminated from the game.

Guide: moves 1 or 2 steps in any direction, takes 1 step from mountain to valley or vice-versa.

Shooter: moves 1 step in any direction, takes 1 step from mountain to valley.

Poacher: moves 2 or 3 steps in any direction, may take only 1 shooter (per game!) 1 step in any direction, may ot use the coach.

Stage Coach: moves up to 3 steps on the red roads and takes all enemy pieces on the way if they are not standing directly behind each other. May transport friendly pieces up to 2 steps.

—user summary

name: Alphabet Dungeon
description:
Alphabet Dungeon is a two to four player game where a group of stalwart adventurers go on a quest for treasure tiles. You will be exploring a mysterious dungeon, fighting monsters and searching for treasure tiles. In this dungeon the treasures are letters and your goal is to solve all the words on your quest. As you explore the dungeon and defeat monsters you gain more letters to help solve more words. The player that completes his/her entire quest of words wins the game. During your exploration you can visit the bazaar and purchase vowels to help you complete your quest.

VICTORY CONDITIONS:
When a player completes all the quest words on his/her quest card, they win the game. The Bonus word is used in case of a tie where both players complete their quest card on the same turn, the player that has also completed the bonus word would end up being the winner. If both players complete all words and the bonus word on the same turn, then both players share the win.

-description from designer
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Word Game
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Turn Order: Auction

name: Arvaa, mitä ajattelen?!
description:
Players pick two cards, adjective and noun, and try to figure out third,suitable word for both of these words. If two players come up with the same word, both get points.

—user summary

name: Hooch Stooges: Promo – Origins of Don
description: A promo card given away at conventions. “Until the end of turn, if you would get busted, draw a card instead.”
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Galaxia
description:
Card game based on the solar system.
This a variant of the French Tarot. Like tarot, it could be played as a team with 4 or 5 player (teams change at each round). The player with the most points after some rounds, wins the game.

Translation from the back of the box:
"72 MAGNIFICENT CARDS, with colours and graphics, make up this completely original new game."

name: Mythic Coins Card Game
description:
Mythic Coins Card Gameis a player vs player game where you control a mythic character such as a God, Goddess, or other powerful being. Each character comes in their own Coin Deck.

A Coin Deck contains a coin, display stand, dice, and 108 cards themed to that character.

There is no shuffling or drawing cards. Players use the cards to build their character based on their vision of that character and strategy for the game. A character can be customized to various power levels in the areas of Attack, Defense, Damage Bonus, Resistance, Health, Power, and Ability Cards.

There are over 50 unique Ability cards. Players secretly choose a set number of Ability cards before the game. These are kept in a player's hand and only shown when used. Most Ability cards require a specific amount of Power cards.

During a player's turn, they can choose to Activate a Character, Rest a Character, or Use a Card. Most cards result in a battle with another character. Some cards have other effects.

A player must protect their Health cards and manage their Power cards while attacking and defending against an enemy. Many attacks are resolved by opposing dice rolls. However, other attacks/defenses are countered by your opponent's cards.

There is no board. The coin is placed on its display stand in front of the player. The cards are placed next to the coin.

There is no limit to the number of players. You can play in teams, a handicapped game, or other game modes.

Game balance is maintained since each deck has cards with the same abilities. However, they are themed to fit the character. An evasion defense may be called Flight for a Dragon but Teleportation for a Lich.

Every card has a counter. More powerful cards cost more to use. You can only use an Ability card once. These things prevent one or two cards from dominating the game.

When not playing, coins can be used as display pieces since they come with a stand.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Player Elimination

name: Tropical Tribes
description:
In Tropical Tribes, you are the chief of a small island tribe, looking to grow to the most mighty tribe in the Pacific.
It is up to you to collect resources, build new buildings and boats, and go to war with enemy tribes.

Tropical Tribes is a simple roll+write game of tribe building and ocean warfare for 2-4 players.

—description from the publisher

name: Black-Pot
description:
Black-Pot is played on a board of 109 squares (11x11 with the corners removed) on which players take turns to add tokens of their color, with the object of forming five tokens in a row.

Each square has a number on it and on a player's turn they roll three dice then use the numbers on the dice singly or in combination to determine which squares they may occupy. For example if a player rolls 3–4–6, they may occupy a 13 (3+4+6), or an 18 (3x4+6), or a 12 (3x4) and a 6, or a 7 (3+4) and a 6, or a 3 and a 4 and a 6, or various other combinations.

When a five-in-a-row has been made, the five tokens are removed from the board and the player scores a varying number of points depending on the numbers used in the row — numbers that are more difficult to make score more points and a large bonus is awarded for a row which uses multiple "Black Pot" numbers, which can be made only using all three dice (such as 13, 17, 21).

This game is similar to the publishers' earlier game X-O, but the board is smaller and the scoring is different.

name: Logitac
description:
A chess-style abstract strategy game played on a pyramid of four boards: 12x12, 8x8, 5x5 and 1x1. Each player has a pyramid (king), a cube (rook), a cylinder (bishop), a double-pawn (knight) and 44 pawns, and the winner is the player whose pyramid ascends to the fourth (1x1) board.

The game starts with each player's pyramid, cube, cylinder and 12 pawns arranged on the first (12x12) board; the remaining 32 pawns and the double-pawn start off the board and can be introduced on the owning player's back rank in lieu of a move. A player's piece can ascend to a higher board only when two pawns or one major piece belonging to that player have been captured. Otherwise pieces move approximately as their chess equivalents, although pawns gain the ability to move in more directions when they ascend to smaller boards.

name: Yotal
description:
An abstract strategy game somewhat resembling checkers: each player has 20 pieces and the winner is the player who gets more of their pieces to the far side of the board. On their turn each player moves one of their pieces to an adjacent space, or captures an opposing piece on an adjacent space.

The board is a tessellation of 188 triangles, and the unique factor of the game is that each space of the board is coloured one of five colors (red, orange, yellow, green, purple) and each piece can only enter three of the five colors.

name: Heroes Among Us: Villains Among Us
description:
Villains Among Us A supplement for Heroes Among Us

Introduces campaign play to Heroes Among Us. Players will take control of a team of super powered beings and battle across a short campaign to see who will come out on top and save or rule Arch City.

In Villains Among Us, players now take part in scenarios to earn VP (victory points) to win the overall campaign. One player will take control of the villains, while the other player represents the heroes.

You will need a copy of the HAU core rules to use this book.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Le Manipulateur
description:
Abstract connection game played on a 17x17 board. Each player has a "Manipulator" piece which moves by making a rook move, then dropping a pawn on the square arrived on, then making a second rook move at right angles to the first.

On a player's turn they either move their Manipulator in the manner described, or they capture one or more opposing pawns by making a jump or series of jumps with one of their own pawns in a manner similar to checkers. Pawns cannot move except to capture and the Manipulators cannot capture.

A player wins when their pawns either form an unbroken chain from one side of the board to the other, or have trapped the opposing Manipulator so that it cannot move.

Winner of the "Pion d'Or 1983" award from "Jeux & Stratégie" magazine.
A winner of the 1983 Concours International de Créateurs de Jeux de Société.

name: Flank the Tiger
description:
Flank the Tiger a World War II game with Tanks, lots of TANKS.

There are a lot of rule sets which more accurately capture the combined arms nature of World War II combat, but these rules do not pretend to be one of them.

This game attempts to be realistic-ish in what it represents, swirling tank battles.
But the lack of infantry, artillery, engineering, and air power gives it more of an arcade feel than that of an actual battlefield.

The only intent with this rule set is to give players a chance to use their tank models in a fast and fun game where you get to blow stuff up and maybe even enjoy getting your own stuff blown up.

Flank the Tiger includes vehicle data for 142 vehicles (Germany, USSR, USA and UK) and has pre-filled vehicle sheets for 61 select vehicles (18 Germans, 17 Russians, 12 American, and 14 British).
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Pitter-Patter
description:
Pitter-Patter is a dexterity roll and draw area control game for 2-4 players. In the game players are raindrops having a war over puddles on the window pane. Players roll or toss dice onto a paper, drawing puddle around the die where it lands, and trying to push and take control over opponents puddles.

In the files section there are rules for the game. Other than rules, you need 5 dice per player in one color, a piece of paper and a pencil.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Zone of Control

name: Armoured Assault
description:
Armoured Assault book provides gamers with additional vehicles not featured in other Great Escape Games publications.

It also contains two new scenarios which allow gamers to field more than on vehicle alongside their infantry platoons on multiple vehicles on there own.

The majority of the vehicles in the book are from the later part of World War Two. These are vehicles that weren't featured in the Orders of Battle given in the rule book or Operation Bagration source book.
Also are included a few vehicles not in the field in large numbers for diversity.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Sock Race
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player across the finish line with the most pairs of socks. A “clothesline” to hang your socks, special play socks, Sock Monkey cards, Wash Day cards, Darn cards and a Sock Hop all guide you through collecting socks, losing your socks, and matching them through cute illustrations and everyday, relatable ideas.

Players move around the Sock Track (game board) and follow the instructions on each square. The player may pick socks from the Sock Drawer, win locks from the Sock Pile, or lose socks to Redhand the Raccoon or the Sock Monkey. If the player crosses the finish line (one lap around the Sock Track) with the required number of socks, they win!

A game of two players will run between 20-30 minutes, 4-6 players complete in just under an hour.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Royalty: King and Queen Collide
description:
Two rulers advance on the battlefield with their retinue of greatest warriors. Each of them prepared for a duel the likes of which none have ever seen. From Chessand the great White Queen marches forth, ready to decimate his brutish opponent with her superior cunning and strategy, while the all-powerful warrior-king The Red King of Hearts advances from Carda with his superior defenses and firepower. Only one shall leave this battlefield alive, but who will it be?

Royalty is a two-player strategy dice game. Use your four dice and the varied abilities of your Heroes to outwit and strongarm you opponent and claim victory! Use these dice to move and activate the abilities of your three wildly different Heroes or go for broke and use them to activate the difficult but powerful abilities of your Royal leader! Defeat your opponent with strategic movements or burst through their forces with cunning force!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Point Man: WWII Skirmish Rules
description:
Point Man is a set of skirmish rules covering the period 1939-1945. These rules are easy to learn and the basics can be taught in as little as five minutes to a novice player.

As easy as they are they feature a movement - fire system that simulates simultaneous movement without record keeping or any of the other typical problems with that sort of system.

The rules also feature detailed weapons charts that allow for the feel of the individual figure. Rules include both aimed and area fire, indirect fire, command and control, armored fighting vehicles, aircraft, hand to hand combat, friendly fire, paratroops, naval landings, field fortifications and combat engineering.

Designed for 20mm minis but can be adjusted to other scales.

Sequence of Play:
Each turn consists of a undetermined
number of phases.
Each phase consists of an Initiative Sub-
Phase, a Declaration Sub-Phase and an Action Sub-Phase

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: All-American Gamers Guide
description:
All American Gamers Guide (ASL Comp)

Final expansion of the "All American" series, the item crowns the trilogy by providing additional material to this highly detailed historical sequence. It is closely linked to the last issue "Shanley's hill".

28 page long, it contains:

the designer's notes of Shanley's hill from Ian Daglish
a new Campaign Game called "Night Drop"
3 scenarios pitting 'old' Paratrooper scenarios into the real battlefield thanks to the accurate map provided
a Solitaire mission "Group Able south!" using the three previously published maps
and finally an interview of a famous veteran of those days, Robert Murphy.

name: Iron and Blood: Easy Rules for Gaming The Franco-Prussian War 1870-71
description:
Iron and Blood: Easy Rules for Gaming The Franco-Prussian War 1870-1871


Doomed cavalry charges!
Rattling mitrailleuses blasting holes through ranks of spiked-helmeted Prussians!
The deadly accuracy of the Chassepot rifle vs. Krupp artillery!


If you've ever wanted to game the Franco-Prussian War of 1870–71, but were put off by the steep entry cost, this might be what you're looking for.

This is a set of miniatures rules that are easy to learn, completely intuitive, and provide meaningful tactical options for players.

NOTE: This is not a campaign book or scenario book, just a system for running whatever historical or hypothetical battles of the period you please. Army lists are not included!

Minis: designed for 6mm but can be easily adapted

Turn Sequence:

Place Orders
Load Cannons
Move Commanders
Check Orders
Move
Melee
Fire


—description from the publisher and rulebook
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Wars of Yor: Basics
description:
Wars of Yor: Basics is a simplified wargame for two or more players with a Rock – Paper – Scissors style format.

Maneuver your armies' units and plan your attacks where you have the advantage.
Calvary beats Infantry, Infantry beats Pikemen, and Pikemen beat Calvary.
Archers plink at range, and die in close combat.

This title includes PDF rules, and STL files for 3D printing the units.

This set includes both full units, or, for those who want to save PLA, minimal unit bases.
Both are the same size bases so you can play with either style, or mixed, with no rule changes.

This set has some custom dice STLs, but they are not needed for play.
You can use regular D6s and consult the Advantage chart for results.
The dice are designed in a way to allow for as much randomness as possible, but nothing beats a casino D6 for impartial rolling.

—description from the publisher
categories: Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Barrow Builders
description:
You have been hired to build a henge atop a barrow within a single year, taking one turn for each month. Using the runes to guide you, create different stone configurations and place them on the barrow mound.

There are three different types of placements: arches, standing stones, and round stones. There are three different colors of stones: exotic blue, polished white, or common dark gray.

You play by pulling any of the 24 Elder Futhark runes out of a bag. Each turn drawn two runes. The first rune drawn determines the placement, while the second rune drawn determines the color.

There is a chart provided for using dice: one eight-sided die and one six-sided die, if the player doesn't have access to any runestones.

—description from the designer

name: World War One: A Miniature War Game
description:
World War One is a miniature-based table top wargame aiming to recreate the battles that took place in the years 1914 – 1918, as well as in the early 1920s - such as the Polish – Bolshevik war of 1920-21

Smallest unit size in the game is the platoon.
Activation is done at the Company level.

Game is designed for 20mm (1/72nd)
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Corona Wars: Survival
description:
It is now 2026 post corona and mutants roam freely and you are the last of humanity’s remnants. You and your followers fight to escape the planet by any means necessary. Compete against other
factions in a race for resources, weapons and to be the only one to escape in a colonization ship.

Components
● DNA Deck- These cards come in 4 values and 2 different colors(back). 2,3,4 and 5. The 2 and 5 pieces have red backs, while the 3 and 4 pieces have greenbacks. Collecting these cards will help solve the molecular DNA crisis and create a cure for the COVID-Z21 virus. When any player accumulates a sum of 10 or more DNA, then the game can be won!
● Schematics Cards (52 card Deck) - Rare cards that will allow a faction to create a spaceship to escape the planet. Collect 15 schematics in order to win the game by leaving the rest of humanity behind in order to colonize the stars. Only 7 of these cards exist in the entire game!
● Survivor Deck - A deck of cards that have survivors in them. Each survivor has a unique ability which will improve your chances at surviving the epidemic. When all survivors are gone, game over!
● Tools Deck - This deck holds items and tools that can be used to survive the Zombie Plague. This includes weapons, defense tools , resources , med kits and more.
● Threat Deck - Cards which feature various zombie threats and humanoid threats courtesy of the Illuminati. Defeat zombies to harvest valuable DNA, while you must contend with illuminati threats to survive!

Set Up

● Determine turn order amongst yourselves.
● Each deck should be shuffled well before the game begins.
● Deal 5 cards from the Survivor deck to each player. In turn, each player should place their Survivor cards face up in front of them.
● Add the Schematics cards to the Tools Deck as well as the remainder of the Survivor Deck. Shuffle the new Tool Deck well.
● Each player should also now be dealt 3 cards from the Tools Deck. Place the remaining Tool Deck cards face down in the center of the play area.
● Place all of the remaining decks (Tool and Threat Decks) face down in the center of the playing area.

With this the game is ready to begin!

Rules

The purpose of the game is to collect a sum of 10 schematic cards, the first to do this wins. Players can choose to help or hinder each other during this process.

Alternatively, if any player manages to collect 20, DNA cards and to sacrifice 5 cards, the game will end!

You lose if:
1. Another player collects a sum of 20 or greater DNA material.
2. A player collects 10 schematics cards to complete the process of building an escape ship.
3. You lose all survivors in your faction.

Collecting DNA Cards
Perhaps the easiest way to win is to collect DNA cards. Each has a value listed on it which denotes the value of the DNA within. Collect a sum of 20 or more to win. This can be done in four ways:

● You can defeat a zombie to collect 1 DNA card.
● You can obtain them through bartering with other factions (players).
● You can steal or syphon them from other players.

Turns and Turn Actions

Each player has several actions they can take during a turn. These determine how the game progresses and are listed below:

1. Place a card in play. This varies based on type of card, but generally there are no limits to the amount of cards you can have / place in play throughout the duration of a game or in a single turn.

The exception to this is Survivor cards, of which you can only have a maximum of 10.
2. Draw a Threat card. This must be done every turn. You will either need to resolve your battle or you will have the freedom to take one or more other actions. [See Battle Resolution]
3. Sacrifice 2 cards to draw from the DNA Deck.
4. Sacrifice 2 cards to draw from the Tools Deck.

Of these four potential actions, #1 and #4 have no limitation on the number of times they can be performed during a turn. #2 and #3 can only be performed once per turn.

Finally, the player must make sure they have no more than 6 cards of any type in their hand at the end of the round. If you have more than six cards in hand you must make a decision as to which you’d like to discard, or offer them to other players in order to make a deal.

Once a player has performed all four of, or the actions they desire to perform for that turn, turn order moves to the next person in gameplay. When it isn’t your turn there are a few things you can do as well.

1. Barter with other players. This includes assisting them, or bribing them so that you don’t hinder them.
2. Play cards against other players. This can come from your hand only, not previously active cards.

The game continues in this way until winning conditions are fulfilled by one faction player.
categories: Card Game, Math, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Alliances, Bribery, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Interrupts, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Trading, Traitor Game, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: MadCash
description:
In MadCash, players start with nothing but the shirts on their backs and race to accumulate wealth any way they can. There are several ways players can accumulate cash, including getting jobs and gambling, but the trick is getting it into their bank account before they lose it.

The game board is a racetrack complete with a shortcut and spaces designed to create action or force decisions on every turn. Players use dice to move around the board and acquire Jobs (and a subsequent salary), receive Emails, collect cash payouts, and perform variety of other actions. Everyone starts by using dice and can use cash they collect to invest in other forms of transportation which allow them to strategically use up to 3 dice each roll, this also increases their job salary and the frequency at which they get paid.

There is a deck of Email cards with corresponding email spaces on the board that subject the players to a variety of events good and bad including salary increases, bills, and cards with the power to hinder other players' progress. Once players collect cash, they try to land on an ATM space in order to deposit into their bank account. Until a player's cash is safely deposited into the bank, it is fair game and can be stolen by other players, or lost in several other ways.

MadCash can be played individually or as teams with goal of accumulating a bank balance of $50,000. Game duration can vary greatly because of the volatility and unpredictability of the game play.

The game is designed in the tradition of other financial race games like Monopoly and Parker Brothers Full House, but with more of a ruthless, backstabbing element with no player ever truly being out of the race until the game is over.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Catch the Leader, Different Dice Movement, Income, Lose a Turn, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Went the Day Well?
description:
Miniature Wargame Rules, set during VBCW or Very British Civil War, it is an alternative history where Edward VIII refuses to abdicate triggering a constitutional crisis which divides the nation and results in Civil war. As a result instead of going to war in Europe, the nation is facing a very British crisis.

Platoon to company level rules, designed for 28mm

Turn Sequence:

Initiative phase,
Random Event phase,
Recovery phase,
Movement phase,
Shooting phase,
Melee phase
categories: Book, Civil War, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Bamse och häxans dotter: Guldjaktenspelet
description:
Child game based on the movie swedish movie "Bamse och häxans dotter". Roll a die and collect gold from the lake. But watch out, Krösus Sork (the thief) wants to steal your gold.

On your turn you roll a dice and get either gold from the pond or diving equipment. If you are unlucky and hit the thief's symbol, you will lose gold. If you hit the "Bamses" symbol, he retrieves all the gold from the thief and gives it back to you. The first person to collect six gold dumplings wins the game.

—user summary

name: Savage Core
description:
Savage Core is a fast play, competitive set of skirmish rules set in a primal land of savage warfare where clans battle for survival. Mature readers only, mature themes of primitive warfare.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Fighting, Mature / Adult, Miniatures, Wargame

name: At Lances Point: Army Lists
description:
At Lances Point Army Lists contains:

Early Imperial Roman 30 BC to 211 AD
Dacians 82 BC to 106 AD
Britons 54 BC to 117 AD
Early Germans 113 BC to 238 AD
Parthians 247 BC to 224 AD
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Brigadier '38: Army Lists – Part One: The Field Armies
description:
Brigadier'38: Army Lists - The Field Armies

Covers:

the Royalist field armies,
the Anglican League brigades,
BUF and Reactionary forces,
Army of the Lord Protector and
the People's Assault Columns
categories: Book, Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Brigadier '38: Army Lists  – Part Two: Scotland, Wales, Independent and County Forces
description:
Brigadier'38: Army Lists – Part Two

This part covers

Scotland (5 lists),
Wales (3 lists),
Independent and county forces including Cornwall, Wynd Grator and the SFF.
Also some additional rules for guerilla actions.
categories: Book, Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: RUN: Villains & Vigilance
description:
In this expansion to RUN: The Board Game, villains and fiends infiltrate the dungeon, causing randomized battles, whereby you and your team will have to properly balance your speed, strength and damage to overpower those who would stand between you and escape.
Players arm themselves with weapons and special impact cards to overcome their foes!
The villains are not intended to deal physical damage to the players; instead, they either slow or speed the allies, adding an additional element to the game.
Of course, any good expansion would not be complete without a new themed boss and maybe even a new ally to join the fray!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Confrontation: Ram Army Book
description: Supplement for Confrontation: the Age of the Rag'narok that contains additional rules for playing with the Ram (Undeads) Army and its associated artifacts, miracles and spells.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Venedig
description:
Before the game beginns, the canals are filled with water. The Movement of the tourists is determined by a spinner with possible results of 3 to 8. Other possible results are "K" (draw an action card) and "B" (place or move a bridge). If a tourist gets on a numbered space, he collects the picture postcard of this number.

The first player to collect 8 different picture postcards wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tilt and Tournament
description: A two player chess or checkers variant where each player has ten pieces -- two knights and eight attendants.

name: The Bee-Hive of Fun
description: A game of forfeits for up to 12 players (minimum 3). Includes various props: cardboard glasses, a fool's cap, and old lady's cap, and labels to be worn on the head. Movement with dice and dice-cup.

name: Crispino
description: Two to four players each have their own dice and dice cup and maneuver around a square board with multiple forks and windy paths. Each player has three pawns and one king.

name: Stella
description: A parcheesi variant.

name: Chancery
description: A race game for four players. Each player uses four counters, two dice, and a dice cup.

name: On The Clock
description:
On The Clock is a game about surviving corporate BS. The goal is to avoid as much work as possible while trying to get paid when it's most advantageous. If too much work is accrued, the player suffers burnout and is out of the game. Conversely, if the player makes enough money, they get to retire. The first to retire or last to burnout wins.

Each player takes turns drawing a card from the Event pile. The event card describes some BS the player is not on the hook to handle and how much work that Event will take. However, the player starts with Escape cards at their disposal. The Escape cards will help the player get paid for the work, pass it to another player or reduce the level of effort. If the work is passed, the recipient of the work can either counter the work with their own Escape card or just save their cards for a rainier day.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Army Men: Card Combat
description:
Army Men: Card Combat is a dirt simple, two player wargame that’s playable with only a handful of plastic Army Men and a pack of standard playing cards.

The game was designed with kids in mind and is a great way to introduce your younglings to the world of wargaming.
In pursuit of this goal, the game is built on a simple foundation drawing on the classic card game, War, with the addition of figures and movement.
Several optional advanced rules are then presented throughout to add more strategy as players become comfortable with the rules such as Cover, Stats, and Special Abilities.

Army Men: Card Combat also offers a low cost, fast playing wargame option for all ages if you just want a casual, beer-and-pretzels experience that hits all the right nostalgia notes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II

name: Legend of the Poetry Dice
description:
Legends said that there is a set of magic dice that was made by the God of poetry, they were owned by many famous and talented poets and helped them create the most beautiful poem through human history, and now, the dice are in your hands…

Legend of the poetry dice is a Yahtzee-style dice game which 2 ~ 5 players try to compose the beautiful poem in the help of the magic dice and become the greatest poet in the world.

Players try to get poem cards in order to get points. All poem cards are different, on the back of the card is a poem that was composed by talented poets in history, and on the front of the card are elements that the poem contains, players have to read the poem and tell what elements it contains then try to accomplish them by rolling dice in a Yahtzee-style system.

—description from the publisher

name: Quizzles Book 2
description:
Quizzles is a family trivia game for 2 to 4 players or teams. Each question in the question booklet is multiple choice. Each player/team rolls a dice and moves their token around the board. The question they answer is based on their token color and position on the game board.

—user summary

name: Chapters-Indigo Pack of 3 Trivia Sets
description:
A set of 3 individual quiz packs containing 50 quiz cards each with 2 questions per card. The perfect family pastime, test your knowledge and expand your mind with a little friendly quiz competition!

Featuring three different quiz themes: Canadian Quiz (Do you know which lake Bessie is rumoured to live in?), Festive Quiz (Do you know in which country you would find Lapland?), and General Knowledge Quiz (Do you know what year the first iPhone was released?).

name: Chapters-Indigo Family Games Night Pack
description:
Go head-to-head with this bumper set of quizzes and games for the ultimate night in. Featuring game cards designed with a retro-vibe all held within an easy-to-store wooden box, this set will offer endless hours of entertainment.

Games include: Who Am I? The celebrity guessing game; Charades, the classic miming game; Hum That Tune, the musical humming game; Don't Say A Word, the action-packed describing game; General Knowledge Quiz, the ultimate brain-buster.

name: Silhouetta
description:
Each player is dealt some cards. The rest of the cards form a deck in the middle of the table and one card is turned face up.

On a players turn, you can take a card. After taking a card the player may place cards on the table, but only in the correct order. Then the player discards an unwanted card and the next player's turn starts.

The double 'TT' cards form a set. You can only play the 'T' cards from one set The player is allowed to put the correct T card in another line of cards. In exchange the player can take one of the cards S - E from the same row.

The first player who completes the word SILHOUETTA wins the game.

The winner gets:

1 point for each card a player has in hand
3 points for each card a player could have played
5 points for every right T card, except if it's part of a complete set, but the player could not play the set.


—user summary

name: PASA
description:
PASA is an non combinatorial abstract game in the chess family. The game is played on a 5x8 black and white board with 10 pawns and a king. Dice are used for movement. The number determines which pieces can move even for those on black squares and odd for white squares. A 1 can move a piece on black or white. The pieces are also allowed to stack once. Captured pieces are removed unless a stacked piece has a retreat square available. The game is one by capturing an opponent's king.

—user summary

name: Godzilla Rampage: Kaiju Unleashed – The Wrath of Daimajin Supplement
description:
Expansion #1: The Wrath of Daimajin.
Includes: Daimajin Scenario, Daimajin Kaiju Battle Card and Maser Beam Tanks (Upgraded Military Vehicles).
Updated Rules are also included with this release.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: World Crisis Simulator
description:
In World Crisis Simulator, between 3-6 players take on the role of major world powers combating a global issue. You'll take turns hosting summits and contributing (or not!) to helping solve the Earth's problems, all while trying to figure out what your purported allies' end goals are. The fate of the planet is at stake; will you rise to the occasion, or fall to petty infighting?

Taking inspiration from the crisis mechanics of beloved board games Battlestar Galactica and Dead of Winter, World Crisis Simulator sees everyone at the table contributing to that round's summit, with each player having a chance to take the reigns and be the Summit Host. The host gets to decide if the summit is successful, bringing the Earth back to stability, or fails, making everyone's status ever more dire. While everyone in the game probably wants to get through this thing with humanity intact, players' secret objectives will inevitably interfere with them acting in the best interests of everyone else. Act too selfishly though, and other players will use their action cards to cripple your strategy, or even remove you from the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Space Rescue
description:
First time you look at this board game, you would feel like it is a baby version of Battleship VS Battleship game. However, when you look at rules book, try to play a round with your kids. You would realize this game is much more interesting than you thought.

Space Rescue has three method to play. Basic method is built barrier to stop another player and roll the dice to decide how many step you can move. Once you decide your moving code, another player will help you to move your chess and let you know if your chess is moving to the position you expect or stop by some unknown barriers. The first player who get into finish line wins the game.

  Intermediate game play method is add the instruction dice into the game. This dice gives you three extra variable. Loops, Function call and Boolean value. Combine Loops and digital dice together for example, it will give the player a chance to double one of their movement, let the player go two steps further or block by barrier.

  The most interesting part is the Function call and Boolean value. Function call gives players a chance to choose a function blow the instruction board, take a unexpected step and win the game. Boolean value is a hypothesis programming language. Using “IF THEN or ELSE” to detecting other player’s barriers, bypass the barriers and take a move. But if there is no any barrier, it will do the ELSE step.

  It is an interesting for kids to training their logical analyze ability, programming thinking, perseverance and pre-judgement ability.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Maze, Space Exploration

name: Arthur's Match 'Em Up! Game
description:
A Memory Matching Game

Arthur's Match 'Em Up is a memory game with pictures of Arthur & his friends, and whimsical objects from your favorite Arthur and D.W. books. Younger children can match two-of-a-kind. Older children can challenge themselves to find four-of-a-kind. Make up your own variations!

This game helps children build memory and reading skills.

—description from the back of the box

name: Color Dash
description:
A fast and funny educational game about primary and secondary colors. Draft, trade and play Color Cards, in order to get on the Palette zone all the color requested by your Palette Cards to get points.

The game is divided in rounds, when each player did his turn the round ends and a new one begins.

At the start of round, the First Player must choose which cards will be play in the round, chosing among:

Same Color cards (each player will choose in his own turn which color he will play).
Different Color cards (players could play only one card of a color in theyr turn).


In their turn players have to play color cards trying to get on the Palette zone the color patterns required by their Palette card, when it happens,, they can reveal the Palette card and earn points, than they draw another Palette card.
If there are no more Palette cards to draw the game ends at the end of the round.
Each player count his points to declare the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game

name: FATUM: tempus mortis – Ambasciatori del Regno
description:
First independent set of Fatum, tempus mortis. A 1vs1 card game taking place in a dark fantasy world.

Three different cults, three different ways of seeing the world and seeking salvation, but none of them will matter when the time comes…to die.
You are an otherworldly being and you need to secure the highest number of souls in order to build your own reign in the Afterlife.

But numbers aren't enough, what also counts is the quality of the souls you take. In order to obtain this, you will have to use your creatures, according to the different cults, and working them to secure the highest number of souls once their earthly life is over. You will also have other resources to take forward your plan of conquest, but you will always have to submit to the Oracle.

—description from the designer

FATUM, tempus mortis è un gioco di carte strategico a scontro diretto ambientato in un universo Dark Fantasy nel quale i giocatori si sfidano a colpi di sacrifici umani, assalti e reclutamenti per portare a casa più anime possibili, sì, perché ogni giocatore è un essere extra-dimensionale che deve creare il suo esercito nell’ Aldilà.

Le creature sono solo pedine nelle tue mani, sacrificale, uccidile o reclutale per approfittare delle loro capacità, i 3 Culti forniscono loro le diverse abilità e l’ incoraggiamento a battersi senza paura, di questo, ovviamente, ti approfitterai per manipolarle ed al giusto momento portarle nel tuo Aldilà. Avrai anche altre risorse per portare avanti i tuoi piani di conquista, ma dovrai sempre sottostare all’ Oracolo quando invocato!

Dovrai essere abile per capire che tipo di strategia adottare in quello specifico momento poiché i Luoghi ti permetteranno solo determinati tipi di azione movimentando l’ esperienza di gioco e allo stesso tempo non dovrai aver paura di rischiare per cercare di trovarti in vantaggio sull’ avversario.

"Ambasciatori del Regno" è solo il primo set di questo gioco, tutti i diversi set sono giocabili indipendentemente, non esiste pertanto un set base e con un set ci giocano 2 persone. In più, una volta uscito il 3° set si sbloccherà anche la modalità Deckbuilding, permettendo di fatto ai giocatori di costruire ognuno il proprio mazzo scegliendo tra le carte dei vari set per sfidarsi in partite ancora più avvincenti!

—description from the designer (Italian)

name: Pirate Hexes
description:
Pirate Hexes is a simple fast-paced set of rules for naval combat in the age of sail. It is played with miniatures on a hex mat.
The object of the game is to capture enemy ships and islands, and with optional rules one can also collect treasure and rescue marooned captives.
The movement and combat mechanics are so simple that after playing for a short time no tables or reference sheets are needed, though a one-sided quick-reference sheet is supplied.
The basic game can be played on a hex mat as small as 9 x 9 hexes, and very large engagements with several players can be played in a short period of time.
Optional rules are included for forts, fog, coral reefs, sargasso seas, sea monsters, whirlpools, treasure islands, and neutral treasure ships.
Other game elements of the player’s own design can be easily plugged in, and the rules can be used to re-create historical engagements.
The ships may be based in any manner, or simple carboard counters can be employed.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: On Unknown Fields
description:
On Unknown Fields: Scenarios and Fog-of-War Rules for Battles of the American Civil War
This book provides nine fictional scenarios and fog-of-war rules for the American Civil War for use with many game systems. The scenarios are for medium and large battles.

What is a miniature wargame scenario?
At least a map, orders of battle, initial deployments and a schedule of reinforcements. So any scenario should be usable with any American Civil War game system for which the orders of battle and map scale make sense.

Why fictional scenarios, battles that could have happened but didn’t? Historical scenarios give knowledgeable players way too much information about their opponent and take away many command decisions. And you’ve probably already played scenarios based on most major historical battles of the American Civil War anyway. So how about trying some brand new situations that test your skills, situations that let YOU make the decisions?

Why fog-of-war rules? Do you want to keep your enemies guessing as to what you’re up to and distract them with fake maneuvers? Do you want to disguise your attack plans, mass your forces where they’re least expected, and then launch blistering attacks? Are you bold enough to plan and execute attacks like Jackson’s at Chancellorsville? If so, then you need fog-of-war rules!

You get:

Nine fictional scenarios for use with any American Civil War game system that has divisions/brigades as its basic units. All scenarios and rules are adaptable for game systems that are based on brigades/regiments….
Orders of battle for Shouting the Battle Cry of Freedom and another popular game. The orders of battle can be used as templates to create orders of battle for other rule systems….
Maps and initial situation write-ups for all scenarios with initial deployments and arrival times for reinforcements….
Unique, general purpose fog-of-war rules that allow hidden movement and deployment for use in all of the scenarios and in scenarios designed for other game systems….
Night and sleep rules for multi-day battles….
Color-coded troop tags for all orders of battle….
Hidden deployment and movement cards for use with the fog-of-war rules….
Terrain markers (Light/Medium/Heavy) for hiding the nature of terrain until units actually enter it….


—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Silben-Match
description:
A German word game with plastic game material: By laying out, laying on, combining and exchanging syllable tiles, words must be formed from 184 syllables. There are points for the length and number of words formed, which can also be contested.

—user summary

name: Uranus/Saturn: Winter Storm on the Don 1942-43
description:
Uranus and Saturn were the names given to the great Soviet Offensives on the Southern front in the winter of 1942-43. Their success resulted in the destruction of the elite German Sixth Army at Stalingrad, the disintegration of Germany's Allied Armies and the unhinging of the entire Axis position in the Ukraine. The Axis, for the first time, were thrown on the strategic defensive and the road to Kursk.
