However, cars have wear points and can expend these for extra changes to movement: half a point per extra acceleration and a point per extra deceleration.

Four different cars are provided with different characteristics.

If playing multiple laps pit stops may be made to replenish wear points.

name: Crossover
description:
Crossover is played on a 5x5 grid with 25 pieces with different colors on each side. Two markers are also required which move along two edges of the board - one is controlled by each player.

On a turn a player moves their marker and then places a piece at the space the two markers are pointing at, if it is empty. If a player cannot move to point to an empty space they point to an occupied space and flip the piece there over, regardless of which side is currently showing.

The winner is the first to get four pieces of their color in a contunuous orthogonal line.

name: The Horus Heresy: Book Eight – Malevolence
description:
The eighth book in the Horus Heresy series from Forgeworld and Games Workshop. The Horus Heresy is set in the past of the Warhammer 40,000 universe, and covers the civil war that split the Imperium in two following the betrayal of the Emperor by the Warmaster. Malevolence contains the background and rules for the Blood Angels and White Scars legions, as well as the Daemons of the Ruinstorm.

The Horus Heresy Book Eight – Malevolence is the latest chapter in the Horus Heresy saga, bringing two new Space Marine Legions, armies of Daemons and more to your Age of Darkness games.

As the traitor Warmaster Horus and his armies burn their way across the Imperium, their sights fixed on Terra, the Dark Gods' plans for other Legions unfold in the dark places of the galaxy.

A hidden war rages, as the Daemons of the Ruinstorm manifest in reality in numbers undreamt of, laying waste to worlds and trying to bring more of the Primarchs under their masters' sway. Chief among their targets is the angel Sanguinius, whose Legion has been deployed to the Signus Cluster where horror awaits him.

Elsewhere, the proud and savage White Scars cleanse the Chondax system of greenskins, but the Alpha Legion wage a war of stealth and deception against their erstwhile brothers. Will the White Scars and Blood Angels fall to the lures of their enemy, or hold firm in defence of the Imperium?

Malevolence contains extensive background on the wars that rage across the Imperium's fringes, including the Betrayal at Chondax and the Battle of Signus, as well as details of the Daemonic hordes that assail the Imperium. In addition, it details the Blood Angels and White Scars Space Marine Legions, their heraldry, history and traditions. There's also loads of rules content, including characters and units from these Legions, army lists, and two complete campaign systems based on the major battles from the book. Inside, you will find:

– Legiones Astartes Appendix: The Blood Angels – special rules, wargear, units and characters

– Legiones Astartes Appendix: The White Scars – special rules, wargear, units and characters

– Daemons of the Ruinstorm – army list, special rules and psychic powers

– Talons of the Emperor – special rules, wargear and a variety of units

– Space Marine Legion Army List additions

– Psyarkana – relics of the Great Crusade

– The Signus Prime Campaign – includes campaign rules, armies and 3 special missions

– The Chondax Campaign – includes campaign rules and 5 deception missions split across two campaign phases
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Psychotic Settings
description:
Volume Three of the Psychos & Slashers games, Psychotic Settings adds a brand new aspect to the previous two card games: hex-tile settings. In addition to the five large hex-tiles, the expansion includes five new Killer cards and 15 Attack cards. Psychotic Settings can be used in combination with the prior Psychos & Slashers series games, Suburban Slasher and Kamp Killjoy.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Acedrex Backgammon
description:
Acedrex Backgammon is a four-handed variant inspired on [The World: a four-handed backgammon, 1283 a.D.], which is on Alfonso X codex. The concept lies on middle age wars, were warriors engage in combat with shields and swords.
Acedrex Backgammon proposes a more fluid betting model and the “prime” [slots blocked by pieces] from milenar backgammon has been replaced by small battles between pieces competing for same slot, battles called Acedrex, [Ace] if attacker wins and [Drex] if defender wins, allowing players to take part in every turn if they have their pieces on same territory where turn is.
mechanics: Advantage Token, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: There's A Yak On The Track!
description:
There's a Yak on the Track! He's holding up the train and making the animals late. While Rocco the Rhino works to move the Yak, you try to steal as many of the train cars as possible.

Yakson the Yak lived near a railroad in the forest. Being a fussy eater, he knew all the tastiest grass grew between the rails of the tracks; so whenever he was hungry, Yakson would stand right in the middle of the tracks to eat. Luckily for Yakson, the train has an expert at the wheel.

Rocco is the best railroad engineer around. He is the only one who can stop fast enough to save Yakson, but what is his thanks? Every time he stops, that Yak steals all of his train cars!

In this 2-5 player game, plays put down a yak card to steal all the train cars played. The player with the most stolen cards at the end of the game wins.

How to Play:
Deal each player 5 cards. Place the rest of the cards face down in the middle as a draw pile.

Place the Rocco the Rhino Engine card face up. Draw one train card from the draw pile and put it on the end of the engine card to start the train.

Each player takes turns adding train cards end to end so that the color and character at the end of the last train card matches the one you are playing.

After you put down a card, draw a new card from the draw pile so you have 5 cards in your hand. If you can't play a train card on your turn, pass and don't draw. Play moves to the next player.

If you have a yak card, you can play it on your turn or hold it to play later. After playing a yak card, player picks up all the cards in the train, expect for the engine, and places them in a pile in front of them. The game continues until all 5 yaks have been played.

The person with the most cards from the train (including the yaks) wins.

Wild Zebra can be played if you can't play anything else. Play Wild Zebra and then play the card of your choice, drawing 2 instead of 1 card to bring your hand back to 5.

-description from designer

name: Conflict
description:
Conflict is an abstract wargame played on a triangular grid in a trapezoidal configuration. One player is the defender and has a camp on the long side of the trapezoid; the attacker sets up near the short side. The opposing generals are nominally Napoleon and Wellington. Counters (not provided) or miniatures can be used.

There are two basic formations in the game - a hexagon and a line. All units in a formation can be moved at once. However, units have different movement allowances and no unit can exceed its allowance. (Counting generals there are nine different types of units.)

When combat takes place different units may lend their combat value or morale value based on their positions relative to the attacking and defending units.

There are some additional rules for terrain (hexagons representing hills and a town are placed on the board before the game), reinforcements, and formation of infantry "squares."

name: Inflation
description:
Inflation is a simple auction game for three or more players (the original rules give no upper limit; six seems like a practical maximum).

The game requires a supply of counters and three decks of ten cards each. Each deck is used in turn: it is shuffled and the cards are auctioned off using open bidding. Bidding is done with the counters; every player gets one counter before each auction.

The first deck contains two cards worth four points, four worth two, and four worth one. Each succeeding deck has the same distribution of cards but halves their values, e.g. the second deck has two two-point cards.

Once all cards have been auctioned the player with the greatest total value of cards wins; counters are worth nothing.

name: Exchange Rate
description: Exchange Rate is a game of coming and going, shifting values, and evolving towns. On your turn, someone must go. However, their departure gives you an opportunity to utilize their skill. Immediately following their departure and skill activation you get to welcome a new town member. Throughout the game (6 rounds) your town and the communal scoring track will change, however your strategy should remain focused depending on your secret special ability and evolving town. Simple actions such as influencing a communal scoring track, attempting a key trade, or activating a wild card will keep the game fresh and unique.
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Hidden Victory Points, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Explosion
description:
Explosion is played on a 6x6 grid with pieces having different colors on each side.

Each turn a player adds one piece to the board, either to an empty space or a space with their color showing. Each space has a capacity, which is the number of orthogonally adjacent spaces; if the space played in is now at capacity, it explodes, meaning the pieces are distributed to the adjacent spaces.

If a piece explodes on to an opposing stack, the pieces in that space are flipped over.

If an explosion causes other spaces to reach capacity, they also explode, and so on.

Winning the game requires eliminating all opposing pieces.

name: Ultimate Rescue Force
description:
Ultimate Rescue Force is the explosive new release from Sundered Vault!
Forged from the wonderful themes of Saturday morning action cartoons and the glory days of 8/16 bit video games, Ultimate Rescue Force is over the top in bombastic heroic action and color!
With an army 54 Unique Action Pixel Figs (minis), fun and engaging rules, Agent stat cards, and all the scenery and level Mats, you get everything except the dice in this barely contained explosive package! Check out these super features!


Awesome Agents: Now two Rescue Force Agents are the same! Each hero has special loadouts, tactical abilities,


and perks! By themselves they are force to be reckoned with, but together they are Ultimate Rescue Force!

Play Solo...Or Not!: This is a cooperative game, where the hostile Fang forces have Scripting Patterns


to manage them, and you, alone or with buddies, get to rescue the world in the combat boots of 8 elite Agents!

Varied Missions: Take your squad to various locales like thick jungles, urban scapes, and winter wonderlands!


Eliminate Fang forces in Secure Ground missions, defuse bombs in Explosive Duty missions, and extract hostages
in Extract missions! You can even combine types for Hybrid Missions!

Dangerous Foes: Rescue Force wouldn't be Ultimate if they weren't facing a seriously serious threat, right? The


evil forces of Fang have all manner of specialist soldiers, from assault troopers, snipers, elite shocktroopers,
cunning officers, machine gunners, defense experts, and even renegade ninja warriors!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fivalath
description:
Fivalath is a derivative of Yavalath (like Squava).

It is recommended to be played on a 10x10 square board, although other sizes are allowed (no less than 8x8). 2 players (White and Black) alternate turns placing a pawn of their colour on an empty space of the board.

Players strive to make a line of 5 pieces of their colour, but lose if they make a line of 4 before doing so. Lines can be orthogonal or diagonal.

Special thanks to Cameron Browne for creating Ludi and to Stephen Tavener for the game name and for coding it in 5 minutes on a Saturday morning.

—description from the publisher

name: Table Air Combat: D3A Val
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each ruleset is a self-contained game including cut-out miniatures of one aircraft and a set of rules. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters.
Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.
Each player has a flight of four aircraft, represented by two counters.
Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

TAC is designed for portability;
The entire game can fit in a plastic bag.
Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

Each aircraft is sold separately.
Only pay for the ones you want, and print out as many copies as you need to create your own epic WWII air battle.

The Aichi D3A "Val" dive-bomber was considered obsolete at the start of the war, but claimed warships at Singapore, Pearl Harbor, Midway, Coral Sea, and Guadalcanal.

This set is a self-contained rulebook that includes miniatures for the Aichi D3A "Val" and contains three scenarios that reference other aircraft:

Iron Bottom Sound: D3A dive bombers escorted by A6M2 Zeroes attack a US Navy destroyer. The destroyer is defended by a F4F-F Wildcats.
Easter Sunday Raid: Continual-spawning D3A Val and A6M2 Zeroes threaten to overwhelm defending RAF Hurricanes over the city of Colombo.
Midway: Attack the USS Yorktown with A6M2 escorts while fighting off defending F4F-F Wildcats, SBD Dauntlesses, and flak from both the carrier and an escorting destroyer.


—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Table Air Combat: B5N Kate
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each ruleset is a self-contained game including cut-out miniatures of one aircraft and a set of rules.
All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters.
Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.

Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag.
Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

Each aircraft is sold separately. Only pay for the ones you want, and print out as many copies as you need to create your own epic WWII air battle.

The Nakajima B5N2 "Kate" was a carrier-based torpedo bomber.

This set is a self-contained rulebook that includes miniatures for the Nakajima B5N "Kate" and contains three scenarios that reference other aircraft:

Battle of the Coral Sea: B5N torpedo bombers escorted by A6M2 Zeroes attack the USS Lexington. The carrier is defended by a F4F-F Wildcats.
Battle of Santa Cruz Island: The badly-damaged USS Hornet is being towed by the cruiser USS Northampton. Now a strike force of B5N torpedo bombers and A6M2 Zeroes arrive to finish her off. F4F-F Wildcats defend both ships.
Midway: Attack the carrier USS Yorktown with A6M2 escorts while avoiding F4F-F Wildcats and flak.


—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Auktion
description:
This card game consists of 64 cards (5 collections of 12 cards each and 4 jokers) and play money. On your turn, you may buy an unknown card, sell a collection consisting of 6 cards at least, pass and pay a fee or auction off any amount of your cards. You may ask for a minimum bid. If nobody buys, you keep your cards and must pay a fee. A broken player must tell so and is out of the game. The player with the most money wins.
Published around 1980.

—user summary

name: So Money
description: This game was given to employees of the company Social Finance (SoFi)game. The card game revolves around a knock off idea from apples to apples wherein the players are presented with a question and figure the best answer to give for it. In this game the questioned gives either a lie or a truthful answer depending on the word on their blue card. The dealer chooses if it is either a lie or a truth. Points awarded for correct guesses. The dealer moves to the next player clockwise. First to 5 points, wins.

name: Animal Trackers
description:
Players represent South African indigenous Khoisan animal trackers seeking to stymie the mischief wrought by Skebenga the Hyena in the regional bushveld wilderness. Each sets off on their preferred trail and seeks to rescue the various species that are in danger and return them to their "hide" (starting location).

The many cards and interrupts offer gratuitous opportunities to learn more about the South African flora and fauna, while avoiding poachers and other pitfalls. While the educational content is aimed at South African children, for those outside the country it functions equally educationally for adults.

From the promotional material: "An innovative boardgame that encourages forward-planning and strategic decision-making. Trading and bargaining form part of this exciting, fast-moving game!".

name: The Sportsman and the Rabbit
description:
The Sportsman and Rabbit game is a roll and move game for 2 to 4 players. Players move around spaces on a playing board either as a hunter or rabbit. The rabbit tries to elude the hunter and reach its rabbit warren. The hunter tries to catch the rabbit to win the game.

The lithographed board displays Australian rural life where the abundance of wild rabbits became a staple meal during the early 20th century, The board has hunters, rabbits, rabbit warrens and a wheat field for rabbits to hide.

Published by the National Game Company in Australia and Recorded in the National Archives of Australia as being registered in 1913.

—user summary

name: In This Together
description:
In This Together is a cooperative print-and-play board game for 1–8 players, playable via video call.

The players each start in control of their individual island represented by a player sheet. Based on die rolls, the buildings drawn on the sheet will produce resources which may be spent to develop upgrades (including technologies that provide various benefits and boats which allow the players to connect and share resources).

Once each island is connected with at least two others, the players win. However, each die roll increases the chance of Disasters which may hamper the players' progress and trigger the game ending in a loss.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Random Production

name: Brexit: Dead in a Ditch
description:
This game has been designed after extensive research on the Brexit process for my PhD. It aims at simulating as closely as possible while remaining a rather simple (yet big) boardgame the various power shifts that we saw in 2019. (A playtest held a few days before the 2019 general elections saw the Tories win an absolute majority and getting rid of their coalition with the DUP... just sayin')

This is a political game focused on player interactions with half the game revolving around card play inspired by the Sun Tzu boardgame and the other half centered on players negotiating between them how they will vote on the Draft Bills proposed to the floor. It is a long and difficult game that requires a minimum of role playing as players take on specific parties' leadership with specific objectives. It is an asymetrical game where each player has a specific way of winning in order to show the various strategies deployed during 2019 by the real life parties.
The first one is the campaign map. Players compete each turn to gain popularity in 21 constituencies by playing cards and comparing their values. (Similar to the Sun Tzu game's mechanic.) Having more popularity than others gives players a chance to increase their number of Members of Parliament once an election is held. But only the Prime Minister can call for an election, with a little push from the opposition if needed...

The second battleground is parliament. Players propose Draft Bills to vote into the Brexit Deal. Those bills are policies that tackle Brexit-specific issues. Depending on how the issue is tackled and who proposed the bill, the Brexit Deal gets filled up with policies that grant Victory Points to players, or removes some. For that phase, players vote with all the might of their MPs in Parliament. This is why having an election at the right time can completely change the balance of power in the Westminster House of Commons, and change the face of Brexit as a whole !

The final competition takes place around those two phases as players get to play Spin Cards, showing how their political teams spin events and control the political landscape.

—description from the designer

name: Yggdrasil Chronicles: Les Voyages de Rig Scenario
description:
New independent scenario that still uses the campaign mode rules.

French edition found in Plato Magazine 126.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Map Deformation, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Turn Order: Auction, Variable Player Powers

name: Crazy Kitties
description:
Crazy Kitties is a fun, fast paced, card shedding game. Each round is lightning quick and the game is easy to learn and crazy to play. Crazy Kitties is a family friendly game that is a great way to spend an evening with friends or family.

Cover the laser pointer, clap the ball of yarn, knock the glass of water or stick the opponent with a card draw... or 10!

Embrace your kitty mentality and play out of turn if you have an exact copy of the last card played.

There are 3 different types of kitties, spotted, striped and solid, and 7 different types of cards in each suit. On top of that, there are 2 wild cards for a total of 23 different Crazy Kitties! 108 cards in total.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Monkey's Forest
description:
Become a monkey and collect as much fruit as you can and brint it to your tree, but be careful with the transport, as the more you bring, the more danger these is of one of them falling on the way there.
Thru the dice and take one or two fruits, lose one fruit or win extra fruit in your pile, you win the fruits when you bring them to your tree.
Win who has more fruits in his tree.

—description from the publisher

name: Emo Park
description:
Action and observation game, using the you must describe the cards using the emotions, but without suing the prohibited words, the first one to find the scene on the board, will win the card.
Also, you'll find some recommendations for using this game with adults (parents, educators, ...)

—description from the publisher

name: Ring Win
description:
Find the right animal before the others and put it into the compound.
Be the quickest to find the animals which have escaped from the farm, take them back and put them in the compound. Hold them firmly, because if you drop them you'll lose the card.
Flip one card with animal and another with color, the first player find it and ring the bell, win the card and should put it in his body as per card instructions.
The winner is who has 5 cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Pirates Adventure
description:
Which team of shipwrecked pirates will arrive first to the island and will build a pirate ship to continue on with their adventures?
Two pirate ships have been shipwrecked and its crew has to get to an island that they see in the distance and try to build a new ship to be able to return home.
Each team should pass the challenges as paint, define or imitate, if they pass the challenge, win a coin, at the end of the road, if the team has 10 coins, can buy the pieces to build the ship.
In this game, the board is the floor of the house and the chips are the players.
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Team-Based Game

name: Cafe Christa
description: A co-operative dice-and-cards board game wherein players collaborate to try and serve customers at a cafe each course of their meal in order. Dedicated to the memory of the designer's daughter, an accomplished chef and baker. It can also be played solo.

name: Entirely Plausible Journey
description:
The Phlegbonian Ambassador is ill and the fate of the universe hangs in the balance!

This is a sci-fi space opera with a difference.
Instead of cruising the outer reaches, Space Patrol will be shrunk down to microscopic size to battle a disease that is killing the alien physiology of the ambassador.

The scenarios are written as a supplement for Quick Intermediate Level Skirmish, free rule set.
Designer's notes and guidelines help port the game to any game system you want.
There are also suggestions on how to tweak the scenario with hints and tips learned tweaking the scenario during playtest.

It contains:

Scenario with simple rules to create a dynamic, challenging alien physiology
Simple print and play terrain bits so you can run the game rightr away
Loads of playtested suggestions for variants, so it's the scenario that keeps on giving


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Madinah Salat Fun Game
description: A Muslim board-game that reinforces the steps towards completing the required daily prayers, published by Goodword Books as part of a set that also includes the Hajj Fun Game. Move around the board while answering trivia questions to continue - there are no dice, to prevent running afoul of traditionalists who dislike games of chance.

name: Urbe: For the King
description:
Urbe: For the King is a fast and fun tile placement game where the players will compete to create the most beautiful and well organized City, trying to obey to the Royal Decrees issued from His Majesty, the King.

Each player will represent a Guildmaster who will try to be the most influential on the Kingdom using their specific tools, Coin Cards, to outperform the other Guilds in creating the most efficient and beautiful City for His Majesty.

By gaining City Tiles through placing their Emissaries and wittingly using Coin Cards, players will try to beco­me the best builder, thus being appointed by the King himself.

Fountains will enrich the City as new neighbourhoods are built, so you will be able to surprise the King creating even more beautiful Cities than he required.

-description from publisher's website

name: Bop It Beats
description:
A DJ musical addition to the Bop It line where players must Spin It, Scratch It, Flip It, and of course Bop It to the beat. Contains actual tracks from EDM artists that are synchronized to the game play.

—description from the designer

The original English version of the game had a bug in the DJ Expert and DJ Lights Only mode on which you reach to a 6 command pattern and the game will say that you failed. A demonstration of the bug can be watched here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xve3SOH6gBo&;ab_channel=SamLocke

The only way to bypass the bug is to play either a foreign version of the game or to play it on DJ Party as demonstraed here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ylo-Y18bXMY&;ab_channel=SamLocke

name: Frosch und Fliege
description:
"Fridolin-Spiele in der Tüte" Nr. 8 (between 1921-1928)

The frogs sit on the four green spaces. The flys start at the upper left corner. Each player has five flys, but only one of them in play at any time. If a fly gets eaten or catched the player starts with the next one. If a player gets a fly on the nose of the human figure in the center of the game board,he wins the game. Movement is determinet with a special fling die, a handle with three numbered discs (1-3 on the front side and a blank back) on a string.

If a fly gets on a space with a frog it gets eaten. On a blue space the fly is caught by the human. If a fly gets on a red space it at once advances along the arrow to the next yellow space.

If a player flings a 6 he shouts "Quak Quak", flings again and moves a frog of his choice. If the frog lands on a fly, the fly gets eaten.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wup di Wup
description:
The players use the springboard to flip the "Federhopfer" onto the game bord and score or lose the indicated points. The points are marked by pins on the top of the game board. The first player to score 100 points wins the game.

—user summary

name: Velká výhra
description:
3 to 5 players compete to get rich as quickly as possible in this game from Communist Czechoslovakia.

A single pawn is moved around the game board, based on dice rolls. Before each roll, all players can put some (or all or none) of their funds into the bank as a bet. Based on the roll, the pawn is moved (with possible re-rolls) and the color where the pawn lands determines what happens to everyone's bets. This can have varying results, including "lose all money in the bank", "win 10x your bet" or even "lose all money NOT currently in the bank".

This may sound like a game of pure chance but there is some strategy involved because of the re-rolls, the distribution of colors on the board (e.g. at any given moment, there is higher probability of pawn ending its turn on color X and not on any other color) and the changing order in which the players place their bets.

The winner is the first player to own 1,000,000 of "Game Crowns" (fake money).

name: The Great Outdoors Game
description: A roll-and-move trivia game with various questions about hunting, fishing, and wildife.

name: Battle for the Planets
description:
Battle for the Planets is a fun fast paced game that has you and your friends scrambling to match cards and claim planets.

The aim of the game is collect three cards but to sabotage your opponents at the same time. First player to collect all three cards wins, once you yell out the planet's name, victory is yours!

Each game is a bit different as each planet card you are trying to get has a different game rule. Action cards also spice up the gameplay, adding new strategies and tactics. Will you save up your 'steal' cards to take players' cards, or discard them to get a new card?

Every game is unique with 30 planet cards with different game modifiers. What are you waiting for? Battle for the planets!

—description from the designer

name: Bad Koalas
description:
The Koaladay Parade has gotten out of hand! Instead of marching peacefully to the forest the koalas are now starting to gather in the city and riot!

Bad Koalas is fully-cooperative, which means players win or lose as a team. Only one player takes a turn at a time, but they may solicit feedback from other players.

• The deck contains of 4 different colors (types) of koalas.
• The play area is communal for all players. It consists of four columns, one for each koala type. The horizontal row of 4 zones at the bottom of each column is collectively called the City; each koala that enters play from the deck is placed into the city zone that corresponds to that koala’s color.
• Koalas are unhappy in the city; when too many of them end a turn in the same city zone, they riot, which leads to problems for the players.
• The center row above the City is called the Country. Koalas in the country are relatively happy and therefore don’t riot like the koalas in the city.
• The row of zones at the top of each column is called the forest; players want to advance koalas to the forest to score them (flip them over) and gain upgraded action powers that the happy koalas in the forest grant you.
• Above the play area are the 4 action cards that each player can choose from on their turn. Each action is dedicated to moving koalas up toward the forest zones. (The koala token must be moved to a different action card each turn; you can’t select the same action that was chosen the previous turn.)
• On their turn, the active player moves the koala token to the action card of their choice, resolves that action, and then places into the city zones the (2+) new koalas that automatically come out of the deck... and resolves any riots that ensue as a result. Then the next player in clockwise turn order takes their turn. The game ends immediately when players win or lose together.

All players win immediately if at any time all koalas have been cleared from the city and country zones.

All players lose if either of the following conditions are met:
• if there are 15 or more koalas in the city zones
• if the koala deck is empty when a card is required to be drawn

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Impulse Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Trivia by the Pound: Music
description: Playable on its own or to supplement your favorite trivia game. Features 1200 questions on music.

name: Trivia by the Pound: Movies Trivia Game
description: Playable on its own or to supplement your favorite trivia game. Features 1200 questions on movies.

name: Trivia by the Pound: Big Screen
description: Playable on its own or to supplement your favorite trivia game. Features 1200 questions on the Big Screen.

name: Trivia by the Pound: Small Screen
description: Playable on its own or to supplement your favorite trivia game. Features 1200 questions on the Small Screen.

name: Trivia by the Pound: Television Trivia Game
description: Playable on its own or to supplement your favorite trivia game. Features 1200 questions on television.

name: Ultimate Frisbee: The Board Game
description:
In a rivalry that pits team Ocean vs team Fire, Ultimate Frisbee: The Board Game brings ultimate frisbee home.

The goal of the game is the score 3 touchdowns first. Touchdowns are scored by completing passes to teammates and moving down the field for an ending pass being caught in the endzone.

Following a chess like style in movement, the team on offense utilizes different cards from their hand to attempt passes. Different passing options include a backhand, forehand, swing, and dump pass. Both offensive and defensive players can also utilize speed boost and dive cards that can make all the difference from a defended pass to a completed touchdown.

This board game presents an option to play real-time ultimate, where strategy, and a bit of luck will be needed to put you over the top.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Birds & Bees: A Co-operative Tilt Game
description:
A co-operative boardgame in which players tilt the playboard back and forth on the wooden tilt-block to move the "birds" and "bees" marbles into their respective nests, flowers and bee hives. An educational game intended to touch upon the basics of reproduction, it includes four variant sets of rules as well.

—user summary

name: Let's Make Pizza
description:
A cooperative tile-based game which has successive turns, but requires players to prepare their ingredients in such a way as to maximise the production by the next player following them. Everybody is making pizzas, while making sure the oven doesn't get too hot and burn any pizzas which would risk ending the game as a collective loss. Includes Red dot, Green dot and Yellow dot tiles for various age levels.

—user summary

name: Speedy Parcel
description:
A co-operative card game wherein multiple drivers for a delivery company race alongside each other to deliver all parcels correctly to their destinations while avoiding delays like flat tires or aggressive dogs. Contains 12 parcels, 12 homes, 3 dogs, 3 dog treats, 3 flat tires, 3 spare tires, and 4 trucks.

—user summary

name: The Hungry Ones
description:
A cooperative tile-placement game in which players seek to arrange the backyard feeders in a pattern that will allow each of the eight different types of creatures to feed without disrupting the others, under the most Family Pastimes-esque tag-line "Let us feed as many hungry creatures as we can, and teach these little ones to share - so no one goes without". Includes rules variants for different age groups.

—user summary

name: High Seas: The Collision Regulations Game
description:
A board game published in limited numbers by the Canadian Navy for its personnel to play aboard long boring voyages at sea, and improve their innate knowledge of collisions-avoidance. Since it's a government asset intended for use at sea, it's made of fantastically high-quality materials which help to make up for how utterly inane the actual trivia proves to be (example: According to the 1972 mandate, what is the minimum length of sounding cord that should be trailed behind any vessel approaching a port from the leeward side with the intention to transfer cargo after dusk?"). The game box also includes a copy of the hefty "Collision Regulations: International Regulations for Preventing Collisions at Sea, 1972 - with Canadian modifications, 1983".

Players start out taking only yellow coastal routes, but as their knowledge progresses their ships (oddly represented as multicoloured faux bullets made of iron termed "projies") can move out into the ocean, ultimately needing to reach certain key ports and complete specific routes, all while avoiding hazards and inclement weather. The winner is officially termed the "Commander of the High Seas", and more importantly the Canadian naval personnel have passed another two hours at sea. The popularization of video games ultimately rendered traditional classics like "High Seas" less necessary.

It was reported that the initial printing was of only 100 copies of the game in October 1987 for initial deployment and testing, and it's unclear whether there were later versions produced as the rules stated "Copyright 1988"; it is referred to in naval literature as both "High Seas: A Collision/s Regulation Game" and "High Seas: A Performance Maintenance Game".

—user summary

name: Cigar Game
description:
In Cigar Game, players take the role of cigar manufacturers. Acquiring leaves and production methods from regions all over the world, players will attempt to create some of the most unique and desirable cigars in the hopes of gaining the title of the Most Prestigious Cigar Maker.

Cigar Game uses drafting mechanics which players will use to gain tobacco leaves, as well as a variety of methods in which to grow, ferment, and age them.

Each cigar is formed by combining three leaves together to form the wrapper, binder, and filler. Prestige points are gained based on the leaves used for the cigar, how long it was aged, and any added modifiers. Additional objectives can be met through rolling and selling cigars to gain extra Prestige points. The player with the most Prestige at the end wins!

Enjoy Cigar Game with friends at home or the local cigar lounge over a nice drink and your favorite stick. Being easy to learn and quick fun will make Cigar Game a group favorite for years to come and a great gift for the cigar aficionados in your life.

name: Inept Recruits
description:
Inept Recruits is a card drafting, set collection game. You win by completing formations using recruits from the recruit line. Each formation is worth 3-6 points, complete 15 points worth of formations to trigger game end, have the most points at the end to win! In addition to using recruits to complete formations, each recruit has its own special ability that can be used to get the recruits you need out of the recruit line.

-description from publisher

name: UNO: Speed Racer
description:
The usual Uno rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Race X Card - This card is a booby trap you can play on your rivals. But be warned, you could get caught in your own trap! When you play this card, you immediately flip the top card from the draw pile onto the discard pile (this card needs to be a number card, so, if necessary keep flipping over cards until a number card is on top.

Going in the current direction, each player in turn must play a card from their hand that is ONE number higher than the card on top of the discard pile. You would play a 0 after a 9.

Continue to go around until a player can not do this and they will draw 3 cards.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Animal Your Name
description:
Guessing the face-up cards are “whose” favorite food is?
And “whose” favorite game is? The player who knows and says the names of animals most will be winner of this game!

—description from the designer

name: Booksmart
description:
Booksmart is a game for fans of classic literature... or just the prankster in your friend group who can convince anyone of anything.

The dealer takes a card and reads out the title and author of a classic novel. Players write down what they think (or want others to think) the first sentence of that novel is.

After all answers are handed in, the dealers reads them out, slipping in the real sentence along the way. Players must vote on which answer they think is correct.

The person who guesses the correct sentence gets two points, but if you manage to trick everyone into thinking your answer is the real one, you get a point too. Player with the most points at the end wins!

Booksmart can be played with family, friends or used as an educational tool in the classroom.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Educational, Novel-based, Party Game

name: Wir bauen ein Haus
description:
Roll and run game. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to reach space 120 wins the game. On some spaces events benefit or hinder the player. The players may gain and loose tokens while playing. The player with the most tokens at the end of the game is the starting player for the next game.

This promotional game is from the 1950s.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ars Bellum
description:
Relive the great battles of Antiquity and at the head of your army, impose your power on your opponent!

ARS BELLUM is a game of medium complexity, allowing you to simulate all the battles of antiquity. The mechanics are concentrated on 5 pages of rules, for a 16-page booklet with illustrations and scenarios. The whole is easily learned. This system can be a game of discovery of wargames, but also a system that will satisfy the most seasoned players.

This game seeks to have the best compromise between historicity (orders of battle, aspect of the units) and playability.

Players play out the battles of the proposed scenarios, which are descirbed on A4 or A3 maps. Their style is simple and clean. The duration of a game is 1 to 2 hours.

The units (leaders or combat units) have a movement and combat capability (possibly including firepower) and represent 500 to 1000 or 2000 men depending on the type of unit and the scenario. For some scenarios, these figures are theoretical given the sources (difficult to represent the million men of Darius or Xerxes or others).

The system is based on the initiative won by players as a result of a die roll and the impact of leaders and/or other modifiers in the scenario.

In ARS BELLUM, the system is based on the skills of the units, which balance reality and gameplay. These are abilities assigned to units, basic or special, that represent a property or advantage during combat.

The basic module of the game gives the essential rules and discovery scenarios; the extensions are groupings of scenarios around one or more armies, a historical character, a military campaign.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Revivez les grandes batailles de l'Antiquité et à la tête de votre armée, imposez votre puissance à votre adversaire !

ARS BELLUM est un jeu de complexité moyenne, permettant de simuler toutes les batailles de l’Antiquité. Les mécanismes sont concentrés sur 5 pages de règles, pour un livret comportant 16 pages avec les illustrations et les scénarios. L’ensemble est aisément assimilable. Ce système peut être un jeu de découverte des wargames, mais aussi un système qui satisfera les joueurs les plus aguerris.

Ce jeu cherche à avoir le meilleur compromis entre historicité (ordres de bataille, aspect des unités) et jouabilité.

Les joueurs livrent les batailles des scénarios proposés sur des cartes A4 ou A3 maximum. Leur style est simple, propre. La durée d’une partie est d’1 à 2h.

Les unités (chefs ou de combat) ont une capacité de mouvement et de combat (regroupant éventuellement celle de tir) et représentent 500 à 1000 ou 2000 hommes suivant le type d’unités et le scénario. Pour certains scénarios, ces chiffres sont théoriques compte tenu des sources (difficiles de représenter le million d’hommes de Darius ou Xerxès ou autres).

Le système est basé sur l’initiative conquise par les joueurs suite à un jet de dé et à l’impact des chefs et/ou autre modificateur dans le scénario.

Dans ARS BELLUM, le système s’appuie sur les compétences des unités qui amènent respect de la réalité et particularité ludique. Ce sont des capacités attribuées aux unités, de base ou particulières et qui représentent une propriété ou un avantage durant le combat.

Le module de base du jeu donne l’essentiel des règles et les scénarios de découverte ; les extensions sont des regroupements de scénarios autour d’une ou plusieurs armées, d’un personnage historique, d’une campagne militaire.

—description from the publisher

name: Hack
description:
Friday night. The year is 1999. Teenagers around the country are gathering around in basements and living rooms, bringing with them their monitors, computers, keyboards and network cables. The party is starting.

But this is no ordinary LAN. These kids aren’t here to snipe each other with the Golden Gun, or blast each other with Siege Tanks. They’re not going to watch Anime or bootleg MP3s. They’re here to prove which team has the best hacking skills. The winner gets bragging rights for a week. The loser gets a blue screen of death. So switch on the power strip. Fire up the router. Queue the techno. And get ready to Hack.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Take That

name: Road Patriots
description:
Welcome to the Alternate American Revolution!

Road Patriots is a skirmish-style wargame set in an alternate version of 1776 Colonial America.
In this version of the colonies, the revolution is about to be in full swing. Colonists are preparing to fight the British and claim America as their own country.

However, there is one subtle difference. Both sides of the war have cars--cars that run on steam engines. These cars were used extensively in battles. They often had mounted cannons and muskets. Riders were militia and continentals wielding sabers.

Welcome to the world of vehicular combat during the American Revolution.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Tornado Chasers
description:
Tornado Chasers is a fun game full of excitement, strategy, challenges, and it does require some guts! You're a professional tornado chaser looking for the best photographs in the heart of tornado alley! Unfortunately, there is a massive tornado outbreak and now the tornados [sic] are chasing you!

The first player to collect five photographs of a tornado or the last player to survive wins!

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Sudden Death Ending, Take That

name: The Messenger
description:
The Messenger - a solitaire card game for 8-12 year olds.

The High King faces a surprise attack by the approaching armies of his nemesis! You, the royal messenger, must return to the palace and deliver the urgent message you've received from the scouts as quickly as possible.
Fail to deliver your message in time - and the palace will come under attack before the High King's armies have been mustered!

Quick as you are, this challenge may be too hard even for you, messenger. The palace is far away, and it'd normally take you seven days to cover the distance. Now, you only have five. What's more, the roads have become much more dangerous of late. Nevertheless, set out you must, if the High King is to receive the warning in time!

Your goal is to return to the palace and deliver your message in five days or less. Along the way, you will face several challenges and come across several people and animals. Each day will present a new challenge or encounter. While some will hinder you, others will help you make it to the palace in time.

Your base speed is 40 miles per day, and the royal palace is 280 miles away from your starting point. You won't make it in time unless you somehow manage to increase your speed. Perhaps something or someone along the way will help make you faster...

Each time you play, you will draw up to five cards - one card each turn - and face at least three different challenges. It is up to you to decide whether you take on the encounter of the day or avoid it. While some encounters can be automatically avoided, others require you to successfully hide in order to avoid them, and some encounters simply cannot be avoided. You must take on at least three of the encounters you come across (including those which cannot be avoided).

—description from the designer

name: Sankli: A Game of Chain Tag
description:
Enjoy a game of Sankli (chain tag) brought to you on a board game.

In this fast-paced two-player game, each player must race to create a line of their characters with their hands linked
together.

A simple format where players pick 3 cards each, place them on the board, and then use move them one at a time, rotating the card as they go, to form a line where the cards are linking hands.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Pattern Recognition

name: Patata Burgesa
description:
The Patata Burgesa is a game set in the Medieval Potato universe, where players will have to do everything in their power to secure and maintain the prized "Patata Burgesa" card.

In this new edition, the game has updated all the art and it has 3 more Potato Cards type, making the game more unpredictable and strategical. It also reorganizated all the Potato Cards in category to improve the game flow.

The turn:
During each Round, each player has a turn, during which the player can only throw a card and then the action of the specific card will be performed.

The victory:
When as many rounds as players have been made, the end of the game will be marked, and the player who has the “Patata Burgesa” card, wins the game and rules the Potato-Medieval universe.

‘’-description from designer’’

name: Der Irrgarten
description:
The players start at the entrance of the maze and have to make their way through to the exit. The first to do so wins the game. Movement is determinated by one die. At the crossroads the players have to follow the arrows corresponding to the number they have rolled (1 = green, 2 = red and so on).

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Der Rundflug
description:
The players have to get their planes from start to finish. Movement is determined by one die. If a plane gets into the rainstorm (spaces 21-23) it has to do an emergency landing before continuing. All planes have to land at the airfield (Space 58) to refuel. At space 87 the planes have to land for a check up. If a plane gets on space 97 (snowstorm) is misses a turn. The first player to reach space 113 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: 1066 Campaign Game
description:
A wargame for one player to recreate the English campaign of 1066.

The player takes on the role of the Saxon King Harold as he defends his throne from his rebellious brother Earl Tostig; Harald Hardrada the Viking king of Norway; and the Norman Duke William.

The game has a colour map, 12 plastic replica silver penny fortune counters and 11 chess pieces (replicas of the 10th century Lewis set) to use as army locators and intrigue markers, and a Haley’s comet marker to record the 12 monthly turns.

Warlords plot and launch their invasions while Harold heroically struggles to maintain his fortunes, gather the army and move in position to strike against his enemies.

—description from the publisher’s website

name: Slime Heroes
description:
Slime Heroes is a two-player, area control slime game.
It was originally inspired by the designer's favourite game Splatoon 2.

Players battle by manipulating their slime on the board and expanding your area.
Each player has an action deck of 16 cards. There are four types: place a color, place a bomb, support actions, and specials.
The game ends when both players run out of cards. The player with the most colors wins.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Sports, Territory Building, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Command Cards, Kill Steal, Open Drafting

name: Caccia al pirata!
description:
A pirate ship flees across the Caribbean Sea, chased by 2-4 hunters.
The pirate earns one doubloon for each turn he is not taken, and more if he reachs places he never visited before.
Hunters earn doubloons for reaching the pirate.

Ather each player gets a turn as the pirate, the game is over and the richest win.

This game is a reimplementation of the paper & pencil game Strachan's Fugitive, with a new setting for a historical magazine for kids. It comes with a long article about pirates and corsairs.

—description by the designer

Published on History Kids, italian edition, issue #2.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Children's Game, Educational, Nautical, Pirates
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Across the Po Valley: Wargaming the Late French Revolutionary War
description:
Across the Po Valley: Wargaming the Late French Revolutionary War

Wargamer and author Tom Garnett provides a view into a lesser known campaign where the successes of Napoleon Bonaparte in his brilliant 1796-1797 campaign were wiped out in 1799 by an equally brilliant campaign led by the Russian hero Marshal Alexander Suvorov.
Twelve battle scenarios, ranging from northeast to southwest northern Italy, tracks the sweep of the Russian-Austrian coalition against their French opponents.
Each scenario comes with a detailed battle map, a complete order of battle with unit labels, and special rules and content you need to set up and play each game.

SCENARIOS:

French Attack at Pozzo, Battle of Magnano
Russian Attack at Lecco, Battle of Adda River Line
Austrian Attack at Vaprio, Battle of Cassano
French Attack , Clash at Bassignana
French Attack at San Giuliano Vecchio,
Battle of 1st Marengo
French Morning Attack, Battle of Tidone Creek
Coalition Counterattack, Battle of Tidone Creek
Coalition Right Column Attack, Battle of Trebbia
French Right-Wing Attack, Battle of Trebbia
Austrian Right-Wing Attack, Battle of Novi
Russian Attack Against Novi, Battle of Novi
Morning Meeting Engagement, Battle of Genola


This book only provides scenario information and some additional rules modifications designed for a variant of the Regimental Fire and Fury rules system. The basic rulebook is needed to play these scenarios.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: A Handful of Cuts
description:
A Handful of Cuts sees each player taking the roles of assassins and plotting to slowly kill their fellow assassins in a death by a thousand cuts, or in this case A Handful of Cuts. Lie, steal, cheat and constantly think outside of the box to get the best of your fellow friends and enemies to take their blood cards and be the last alive.

Each player starts by drawing three mission cards. These could range from coercing a player into doing the most mundane of tasks for you to pulling off complicated schemes with the help of other players. Each successful mission allows you to steal blood from that player. If all but one player has run out of blood cards the game ends and that player wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Party Game, Real-time, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Acting, Contracts, Hidden Roles, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That

name: Human Season
description:
Human Season is a 2-6 player set collection hunting sim. Play as one of 6 critters as you race to be the first to fill all your harvest tags. Each turn, you move and then perform an action. You can search for an item, hunt a human, steal from your buddies. Be the first to return enough trophies to the hunting lodge to collect 7 hunting tags.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Set Collection, Simulation, Take That, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – Reflections Starter
description:
This is a very simple CCG based on the movie Star Wars: Episode I.

Reflections Starter contains two customized 30-card starter decks.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – Duel Of The Fates Starter
description:
This is a very simple CCG based on the movie Star Wars: Episode I.

Duel Of The Fates Starter contains two customized 30-card starter decks.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – Boonta Eve Podrace Starter
description:
This is a very simple CCG based on the movie Star Wars: Episode I.

Boonta Eve Podrace Starter contains two customized 30-card starter decks.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – Battle of Naboo Booster Pack
description: 11 Card Booster Pack for the Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – Battle of Naboo Starter.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – Boonta Eve Podrace Booster Pack
description: 11 Card Booster Pack for Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – Boonta Eve Podrace Starter
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – Duel Of The Fates Booster Pack
description: 11 Card Booster Pack for Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – Duel Of The Fates Starter
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – Menace of Darth Maul Booster Pack
description: 11 Card Booster Pack for Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – Menace of Darth Maul Starter
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – Reflections Booster Pack
description: 11 Card Booster Pack for Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – Reflections Starter
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Greedy's Crazy Coconut Game
description:
The object of this card game is to collect the most coconuts before the yellow picture of Greedy the Monkey is built.

Each player takes it in turns to take a card from the deck, starting with the youngest. If it is coconuts take the card and keep it showing the number of coconuts on the card (1 to 6). If it is a yellow card showing part of Greedy the monkey place it in the middle. Once all the Greedy jigsaw is complete the game ends. If a blue monkey card is drawn the player loses all their coconuts back to the deck. The winner is the one with the most coconuts when the jigsaw is complete.

name: El Juego de la Vida Educacion y Cultura Financiera
description:
El Juego de la Vida Educacion y Cultura Financiera is a game about Financial Education and Culture. This consists of a board, with email and surprise cards, tickets, bills, checks, insurance policies; in which the players advance according to what is thrown on the dice, paying and / or charging for consumption / rent according to the business in which they or a player arrives, having the opportunity to buy businesses that do not have an owner and putting franchises on them , mortgage and pawn, as well as can request a credit from the Caja; put your money in installments, buy insurance policies, handle checks, buy bicycles, panels and solar water heaters to save on electricity and gas, and invest in machinery to work the field crops such as combines and tractors.

Each player receives an endowment of money when starting the game, and chooses a token from the 6 available colors, when passing through the Payroll space, each player receives money on a monthly basis. The player who has the most accumulated money including the sum of his properties and manages not to go bankrupt wins.

—description from the designer

name: Tangoes: Card Set 2
description: Tangoes Card Sets provide hours of additional play variety for the Tangoes tangram-based games. Each pack includes 54 challenging puzzles and solutions, on 27 cards, in a slim resealable plastic container. There have been a total of 11 expansion card sets released, numbered 2 through 12 because they count the original game's cards as set 1. The card sets are not numbered by order of difficulty; each set simply contains new and different puzzles.
publishers: Rex Games, Smart Toys and Games, Inc.

description: Tangoes Card Sets provide hours of additional play variety for the Tangoes tangram-based games. Each pack includes 54 challenging puzzles and solutions, on 27 cards, in a slim resealable plastic container. The card sets are not numbered by order of difficulty; each set simply contains new and different puzzles.
publishers: Rex Games, Smart Toys and Games, Inc.

name: Americana!
description:
This fun & surprising Americana Trivia Challenge will broaden your awareness of America's most fascinating cultural knowledge! Try to stake your flags in richly imaginative categories as you share and discover funny stories, amazing tidbits and truly inspiring american lore!

—description from the publisher

name: Poker Family
description:
Poker Family is a card game variant of Poker that allows beginners and families to play the game.

Poker Family is a card game for 2 to 8 players, suitable from about 6 years. It takes about 45 to 120 minutes, depending on the number of poker chips used or the amount of play money. The game comes with a poker card deck of 55 cards; a set of double-sided cards with poker chips on one side and play money on the other. Additional accessories are also included to make the poker rules and the flow of the game more understandable to younger players and beginners.

Poker Family is played according to the rules of Texas Hold'em: The cards are shuffled well. The players next to the card reading place the Small and Big blind. Each player gets 2 cards. There is a first round of bidding (call, raise, fold). Then 3 community cards are revealed. The 2nd round of bidding takes place. The 4th and 5th community cards are revealed, followed by the bidding rounds. The players remaining at the end of the round who have not folded show their poker cards in the showdown. From their own 2 cards and the 5 revealed community cards, the players try to form the highest ranking cards. The player who has formed the highest ranking cards at the end of the game gets the pot of poker chips or play money.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Bitte einsteigen
description:
The players start with five trains at a train station (Ab) and have to reach the opposite station (An).One may use the express railway (red stations) or the regional train (white stations). Movement is one station per turn or jumping over occupied stations, if the station behind is unoccupied. Trains on red stations may be thrown out by passing trains. Trains on white stations are unaffected if jumped over. Each railway hat two tracks which may be switched at the stations, which counts as a move.

This game was produced in the 1950s as a promotional giveaway with a sticker of the advertising business on the cover. Its an interesting combination of pachisi and halma.

—user summary

name: Shelter 66
description:
Shelter 66 is a cooperative card a game that challenges players to place traps, steal cards from other players, and use the tools that they can find.
“NUKE CHANCE” cards will make the game much more interesting and strange.

In this game, we introduce: tactics, traps, action and different gameplays.

Shelter 66 is a dynamic board game with cards and dice
Different inventory cards which can be combined.
Strange and unexpected events. Interesting tactics.

—description from the designer

name: All Purpose Miniature Rules
description:
How many times have you looked at some new figures in the store only to say “Those are neat but I don't play that game.” Or seen a game but not had the figures to play?
Now that problem is solved.
All Purpose Miniature Rules is a game of miniatures combat that utilizes any miniatures you own.

With these rules you can recreate classic military battles, like Gettysburg and the Battle of Hastings.
You can see what would have happened if a squad of Viet-Nam-Era U.S. Troops went to the Alamo and fought against the Mexicans, or if Space Marines were helping the Greeks at Thermopylae.
Anything you'd like to do is fair game.

The game itself is divided into four primary parts:

Skirmish Combat,
Mass Combat,
Vehicles and
Creatures and Special Powers.



The Skirmish rules, presented here, are for the actions that include less then 24 figures on a side, and use primarily 25-30mm figures.

Note that you will need this first part of the game rule as this product supplies all the basics rules and mechanics for the system as a whole.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Acorn Paws
description:
Lend a paw and earn your share of acorns as the park squirrels gather all the loose acorns from around town and divide them up. Players select cards from their hand trying to receive the most acorns from the day's collection. The player with the most acorns at the end of 7 rounds wins the game.

Each round a new bag of acorns is poured into the center of the play area. Players count the acorns, and then select a card to play, trying to earn the largest share of the acorns. When all rounds are completed, the player with the most acorns wins the game.

Skills Focus: Division with Remainders, Probability

name: Pistols at Dawn
description:
Based on the 17th-century pistol dueling game for iPhone "Pistols at Dawn" by Cedar Hill Games and Tobyn Manthorpe.

Players take turns playing cards to move their crosshairs to stay on target or to move the opponent's crosshairs off target. There are three types of targeting cards that move a player's crosshairs, their opponent's crosshairs, or both. Players can earn "shot points" which can be used to purchase special abilities from the shop.

Play alternates between players until both players pass. A player will only pass if they cannot play a card or purchase abilities. After both players have passed, any crosshairs in the red zone score a hit on their opponent.

Keep your opponent off-target while you take aim and fire.

Regarding the iOS app that this game is inspired by, "Pistols at Dawn, a great game that no one played." Tobyn Manthorpe

-description from designer

name: L.E.A.D.
description:
L.E.A.D. stands for Lead Everyone Against Discrimination.

Inspired by the Tower of Babel, this board game has players use of multi-lingual lead types salvaged from an ancient print shop in Ipoh in the formation of a tower, while describing Malaysia's captivating heritage. Character cards depict people in a variety of different traditional styles of dress, and feature the a border of the words "Lead Everyone Against Discrimination" in 4 different languages, representing the melting pot nature of Malaysia.

Win the game by building the tower of lead types till it's completed with one lead type standing on top of the tower.

"Through this game, The Alphabet Press (TAP) hopes to enlighten more people on the history of letterpress printing in Malaysia and at the same time, highlight the diversity of languages spoken in this country – which has led to the existence of and need for these multi-lingual lead types."

name: Javelins
description:
JAVELINS is a relative of Amazons

Materials
10X10 square board
8 pawns in two colors
Supply of sticks (javelins)

Play
White moves first. Turns then alternate.

On a turn do two things.

1. Move your pawn in a straight line across any number of empty squares (orthogonally or diagonally). Pawns cannot move through other pawns. When moving orthogonally pawns cannot move through javelins. When moving diagonally pawns cannot move through 2 or more javelins whose ends meet at the same corner of a square.

2. The moved pawn throws a javelin orthogonally in a straight line across any number of empty squares and empty edges of squares. Javelins cannot be thrown through other javelins or pawns. If thrown vertically a javelin is placed horizontally along an empty edge of a square. If thrown horizontally a javelin is placed vertically along an empty edge of a square. No javelins are to be placed along the outer edge of the board.

Last player to move wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Tile Placement

name: Original Deutschland Rallye
description:
The players chose one of the ten routes and mark the 25 listed cities with green pawns (markers). Each player has to get five cars from start to finish. Movement is determined by a die. The players roll for each car already on the route.

Points are awarded for collecting the green markers (1 point) and opponent cars (5 points) by landing on the same town. Cars in big cities (100.000 residents or more) are only set back a number of cities according to the last roll.

If a green marker is collected, it is replaced by a red one. Red markers have to be collected too, but are counting -5 points. Each car reaching the destination counts 10 points.

The game ends when all remaining cars have arrived at the destination. The player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cluedo: Charleroi 1666
description:
The classic detective game! With a historical twist.
1666, the fortress of Charleroi in Belgium.
The king Charles II is murdered, but who did it ?


Une intrigue, six suspects, six armes et neuf lieux historiques…
Bienvenue dans le plus célèbre des jeux de déduction personnalisé à l’occasion des 350 ans de la plus grande métropole wallonne.

Charleroi, septembre 1666. La vie du jeune roi Charles II
est menacée… Il se murmure que l’héritier de Philippe IV
trouverait la mort de la main de l’une des personnes
de son entourage direct ou indirect.

Au départ de cette fiction, le jeu nous plonge dans le « Charleroy » du XVIIème siècle pour nous suggérer des situations rythmées par des conquêtes, la soif du pouvoir et de l’argent.
Les enquêteurs ont établi une liste de 6 suspects potentiels, de 6 armes du crime et de 9 lieux où se projette cette conspiration.
Parcourez l’ancienne forteresse à la recherche d’indices, posez les bonnes questions au bon moment et retournez toutes les cartes.
Serez-vous le premier à trouver la clé du mystère ?
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Pike and Shot
mechanics: Deduction, Grid Movement, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Dico Games, Hasbro, Winning Moves France

name: Monster Bounty Hunters
description:
Monster Bounty Hunters is a quick-fire card game for 1-8 players with plenty of different gameplay options for players of all levels and abilities.

Professor Hawkesbury has genetically engineered the scariest monsters in the world for a brand new exhibition in his Monster Park, but a freak storm caused a power outage meaning they all escaped and are now on the loose.

The Professor has asked you to assemble a special team of Bounty Hunters to round them all up.

For every monster you capture there's a reward on offer, but if the monsters escape into the world for good you’ll have to pay a fine for your failure.

Let's get hunting...
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Selection Order Bid, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: DreamQuest
description:
DreamQuest is part 2 in a series of solo narrative-driven card games set in the worlds created by H.P Lovecraft and similar pulp horror writers. Each box set expands and combines fully with previous titles in the series, adding new adventures, characters, artifacts and sanity blasting nightmares for you to experience (and survive)!

"In dreams, I have known the real clutch of stark, hideous, maddening, paralysing fear." - H. P. Lovecraft

DreamEscape is the first box set in the series.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Storytelling

name: Larvapocalypse: Slime Pit Expansion
description:
The Slime Pit Expansion features the 2" Flukebeast Immortal Monster with special rules and two 3x4 slime board tiles. The sounds of combat will rouse the Flukebeast from its slumber, but don't be fooled by its slow movements; it makes up for speed with sheer size.

This is the first Larvapocalypse expansion to feature a 2x2 figure for the game.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Map Deformation, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid, Take That

name: Survival Series: Mirage
description:
During a routine reconnaissance mission over the Gobi desert during WW2, a strange and sudden loss of flight controls renders your aircraft downed and in flames...

Surviving the crash is only the start of your epic struggle to survive.

Whilst swiftly salvaging what you can from the burning wreckage, you realise you are very alone and at the mercy of the elements and whatever else may lurk here.

Survival will not be easy, but you make your way out into the desert expanse, in the hope of finding civilisation, sanctuary.....and survival.

Mirage is a lightweight, fun, solo adventure card game, partly inspired by the retro classic text based adventure video games of old and with lovingly drawn art. Its a great game for when you need that quick gaming fix as it sets up and plays in as little as 10 - 15 minutes.

In Mirage, you must survive for six days. Search the Gobi Desert by placing your 'Exploration Tokens' at specific areas and resolving 'Exploration' cards . These will either be helpful or harmful locations, useful items or dangerous enemy encounters.

Choose areas wisely, as exploring the same place will have a smaller effect on your stats, .....BUT, cause you to be ambushed by a stalking enemy. Searching further afield has a more detrimental effect on your stats but you are not subject to the punishing ambush attack.

Manage your vital stats of Health, Water and Stamina in order to stay alive. Adapt your strategy based on your current stats and items at hand.

As well as the 'Standard' game challenge, you can play as one of several realistic Royal Air Force characters to further bring the game to life. Each character comes with specific starting items and stats. The 'Epic' level challenge will certainly keep you tested to the max!!

Welcome to the first in the Survival Series.....welcome to Mirage!.

—description from the publisher

name: Aklasi
description:
Lead an army to destroy your opponent.

Each player has 5 checkers with different values. In turn the player may advance one of his checkers by the number of steps indicated on the chosen chip, no more and no less. At the end of his move, the token must be rotated 90° before a potential confrontation.

The goal is the complete elimination of the opponent's checkers.

Proposed with 2 variants.

name: Safradino
description:
A dinosaur photo collection game in a park. A course and hand management game.
in turn the player decides whether he wants to advance or take "foot" cards. The first player to complete their goal card wins the game.

name: Diablada
description:
Game for 2 players, from 6 years old, for games of 15 minutes.

Tactical game from the Mini Concept range, where you have to form figures thanks to the drawn tiles, in order to make points.

Print'n play free

name: Dolphin Water Polo
description:
In this action game, the object is for 2 players or 2 teams to score goals and baskets with their dolphin water polo team. Each play at opposite ends of the board. In front of you there is are a few levers that control the team. The board has a number of indentations, into which the ball will settle. When it does, if you press the right lever, it will be ejected upward and/or bounced forward. Of course, your opponent is trying to do the same thing, so speed is essential. A goal is worth 1 point while a basket is worth 2 points. The first player to 10 points wins!

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Sports

name: Win Immunity: Stop The Virus
description:
Immunity is a fun and educational board game for all children aged 5 to 75. A game with lots of twists and turns and Great Fun for family and Friends.

Immunity is dealing with the spread of viruses and the actions to be taken of eradicating them.

In reality, when we humans get infected by a
virus, we have our immune system to protect us
by using anti-bodies to fight the invisible “invader”.
Once the threat is eliminated our bodies develop
Immunity against the virus so that the next time
another one attack us we are prepared to deal with
it easily Immunity follows the same rules. The game could be played by 2 to 4 people at a time.

The game consists of four levels:
Contamination, Quarantine, “Cross-Immunization”
