1 point for each correct match (Not including guessing their own)
2 bonus points if a player completes all matches in one turn
4 points for the founding member if no correct matches are made before the mic makes it back to the founding member


The player with the most points after 3 rounds wins



-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game

name: Sherlock's Mysteries
description:
Sherlock's Mysteries: Lucid Dreaming is an incredibly detailed and interactive puzzle adventure in the world of Sherlock Holmes available in both Journal and Puzzle Box formats. Solve puzzles, unravel enigmas, decipher codes & step inside the Mind Palace of Sherlock Holmes, as you race to save the life of the World's Greatest Detective.

The Journal seamlessly blends a narrative murder mystery experience with the puzzle and enigma solving that you would find in an escape room game. With more than 150 puzzles ranging from ciphers and codes to association and logic.

name: Tiles: The Name of the Game
description:
Tiles: The Name of the Game is a promotional game by Villeroy & Boch for their 250th anniversary. It was produced by Ravensburger.

Get your room board tiled with the help of two floor tilers. Collect different kind of tiles and and win with the most valuable pieces.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Roll / Spin and Move

name: La Haye Sainte
description:
On the evening of 17th June 1815, the German garrison of the large farmhouse La Haye Sainte (the sacred hedge) settled down to dry out. They were posted there by the Duke of Wellington who saw the solid building as an anchor to his left flank and vital communication line to his Prussian allies. As the rain poured down, cold and wet soldiers did what all soldiers do – they smashed down the large gates of the barn to build a fire, little thinking that in six hours they would desperately need those gates...

The epic struggle at La Haye Sainte is now the stuff of legend, with its small, but regularly reinforced garrison of green-clad rifleman of the King’s German Legion and their allies clinging on grimly against massed French infantry assaults.

Finally, with the riflemens’ ammunition spent, Marshall Ney ordered one more frenzied assault and this time, with Engineers led by Lieutenant Vieux swinging axes and crowbars, the French drove through the main gate. Bayonets and swords were freely used, in savage hand-to-hand fighting. By early evening the farm was in French hands and the loss of the farm keenly felt by the Allied forces. The overwhelming arrival of Blücher’s Prussian forces won the day for Wellington’s hard-pressed men who then reoccupied the battered remains, but the struggle for this key building will be remembered for eternity.

You can now recreate this epic struggle with this superb battle-set.
Will your brave German defenders be able to stave off the massed enemy assaults?
Will your proud French troops be able to drive the Allies from this vital strongpoint and threaten Wellington’s flank?
Only time will tell...

La Haye Sainte contains:

Laser-cut wooden farmhouse, out-buildings, walls and pond including construction guides and acetate windows
Laser-cut wooden tables and chairs – use as firing steps
Two laser-cut wooden carts and plough (barricade)
Six metal branches to form an abatis
Major Von Baring, King’s German Legion 2nd Light Battalion (exclusive metal figure)
15 metal King’s German Legion 2nd Light Battalion with rifles and muskets
5 King’s German Legion light infantry
36 French Light Infantry (30 plastic and 6 metal) including full-colour flag sheet and waterslide decals
Lieutenant Vieux (exclusive metal figure) and five metal French Engineers with muskets or tools
12-page scenario booklet

Note: There is a collector's edition of this that also comes with:

1 resin sandpit
Metal farmer's wife tending young calf
Resin pile of dead Frenchmen
6 metal French Voltigeurs skirmishing
Marshall Ney shouting at brigade commander
4 metal French casualties
Mounted French Officer
36 French Infantry (6 metal command and 30 plastic infantry)
6 Luneberg Light Infantry
6x 95th Rifles
1 British Rocketeer and a horse.
1 Nassau officer using cooking pot to extinguish the barn fire
6 metal Nassau infantry
36 Hanoverian Line Infantry (6 metal command, 30 plastic infantry)
Sprue of abatis stakes and branches (metal)

—description from the publisher's site
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Luck Plus / O'NO 99
description:
A combo box containing Luck Plus and O'NO 99.

The object of O'NO 99 is to avoid totaling 99 points or more, which would cause you to lose that round of play. If a player loses four rounds, they are out of the game.

The deck consists of 54 cards; three each of 2s through 9s, four Holds, six Reverses, ten 10s, four -10s, two Double Plays, and four O'NO 99s (which count only as hand-fillers); there are also 24 tokens that are used to keep track of losses - a player surrenders a token when they lose a round.

Each player starts with four cards and three tokens; on their turn, each player draws one card and then plays one from their hand, all the while the total on the table increasing until 99 is reached. The player that ends their turn on 99 points (or more) loses the round and surrenders a token; those with no tokens left are out of the game. Last player with remaining tokens wins.

Luck Plus is a unique card and dice game of number matching. The object is to be the first player to eliminate all of your cards by matching cards and dice. Each player is dealt 8 cards face up. The remaining cards are stacked face down in the center of the table to form the draw pile. The top card of the draw pile is turned face up and placed next to the draw pile to form the match pile. Each player will then try to get rid of as many cards as possible by matching the numbers on the cards with the numbers on the dice they roll. There’s a bit more to it than that, but you’ll have to see the rules to get the whole picture.

name: Geländebrettspiel
description:
Despite the explicit intention of the designer to invent a completely new, innovative game, it's based on chess. But considering he invented the game in the 30s of the last century, it’s an impressive and complex idea.
Before the actual playing starts, the board is assembled according to 3 dice. The 64 tiles form an 8 x 8 board showing sometimes a different landscape like wood, lakes and hills. There will be a river and a road. On each end of the road, there will be the own city of each player on his base line (the closest tiles).
Each player has 8 (+2 for the advanced version) pawns. They have different moving patterns that are restricted by the actual landscape.
Once during play, a player is entitled to a double move. The first player who conquers the city of his opponent or captures his "Stander" (like the king in chess) wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Platoons: Core Rules
description:
Tactical skirmish-sized wargaming rules that can be used for multiple settings/periods.

Features:

Strategic and tactical with many interesting choices
Order Point system allowing units to be used multiple times per round
Advanced Fog of War mechanics using hidden units to keep your opponent guessing where your units are and how many of them are left
Open list creation to allow you to create and organize your force the way you wish with many possibilities
Early and late war combined armies as well as useful special upgrades for every list allows each force to have a fighting chance against even the best equipped armies
Dynamic scenarios with varied set-up options for a different experience each time


Army Lists

Army lists are available for free and updated at the publisher website


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Der Wienerwald
description:
Old and typical roll and move board game about the travelling through Vienna Woods'(Austria). The Vienna Woods was the royal hunting grounds from the 11th century until 1850. Industrial development beginning circa 1840 encouraged increased settlement of the area. In 1870, plans were brought forward to clear most of the forest, but this caused widespread public resistance. In 1987 signed the Vienna Woods Declaration to protect nature in this region.

The first player, who cross the route first - wins the game.

—user summary

name: Quad Play
description:
4 hearts together. 4 pieces in each. 4 of all are different. 4 decades of combinations. In short everything is related to the number 4.
Game-play is based on a special shape resulting from combining 4 hearts. The way the hearts are merged makes each divided in 4 pieces. The whole shape has 9 pieces in total instead of 16 as some are common for two or more hearts.
A 'quad' is the shape described above with any 4 pieces ('qarts') marked in contrasting colour. According this quads can be divided in two groups (sides): light ('glim') quads if qarts are darker than other parts (as the 4 of qarts is always the minority) and dark ('grim') quads if vice versa. Each qart has value in points depending on the number of hearts it is common for. So it can be 2, 4 pts for glims, -2, -4 for grims and 0 for both. Changing qarts order gives 20 meaningfully distinctive combinations for each side, 40 quads in total. Quads in a side are rank-ordered. The overall ranking follows the qarts configuration (all qarts in one heart is the best) and is subdivided in two dimensions: vertical (4 'piles') and horisontal ('atop' 0-4 according the number of quads above). The priority between sides can be set by game rules and vary in playing progress.
The system can provide new experience in randomising, solitaire, card and dice playing as well as refresh many traditional games.

name: Club Pétanque
description:
The club is proud to present you the counter petanque! Fast, simple and fun, this summer it will be your perfect companion for an aperitif. In double or triplets, it's up to you! So, do you shoot or point? As with petanque, every time you throw, shoot or point, choose the right dice!

The Club Pétanque game box contains:
1 field: a mini tray in several copies
2 dice: 1 "shooter" die to attack your opponent, 1 "pointer" die to place your "balls" on the field
6 blue "balls"
6 white "balls"
1 storage bag
1 rule of the game.
Made in France.

name: Reiten
description: A simple children's roll & move game in the ZDF Sportstudio-Linie range of small box sports board games.

name: Radfahren
description: A simple children's roll & move game in the ZDF Sportstudio-Linie range of small box sports board games.

name: Break Par Golf Game
description: A simple card-driven golf game with crayons to mark where your ball lands. Each shot you choose between Driver, Fairway Shot, Approach, Trap Shot, and Putting. Flip the next card and see how far you've hit the ball and mark accordingly with the wax crayons, or your pawn. Each hole has a number of spaces between the tee and the green denoting the distances between them, with fairways marked white, approaching zones yellow, and traps red.

name: Poker Roll
description: A lighthearted carnival-game style poker game of rolling marbles to mark cards and score the best hand you can. Roll 5 marbles up the inclined board towards a number of poker cards with holes in them. Try to sink the best cards and use the chart at the bottom of the board to see how many points your hand is worth. A new way to play poker, where skill is just as important as luck.

name: Elections of US America Election: The Expansion Pack
description:
The amazing, vote-tastic expansion comes with an additional 21 cards, including 14 new Wonk cards, 5 Scandal cards and 2 cards with the special edition rules adding a whole new way to play (sort of like a campaign mode!) where you're doing the primary and the main election. More fun than an impeachment hearing!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Political

name: Senso: Japanese Feudal Warfare Rules for Skirmish Actions
description:
A set of miniatures rules for tabletop skirmish actions in Feudal Japan. These skirmish level rules are written to cover the period 1200 AD to 1500 AD. This period begins with the ascendancy of the Daimyo and ends in the "Age of War."

The rules are intended to cover skirmish type actions which might involve thirty figures per side. The game can be played with either 15mm or 25mm sized figures. The measurements given are for 25mm figures and should be halved for 15mm figures.

Two forces consisting of samurai, ninja, mercenaries, and peasants, face off over variable scenarios. Features a point-buy system for force creation.

Turn structure is fairly fluid -- figures act in dexterity order, performing their action (fire missile weapon, or move and possibly attack). Damage taken by a figure reduces both hit points and dexterity.

Includes a simple campaign system.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Honorowy Obywatel
description:
The Honorowy Obywatel (Honorary Citizen) game describes the preparations before Marshal Józef Piłsudski's visit to Białystok. The Chief of State will arrive in the morning of August 21, 1921 and, before receiving the title of Honorary Citizen of Białystok, will take part in numerous ceremonies. The players try to organize all planned events at the best possible level.

The game is played with cards, most of which represent the time of day (morning, midday, or evening) or the place (Main Railway Station, Kościuszko Square, Branicki Palace, or the Barracks at Traugutta Street). The organization of each event consists of collecting a set of cards that correspond to its place and time of day: the player who collects the appropriate set gains glory points. Players who haven't had time to help organize the event can also earn Glory Points as long as they collect cards that allow them to participate. The game will be won by the player who has the most glory points at the end - and thus will be the most remembered in the history of Białystok.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Zbuduj miasto: Planszówka z Sulejówka
description:
The game shows the expansion of Sulejówek in the first half of the 20th century.

Players place tiles representing roads and buildings on the table, creating three historical layers. Correct placement of a tile on the lowest layer is awarded with victory points, while on the second layer it allows the player to make an additional move. The highest-scored tiles, depicting interesting monuments of the town, are placed on the top layer. When laying the tiles, players often have to decide whether they want to make additional moves, while making it easier for their opponents to place tiles on the top layer.

In the full game, the winner is the player with the most victory points at the end. In the simplified version, the winner is the one who gets rid of either his roads or monument tiles.

-description from designer

name: Jam Session
description:
The curtain opens for a new Jam Session, enjoy a quick game with your family and friends.

Become a musician and show everyone that you are the best, improvise without fail and thus you will be the leader of the band.

Choose your character, shuffle the deck and deal the cards corresponding to each player.

In each turn you will have to play a card that you must combine with the active card on the table to achieve a score of 7. Only then will you be able to advance in your point board, but don't worry, if you cannot do it with your cards you have the opportunity to do it using the improvisation die. Do not trust your score, during the game events that can change everything appear.

The player who first completes his board wins.

Do not detune if you want to be the best in Jam Session.
publisher's summary

Not to be confused with ジャムセッション (JAM SESSION).
categories: Animals, Card Game, Math, Music, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Shattered Lance
description:
Shattered Lance is a deck-building game with worker placement elements based on medieval jousting tournaments. Knights face-off against each other over the course of a seven day tournament with each round consisting of a Court Phase and Joust Phase. At the end of the seven days, the knight with the most victory points is named King's Champion.

Knights participate in one-on-one matches and gain reputation and gold for their victories. Between matches they visit the Court to gain new items or mounts, gain favors from nobles such as the King and Queen, mingle with nobles to increase their reputation, or gain additional training for their knight and squires.

During the Court Phase players place their knights and squires within the Royal Court. Squires spend gold to purchase items for their knights while the knights use their reputation to gain them. Players can build their decks at the "Training Grounds" to be used in the Joust phase.

During the Joust Phase players will compete against their opponent using their decks. Items gained or purchased in the Court Phase can be used during the joust to aid the knights. There are four passes within each joust. During a pass each player strategically plays three different cards from their hand consisting of the "Herald", the "Shield", and the "Levee". Knights start with 10 stamina which they spend to play cards from their hand and lose it when they are hit by their opponent's "Levee". If a knight's stamina reaches 0, they are unhorsed and can decide to remount if they still have a chance at victory. The first knight to score 10 points by the end of the fourth pass gains a victory token, gold, and reputation.

At the end of the seventh day, players combine their victory point total based on their cards, victory tokens, and reputation points. The player with the most points wins the tournament!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Worker Placement

name: Classic 3 Game Naval Set
description:
This Classic 3 Naval Game Set includes three older Minden titles in a set.
The games are Monitor vs Merrimack: Battle of Hampton Roads, 1862 (American Civil War), Great War Salvo!: Solitaire Tactical World War I Naval Game (World War I solitaire), and Emden vs. Sydney (World War I).

Monitor vs Merrimack recreates the Battle of Hampton Roads, March 1862, between the Union Monitor and the Confederate Merrimack (Virginia), the first battle between ironclad warships. Comes with 12-page rule booklet, set of ship counters, standard rules and game tables covering the famous battle initial battle of March 9, and optional rules and March 8 scenario. Originally published in 2012. For two players, low complexity.

Great War Salvo! Promo ed.. is an introductory but fully functional and playable solitaire WWI naval game using the Great War Salvo! system. (If you own GWS! 2nd or 3rd ed. no need to buy this, as you already have everything in this edition). Four pages of rules and tables, two counter sheets (Sheet A and B, 48 rated warships of various types and nationalities). This fairly low complexity, solo game edition was originally published in 2014.

Emden vs. Sydney is a two-player World War I game, using a modified Fletcher Pratt game system to smulate the Battle of Cocos, November 1914, between the German Emden and the Australian Sydney. Comes with eight page rule booklet with rules and tables, sheet of ship counters, six ship data cards. Moderate complecity. Originally published in 2015.
categories: American Civil War, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Zeal
description:
Zeal is a game of religious conquest in a 16th century type of setting. Each player represents a different religion/cult that is trying to spread across the globe.

Gameplay is simple but strategy is deep and luck is not a factor. Players, on their turns, can take one action (move pieces, produce more pieces, convert an area to their religion, or slaughter pieces).

Each player also has 4 miracle cards that they can use to their advantage (each god has its own unique set of 6 miracle cards to choose from).

Game can end in 2 ways:
If a player places 10 temple cubes/controls 10 areas on the board (8 in a 3p game), that player wins immediately.

If every area on the board has a temple on it, the game ends immediately. The player with the most temples on the board wins. If a 3 player game ends this way and 2 players are tied for most temples, remove the losing's players temples and the 2 players that were tied for first continue to play until one of them places 10 temples.

-description from designer

name: The Option Game Board
description:
The Option Game Board has four levels of play, each bringing you the fun and excitement of trading for high stakes in the fastest action game in town!

Players spin the wheel to determine Buy-Sell-Expiration months, premiums and stock last sales. Option trading cards record transactions. Consequence cards create various market conditions.

Players can do transactions based on the values of the wheel trying to make as much profit as possible.

There are four rounds of trading (January/April/July/October) and the player with the most money from all their trades is declared the winner.

—user summary

name: This Is Not a Test: The Big Book of Scenarios – Vol.1
description:
The Big Book of Scenarios is packed with 20 scenarios written by some of the best fans in the world. Created as part of the This Is Not a Test (TNT) Scenario Community Challenge, these scenarios in this book were deemed the best of the best and are now ready to challenge your warbands.

Featured scenarios include:
Rad Roach Roundup (First Place Winner) – Charged with rounding up a settlement’s food supply, players have their warbands wrangle ornery rad roaches into their enclosures. This is easier said than done as warbands have to be cautious as combat can overexcite the roaches.

The Preacher (Second Place Winner) – This scenario is a treasure hunt with a rad zombie twist. Warbands must survive the irradiated undead to loot the corpse of a fallen preacher. Rumors say there is a powerful relic stashed away with the dead clergyman’s holy book.

Wasteland Bases (Third Place Co-Winner) – Not one, but five separate scenarios where your warband must find a base, build it up, and defend it; all the while attacking enemy bases. With plenty of options for customization and rules for resource gathering, this fun campaign brings a near real-time strategy game feel to the TNT wasteland.


The TNT Tribal Campaign (Third Place Co-Winner) – This thematic campaign is a clever set of five warband specific scenarios featuring wasteland tribals, either played with a tribal warband or featuring the tribals as recurring foils for the warbands. In this campaign your warband delves deep into tribal culture by appeasing the wasteland spirits through sacred rights, protecting refugees during a forced migration, and even stopping ritual sacrifices.

Eight Other Exciting Scenarios – Great for one-off gaming or easily inserted into an ongoing campaign, these scenarios contain assorted of fun wasteland activities like battling deranged cultists, raiding a underground vault, stalking through bat-haunted ruins, and much, much more!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Battlelund: The Paper Wargame – Core Rulebook
description:
Battlelund is The Paper Wargame.
It is accessible, adorable, and affordable.
Battlelund is the charm and cute that everyone needs. It is made for everybody in the world to enjoy with anybody they want. Awaken your dreamer and find the treasure that is Battlelund.

Ready to smile? Good!
Battlelund is an exciting, fast-paced 15mm high fantasy wargame with a decidedly cute and whimsical nature.
If the wackier, cheerier side of things appeals to you, as well as games involving strategy and choice, Battlelund has you covered!
The game, by intention, is easy to learn and enjoy, but to be the true "bashy smashy master", well that's another story... So then, what's inside this adorable 85-page tome of wargaming goodness for all?


Visuals: Full color! Tons of photos and cheery art detailing the Battlelund World, as well as the weaving scope of our Battlelund printable miniatures line!
Setting: Fairy tale-styled impressions of the Battlelund World, Albrathia, with flavorful, fun quotes and snippets.
Rules: All the rules, spells, special abilities, game types, etc. Written in a fun, and very learnable way!
Stats: Every unit, hero, engine, and creature of every army has their profile listed inside! All you need is right here!
Battle Report: Not only an enjoyable read, but a fun demonstration in motion!
Resources: Tutorials on assembly of miniatures and base covers, as well as storage and the like! Also, reference document for ease of play.


Simply put, Battlelund is fun and cheer for everyone, perfect for both children and adults. Hear the trumpets blaring? That's the Battlelund World calling. See you in Albrathia!

—description from the publisher

name: Tricon
description:
Tricon is a pure connection game for 3 players (one and only one player will connect and therefore win).

The game is played on a triangular board with 21 dots each of three different colors, one color for each player. These dots are laid laid out to form a triangular grid play area, which has one dot of each color for each triangle play location. There is a black dot (6 total) in each corner and the middle of each side of the triangular board, which identify non-playable locations. When the game starts, 4 dots of the same color (two sets for each color) are already connected as a three link line along the outside edges of the triangle game board. The goal is to create a path in your color that connects your two initial lines on two different sides of the triangle game board.

Players take turns connecting two dots of their color. Each turn the active player chooses an empty triangle play area. Then, they draw a line from the point of their color through the opposing side of the chosen triangle. If the next triangle is not empty there is only one possibility to leave it. The player's line continues in that direction and may go through several non-empty triangles. As soon as the line comes to an empty triangle play area it ends on the opposing point, which is the active player's color. Note: A move that would go through a triangle containing a black dot is forbidden.

A player wins if they connect their two initially filled in lines along two sides of the triangle game board.

name: ネコナイン (Nekonine)
description:
ネコナイン (Nekonine) is a co-operative card game from Japan.

A cat-loving millionaire has decided to create a zoo 'Nyapari Park' that is only for cats. Immediately, they decided to hire a zoo architect, and collected many people to work on it. You are first-class architects assembled for this project. Take a breather and complete the best zoo!

Every round, you’ll choose one of your two hand cards to lay down, and everyone reveals what they laid at the same time. These cards go in the middle, eventually forming a 6x6 grid of 36 cards. Once all the spaces have been filled, the next stage of the game begins.

Now you all have to decide how to make one line to connect the START and the GOAL that also connects nine different animals. If you can do that, you successfully complete the game and everyone wins!

If however, you can’t complete the line or find a way to pass all the animals, or if you can’t find a place to put your card when making the grid, your team fails and everyone loses the game.

猫好きの大富豪がネコ科だけの動物園『ニャパリパーク』を作ることにしました。
早速、動物園建築士を雇うことにしたのですが、
金に物を言わせて何人も集めてしまったから、さぁ大変。
あなた達はこのプロジェクトに集められた一級建築士です。
息を合わせて最高の動物園を完成させましょう！

毎回2枚の手札の内１枚を伏せて全員一斉に公開します。
公開されたカードを中央の場に配置していき、6×6の計36マスが埋まりきったら終了です。
STARTとGOALが繋がるように一筆書きで進んで、
９種類の動物と出会うことが出来ていれば見事完成。全員が勝利します！
もし、その条件を満たせなかったり、途中でカードを置くことが出来なくなれば
プロジェクトは失敗となり、全員が敗北します。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Network and Route Building

name: Brew & Fool!
description:
In a far away kingdom, the King’s loyal Grand Alchemist has passed away. The King has personally requested for the best alchemists in the kingdom to brew the ultimate potion for him. The first alchemist to do so will be crowned the next Grand Alchemist. To speed up the process, the King has given each alchemist an equal chance to be appointed as the Royal Alchemist. The King ordered all the other alchemists to share their own Ingredients and findings with the Royal Alchemist to help each others’ progress. However, wanting to be the future and only Grand Alchemist, you will secretly sabotage the other alchemists using powerful spells while avoiding punishments from the King. Who will rise to the top to become the Grand Alchemist?

In the beginning, each player is dealt 1 Sabotage card which can be played an unlimited number of times and an assortment of Ingredients or Spells. Each round, a player has the chance to bear the Royal Emblem. The Royal Emblem denotes the Royal Alchemist, and all other players are instructed to give one ingredient to the Royal Alchemist. However, you can choose to sabotage by playing the Sabotage card or a Spell instead. As all the cards are played face down, nobody knows what anyone else is playing. The Royal Alchemist reveals all the cards and determines the fate accordingly.
There are 3 possible scenarios:

If half or more than half of the cards played are Ingredients: The Royal Alchemist collects all the Ingredients played and the spells will be cast.
If less than half of the cards played are Ingredients: The Royal Alchemist collects all Ingredients played and players who played Spells or Sabotage cards must instead give the Royal Alchemist any 2 cards from their hand. Spells will continue to be cast.
If all cards played are Ingredients: All Ingredients played are discarded instead.


During each round, players have the choice of depositing ingredients in their cauldron. Once in the cauldron, these ingredients cannot be returned to your hand. The first player to hold the Royal Emblem and have 10 or more ingredients of at least 6 different types in their cauldron wins the game. Alternatively, any player to collect 7 of the same ingredients in their cauldron instantly wins!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Open Drafting, Predictive Bid, Prisoner's Dilemma, Push Your Luck, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Sfida tra opliti!
description:
Marching in rows, hoplites from Sparta and Athens fight each other on a vaste plain. Whoever manages to outflank the enemy or sneak into their line will bring havoc!
A themed version of Apit-Sodok.

—description by the designer

Published on History Kids, italian edition, issue #3.

name: Verflixter Wettbewerb
description:
Published by a car paint manufacturer, all players compete to be the best car paint garage. On his turn, a player may choose 1 of 3 options:

Buy up to 2 investment or cooperation tiles or perfomance stars
Roll the die and move one of the 4 cars on the board track and - according to the space landed on - draw a mission card, an action card, an event card or do nothing. The mission cards give rewards, the more, the better you meet the required conditions (have stars and the right tiles).
Play an action card against an opponent.


If a player has completed his garage table with 6 investment tiles, 3 cooperation tiles and 6 perfomance stars, the game ends. The player with the most valuable garage wins.

Produced by Ravensburger Freizeit- und Promotion Service.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Investment, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Track Movement

name: Das Zeitungsspiel
description:
The players are reporters and want to collect 8 articles for their newspaper. On your turn, you throw 2 dice. The colored die determines what kind of card you are entitled to draw onto your hand. Blue cards show a specific department, grew ones a specific action like swap cards, play a department card from your hand into your display, make a revealed card of an opponent a canard (worthless), decide to accelerate before throwing the dice. The regular die determines the number of spaces you advance on the track.

You may play one action card on your turn. When you have 8 cards in your display, try to reach the space of the head quarter. After someone arrived there, all players add the value of their cards in their display and deduct the number of spaces they need to reach the headquarter. Highest score wins.

There are several German newspapers that published this game idea.

The game is produced by Ravensburger Freizeit- und Promotion-Service GmbH.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Track Movement

name: ターンアップシャーク (TURN UP SHARK)
description:
ターンアップシャーク～超B級サメ坊主めくり！～ (Tan-appu shaku - cho B kyu same bozumekuri! - )(Turn-up Shark - Super B-movie Shark Card Game!! -) is a card game from Japan.

Death comes when the power of sharks goes over the limit!
Handy and easy, but super-exciting!
Escape from the sharks that hunt you anywhere!
Sometimes, make counter-attack with weapons!!

A diabolical-modified Bonzu mekuri*! Players are characters in a Sharknado style movie. A player draws only 1 or 2 cards a turn. If they get overwhelmed by sharks, they die! But weapon cards help the players survive.


Bonzu mekuri is a historic card game in Japan, which consists of flipping cards and holding or collecting cards, or going bust.


user summary

サメが限界を超えたら死亡！
簡単・お気軽・超エキサイティング！
どこまでも追ってくるサメから逃げろ！ 時には武器で反撃！！

一言でいえば魔改造坊主めくり！
ターンですることは、「１」枚か「２」枚めくるだけ。
限界を超えるサメを浴びると死亡！
publisher's summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Horror, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: 星空を積む。 (Hoshizora wo tsumu.)
description:
星空を積む。～七夕の夜に天の川を作ろう～ (Hoshizora wo tsumu. - Tanabata no yoru ni amanogawa wo tsukurou -), meaning "Pile up a starry sky. - Let's make a milky way in the Tanabata night -", is a dexterity game from Japan, using folded cards.

Tanabata is a famous, popular festival in Japan, which celebrates the meeting of the deities Orihime and Hikoboshi. These lovers are separated by the Milky Way, and may only meet on the 7th night of the 7th month.

The game has a deck of cards showing beautiful starry night skies, with a comet streak on one side. The players take turns to draw and fold a card along the comet streak, and then place it upon the other cards. In this way, players build up a starry sky, and score points for making good connections between cards. But if cards fall from the sky, the player scores nothing that turn. The game ends when a player reaches a score target, or the card deck is exhausted.
user summary

- A balance game to make a tower with the starry skies printed cards.
- Compete the scores by pile-up and/or broaden the starry skies.
- And, after the game, enjoy the starscape which you made up.

・星空が描かれたカードを積むバランスゲーム
・星空を重ね、広げて得点を競おう
・ゲーム後は完成した星空を眺めてみよう
publisher's summary

name: All-Star Hockey Card Game
description: A set of 38 cards, 19 each for each the "Blue" team and the "Red" team, are arranged randomly to recreate the fast-paced game of ice hockey in which each side tries to score the most goals.

name: Kayo Boxing Card Game
description: See who is champ! Square off with your opponent for an exciting bout. Punches, jabs, hooks, knock-outs, low punches - they are all in the cards of this exciting, easy-to-play boxing card game.

name: As Ilhas: Wargame nas ilhas britânicas
description:
As Ilhas - The Islands

Historic wargame based on the timeline of the conflict in Anglo-Saxon Britain encompassing the historic period shortly after the departure of the Roman army in the 4th century until the Norman Conquest in the 11th century.

Turn Order:

Initiative
Movement
Skirmishers Firing
Firing
Melee
Moral


Army lists cover:

Britons -200–600
Early Saxons 420-885
Anglo-saxons 1000-1060
Early Danes / Vikings 700-900
Northmen 900-1100
Normans 1000-1200


— User / publisher description

name: Shark Bay
description:
You are in a bay surrounded by 3 sharks with your opponent. Only one of you will survive. Each turn you draw a card to complete 1 of 3 actions. You can either move your player, move a shark of your choice, or set up shelter with a sandbar. However, beware as each shark possesses a special ability! While sandbars may provide protection for now, they are not guaranteed to remain. In order to survive you will need the tactics to both evade the sharks and outwit your opponent into being the tasty treat.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Lucky Roll
description:
Lucky Roll is a fun little mix of luck and instincts. Roll dice to obtain gems to collect points. Points are collected after players place gems on the game board and their claimed number is rolled. However, if their number is not rolled, 1 gem from you must be removed from the board. The goal is to collect the most points and have the most fun possible!

—description from the designer

name: Senate: The Argument Game
description:
In Senate the Argument Game, you are a senator in the esteemed Roman senate. Think up the most mischievous Propositions for your peers to act out. But be careful, arguing and getting your way in the Senate requires quick wit and strategy.

As any good senator, you must use your Influence to acquire new arguments on the start of every round. The goal is to end up as on the winning team at the end of the round by Objecting arguments or Supporting those who are already winning. The round starts when a Senator makes a Proposition and ends when the senator who started the round plays their eighth turn. Everyone on the losing team must then act out the Proposition. The game ends when every senator has had the chance to make one Proposition.

Members of the winning and losing teams switch frequently throughout the round and Influence keeps changing hands due to yours and other senators' actions, so manage your arguments well. Betrayal, deception, and even begging - everything goes when reputations are at stake.

description from designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Political, Print & Play

name: Tops: The Number Game
description: A simple race to play all of your numbered tiles by placing them on central ascending stacks or on other player’s piles when numbers are one more or one less. Play one out and have another turn.

name: polaryCUBE
description:
Skill game based on small cubic magnets to be placed on a game board.

Each player receives the same number of magnets at the beginning of the game and tries to place them on the board without them attracting each other, in a chain reaction.

name: Sal & Pólvora
description:
Sal & Pólvora (Salt & Gunpowder) is a Naval wargame system focused on the Age of Navigation, 1750-1825

Scale:
1 hex= 20 m
ship = 1/600 - 1/1200

Sequence of play:

Wind adjustment
Initiative
Movements
Shooting
Boarding
Repairs
Moral


Contains ships data for France, Britain and Spain

- User description
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Stacknsleuth
description:
Objective: to enjoy the treats in the mansion while solving a short mystery before a night of gaming. 1) set up a mansion with treats, trinkets, or drinks, 2) load a story on the companion app, then 3) enjoy the mystery and narrative as you explore each room on the table and in the app.

Components
A physical mansion - can be printed and built out of boxes or drawn on stackable shot glasses, your creativity is the limit.
A device that supports the website to load the interactive story.
The treats, trinkets (could be game pieces as prep for the next game), or drinks to place in each room.

Setup
Place the unique items in the mansion boxes or shot glasses.
Stack the mansion to look like the companion app.
Load the game or story.
If you are playing with somebody over zoom or google meet, make sure you both have your mansion stacked (you could send them one loaded with surprises) and then connect and one of you can open the app and load the game, then present to the group, taking turns reading the narrative and opening physical rooms.

How to Play
Tap on your first room in the app and once you tap “enter the room” (not before) open the physical room. Some rooms cannot open at first, so it is best to wait to make sure the room can open before opening the physical room.
Each room will have a puzzle you can solve that leads to an end solution of the game. You can go back to rooms to read the solutions at any time.

Winning the Game
You win or lose the game if you solve the final puzzle correctly or incorrectly.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Horror Flick
description:
Horror Flick is an all vs one game where one player takes on the role of the antagonist and the rest of the players take on the part of camp counselors trying to rescue the campers and achieve a goal depending on the antagonist.

The counselors will be moving to locations constructed by the antagonist to find and build up a simple engine to help them to deal with the problems that arise. Players can fight, hide, search, and run as basic actions. Each player has variable powers and items further the things they can do.

The antagonist will construct the search decks at the locations laying traps and surprises to get the players. Then during game play will move around targeting players trying to complete a goal based off of the antagonist they chose at game start. Each antagonist has different actions they can do.

The winning condition for both sides is based off of which antagonist the player chooses. It could be find key items to escape, rescuing a number of campers, performing a ritual, and the list goes on. Just think of any campy horror flick and how it resolves.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Modular Board, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Slide it
description:
This is an abstract puzzle game that plays 2 to 4 players where the players manipulate the board in order to get their pieces closest to the goal before the game ends.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Behind the Bleachers
description:
This game falls in an alternate world where colleges are run by the students in a mafia like world. It is a dark horror where the students will do whatever they can to take out the other students that get in the way of them being the most popular.
The game uses a drafting mechanic with area control to spread your influence in different locations to sway other students onto your side and win out on being the most popular girl in the school.

—description from the designer

name: 5150: Bugs – Breakout
description:
Don’t Call Them Bugs!

Listen up newbie! I know what you unwarranted high regard for yourself recruits call our enemy – Bugs. A bug is something very small you see crawling on the ground. Something insignificant that you step on and keep doing whatever you’re doing. I got news for you. That’s not what these things, these Bugs, are. We’re going down into the Tunnels looking for real Bugs. When you meet one face to face, try not to wet yourself, and pray to whatever god you believe in that you get out alive. Because to them; we’re the insignificant ones.

5150: Bugs – Breakout is the third of three books linked together to cover the Bug infestation that threatens the 5150 Universe.
All three are stand-alone games.
In fact, 5150: Bugs –Into the Tunnels can be used with all of our other 5150 titles.

What: Small group size combat.

Scale: Man to man combat. 1 figure equals 1 man or Bug.

Your Role: Players can Lead from one group of Civilians, Police, Gangers, Survivors, Planetary Militia or Star Marines.

Playability: Designed for solo, same side and head to head play.

In 5150: Bugs - Breakout you can choose to:

Lead a small group of Civilians, Gangers, Survivors, Star Marines or Planetary Militia, each with their own goals.

Play all of the listed groups, moving from one to the other in linked Encounters.

Or if you're really brave; you can choose to go alone.

The bottom line is you can play it any way you like, with any figures you may already have or with the included color counters.

Inside you’ll find:

A man to man skirmish combat system that plays fast and yields realistic results.
Complete rules covering six types of Humans - Civilians, Police, Gangers, Survivors, Planetary Militia or Star Marines; plus the BUGS! Warriors, Workers, Sleepers and the Brain. Kill the Brain, save the world!
Two color Battle Boards; one a Tunnel and one a Street. Use them with your figures or the counters we've provided.
Eighteen different Scenarios that are linked together, building your Story.
Seven different Lists covering seven different Factions for you to choose from - all with their own goals.
A minimal bookkeeping Campaign System that gives meaning to every game as the results of one will affect the outcome of the next.


Bugs in New Hope City!

In 5150: Bugs Breakout you’re a resident of New Hope City, making ends meet in a usually uneventful life. That’s all going to change as the Bugs have arrived!

You can play the Bug Outbreak from six different points of view – Civilians, Police, Gangers, Survivors, Planetary Militia and lastly Star Marines. Each group has their own goals and although they may be different they agree on one thing...

the Bugs got to go!

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: 5150: Bugs – No Retreat
description:
Don’t Call Them Bugs!

Listen up newbie! I know what you unwarranted high regard for yourself recruits call our enemy – Bugs. A bug is something very small you see crawling on the ground. Something insignificant that you step on and keep doing whatever you’re doing. I got news for you. That’s not what these things, these Bugs, are. We’re going down into the Tunnels looking for real Bugs. When you meet one face to face, try not to wet yourself, and pray to whatever god you believe in that you get out alive. Because to them; we’re the insignificant ones.

5150: Bugs – No Retreat is the second of three books linked together to cover the Bug infestation that threatens the 5150 Universe. All three are stand-alone games. In fact, 5150: Bugs –No Retreat can be used with all of our other 5150 titles.

What: Sci-Fi Squad/Platoon size combat.
Scale: Man to man combat. 1 figure equals 1 man or Bug.
Your Role: Players can command from one Squad to a full Platoon of infantry.
Playability: Designed for solo, same side and head to head play.
5150: Bugs - No Retreat can be played in a variety of ways:

You can play as a Squad Leader with a full Squad.
You can play as a Squad Leader with less than a full Squad.
You can play as a Platoon Leader with a full Platoon of multiple Squads.


The bottom line is you can play it any way you like, with any figures you may already have or with the included color counters.

Inside you’ll find:

A man to man skirmish combat system that plays fast and yields realistic results.
Complete rules covering five types of Bugs – Warrior, Worker, Flyer, Puker, Queen and Brain.
Color Counters including Fort 373.
Ten different Scenarios that are linked together, building your Story.
Sixteen different Lists covering seven different Factions for you to choose from.
A minimal bookkeeping Campaign System that gives meaning to every game as the results of one will affect the outcome of the next.


Surrounded? So what!

Word’s come down from the top. The Bugs are on a roll and moving fast towards us. We’re cut off from any support so we need to pull back to Fort 373. Once there, we hold the fort and buy HQ some time to regroup. With any luck, they’ll send someone to pick us up, but don’t count on it. Doesn’t matter anyway, we just have to do our job.
Do…your…job!

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: Jodłogrody Małe
description:
Firville is about to change! The mayor of this cosy town has just ordered a new suburban district – Little Firville.
The key to the plan is to develop the centre of the new district, which at the moment is full of sad empty parcels.

Become a member of one of four animal families and plan the building of the new district. Assign tasks to the residents of your quarter, send your representative to the bulding site, perform actions and earn materials.
Before the game ends you will need to have proven cunning in order to earn as many winning points as possible.

'Little Firville' is a family game on economy based on the worker placement mechanics.

name: アマビエレース (AMABIE RACING)
description:
アマビエレース ～オレが、わたしが、アマビエだ～ (Amabie resu - orega, watashiga, Amabie da -) (AMABIE RACING - The true Amabie is me -) is a game from Japan.

In Japan, there is a long history of folklore creatures known as Yokai, various weird monsters, spirits and demons, some malign, some benign. Amabie is onesuch benign creature that appeared in 1846, with a promise to dispel a pandemic. Long forgotten, with the arrival of COVID-19 in Japan, the image of Amabie has been revived widely. In this game players try to race to be the creature rising from the waters and claim to be the real Amabie.
user summary

Faster than other players, jump out from the sea water and claim "I am Amabie."
Use items wisely and take advance of the race.
The keys of the game are 'prophet', 'items', and 'fortune'.

・一番に海から飛び出し「わたしがアマビエだ」と言い張ろう
・アイテムを使いこなしてレースを有利に進めよう
・勝負の決め手は「予言」「アイテム」「時の運」
publisher's summary

name: TAISAKU BUILDING 感染症対策ソロデッキ構築型ゲーム (TAISAKU BUILDING Kansenshotaisaku soro dekkikouchikugata gemu)
description:
TAISAKU BUILDING 感染症対策ソロデッキ構築型ゲーム (TAISAKU BUILDING kansenshotaisaku soro dekkikouchikugata gemu) (TAISAKU BUILDING Anti-Infectious Disease Solo Deck Construction Game) is a solitaire deck-building game from Japan. Uisng two decks mixed, it can be played by two players alternating turns.

The game has a series of monsters that attack the player with various infectious diseases. The player must use appropriate medical counter-measure cards to fend off and defeat the enemies. If they can stop all five of the enemies, they win. If they run out of hit points, they lose.

The game allows the player to alter the difficulty level of the game in preparation. The game warns the reader to not take it as proper medical advice.
user summary

- A solo deck construction game.
- Setback the viruses with proper prophylaxes and countermeasures.
- The difficulty can be adjusted as you like! Can you clear the highest difficulty!?

・１人でできるデッキ構築型ゲーム
・ウイルスを対策で打ち倒せ！
・難易度調整可能！ 最高難易度をクリアできるか！？
publisher's summary
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Mexican Jack Squint Presents: The Lion Eats Tonight
description:
The Lion Eats Tonight. This digest size title from the demented mind of Howard Whitehouse is all about the hunt for Big Game in the wilds of colonial Africa.

The game can be played with or without a gamemaster.

As players take turns trying to bag the best game, the other players will decide whether to award or subtract points depending on whether the hunter shot the charging rhino from the top of a tree or stood is ground as the beast charged directly toward him.

There are rules for tracking animals, stalking hunters, gun-bearers, and, of course, shooting with the best and worst guns of the time.
Realism is tossed out the window in place of a rip-roaring good time.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Animals, Book, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic

name: Checkermates
description:
Checkers for 2 to 4 players. Each player sets up his/her checkers on the side of the board opposite to, and matching the named color, on the board perimeter. The board is big enough to accommodate all 4 players. Movement rules and capturing are identical with checkers and "kinging" is also a part of this game, occuring when a player's piece reaches the opposite side. The goal is to be last man standing. "Kingless" variants are given, with winning conditions depending on various goals for single pieces.

—user summary

name: Tranquil Terror: Tiny Turtle Terrors
description:
Expand the playable of Tranquil Terror with the mini expansion - Tiny Turtle Terrors. Play as a group of newly hatched sea turtles trying to survive.

Swimming against the current is challenging and tiring. In a situational flip, eat the jellyfish that get in your way to open a route. Be careful though, open water leaves the turtles visible to predators. Hungry sharks from below, and hunting birds from above, pose a constant threat to these hatchlings.

Every turn, swim against the current and try to survive long enough to get far out to sea. This cooperative game requires players to strategize in order to get 10 baby turtles safely on their way. Once they have all made it to the far side, you win.

name: Fortune of the Forgotten World
description:
Welcome to FORTUNE OF THE FORGOTTEN WORLD. In the future, genetic engineering has made possible the return of dinosaurs to planet Earth. Meanwhile, entertainment demands are at an all-time high.

A child of these strange times, FORTUNE OF THE FORGOTTEN WORLD is the highest rated show in history. Located on Island 17A, a scientific experiment gone awry, the television show offers contestants a chance to find a veritable fortune in cash that is stashed on the island, locate the hidden raft and escape to safety, all the while fighting and running from dinosaurs, collecting useful items, fending off other contestants, and competing for the best ratings with the television audience.

YOU are one of this season’s contestants, having survived a rigorous screening process that includes a paleontologist, an engineer, a soldier, a trail guide, a cook, a medical doctor, a professional athlete, and a popular celebrity. Can you outwit the competition, survive combat with history’s deadliest predators, puzzle out the island’s technology all to recover the hidden stash of cash and escape with your life?

Gameplay involves players "landing" on the island by placing their tokens on the hex board, and then rolling dice to move around, revealing tiles that they encounter along the way. Tiles might be useful items such as weapons, health packs, or tools -- or they could be wild dinosaurs which force players to evade or battle them. Only one tile is the sought-after prize money. Once the money is found, players must race to find the raft off of the island, which may lie beyond gates that must be powered on and unlocked. Will you prepare a route to safety before you search for the prize money? Establish choke points to steal the money from other players? Scour the island for the prize money in hopes that you don't encounter a deadly dinosaur instead? Your decisions affect how the TV audience perceives you. Unpopular players may get "fired", while popular ones will be rewarded by studio executives. Random events may interfere with your strategy, so always have a contingency plan and don't forget about your character's unique skills!

—description from the designer

name: Zoo Tac Toe
description:
The board represents a zoo with unique 36 animals. Players must get animals to escape from the zoo by matching animals with attributes on cards. When matched, an animal tile is flipped to reveal an arrow. Align the arrow to point to the player.

Once three or more adjacent arrows or a square point to a player, that player's animals "escape". The player collects a coin matching the number of animals released and those tiles are replaced with new animals. It is possible to collect two coins when two lines are made by intersection.

Once all attribute cards have been played, the player with the most coin values is the winner. In case of a tie, continue with ten more attribute cards.

—description from the designer

name: Battle of the Bards: TWIST Gaming promo card
description:
Available from TWIST Gaming Year 4 Kickstarter campaign.

Audience card :
cost: 3 performance tokens (any color)
VP: 5
ability: While Taking the Stage, if you play your Lead Bard and a Veteran Bard, you may gain a tune token
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Music
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Bases Loaded: A Word Game That's NOT About Baseball
description:
Bases Loaded is a fast-paced word game... that's not about baseball! You'll be competing against other players to call out answers to various combinations of cards. These combinations will be ever-changing, so players will need to keep their eye on the ball if they want to win!

Each inning will start with someone placing one base card (a category), and one loaded card (a describing word) at first base. The other players will compete to call out an answer that fits both cards (such as "broccoli" if the cards were "bitter" and "vegetable"). The player who successfully provides an answer gets to play the next card. They can choose to add another loaded card to 2nd Base, or they can choose to replace an existing card (loaded card OR base card).

Players continue to add cards, earning singles, doubles, and triples, depending on the number of loaded cards in play. Once there are four loaded cards, one player can attempt to hit a "grand slam" by sharing an answer that incorporates all 4 loaded cards! Once the grand slam is awarded, players will tally their total points from all of their "hits", and take note of their score for that inning. After a set number of innings, players will calculate their total scores to determine the winner of the game!

Throughout the game, players can lose points by calling out incorrect answers (strikes) or by placing nonsensical cards on their own turn (outs). Strikes and outs cause you to lose varying amounts of points, depending on how many cards are in play! However, players will have two abilities (curve-balls and splitters) to help them get out of a tight spot.

—description from the publisher

name: Dino Soldiers: Core Set
description:
Do you remember the games you played when you were a child, where you, as the general, directed massive battles ?
As your brave toy soldiers followed your orders?
Or when incredible dinosaurs roamed, hidden in the dense, mysterious jungle of your backyard ?

With Dino Soldiers, you can relive these adventures around a table in a tactical combat game, where only one player emerges victorious.

The Vietnam War. In the middle of the jungle, during a recon mission in a misty valley, a squad of soldiers of the Delta Sierra company comes face to face with dinosaurs from a bygone age.
A savage battle ensues on a terrain full of traps and hazards, where everyone must fight to survive.

One player leads a squad of soldiers and the other plays the dinosaurs. One group plays strategically while the other is more primitive in its tactics. The game ends when all soldiers or dinosaurs are eliminated.

First, you choose or create your teams. Then, each player draws and places terrain tiles, face down, one after the other, trying to create a playing field to their advantage.
After that, the players discover the field while fighting each other. Movement, placement and distance determine if a unit can be killed. Soldiers can attack from afar, while dinos can only do so up close and personal. Special abilities give each unit a tactical value and allow for elaborate strategies.

—description from the designer
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: Phase 10 Bonus Pack
description: A 2-in-1 combo box. The box contained Phase 10 card game (packaged in its usual cardboard box) and Phase 10 dice where the dice were sealed but otherwise not contained in its own box. The rules and score pad for it were just packaged inside the combo box itself.

name: Mergers "Stock Market" Game
description: A Monopoly-style game, but instead of buying properties, players buy companies and subsidiaries. They do this, in part, by landing on spaces representing real companies on the perimeter of a board. In order to qualify for buying a company, though, a player must be able to identify that company's stock ticker symbol among all the symbols printed individually on a set of cards.
mechanics: Income, Investment, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: In Harm's Way: Rules For Naval Surface and Air Combat 1900-1945
description:
In Harms Way gives you the flavor of naval surface actions from the 1890's thru 1945.

More importantly it accurately portrays each ship and it's capabilities allowing the player to simulate any type of action, from ship on ship up to major fleet engagements like Tsushima, Jutland or Leyte Gulf. Players can do conventional tactical battles where you close on the enemy and open fire, up to sweeping strategic level games, covering wide areas of ocean, hunting the enemy and maneuvering fleets.

In Harms Way allows you to run historical campaigns with the major powers of the era, or "what if" scenarios such as the US Fleet being aware of the attack on Pearl Harbor.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: New World Order: Bavaria
description:
In the spirit of games like The Resistance and Secret Hitler, players fill the roles of Freemasons in 1780s Bavaria seeking to identify the subversive Illuminati.

Over the course of several rounds, the players will be sent on various missions to secure loyalty in eight Bavarian cities. Some of the players are secretly loyal to the Illuminati, and will sabotage these missions when it is strategically sound to do so. The Illuminati know one another, while the rest of the players are left in the dark.

The game is divided into years. The Lodge sends out missions in January, April, September, and November. In December, the Factory owners elect a new Alderman, who has minimal power.
Every June the Lodge will elect new officers who will be responsible for assigning the committees that go out on these missions. The Secretary will select where these committees will go (from limited options presented to him), and the Worshipful Master will nominate a committee to send. If the Lodge consents, that committee will go, and their actions will determine the loyalty of that city. Some cities will be visited more than once over the course of the campaign.

After four years (sixteen missions), check for the following endgame conditions:

All eight cities have picked a side of this fateful conflict
Six or more cities are on the same side


If both conditions are met, the game ends, and the team with majority control wins.
If either of the conditions is not met, then the game continues one more year.
At the end of that final round, if neither side has six cities, the Elector, Karl Theodor, will outlaw both the Illuminati and Freemasonry, and the Rosicrucian wins alone.

In addition to your secret roles (Loyalist/Illuminati/Rosicrucian), players are given public roles which limit when they can travel, limit the travel of others, allow them to learn the loyalty of another player, or allow them to manipulate committees before they begin their missions.

-description from designer
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Diskwars: Farrenghast's Undead
description:
A Fantasy themed miniatures wargame without the miniatures. Will you play as the ubiquitous Elves, the barbaric Uthuk Yllan, the stalwart Dwarves, the vile Undead, the medieval Knights, the desert dwelling Acolytes, the mighty Dragon kin, or the vicious Orcs? Players choose a faction from the eight available in the base game and an army point value for the battle. Each must then build an army using the double-sided cardboard disks and battle it out. At least half of the army points must be from one faction and the remaining points are made up of like aligned or neutral disks and spells.

Each double-sided disk represents either a faction homeland (your starting area), a terrain (ruins, forest, swamp etc... with effects on combat and line of sight), a spell(levels 1-3), a missile or one unit with its alignment (Good, Neutral, or Evil) with values for its Attack, Defense, Toughness, Movement and the army point cost of the disk. The disks have varying sizes (Giants and Dragons tend to be larger) and most units have a wide variety special abilities such as flying, the spell-casting ability or the missile ability to launch boulders, bolts, arrows or fireballs for example. Players take it in turn activating 3 units(disks) and resolving battles, casting spells, and firing missiles.

Activated Unit disks are moved around the table by flipping them end over end a number of times up to their movement value. If the disk lands on top of an opposing army disk a battle ensues with the top disk (the attacker) doing its attack damage value to the lower disk (the defender) who applies its defense value to the attacker if the damage is equal or greater to either unit's toughness it is either wounded or killed. Combats can involve numerous disks upon top of each other and are resolved top down. Missiles can be fired by missile capable units at disks within range by dropping them upon the target from a foot above the table. Those which land upon the target do damage otherwise they miss or can hit other disks they land on. This can result in 'friendly fire' damage on your own troops and adds an element of luck/dexterity to the game.

The game rules come with multiple scenarios that accommodate 2 to 8 players. The victory goal of each scenario can vary from king of the hill, to enemy elimination, to just about any combat scenario victory condition one could imagine.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame

name: Diskwars: Knights of Falladir
description:
A Fantasy themed miniatures wargame without the miniatures. name: Diskwars: Orcs of The Broken Plain
description:
A Fantasy themed miniatures wargame without the miniatures. Will you play as the ubiquitous Elves, the barbaric Uthuk Yllan, the stalwart Dwarves, the vile Undead, the medieval Knights, the desert dwelling Acolytes, the mighty Dragon kin, or the vicious Orcs? Players choose a faction from the eight available in the base game and an army point value for the battle. Each must then build an army using the double-sided cardboard disks and battle it out. At least half of the army points must be from one faction and the remaining points are made up of like aligned or neutral disks and spells.

Each double-sided disk represents either a faction homeland (your starting area), a terrain (ruins, forest, swamp etc... with effects on combat and line of sight), a spell(levels 1-3), a missile or one unit with its alignment (Good, Neutral, or Evil) with values for its Attack, Defense, Toughness, Movement and the army point cost of the disk. The disks have varying sizes (Giants and Dragons tend to be larger) and most units have a wide variety special abilities such as flying, the spell-casting ability or the missile ability to launch boulders, bolts, arrows or fireballs for example. Players take it in turn activating 3 units(disks) and resolving battles, casting spells, and firing missiles.

Activated Unit disks are moved around the table by flipping them end over end a number of times up to their movement value. If the disk lands on top of an opposing army disk a battle ensues with the top disk (the attacker) doing its attack damage value to the lower disk (the defender) who applies its defense value to the attacker if the damage is equal or greater to either unit's toughness it is either wounded or killed. Combats can involve numerous disks upon top of each other and are resolved top down. Missiles can be fired by missile capable units at disks within range by dropping them upon the target from a foot above the table. Those which land upon the target do damage otherwise they miss or can hit other disks they land on. This can result in 'friendly fire' damage on your own troops and adds an element of luck/dexterity to the game.

The game rules come with multiple scenarios that accommodate 2 to 8 players. The victory goal of each scenario can vary from king of the hill, to enemy elimination, to just about any combat scenario victory condition one could imagine.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame

name: Diskwars: Moon Over Thelgrim – The Draco Wing
description:
There is a bad moon rising, full of blood and ill omens. The Great War has come to Thelgrim, and death follows in its wake.

Moon Over Thelgrim is the first expansion set for Diskwars. With Moon Over Thelgrim, you may expand your Diskwars game with more 100 new Disks, including new creatures, spells, lands and even a new faction. Moon Over Thelgrim comes in eight different army packs: The Draco Wing (Dragonkin), Frothan's Ghouls (Undead), The Groman Guard (Knights), The Sons of Triamlavar (Elves), Zocrab's Marauders (Orcs), The Hammers of Urth (Dwarves), The Knives of Q'aro Fenn (Uthuk), and Waiqar's Sundermen (Acolytes). Each pack has four set flats of that faction and four random flats.

What's New in Moon Over Thelgrim:

Terrain - The expansion includes new rules for terrain, as well as six new Terrain Disks.
Champions - These unique new hero Disks add power to your "pure" armies.
New Disk Abilities - Dozens of the new Creature Disks feature new abilities to add variety and strategy to your game.
New Scenarios - No Diskwars expansion would be complete without new scenarios, and Moon Over Thelgrim gives you several from which to choose.
A New Faction - The mysterious wilds of the Thelgrim Peninsula are home to strange new faction that does not appreciate outsiders invading its homeland.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame

name: Diskwars: Waiqar's Path – The Shadow Serpent
description:
An alliance of Elves and Acolytes has set out through the Wastelands in desperate attempt to reach the citadel of Llovar. They are exhausted, hungry and hounded by enemies on all sides. Things are about to get much worse.

8 Waiqar's Path Army Sets: The Shadow Serpent (Dragonkin), The Bone Coast (Undead), The Broken Crown (Knights), The Fire Within (Elves), The Eternal Horde (Orcs), The Dunwarr Gates (Dwarves), The Ru Lords (Uthuk) and The Welqu Storm (Acolytes).
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame

name: Diskwars: Broken Shadows – The Prophecy
description:
The Shadow Serpent has awakened, and now is the time of X'ru. But this is no time for superstition, for this is the time of victory and these are the last days.

8 Broken Shadows Army Sets: Prophecy (Dragonkin), Tombs of Ice (Undead), Sword of Daqan (Knights), Latari Wind (Elves), Banner of the Raven (Orcs), Forgotten Forge (Dwarves), Hand of Llovar (Uthuk), Return of One (Acolytes) @ 2 Fixed Flats, 6 Random.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame
