name: Roll-a-Goal Aussie Rules Football Game
description:
Using two specialized dice-tumblers, two players compete by moving a "football token" up, down and across an oval field in this attempt to recreate the exciting play of Australian Rules football.

—user summary

name: Panthers East!
description:
Scenario pack for Battleground World War II.

Panthers East covers the development of the Panther tank on the Easter Front. Loaded with information and 10 scenarios.
Includes:
8 New Tank Sheets - Panther D, A and G, Panther F, Flak Panther, Jagdpanther, Bergepanther, and the T34/85.

10 Scenarios

New Rules for Mud, Snow and Rain

Rules for night Vision Gear.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Mein Panzer Junior
description:
A game specifically designed for young wargamers! It is just a 4 page book.

Incorporating three levels of play, Mein Panzer Junior can be played by children as young as 5 years old, or upwards of 12 years old or more.

Level One introduces youngsters to the basic fundamentals of wargaming, using only a single d6 per player and a common 6" or 12" ruler. Resolution of movement and shooting is simple and easily accomplished by the youngest players on a tank by tank basis.

Level Two expands upon the previous level slightly by adding Tank Units and the concept of “hits” and “kills”. Play is still extremely simple with only a few additional rules.

Level Three is almost a full featured game including game turns and distinction between the different types of tanks. At this level, players must be able to perform simple subtraction relatively quickly to maintain a smooth, and interesting, game.
categories: Book, Children's Game, Wargame, World War II

name: Five Parsecs: Character Pack 2
description:
This Character Pack 2 contains three new unique character types for Five Parsecs From Home 2:

A Cyborg Mercenary,
the barbarian Prim-Worlder and
the mysterious, teleporting Stalkers.


Each comes with a preconfigured profile and can be included in any campaign next time you have a new recruit coming in.

Whether you want an interesting individual to make the battle field a bit stranger or just want an opportunity to paint a space barbarian, this pack will fit right into your campaign

—description from the designer
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: NIMBY: The Game of Toxic Waste
description:
The object of the game is to deliver all of your drums of Toxic waste to the Disposal site at the lowest possible cost. The game is over when all but one player delivers all of his drums. The remaining player, with drums in his possession at the end of the game, pays twice the fee for disposal . Everyone counts the cash they have left and the player with the most cash wins. Just like real life!

—description from the rulebook

The game takes a somewhat cynical view of toxic waste disposal, offering players the choice between legal handling of the waste and illegal actions such as violating truck weight limits and illegal dumping. But such actions carry the chance of significant penalties if taken.

Players have movers in the shape of flatbed trucks on which they carry the toxic waste drums. They move along spaces on the large vinyl mat, some of which offer services, such as fuel. These spaces may be bought and then earn income for the buyer as in Monopoly.

The game comes in a large cylindrical metal can, labelled to look like a toxic waste drum.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Ownership, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Warships of the Lissa Campaign
description:
Warships of the Lissa Campaign 1866
Ship data in D&C format for the Italian and Austrian ships of the Lissa campaign of 1866.

This data allows the Lissa campaign presented in Broadside and Ram to be played out using the more detailed Dahlgren and Columbiad rules.

—description from the publisher

name: 2 Hour Dungeon Crawl
description:
Lead a band of adventurers into a deep dark dungeon in 2 Hour Dungeon Crawl, a board game adaptation of the RPG of the same name.

With over a dozen different races in the game, there's no telling who or what you could run into while diving for loot or maybe trying to rescue a friend. With eight different professions, from caster to warrior and everything in between, how you build your party is just as important as how tough you are.

The game is playable solo, with rules for a campaign with a simple way to gauge how well — or how poorly — you're doing!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Pipe Fitters Local Six-Sided
description:
Combining the mechanisms of deck-building and roll n write!

There’s a water shortage in Langston. The people need to wash their dishes, and their cars, and their...selves. You and your find associates have been tasked with the challenge of bringing water to these fine, albeit unwashed folk, their flatware, and their automobiles. Each turn brings water closer to the myriad destinations and by the end, the mayor will likely be calling a counsel meeting to offer up the Key to the City to one of you. But which one? Let it flow and we’ll find out!

Players will use their deck of cards to fulfill actions from buying cards, laying pipe on the city map, upgrading player abilities to create a more powerful mechanical engine, increase Flow Rate of pipes, and pay Union Dues. Set collection for end game scoring as well as other ways to gain points. Buy cards at your own risk as your deck-building instinct may not be your best move each turn!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks
publishers: Lagniappe Games, Roll and Write Revolution

name: Battle of Zhijiang
description:
Battle of Zhijiang（芷江战役） is a operation-level wargame, which simulates a battle that took place in Hunan Province, China from April to June 1945. The Japanese army attacked Zhijiang, but ultimately failed. This was Japan's last offensive on the Chinese battlefield and the only offensive that failed.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_West_Hunan

Game Scale:
Turn: 4-5 days
Hex: 5 km
Units: Battalion to Regiment
Game Inventory:
1 A1 size map
1 countersheet (260 dual-side printed counters)
One rules booklet
Two 6-sided dice

name: Reichsautobahnen im Bau
description:
Each player constructs one highway in five sections. The roll of the number die determines how much segments (1-6) of an section are to be constructed. The color die has the following meanings:
blue: a bridge may be build
yellow: no constructing in this turn
black: no constructing in this turn and the last constructed segment has to be pulled off
red: a section already in construction may be finished regardless of the number die.
The first player to finish his highway wins the game.

—user summary

name: Deadflight: Ghosts in the Void
description:
Deadflight: Ghosts in the Void is a strategic space ship combat game that puts you in command of an advanced spaceship fighting a clandestine war for control of the Solar System.

Deadflight Uses a mix of construction, resource management and hex based miniatures combat mechanics across different parts of a turn to create a dynamic and fast paced game system where every decision matters.

Construct your ship, command your crew and complete your mission, at all costs.

—description from the designer

name: Titans Of Eden
description:
"Welcome to a world of total warfare. Your wizards used to be powerful enough to hold your enemies at bay, but ever since the monks discovered the power contained in The Six Great Temples, everything has fallen to chaos, and none of your industrial weapons can restore peace to your lands. Your only hope for survival rests in forbidden and forgotten magic: To save your people from extinction, you must harness the power of the four elements and awaken the protector of Eden."

Titans Of Eden is a fast-paced deck-building card game for 2-6 players. Each player starts with a deck of basic cards, and has to choose each turn whether they want to play powerful cards to battle their opponents, or energy-granting cards that add elemental cards to their deck for future turns.

There are four main elements in Eden, and the strategies and abilities of each element are strong against one other element. This leads to fundamentally balanced gameplay: For example, if your opponent is going hard on an Ice strategy, you can use Fire cards to neutralize their cards and counter their moves. To do well in Titans Of Eden, you must build a balanced deck that can effectively respond to your opponents' actions.

At the end of each turn, you battle your opponents. Once you destroy their three temples, you win the game. With this victory condition, you have to play to win, every turn, because you're never more than 3 turns from victory, and never more than three turns from defeat.

Titans Of Eden includes a classic (Dominion-style) deck-building format for casual play, and a constructed format for competitive play. In the constructed format, each player builds a spellbook before playing, which they use to take on their opponents.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Set-up

name: Raid on St Michel
description:
Raid on St Michel links five Table Top Teasers or scenarios together in a mini campaign. They can be played as stand alone battles or sequentially with each impacting n the next.

The Grand Duchy of Lorraine and the Vereinigte Freie Städte (VFS) are long term adversaries. The Lorraine Forces are modelled on those of France with not dissimilar uniforms, while the VFS - the United Free Provinces - are a fairly tight agglomeration of small principalities, republics, city states and so on, united to oppose Lorraine. The VFS uniforms, inspired by a number of European armies, provide a colourful contrast to the white of Lorraine.

This action takes place in a fairly remote northern area of the border between the two adversaries, the line of demarcation being the River Kneller. On the Lorraine side of the border, to the south, is the small province of St.Michel which unknowingly is about to become the focus of enemy operations.

—description from the publisher's website

name: Benidorm Bar Crawl
description:
Build your Benidorm Empire as you acquire bars, add shows & obtain hotel partnership deals to maximise the spend per visit for each of your venues until the other players go bust and you own it all.

Purchase bars as you land on them then then increase the income you receive per visit by adding shows and hotel partnership deals.

Shows can be purchased and added to any of your bars immediately and can be moved between your venues each turn.

Hotel partnership deals can be purchased when you have 4 or more bars in the same district that will multiply your bar's earnings.

When you land on an area with Jager Bombs you must draw a card from the 'Power of Jager' deck which have good or bad consequences.

Benidorm Bucks are the in-game currency that is used to trade venues, shows, contracts & pay bar fees as the bar crawl continues.

Props can be employed and placed at any bars when you own the bar next door, visitors must then visit both bars on the same turn.

Preparation
To begin, place the game board on the table. Each player selects a player piece. All players then place their player piece on the cash point square of the outta section of the game board. All players roll the dice, the player with the highest dice roll is the Banker, who distributes assets from the Bank to the players. Each player is given 3,000 in cash divided as follows: two 500s, ten 100s, ten 50s and twenty five 20s. All remaining cash and other equipment go to the Bank.

General
On a player’s turn, the player roll the dice and move his/her player piece forward the number of spaces as rolled on the dice. If the player owns any Shows or Props, they can move these between their owned bars during their turn.
If the player lands on an unowned bar, the player may buy it for the price listed on that bar’s space. The money is given to the Bank in exchange for the Property Acquired Card for that premises. Shows can be purchased immediately and added to the premies, increasing its earn when visited. Props can be added when a player owns 2 properties next to each other and Hotel Deals can be purchased when a player owns 4 properties in the same district (colour).
When players land on a property owned by another player, they must pay the player the amount stated on the Property Acquired Card including extra charges if the premises has Shows or Hotel Deal added.
If the player lands on his or her own property, nothing happens.
When players land on Lotto spaces they must contribute 100 Benidorm Bucks to the prize pool in the centre of the board, any fines, the money will be also added to this prize pool.
When players land on Jager spaces, they must draw a card from the Power of Jager Deck, this will either have good or bad consequences.
If the player is sent to ‘The Beach’ to sleep it off, they must roll above a 6 to wake up and continue playing, unless they have an ‘Energy Drink’ card to play.
If the player lands on ‘The Beach’ space, he or she is “Just Passing Through”. No penalty applies.
If the player lands on the ‘Spin Out’, he or she must move his Player Piece directly to ‘The Beach’.
Every time a player passes a Cash Point they collect 200 Benidorm Bucks from the Banker.
You may sell Shows or Props back to the Bank for the full purchase price or sell properties to other players via mutual agreement at any point during the game.
Players can loan other players money and make agreements during the game.
Doubles
When doubles are rolled, the player gets to play again during the same turn.

The Beach
If instructed to ‘Go to the Beach to sleep it off’ via either landing on the space stating that or drawing a Jager Card with that instruction, the player must enter the beach and roll above a 6 to continue playing, they can try once per turn.

Whilst passed out on the beach, if other players enter ‘The Beach’, just passing through, they can challenge the player for a bar of their choice, each, and the higher roller wins both bars.

Lotto
Ant ime a player lands on a Lotto space, they must pay 100 Benidorm bucks to the Prize Pool in the center of the game board.

Bottom Line
Each turn, try to foresee where players will land after your turn to maximise income and bankrupt your competitors.

name: Amabie
description:
This is a very short card game for two using the Japanese Yokai Amabie as the theme. Amabie first began appearing in Japan in 1846 forecasting 6 years of good harvest followed by a plague. Amabie said "draw me and show me to the people, so that you can be free of disease" according to historical experts.

The game consists of only 6 cards one of which is Amabie. The cards are worth differing points from 0 to 3 (Amabie). Players each look at one card from their hand, the rest remain facedown and then give the other player a card from their hand for 3 rounds. the player at the end with the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Memory

name: 5人目 (Fifth Person)
description:
The trick-taking game 5人目 (Fifth Person) was released as part of the publisher ruri ruri games' (るりるりゲームズ) Spring 2018 box of trick-taking games, titled トリテセット Vol. 2 (Trick Taking Set Vol. 2).

The game is a cooperative horror trick-taking game set in a mountain cabin. While the game is intended to be played by 4 players, they'll soon find a fifth card has been played to each trick: but by who?

The power is out, and the players must keep a candle from burning out by playing candle-suited cards periodically in the hand.

There is an amulet suit, and players will use these amulets to ward off the mysterious Fifth Person at the end of the game.

The Fifth Person enters the game after the second trick, with their own deck of black cards. If a player wins a trick that contains the Black 9, that player is kidnapped, and cards played to tricks they or the Fifth Person win will not have their affects activated (such as re-lighting the candle.)

At the end of the game, the players win if the candle remains lit and all players have enough amulet to ward of any black cards they obtained. A partial victory is granted if at least one player does not have enough amulets. All players lose if the candle goes out.
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: Warhammer Warriors: Tyranid Warrior
description:
A Warhammer version of Lost Worlds based on Games Workshop's 40,000 setting. Each player uses a battle book and chooses a page number for a maneuver for their turn. These are revealed simultaneously and cross-referenced. A chart then shows you which page to turn to see the results of the maneuvers. Players usually end up wounded or in a better position to strike a killing blow.

Warhammer Warriors is slightly more stream-lined than Lost Worlds and plays faster. Warhammer Warriors does not have "behind you" maneuvers and there is a lot more shooting/ranged combat. All characters have a Deathblow maneuver which speed up games if you're in a good position.

Tyranid Warrior is number #6 in the series.

name: Warhammer Warriors: Eldar Exarch
description:
A Warhammer version of Lost Worlds based on Games Workshop's 40,000 setting. Each player uses a battle book and chooses a page number for a maneuver for their turn. These are revealed simultaneously and cross-referenced. A chart then shows you which page to turn to see the results of the maneuvers. Players usually end up wounded or in a better position to strike a killing blow.

Warhammer Warriors is slightly more stream-lined than Lost Worlds and plays faster. Warhammer Warriors does not have "behind you" maneuvers and there is a lot more shooting/ranged combat. All characters have a Deathblow maneuver which speed up games if you're in a good position.

Eldar Exarch is number #5 in the series.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Warriors: Kharn the Betrayer
description:
A Warhammer version of Lost Worlds based on Games Workshop's 40,000 setting. Each player uses a battle book and chooses a page number for a maneuver for their turn. These are revealed simultaneously and cross-referenced. A chart then shows you which page to turn to see the results of the maneuvers. Players usually end up wounded or in a better position to strike a killing blow.

Warhammer Warriors is slightly more stream-lined than Lost Worlds and plays faster. Warhammer Warriors does not have "behind you" maneuvers and there is a lot more shooting/ranged combat. All characters have a Deathblow maneuver which speed up games if you're in a good position.

Kharn the Betrayer is number #4 in the series.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Warriors: Captain Leonatos
description:
A Warhammer version of Lost Worlds based on Games Workshop's 40,000 setting. Each player uses a battle book and chooses a page number for a maneuver for their turn. These are revealed simultaneously and cross-referenced. A chart then shows you which page to turn to see the results of the maneuvers. Players usually end up wounded or in a better position to strike a killing blow.

Warhammer Warriors is slightly more stream-lined than Lost Worlds and plays faster. Warhammer Warriors does not have "behind you" maneuvers and there is a lot more shooting/ranged combat. All characters have a Deathblow maneuver which speed up games if you're in a good position.

Captain Leonatos is number #2 in the series.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: The Annexation of Chiraz
description:
The Annexation of Chiraz links five Table Top Teasers or scenarios together in a mini campaign.
They can be played as stand alone battles or sequentially with each impacting on the next.

The year is 1754 and hostilities between those two old adversaries, The Grand Duchy of Lorraine and the Vereinigte Freie Städte (VFS), - the United Free Provinces - a fairly tight agglomeration of countries, small principalities, republics and city states, are continuing.
The Grand Duchy of Lorraine, closely allied to France further to the west, has struggled to maintain her borders for many years against the blatant aggression of the VFS.
The VFS is itself part of a broader alliance known as The Electoral League.
A part of this alliance is the Electorate of Tuetonburg-Fredonia to the south of the VFS and with a small border with Lorraine delineated by the River Surren.
Tuetonburg-Fredonia has in recent years assisted her allies in their conflict with finance and mercenaries but has herself maintained a polite detachment from matters military– things are about to change!

—description from publisher

name: The Wolfenbüttel War
description:
The Wolfenbüttel War concerns the hostilities of Charles’ two fictitious mid-eighteenth century combatants, the Grand Duchy of Lorraine and the Vereinigte Freie Städte (VFS). The scenarios are applicable to any horse and musket period with little modification.

Where this mini-campaign differs from its predecessors (Raid on St.Michel, The Annexation of Chiraz) is that it is loosely based on a real campaign – that of the Hundred Days, culminating at Waterloo. The four scenarios and the movements between them are drawn from the battles of Quatre Bras, Ligny, Wavre and Waterloo. However, while the campaign sequence is followed the outcome is far from certain.

The book provides the fictitious background to the war, planning details including the selection of forces, the instructions for each army, table top maps and orders for each side. There are instructions for the game organiser and options for forces in each battle if fought as a stand alone wargame. The book is illustrated with photographs of each battle as it was fought with Charles’ armies. Newspapers and a Who’s Who, not to mention the Ballroom scene, add colour to the story of the Wolfenbüttel War.

—description from the publisher's website

name: Merchants of Sol
description:
As Merchants of Sol, You're the Captain of a merchant ship and head of one of the most powerful families in the solar system. Your goal is to reach all of your destinations whilst collecting as much cargo as you can along the way. There will be many challenges to overcome.

To travel through the void unmarked by hardship is a fool’s dream. The system is filled with pirates, mutants, endless bureaucracy, and —worst of all— other merchants.

A keen mind can turn the tide. Just remember, even for the saltiest of captains, Lady Luck can be quite fickle.

Merchants of Sol is a game for 2-6 players age 12+. Gameplay averages out to about 20-30 minutes per player. A key element of the game is its narration. As you draw cards to determine your fate, each destination and event has an exciting blend of story and facts about our solar system including the planets, dwarf planets, and moons that fill it.

Unique design and simple mechanics involving subtle strategy ensure a wonderfully balanced play experience. Every play session will be different as there are multiple paths to victory. Amazing artwork graces every surface making it as fun a game to look at as it is to play.

Fair winds and following seas!

—description from the publisher

name: Jigūan: The Eastern Mechanist – New Resource Tracks
description:
Comes with 4 players markers and one double-sided resource track.

There are two sides to the New Resource Tracks: Immediate Rewards and Gear Exchange Rewards. At the start of the game, decide which side to use and place beside the Five-Pagoda board. All players will use this side during the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Industry / Manufacturing, Math
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: The Obscure: A Sinister Adventure
description:
The Obscure - A Sinister Adventure is a cooperative board game where you will be part of a group that has noticed strange things happening in the city of Meradosia, mysterious signs that something bad is about to happen. Traveling around the city, you will have to investigate clues from stories told by witnesses of supernatural events, face terrible creatures and also discover the whereabouts of the Crystals of Doom and prepare to face the much-feared Obscure.

In this game, you will be one of the characters and will have to get enough clues to solve the Adventure cards, being able to overcome the challenges to conquer the Crystals of Doom, which will be responsible for exposing the vulnerability of the game's biggest enemy, the Obscure. However, it’s not just about moving back and forth, you have to be very careful, because in addition to the possibility of the map being infested by creatures, you need to worry about not losing the tracks and also keeping the creatures away from the active areas - area named on the map. Phew phew, it will be a challenge.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Horror, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Katag: Clan of Nature
description: This is a new standalone deck, featuring a new clan and new mechanics, mainly focused on animal companions.

name: Katag: Le jeu de Carte – Fire Extension
description: New cards and new mechanics for your Fire Deck. Introduction of epic Fire Companions.

name: Katag: Le jeu de Carte – Earth Extension
description: Add new cards and new mechanics to the Earth Deck. Introduce epic earth companions.

name: Katag: Clan of Nature – Nature Extension
description: Add new cards and new mechanics to the Nature Deck. Introduce epic nature companions.

name: Engage & Destroy: Volume 1
description:
Engage & Destroy is a simulation game of tactical armored warfare in World War II, 1939 to 1945.
Underlying Engage & Destroy is a comprehensive set of models that generates the game data for each of the units used in the game so that the game subsumes most of the complex calculations allowing the players to focus primarily on combat tactics.

Players play in turns using pulses, with each turn representing two minutes of actual time. Players draw and play chits, the interaction between them outlines who can move and engage with their units. When all units in the game have moved and/or performed a combat action, or both Players consecutively PASS the turn ends. Combat is instantaneous.

Engage & Destroy combat situations are presented in near-historical context, which balance resources and capabilities between the players making the game contest of skill rather than a match between unbalanced order of battles, allowing the game to portray period type engagements in a skill contest format.

There are three types of games in Engage & Destroy:

Meeting Engagements - players must take and hold locations, gaining more points than their opponent before the game ends,
Assault - one player must push a defender back behind a series of defense lines before the game ends,
Firefight - In Arena, it’s a pure shoot out, with the player who earns the most “kill” points winning by game’s end.


Scale:
Complexity: Medium
Time Scale: 2 minutes/turn
Map Scale: 175 metres per hex
Unit Scale: Single Vehicle or Team
Players: 2
Solitaire Suitability: Medium
Playing Time: 1 to 4 hours

name: Lost Worlds: Dino Fight Series – Triceratops
description:
A spin-off from the popular Lost World Combat Book series. Instead of fantasy heroes, the players take the roles of fighting Dinosaurs.

Each player neeeds a booklet to play. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid determines the result (wounds loss, off balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one Dinosaur or the other expires.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Worlds: Dino Fight Series – T-Rex
description:
A spin-off from the popular Lost World Combat Book series. Instead of fantasy heroes, the players take the roles of fighting Dinosaurs.

Each player neeeds a booklet to play. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid determines the result (wounds loss, off balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one Dinosaur or the other expires.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Worlds: Dino Fight Series – "Tyrannosaurus Rex" Tyrant Lizard King
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Worlds: Dino Fight Series – "Triceratops" Three Horned Lizard
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Bad People: White Expansion Pack
description: The WHITE Expansion Pack comes with 100 NEW Question Cards and MUST be played with the Bad People Base Game. Great for groups and an epic BONUS optional adult drinking games variant is included in the base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Bad People: Green Expansion Pack
description: The GREEN Expansion Pack comes with 100 NEW Question Cards and MUST be played with the Bad People Base Game. Great for groups and an epic BONUS optional adult drinking games variant is included in the base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: On the Edge: Booster Arcana
description: Booster Pack, Arcana contains 10 On the Edge Game Cards depicting the mythical subculture of Al Amarja. There are two varieties of packaging, "Angels" and "Devils."
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Credence Barebone
description:
Raised by a No-Maj anti-witchcraft group, the orphan Credence Barebone repressed his magical abilities, allowing a parasitic Obscurus to grow within him. Somehow resisting the creature, Credence became an Obscurial of immense power, making him of immeasurable value in the schemes of Grindelwald.

This set contains a finely detailed Credence Barebone miniature, which may be included in any Grindelwald’s Army or Magical Creatures group.

Contents:
1 Deatiled ready to paint & assemble resin miniature: Credence
1 60mm plastic base
1 Character card
4 Artefact cards
1 Assembly instructions
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: NOVA: Race from the Sun 5th Player Expansion
description:
The 5th Player Expansion for NOVA: Race from the Sun includes everything necessary for a 5th player including 20 additional Tech Cards, 15 dice in 8 colors, a player mat, a spaceship player marker, a Crew Population figure, a Hack token and a deluxe dice bag.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Events, Race

name: Warfare on Distant Planets
description:
Warfare on Distant Planets is a set of rules for science fiction battles with 6mm figures.

Humanity has spread to the stars and they are not alone now they battle with various other races to control distant as of yet unnamed planets.

The rules have a random army choice system that ensures that games are not always evenly matched sometimes winning just means doing as much damage as possible before your troops are defeated.

Stats are given for a number of different forces and it would be easy to create your own as well.

name: White Star Wizard
description:
Pad Pad games are board games on small pads (1/3 A4). The board and the rules are on every sheet and everyone gets a sheet. The pad and a pencil is all that is needed. No big board to lay out, no fiddly pieces, easy to carry and simple rules, so the games can be played almost anywhere; on a ferry, train, waiting room, tent etc.

Story; You are a powerful Elemental Wizard. To prove you are the best, you have challenged your friends to a friendly competition. Try to outsmart the other wizards and become a White Star Wizard.

Each player is a wizard casting Elemental spells, trying to score the most victories before all Elements have been conquered.

name: Refighting History: Volume 8 – The Seven Years War Western Theatre: Small Actions
description:
Looking at the Seven Years War, military historians tend to concentrate on the big battles. However, the day to day campaign activity of the combatants included reconnaissance, raids, probing actions, resupply and a host of other minor operations that frequently lead to small skirmishes.

What I want to do in this volume of Refighting History is to take some of these actions, however small, and however sketchy in terms of accounts, and turn them into wargames. They will also demonstrate that you do not need large armies to wargame the Seven Years War.
The Western Theatre accounts provide details of the day to day activity by both armies. Coupled with this, the great variety of light and irregular troops provides a whole range of different unit.

The result is this volume with nine small historical actions refought on the wargame table. There is also a significant amount of background on the units involved coupled with art work to illustrate the uniforms.

—description from designer

The scenarios are compatible with many rulesets although Sharp Practice ! is recommended by the author (who uses his own modifications of his set The War Game Rules).

name: Refighting History: Volume 2 – The War of the Austrian Succession: Mollwitz, Chotusitz and Sahay
description:
Having covered some relatively small actions in Volume 1 of Refighting History Volume 2 examines some larger battles. The battles in question come from the War of the Austrian Succession and more specifically the First Silesian War.

The first battle is something of a wargame classic - Mollwitz. The Grant’s first Mollwitz wargame is coved with an excerpt from The War Game describing how it was first fought back in 1968. The battle is then revisited and with quite different results. There is then “A slice of Mollwitz” looking at only one particular part of the same battle.

The second battle, Chotusitz, is rather less well known and took place the year after Mollwitz. The battle includes an unusual twist but you will have to read it to discover what it is.

The third battle is the rather obscure battle of Sahay. This battle required quite a lot of detective work and no small amount of conjecture. The end result is a most interesting action.

In addition to the battles there is an update on Charles’ wargame armies and a section on battlefield manoeuvre in the mid eighteenth and its implications for wargaming.

name: For Motherland! The Russian Front, 1941-44
description:
For Motherland! The Russian Front, 1941-44 is the single map game design by renowned Japanese game designer, Masahiro Yamazaki. This edition features a mounted map and delivers an eminently-playable version of his original, two-map War for the Motherland release that can be played to completion in a single sitting.

The game begins with Operation Barbarossa marking the German invasion of the Soviet Union, and culminates towards the end of the war when the Russians had effectively driven back the German forces and were entering the final stages of the epic struggle on the Eastern Front when the tide had completely turned. The game includes four variable turn scenarios:

Operation Barbarossa (1 to 7 Game-Turns),
The Road to Stalingrad (1 to 12 Game-Turns),
Fall Blau (8 to 17 Game-Turns), and
War for the Motherland campaign (1 to 22 Game-Turns).


One of the nice new twists implemented for the strength chit system is the variable and increasing combat chit strength for the Soviets over time to model the increasing combat effectiveness of the Soviet Armies.

Product Information:
Complexity: 5 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 7 out of 10 (no hidden units)
Time Scale: 1 or 2 months per turn
Map Scale: 74 km per hex
Unit Scale: Army (Soviets, Axis Minors) and Corps (German)
Players: one to two, best with two
Playing Time: 2-5 hours for scenarios, 8+ hours for campaign

-description from publisher's website

name: Katz und Maus
description:
Katz und Maus was published as a supplement to Auerbach's Deutschem Kinder-Kalender für 1913.

Up to 10 players play the mice and one player plays the cat. Te mice have to get from space 1 to space 64 without getting caught by the cat. If the cat and a mouse get on the same space, the mouse gets eaten and is out of play. If a player rolls more than he needs to reach space 64, he has to move the surplus points backwards.

Movement is determined by 2 dice (only 1 die from space 60 onward). Only the mice may use the diagonal lines, the cat has to go around. If the cat gets on an unnumbered intersection near the image of a cat, it needs to roll doublets to move again or has to pay 3 coins in it's third next turn. If a mouse gets near a hiding hole it may chose to stop there with it's last moving point, to be safe from the cat.

If the cat rolls a doublet, it may move backwards to catch a mouse. If a mouse rolls a doublet or reaches a space with the image of a mouse, it's roll counts double.

If the cat gets to space 64 before any mouse it wins the game and the whole stake. If a mouse reaches space 64 the cat may only move up to space 63 and wait there for the remaining mice.

The players pay a stake of 2 coins for each mouse and the same amount of coins for the cat. If the cat passes a mouse the mouse has to pay 1 coin to the cat and vice versa. If several mice use the same hiding hole, each has to pay 1 coin to the first mouse.

When there isn't any mouse remaining in play, the mice in space 64 and the cat share the stake.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Black Seas: Bomb Ketch Squadron
description:
A bomb ketch’s primary armament was not cannon or carronade, but a mortar mounted near the bow elevated at a high angle, that employed explosive shells rather than solid shot. They were designed primarily as bombardment vessels (hence the name bomb ketch), and were deployed against fixed land positions.

Though the British first employed a bomb vessel in 1347, it was the French who would develop a design (in the late 17th century) closer to those seen in the Age of Sail. The British copied and refined those designs over the next century, which led to two-masted ketches. Further development over the age of sail would result in bomb vessels designed as full-rigged ships (with three masts) – which allowed them to function as escort sloops between battles.

A bomb ketch is treated as a small vessel in Black Seas with a mortar mounted on the bow. It functions similarly to a gunboat, but benefits from greater speed and durability.

—description from the publisher's website

name: Refighting History: Volume 3 – The War of the Austrian Succession: Hohenfriedberg, Soor and Rocoux
description:
Volume Three of Refighting History follows on from Volume Two continuing to examine and refight the battles of the War of the Austrian Succession.
There are two more of Frederick’s big battles.
These are Hohenfriedberg and Soor, each divided into two games.
There is in addition a rather unusual game featuring the attack on Frederick’s camp by Nádasdy and Trenck during the battle of Soor.

However, the War of the Austrian Succession involved other armies and theatres of operations. Having covered Hohenfriedberg and Soor in this volume the focus move to the western theatre to cover the Rocoux. Here the French forces of Marshal Saxe face the Allied Army including Britain.

In addition to these battles, six games in all, there is the usual update on Charles’ wargame armies and some additional thoughts on artillery.

—description from designer

name: Clean Cut
description:
Clean Cut has 2 decks of 6 cards (the same set of 6 for each player), and those cards are used to construct a small time track. The cards quickly cycle back into the players' hands, with most of the game spent holding 4 cards.

The timing of card effects is based on the orientation of the cards, using markings on them to determine the order in which they take effect. Every card has 2 options for how it can be played, with changes to the effect of the card alongside the change in timing. Matches play out fast, because it can potentially only take 2 hits to land a "clean cut" and achieve victory.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Turn Order: Time Track

name: China: Europe
description: Map of Europe made to fit the rules for China, rather than Web of Power. Can be downloaded from the designer's website.

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Adeptus Astartes – Blood Angels
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Conquest Companion
description:
Conquest Companion is a hardcover rulebook which compiles all the most up to date rulings and clarifications made by the Para Bellum team on the core rules and army lists.
In addition, it contains the new Character expansion rules, allowing players to customize their Characters with all new retinues, skills, and items.

The Companion also has 304 pages dedicated to giving an overview of the world of Conquest and it’s factions, revealing hitherto unknown details about the origins of the world and the history of each faction.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Auf Oskar's Spuren
description:
This game features characters from the German comic strip "Oskar der Familienvater" (1952-1962).

The players start at space 1 and have to go to space 140 to find Oskar and win the game. Movement is determined by a die.
On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Emotional Journey
description:
Emotional Journey is a cooperative storytelling role playing game. Teach empathy and communication skills while having an epic adventure with your family!

Players start by creating characters for themselves and a group goal for everyone to accomplish together. Then they tell the story of their adventure using the images on the Encounter Cards and the emotions on the Emotion Cards to create their story. The game ends when the group goal has been accomplished and a minimum number of Encounter Cards have been completed.

This game encourages discussion involving emotions, embracing different emotions, cooperation, and empathy. By thinking about how different situations provoke different emotions, players learn empathy skills and can explore emotions from different perspectives. By telling a story about the emotions of their characters, players learn self expression and communication skills. By working together to accomplish a group goal players learn cooperation.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy

name: Lawn Lords
description: Lawn Lords is a Print and Play tile laying game for 2 players that plays in about 15 minutes. Players each place 12 tiles on a grid, trying to outwit their opponent to get the most points by getting the majority in each row, diagonal, or column. Only the player with the most tiles in each row will score. Will the dandelions triumph? Or will the grass grow greenest?

name: Refighting History: Volume 5 – Marlborough's Big Four: The Battles of Blenheim, Ramillies, Oudenarde and Malplaquet
description:
The battles, Blenheim, Ramillies, Oudenarde and Malplaquet, are known collectively as Marlbourgh’s Big Four. In this book, after a brief introduction to the War of the Spanish Succession each battle is covered in four sections:

The Background - providing the context to the battle.
The Battle - provides an account of the historical battle. In this section a detailed order of battle, maps and an account of the battle with eyewitness accounts where possible are provided.
Wargaming the Battle - this sets out some of the considerations and thought processes that have gone into delivering the battle to the wargame table.
The Wargame - an account of the game.

name: Refighting History: Volume  6 – The Seven Years War: Moys, Mehr, Eilenburg, Baiersdorf and Closter Camp
description:
Refighting History: Volume 6 covers five battles from the Seven Years War.
The four-part format for each game is unchanged.
The background is briefly described, then a detailed account of the actual action with orders of battle, consideration on how to wargame the battle and finally the wargame itself.

The five battles covered range from the relatively large battle at Moys to a small skirmish near Baiersdorf. The Actions Action at Mehr and Eilenburg provided interesting challenges for both players. The Battle of Closter Camp presents the opportunity for considerable confusion with the early part of the action taking place in the dark.

The chapter on Command and Staff looks at the various staff structures in the major armies before looking at the wargame implications.

There have been a number of significant changes in The Wargame Rules since they were published in 2012 and these changes are summarised in a short chapter.

Finally, to help regular readers find in which volume previous battles have appeared there is a table “A Catalogue of Battles Fought and Published in Wargaming In History and Refighting History”.

—description from the publisher site

name: Skull Lantern
description:
Skull Lantern is based on the fairy tale of Baba Yaga and Vasilisa the Beautiful. After being captured by Baba Yaga, Vasilisa is forced to clean Baba Yaga’s house. As Vasilisa cleans the house, she must find trinkets to help her escape or else be eaten by Baba Yaga.

In this game, you and your friends are spirits that seek to help Vasilisa. But beware, there are other Spirits that seek to hurt Vasilisa. Can you coordinate your spirit powers to help Vasilisa escape or will she be eaten by Baba Yaga? Let’s play to find out the end of this fairy tale!

name: Raze
description: Raze is an asymmetrical, competitive 1 versus 1 card game -- one player takes the role of the Pirate, which mirrors a traditional CCG, while the other player plays as the Sovereign, which mixes in Euro & Engine Building mechanics. Because Raze is a shuffle builder, players get a complete deckbuilding and CCG experience in just 45 minutes. Every aspect of Raze is designed to accommodate both casual play across the kitchen table or nail-biting competition between old school CCG players.

name: Myths at War: Back to the Beginning
description:
New 54 cards set with brand new content for Norse, Japanese and Egyptian mythologies (new gods, events, actions...) to add to any Myths at War installment.

Myths at War is a strategy card game for two or more players who confront each other to determine the fate of a Mythology. Before starting a game, each player builds his or her own deck according to a defined set of rules and then faces other players to deem which Mythology is the most powerful. There are two ways of winning a Myths at War game: GOD OF GODS, by achieving a certain level of power or OBLIVION, by vanquishing your opponent. Myths at War mixes strategy and collection. Each expansion set will help you improve existing decks and create new ones.

name: Bhengel
description:
In this game, you try to preserve the forest of the Hengelhoef holiday park in Belgium while walking through the park and doing recreational activities.

The goal of the game is to have the most points after all players have completed the course. Players get points based on the order in which they arrive (who arrives first gets the most points) and they also get points for collecting and matching up word and item cards.

The board features a forest with 10 trees and a linear track with spaces. You roll a die to move along the track and when you land on a green Bhengel and a grey Timber space you respectively add a tree to the forest or remove it. There are also spaces with a green/yellow dot that give you an item or word card respectively but only if there still trees in the forest. Then there are assignment spaces with a red dot (that tell you to go move ahead, move back, lose a turn, make everyone go to your space, take the long road through the forest etc.). When you land on a double-arrow space, you can decide which direction to move in and certain activity spaces also let you pick the direction. Apart from those little decisions, the game is all luck.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Maztrix
description:
In Maztrix, the adventurer, you are looking for the TRUE Mayan calendar in the hidden temple and interpret the calendar at the top of the temple for the ultimate true secret.

Adventurers have to build their pathway from the border of the secret island and be the first person to reach the hidden temple.

While making your way to reach the hidden temple by placing bricks as a pathway, you also have to prevent the other adventurers from reaching it first by moving placed bricks to disturb other adventurers' pathway.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, King of the Hill, Pieces as Map, Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Kaiju Demolitions Ltd.
description:
Hello? Is that Kaiju Demolitions Ltd.? I have a job for you. We here at Honda City have err… run into a spot of bother with our finances. But no matter, we have come up with a plan. We have taken out a rather substantial insurance policy against the city. All we need is for you to come and destroy as many of the buildings as possible so we can claim the money. But please, do try to steer clear of people’s houses. Oh, and if you could avoid damaging any of our fine historical landmarks that would be swell. We need those to attract the tourists.

Kaiju Demolitions Ltd. is a flip-and-write game for 1 or more players.

—description from the designer

name: SEEKRIEG 5: Ship Logs – France 1880-1945
description:
This collection of the SEEKRIEG ship logs, originally released on CD in 2008, represents the majority of the vessels comprising the navies of France during the years 1880 to 1945. Any corrections made to the original release are included in this set of files (including all corrections released in the 2/18/2009 CD version and subsequent corrections through 2019).

A total of 880 ship logs are included and, wherever possible, planned warships, conversions and never completed vessels are also included and based on available information. In most instances, one or more logs are provided for individual ships within a particular class. Major refits or other modifications significantly affecting the fighting capability of a ship are reflected in the multiple logs available for some ships, however, details regarding individual modifications to some of the smaller vessels (torpedo boats, submarines, gunboats and MTBs) are not generally available so a single ship log is provided to serve for the entire class.

—description from the publisher

name: Musket & Pike Rules
description:
Miniatures wargame rules for 16-17th century musket and pike combat. Published as an article in issue number one of FGU's magazine, Wargaming.

—user summary

The basic intent of these rules is to provide a fast moving and exceedingly playable game which can be fought to a definitive conclusion in slightly over an hour, including set up time . . . To achieve playability, the game and rules are simplified. The concepts are strategic, rather than tactical. For example, in the case of light infantry, no differentiation is made between types of missile weapons . . . In the same way, heavy infantry are simply heavy infantry, regardless of whether they are pikemen or halberdiers. A unit is representational rather than scaled.

The first great simplification is the use of the gridded square. We submit that its accuracy is every bit as good or better than haphazard inch-measured movement as usually used in other games . . . With a diagonal move counting 1 1/2, sufficient differentiation for different type troops is allowed. Movement of all troops can be made very quickly.

The second great simplification is the use of an actual firing artillery piece . . . After movement has been made, the scale gun is replaced by a firing gun, "to the rear, relative to the target" and an actual missile is fired. Where the point of the missile lands is the basis for a one inch radius compass measurement; any troops within this radius are destroyed. This actual firing introduces many historically correct variables. A miss can occur at point blank range; a wild ricochet can destroy the firer's own troops or bounce into a seemingly safe position . . .

There is an advantage to not using a rigid scale, such as 1/20 . . . We decided one economy sized regiments. As detailed in the section on organization, not one of the regiments has over 12 [miniature figure] men, and a good sized division contains only about 150 figures.

The basic playing unit is the stand, with several stands per regiment . . . the exact stand size is immaterial, as long as both players use the same frontages.

—description from the rules
categories: Action / Dexterity, Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Telestrations: Twist Gaming Promo
description:
1 extra card to add to the game.
Shuffle it in with the rest of the cards
6 new words:
Twitch
Onesie
Spotlight
Gamenight
Kingdom Death
Costume

This card was offered as a reward to certain tiers in the "Twist Gaming Kickstarter - Year 4" campaign.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time

name: Atom Age Shark: Cold War Sci-Fi Hunting and Combat For 1 Player
description:
Dear operative,

We’ve just received intel from one of our best men in the CIA that the Russians are now implementing a new weapons project titled Project Tooth. According to our information, this new project utilizes sea life in its execution--specifically a genetically enhanced great white shark. We believe multiple disappearances of American fishing boats is related to this new project. We need you to join one of our submarine crews and hunt this creature down and kill it before it can do more harm . . . or the Russians can build a better one.

Atom Age Shark is a Sci-Fi themed alternate history game set during the cold war where the Russians are using a great white shark as part of the war effort.

It is up to you, the player, to track down the shark and kill it. This will be no easy task as this superpowered shark can rip a sub to shreds if given the chance.

Basic sequence of play:

Hunt the Shark Phase
Submarine Engine Phase
Combat the Shark Phase


—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: SEEKRIEG 5: Ship Logs – United States 1880-1945
description:
This collection of the SEEKRIEG ship logs, originally released on CD in 2005, represents the majority of the vessels comprising the navies of the United States during the years 1880 to 1945. Any corrections made to the original release are included in this set of files (including all corrections released in the 2/18/2009 CD version and subsequent corrections through 2019).

A total of 2,797 ship logs are included and, wherever possible, planned warships, conversions and never completed vessels are also included and based on available information. In most instances, one or more logs are provided for individual ships within a particular class. Major refits or other modifications significantly affecting the fighting capability of a ship are reflected in the multiple logs available for some ships, however, details regarding individual modifications to some of the smaller vessels (torpedo boats, submarines, gunboats and MTBs) are not generally available so a single ship log is provided to serve for the entire class.

name: SEEKRIEG 5: Ship Logs – Germany 1880-1945
description:
This collection of the SEEKRIEG ship logs, originally released on CD in 2004, represents the majority of the vessels comprising the navies of Germany during the years 1880 to 1945. A total of 1,137 ship logs are included and, wherever possible, planned warships, conversions and never completed vessels are also included and based on available information. publishers: Creative Data Systems, Richard R. Sartore & Associates

name: SEEKRIEG 5: Ship Logs – Minor Navies 1880-1945
description:
This collection of the SEEKRIEG 5 Ship Logs for the Minor Navies contains 2,076 individual ship logs representing the warships of the navies of Austria-Hungary, Argentina, Belgium, Brazil, Bulgaria, Chile, China, Colombia, Cuba, Denmark, Ecuador, Estonia, Finland, Greece, Haiti, Latvia, Mexico, Netherlands, Norway, Paraguay, Persia, Peru, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Siam (Thailand), Spain, Sweden, Turkey, Uruguay, Venezuela and Yugoslavia. It covers the years 1880 through 1945 and includes battleships, cruisers, destroyers, seaplane carriers, torpedo boats, gunboats and mine warfare vessels.
This release brings the total number of SEEKRIEG 5 Ship Logs now available to well over 15,000 warships.

—description from the publisher

name: Vicious Cats
description:
A social role playing game where cats can be cute... and deceptive!
The goal is for the good cats to find and cut all the Vicious cats from the game before the Vicious cats cut enough good cats from the game.

But be careful, it is in everyone's interest to claim to be a Good cat. Each game the Talkshow Host leads the game and can set up the game with an elaborate story of their choosing. This sets the tone, place, time, etc.

Each player is secretly and randomly assigned a character via cards faced down. They then secretly look at their cards.

While awake, they talk and take turns accusing others of being a Vicious Cat, then vote on who to cut from the game.

While they take a catnap, secret roles may do their assigned skill, and Vicious Cats can decide who to cut from the game.

Can the Good Cats find all the Vicious Cats, or are the Vicious Cats that great at being cute... and deceptive?

-description from designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Memory, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Beeples
description:
2 players ages 8+

An 8x8 board.
4 bee meeples ('beeples') in 2 colors.
60 flower tokens in various colors.

Setup
The board starts out empty.

Players in turn place their 2 beeples onto any empty squares of the board.

And each player starts the game with a pool of 30 flower tokens.

Play
Players take turns.

Per turn take into your hand from 1 to 4 flower tokens from your pool.

Flower Placement
Place a flower token from your hand on an empty square orthogonally adjacent to a friendly beeple and then place a flower on an empty square orthogonally adjacent to the last-placed flower. But not orthogonally adjacent to any other flower. Keep placing flowers from your hand until all are placed, or until there are no available squares for the next flower.

Return any unplayed flowers from your hand back into your pool.

Beeple Movement
Now move your beeple from the back of the chain of flowers you just placed to an empty space orthogonally adjacent to the last-placed flower.

A player that cannot complete a turn must pass.

The game ends when players pass in turn.

Goal
The player with the least number of flowers in his pool wins.

—description from designer

name: SEEKRIEG 5: Ship Logs – Great Britain & Commonwealth 1880-1945
description:
This collection of the SEEKRIEG 5 ship logs, originally released on CD in two separate sets, represents the majority of the vessels comprising the navies of Great Britain and Commonwealth Nations of Canada, Australia and New Zealand during the years 1880 to 1945.
It contains all the ship logs from both sets and includes over 3,300 individual ship logs.
Any corrections made to the original release are included in this set of files (including all corrections released in the 2/18/2009 CD version and subsequent corrections through 2019).

Wherever possible, planned warships, conversions and never completed vessels are also included and based on available information. In most instances, one or more logs are provided for individual ships within a particular class. Major refits or other modifications significantly affecting the fighting capability of a ship are reflected in the multiple logs available for some ships, however, details regarding individual modifications to some of the smaller vessels (torpedo boats, submarines, gunboats and MTBs) are not generally available so a single ship log is provided to serve for the entire class.

—description from the publisher

name: Simple Skirmish Rules: Pre Gunpowder Era
description:
A very simple set of skirmish rules for the pre gunpowder era could also be used for fantasy games.

Any individually based figures will do fine for historical clashes or alternatively mix and match with whatever you have available.

Designed to be quick and fun ideal for people new to wargaming.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: SeaLion Supremacy: World War II Tabletop Naval Wargaming
description:
SeaLion Supremacy is World War 2 tabletop naval wargaming delivered in a format to use for both experienced wargamers, but also those new to the naval wargaming scene. Designed by a long term fan and user of other naval wargaming rules to present his own take on the genre.

Designed to be used with a range of WW2 hex counters and basemaps, players don't have to invest in expensive physical miniatures and can use counters.
The rules can be used with larger hex grids and physical miniatures if users decide to play it that way.

The rules include fleet ship specs for the following Word War 2 navies:
British
French
German
Italy
Japan
United States

Also included are specifications for various aircraft involved in these naval battles.

Designed to be used with d6 dice.

This rulebook contains a mini A4 printable hex base for use in gaming.

—description from the publisher

name: Familiefighten
description:
An "upgraded" version of memory. Each player gets six cards, and six cards go on the table face down.

On your turn, you flip two cards on the table to make a matching pair - either of those two, or one of them and a card from your hand. All cards have an ability (steal or swap a trick; steal or swap a card; look at a face-down card; you cannot win; this trick count as two at the end of the game).

At the end of the turn there is some refilling.
The game ends when the stack is empty or a player has no more cards in hand.

name: Flash Gordon: Death to Ming!
description:
In the fast-paced fighting card game Flash Gordon: Death to Ming!, players go head-to-head to determine the fate of Mongo. Each player takes on the role of a well-known character from the movie, with these characters being split into "good" and "evil", then players go head-to-head in Ming's throne room to determine the fate of Mongo. Through heroism or treachery, players will customize their card deck with weapons and abilities unique to those iconic characters.

Determine who will triumph: Flash Gordon and his allies, or the forces of Ming the Merciless!

—description from the publisher

name: Cyberstrife
description:
The year is 2067 and players operate elite covert security companies hired by corporations who seek to gain a lethal edge against their rivals in the fiercely competitive solar market. Players must gather units and deploy them on offensive and defensive missions against other players. Players attack each other in a clockwise direction. When players run out of units they are removed from the game until eventually only one victorious player remains.

Game Features
2-12 players - more with additional copies of the game e.g. 36 players 3 game copies
1 Simultaneous turn for every 2 active players - Very minimal time between turns, just as you finish attacking the player to your left the player to your right will be getting ready to attack you and after that it's your turn again
Player elimination until 1 victorious player remains
32 Trait Cards - 496 playable trait combinations
76 Unit Cards - 8436 playable unit combinations
4,184,256 possible teams you could deploy assuring each game will be unique as all players draft different strategies in order to adapt to their enemies

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Diving Into The Wreck
description:
Diving Into The Wreck is a co-operative press-your-luck "Encounters" game in which you dive into explorations as one of the characters in Kristine Kathryn Rusch's Diving Universe.

Players use a set of six dice to defeat a storyline of challenge cards, hoping to discover deeper secrets as they go. Accrue and spend resources, watch each other's back, and solve each phase in time to escape the final challenge.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: The Great War: Tank Battles
description:
The Great War: Tank Battles is a table-top game from Exile Into Imagination that combines strategy with history to make a compelling game based on the armored cavalry of the first World War!

TANKS! First introduced on the field during World War I in the Battle of the Somme, these engines of extermination changed warfare forever. 1916, 1917, and 1918 saw many of these juggernauts introduced. During the War to End All Wars there were 16 different types of tanks created by the Allies and the Central Powers that made it onto the battlefield. The Great War: Tank Battles basic set includes each and every one of those behemoths!
Game play is FAST and EASY to learn! Set-up takes mere minutes. Game play usually takes less than an hour, but the players can adjust the game to last far shorter or far longer depending on time constraints. Since only basic reading and math are required, the game is suited for ages 8 and up.

Thoroughly analyzed and using equations based on armor plating, speed, and destructive capabilities, Damage Points determine what it takes to bring one of these monsters down and Value Points dictate scores at the end of the game. The basic set comes with 54 tank cards with distribution reflective of the actual numbers of each type of tank employed in battle.

Players utilize their Action Cards to fire weapons at the formations of their opponents, send in Air Strikes and Infantry Attacks, plant Mine Fields against their enemies, repair their tanks with Damage Control, use Evasive Maneuvers to avoid incoming fire, protect themselves from above with Air Cover, and even Retreat from battle entirely. When the going gets rough, players can also use Additional Tank cards to strengthen their formation.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Force Commitment, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Turn Order: Random, Variable Set-up

name: Warhammer 40,000: Sanctus Reach – Hour of the Wolf
description:
The stunning conclusion to the Sanctus Reach Campaign, Hour of the Wolf takes the war into a new and deadly phase as Logan Grimnar and Ragnar Blackmane lead their Great Companies into the teeming hordes of the Red Waaagh!

Hour of the Wolf is a 112 page Warhammer 40,000 Campaign Supplement that follows the epic conclusion to the Sanctus Reach war that started in the Sanctus Reach: Red Waaagh!. Inside you will find the glorious tale of conflict, carnage and bloodshed that follows the bitter war for Alaric Prime, a complete campaign that will take you from the Space Wolves heroic arrival to the battle’s cataclysmic finale, and a host of new formations for both Space Wolves and Orks including a collection of exciting Planetstrike missions.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Eagle Huck Golf Board Game
description:
board game for 1-4 players
play 18 holes on fictitious eagle huck golf course
choose to select from custom cards or to roll perfect dice



99% usa content
assembled in oregon

name: 52 Variety Game Chest
description: A game for every week is found in this game compilation. Even though the title indicates that there are 52 games, the box contains 56 games from Bunny Hop to Easter Egg Roll for the youngest in the family, from Baseball to Steeplechase for those who are sports minded and from Shanghai Chinese Checkers to Pa-Chiz-Si for those who want to challenge multiple players
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Flicking, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: GirlyQuiz
description:
A "know your friend" game aimed at 8-14 year old girls.

A player asks a question and its 4 possible answers.
Other players must guess what they think she will answer, and get points if they were correct.

—user summary

name: Micro Medieval: Burgundians
description:
A ziplocked expansion army set for Tabletop Games' 1979 release, Micro Medieval. Includes a cover sheet, counter sheet, and special rules for units of the expansion armies.

—user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Hedge Mazers
description:
You all are world renowned Hedge Maze designers. You are trying to have your design chosen by the Elitist of Elites to have your Hedge Maze used at their new vacation home.

Everybody is given a player board with a cover so that your design is kept secretive. There is a draw bag where X amount of Hedge pieces are in the bag. Every round 5 pieces are drawn from the bag and placed in the center of the table. Starting with the 1st player of that turn you will select a tile from the center followed by everyone else. Once everyone has placed the tile on their player board it remains there and can not be moved. 1st player token is passed to the next player and the round repeats until there are only 4 pieces in the center in which end game is triggered. This will be the last piece placed on the board and the game is over. Time to score.

Victory points will include different objectives that will be met as a whole and individual objectives as well. Most Dead Ends. Most Turns. Shortest distances from start to finish. Longest distances from start to finish.
Certain tiles may be worth certain points as well. Say if they are harder to place tiles and only limited to one or two in the bag.

-description from designer

name: Lustige Autofahrt mit Hindernissen
description:
The players have to travel from start to finish to reach their vacation spot. The first to do so wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events benefit or hinder the players.

The game was published as the back of a blister pack or bag of 15 different lemonade powder items (Frigeo Brause Palette).

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Würfelspiel Feueralarm
description:
Six fires are put in any slots of the house. The remaining 6 fires are laid nearby as smoldering fires. The players in turn roll a die.
1-3: One fire is extinguished and placed in front of the player.
4: Nothing happens, all fires continue to burn.
5-6: A smoldering fire is placed into a slot in the house.

If all fires are extinguished before all smoldering fires broke out, the player who has extinguished the most fires wins the game.

If all smoldering fires have broken out and at least one fire burns at the end of the round, the house burns down and all players have lost.

This game was published as a cut-out sheet.

—user summary

name: Immer auf Tuchfühlung
description:
Each player has 10 pawns, he has to get from his side on the game board to the opposite side. Two pawns of the same color may occupy the same space. Movement is one space diagonally forward on the red spaces. Only single pawns of another color may be caught by jumping (diagonally forward)over the pawn on a free space behind it.

The pawns have to move in groups of at least four pawns on adjacent spaces. If one or more pawns get separated from their group, they are eliminated from the game.

If a pawn gets separated by catching another pawn, the player has to connect this pawn to a group in the next two turns or the pawn is lost.

The player who gets the most pawns to the opposite side wins the game.

—user summary

name: Die Urzeit Horde
description:
The players have to get their one or three pawns (cavemen) from start to finish. The first to do so wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On the red spaces events hinder or benefit the players. If a player gets on a space with dice eyes, he may not move till he rolls the indicated number.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Congeria
description:
Congeria is a game where you decide how good or bad you want to play it. It's a card game where each player has their own goal to acquire 5 different colored gems. To acquire them, players take cards from decks in the middle that allow them to take gems from various locations. Either nicely from the communal pool or not so nicely from other players. First player to reach their goal wins.

—description from the designer

name: The Anarchy
description:
They filled the whole land with castles [...] when the castles were built they filled them with devils and wicked men. [...] When the wretched people had no more to give, they plundered and burnt all the villages [...] the land was ruined by such doings; and men said openly that Christ and His saints slept. -The Anglo-Saxon Chronicle

In 1120 a fateful shipwreck drowned William Ætheling, heir to the throne of England. Over fifteen years, King Henry laid the groundwork for his daughter Matilda’s succession. But when the king died in 1135, his nephew Stephen raced to London and seized the crown. Four more years have passed: Stephen has consolidated power while Matilda has built an invasion force in Normandy and fomented rebellion in the southwest. The stage is set for a decade of valiant deeds and dramatic betrayals, a prolonged and capricious struggle for the rule of England.

In The Anarchy two players revisit the 12th century civil war that plagued the Kingdom of England through a chess motif that models shifting loyalties and strategic circumstances. Players represent the sides of Stephen and Matilda, each supported by a set of knights and bishops. Pawns (English levies and foreign mercenaries) are recruited to raid and battle, and castles pop up all over the map, presenting opportunities to protect key strongholds or tempting an opponent as worthy siege targets. As the years wear on, and leaders are called to court, deployed to fight, and defect through capture or simple exhaustion, each side must strive to meet its own unique objectives to secure their claim to the throne of England.
mechanics: Action Points, Command Cards, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Volume Twelve: The Fall of Orpheus
description:
Imperial Armour Volume Twelve

On the edge of the Segmentum Tempestus, the Orpheus Sector has stood as a bulwark against the outer darkness for millennia. Forged in war and preserved by the blood of the Imperium’s soldiers, it has stood against the privations of the Orks from without and the treachery of the Ruinous Powers from within, but now a new terror has risen that is beyond anything it has faced before.

From their cold tombs beneath forbidden and dead worlds rise the Necrons of the ancient Maynarkh Dynasty.
