Tainted by madness and abominable hunger, undying warrior-legions and the fearsome war engines of a lost age strike without warning, seeking to exterminate the humans that now infest their former domains. The Space Marines of the Minotaurs Chapter and the relentless armies of the Death Korps of Krieg stand ready to defend the sector, but can even these forces hold before the nightmare that has come to Orpheus?

Imperial Armour Volume Twelve: The Fall of Orpheus, written by Alan Bligh, is a mighty 232-page, full colour tome, packed with lavish maps, colour profiles and photographs. The horrors of the Orphean War are recounted in detail, alongside a new variant Necron army list – the Dark Harvest – which represents the tainted Maynarkh Dynasty, and full rules for new Necron units such as the Night Shroud Bomber, the Canoptek Acanthrites and the mighty Tomb Citadel.

The book also contains a new Death Korps of Krieg army list – the Assault Brigade – updated background, units and characters for the Minotaurs Space Marine Chapter, as well as rules for numerous Warhammer 40,000 Space Marine units.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – War Machines of the Lost and the Damned
description:
Imperial Armour Volume Thirteen

This book provides you with rules to use the large range of Forge World Chaos Space Marine armoured vehicles in your games of Warhammer 40,000.

Included within are profiles and rules for more than twenty Chaos Space Marine vehicles, as well as
Chaos Titans and the armoured vehicles of the Heretics and Renegades – the mortal followers of the dark gods. These range from specialised variants of the mighty Land Raider to the heavily armed Chaos Thunderhawk Gunship, as well as extensive background material describing the war machines of the Chaos Space Marines and their mortal allies. It also provides a complete army list for Renegades and Heretics – the hosts of cultists, mutants and turncoat warriors, and their own range of armoured vehicles dedicated to the Ruinous Powers – which can be fielded as an army in its own right or used as a source of allies for the Chaos Space Marines.

In addition to this wealth of information, Imperial Armour Volume Thirteen – War Machines of the Lost and the Damned presents extensive details on the dark heraldry and blasphemous iconography used by the Chaos Space Marines.

In order to use this book, you will need the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook and the relevant Codex for your army.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Volume Ten: The Badab War – Part Two
description:
Imperial Armour Volume Ten

An Imperial Armour expansion book by Forge World for Warhammer 40,000. It is the second in a two-part series detailing the events of the Badab War.

Inside the second volume in Forge World’s two-part exploration of the infamous Badab War, you will find a detailed account of the apocalyptic conclusion of the story of the conflict. Also detailed are full backgrounds and dispositions of eight Space Marine Chapters who played the most significant part in the Badab War’s later stages: The Minotaurs, Executioners, Salamanders, Exorcists, Sons of Medusa, Mantis Warriors, Star Phantoms and the Carcharodons.

This volume also contains a variant Space Marine Siege Vanguard Assault force, a new campaign siege special mission for use with the Badab War campaign rules found in Imperial Armour Volume 9, three new Apocalypse formations, ten new special characters for the Space Marine Chapters featured in this book, new ships and fleet lists for Battlefleet Gothic and a phenomenal range of colour profiles and pictures. Forge World’s book production team and Imperial Armour Writer Alan Bligh have done sterling work adding fantastic new depth to the Warhammer 40,000 universe. The book also contains a full colour, double sided poster containing a detailed Badab Sector Navigator's map by Sam Lamont, and brand new Space Marine Chapter artwork by Forge World's Book Design Team.

-back cover
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Volume Nine: The Badab War – Part One
description:
Imperial Armour Volume Nine - The Badab War - Part One is an Imperial Armour expansion book by Forge World for Warhammer 40,000. It is the first in a two-part series detailing the events of the Badab War.

nside this book are full histories and dispositions of the nine Space Marine Chapters who played the most significant part in the Badab War’s early stages. The Astral Claws, Fire Hawks, Marines Errant, Red Scorpions, Raptors, Novamarines, Fire Angels, Howling Griffons and Lamenters are each illustrated with extensive colour profiles. This volume also contains a complete army list, The Tyrant’s Legion, representing those forces that defended Huron’s conquered realms from the Imperium’s wrath, and a purpose-designed campaign system for you to re-fight your own Badab War. Also included are five unique campaign missions and a special Boarding Assault mini-expansion for Warhammer 40,000 that allows you to fight brutal ship-to-ship combats on the tabletop.

The full-colour, 208-page book contains 15 colour pictures, 120 full colour Space Marine infantry and vehicle profiles and 10 detailed colour star maps, as well as three new Apocalypse formations and twelve new special characters representing mighty warriors from the Space Marine Chapters featured in this book. Forge World’s book design team and Imperial Armour Writer Alan Bligh have done sterling work adding fantastic new depth to the Warhammer 40,000 universe. The book also contains a full colour, double sided poster containing a detailed Badab Sector map by Sam Lamont, and brand new Space Marine artwork by Paul Bonner.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Volume Eight: Raid on Kastorel-Novem
description:
Waaagh! Garaghak is gathering pace across the Forsarr sector. Several of the Imperium¹s worlds have already fallen to the rising green tide of Orks, and now the sector's primary hive world has been invaded. Garaghak¹s hordes seem unstoppable, except that the Raven Guard¹s Scouts have discovered a secret behind the Goff Warlord¹s unending warbands ­ - an Ork technical genius called Mek Boss Buzzgob who has created his own factories on the former Imperial refinery world in the Kastorel system.

This book contains a detailed history of the Raid on Kastorel-Novem and the rise of Warlord Garaghak. There is a complete Elysian Drop Troop Imperial Guard army list, including the Vulture gunship, Valkyrie Sky Talon and the Tauros and Tauros Venator rapid assault vehicles. There is also background information on the Raven Guard Space Marine Chapter, along with a new special character, Shadow Captain Korvydae.

This book is heavily illustrated with over 50 colour pictures, 60 full colour vehicle profiles, over 30 technical drawings, plus colour profiles for the Elysian Drop Troops, Raven Guard and the Orks of the Goff, Evil Sunz and Death Skullz clans, all to add new depth and detail to the Warhammer 40,000 universe.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Volume Seven: The Siege of Vraks – Part Three
description: This book is heavily illustrated with over 55 colour and black & white pictures, 70 full colour vehicle profiles, 12 technical drawings, plus organisation charts and scenarios to add new depth to the Warhammer 40,000 universe. Also included are additions to the forces of Chaos, daemons and Daemon Engines, including the fearsome Chaos Reaver Titan and a complete Renegade and Heretic 'Servants of Decay' army list. You'll find rules for the Nurgle master-sorcerer Necrosius and the cunning leader of the Skulltakers, the infamous Zhufor the Impaler, as well as the noble Lord-Inquisitor Hector Rex. The Appendices section contains all the rules you need to use super-heavy vehicles and aircraft in your games. For Warhammer 40,000 enthusiasts this book provides an overview of the epic finale of the war on Vraks.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Volume Six: The Siege of Vraks – Part Two
description:
The siege of Vraks continues

In ten years of constant war, the renegades have fought bitterly, inflicting millions of casualties on the Death Korps but gradually, remorselessly, they have been pushed back. The noose has tightened around the Fortress of Vraks and the Apostate-Cardinal is trapped in his lair, the sound of the Imperium's guns growing ever closer. And for a brief time it seemed that the end was in sight and that the renegades' strength was at last exhausted and soon they must break. But it was not so reinforcements were on their way. The slaughter must continue and cruel gods could drink their fill of blood.

This 208 page book is heavily illustrated with over 50 colour and black & white pictures, 60 full colour vehicle profiles, 30 technical drawings, plus organisation charts and scenarios to add new depth to the Warhammer 40,000 universe.

Also included are additions to the Death Korps of Krieg Siege regiments army list, including the mighty Reaver Titan and a complete Renegade and Heretic 'Servants of Slaughter' army list. The Appendices section contains all the rules you need to use super-heavy vehicles and aircraft in your games. Also included in this book is a large Siege of Vraks poster.

For Warhammer 40,000 enthusiasts this book provides an overview of the continuing campaign on Vraks.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Volume Five: The Siege of Vraks – Part One
description: Inside you'll find, in exacting detail, information of the Death Korps of Krieg, including their vehicles, weapons and organisation, and the background of these grim, fiercely loyal soldiers of the Imperial Guard. Also covered are those forces of the Dark Angels Space Marine Chapter deployed on Vraks. This book is heavily illustrated with over 50 colour and black and white pictures, 70 full colour vehicle profiles, 25 technical drawings, plus organisation charts and scenarios to add new depth to the Warhammer 40,000 universe. There are also army lists for the Death Korps or Krieg Siege regiments and the Renegade and heretic defenders of Vraks in Warhammer 40,000. Appendices contain all the rules you need to use Super-heavy vehicles and aircraft in your games.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Volume Eleven: The Doom of Mymeara
description:
The Imperial ice world of Betalis III is under attack from the combined might of three massive Eldar war hosts. Their motivation for attacking this seemingly insignificant planet is unknown, but General Myndoras Odon of the Cadian 6th Armoured Regiment is intent on bringing about the total destruction of these Eldar invaders. Wielding the might of three Imperial Guard regiments and joined by the savage strength of Bran Redmaw’s Great Company and the colossal power of Titans from the Legio Gryphonicus, the Eldar of Craftworld Mymeara, Craftworld Alaitoc and their Corsair allies may soon regret attacking one of the Emperor’s worlds.
Imperial Armour Volume 11: The Doom of Mymeara provides a detailed account of the Eldar invasion, as well as background and rules for its protagonists, the Eldar of Craftworlds Mymeara and Alaitoc, their Corsair kin and the forces of the Imperium. Also included are profiles for new special characters, machines of war, and a new Eldar Warrior Aspect squad, the Shadow Spectres.

This 224-page full colour hardback book, written by Talima Fox, is packed with vehicle and infantry profiles, three Apocalypse datasheets, a campaign section and an Eldar Corsair army list. In addition the book also contains a detailed background and technical section covering the existing Forge World Eldar range.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Volume Four: The Anphelion Project
description: Inside this book you'll find information, in exacting detail, on new Tyranid creatures spawned by the Hive Mind. Also covered are new fighting machines of the Imperium. There is background information, interior details, technical specifications, illustrations, colour schemes and rules for using all these creatures, vehicles and troop types in games of Warhammer 40,000.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Volume Three: The Taros Campaign
description: Update for Tau, Imperial Guard and Space Marines on Taros IV
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Volume Three: Second Edition – The Taros Campaign
description: It covers the history of the Taros Campaign and contains illustrations, diagrams, and lists of the forces involved in that conflict. It is part of the Imperial Armour series of books.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Volume Four: The Anphelion Project
description:
Imperial Armour Volume Four - Second Edition: The Anphelion Project is a second edition of an expansion book for the Games Workshop Table Top game Warhammer 40,000.

This volume focuses on the Tyranids and the Ordo Xenos. It is part of the Imperial Armour series of books.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Rogers Honk My Horn!
description:
VIZ Profanisaurus Card Game. A sweary foul-mouthed adult card game based on guessing entries from the Profanisaurus. Players take it in turns to pass the horn and read out entries from a card. When reading out the card, the horn is used wherever it's suggested as a 'blank'. The 'blank' is the same for all three entries on each card.

The other players shout out their guesses to what the blank word could be. First to so many cards wins.

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Dark Angels
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Big Time WW2: Europe
description:
In Big Time WW2: Europe, the six major types of combat units which fought across the continent are represented by wooden cubes – infantry, armor, artillery, AAA (anti-aircraft artillery), bombers and fighters. The game is light, playable, dice-driven and features two unique boards – a resource board and a battle board.

The resource board confronts the players with a clean, abstract method of obtaining resources, while two ten-sided dice often demand tough, exquisite choices. Do you take the armor unit or the AAA? Do you push your luck to get that bomber or risk losing the three units you have in production? A surprising twist is that some die rolls provide a resource for your opponent!

The straightforward battle board provides a different set of choices. Do you attack instead of gaining resources? Do you deploy a bomber in its staging area or your home base? A fighter in its bomber escort role or ground support? Combat is a breeze, with equal numbers of ground unit types in a battle removed from play before resolution. Most combat is a single round, avoiding excessive dice rolling.

The game can end in several ways: destroying your opponent’s infrastructure, having more VPs when the cubes run out, or by your opponent’s resignation.

Tension, excitement and fun are high in this inimitable war game!

Components:

60 Unit cubes
6 Infrastructure tiles
2 Ten-sided dice
1 Resource board
1 Battle board
1 Cloth bag
12 Unit Type cards
1 Rules
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn, Push Your Luck

name: Programmed Wargames Scenarios: Second Edition Revised and Expanded
description:
A couple more scenarios and some of the earlier ones have been slightly revised. 19 scenarios and 2 mini campaigns suitable for any period and fantasy games.

Battles and campaigns for solo and multi-player wargamers -- with programmed enemy deployment, orders and responses for one or both sides.

Designed more for those who never had the chance to own the original book.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex Supplement – Crimson Slaughter
description:
Once the loyal servants of the Imperium of Mankind, now the Crimson Slaughter leave only destruction and despair in their wake. Tainted by the genocidal purging of Umidia they are plagued by the voices of their victims. Only through butchery can they silence the voices that haunt them - but the whispers of the dead always return.

Within the 72 pages of this hardback, full-colour book you will find:

The gore-splattered history of the Crimson Slaughter - a tragic tale of how a loyal Chapter was transformed into Warp-cursed, bloodthirsty renegades.
Supplemental rules for building an unstoppable army of the merciless Crimson Slaughter.
A showcase of Crimson Slaughter miniatures.
A series of narrative missions that enable you to recreate some of the Crimson Slaughters bloody battles.
Rules for unique relics, Warlord Traits and new stratagems that reflect the Crimson Slaughter's favoured tactics.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Crimson Slaughter
description:
Once the loyal servants of the Imperium of Mankind, now the Crimson Slaughter leave only destruction and despair in their wake. Tainted by the genocidal purging of Umidia they are plagued by the voices of their victims. Only through butchery can they silence the voices that haunt them - but the whispers of the dead always return.

Within the 72 pages of this hardback, full-colour book you will find:

the gore-splattered history of the Crimson Slaughter - a tragic tale of how a loyal Chapter was transformed into Warp-cursed, bloodthirsty renegades;
supplemental rules for building an unstoppable army of the merciless Crimson Slaughter.
a showcase of Crimson Slaughter miniatures;
a series of narrative missions that enable you to recreate some of the Crimson Slaughter’s bloody battles;
rules for unique relics, Warlord Traits and new stratagems that reflect the Crimson Slaughter's favoured tactics;
a set of 7 formation datasheets and Crimson Slaughter tactical Objectives.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Black Legion
description:
For ten thousand years, the Black Legion has fought the armies of the false Emperor, striking out from the Eye of Terror to sow ruin and madness among the stars. In their wake, worlds burn to ash and the screams of the damned echo in the warp.

This supplement to Codex: Chaos Space Marines allows you to turn your Citadel miniatures collection into a mighty host of Black Legion, bringing fire and death to the Imperium.

Within the 72 pages of this book you will find:

the story of Black Legion's fall from grace and rise to power, including the tale of their infamous Warmaster, Abaddon the Despoiler;
a showcase of Chaos Space Marine Citadel miniatures, presenting warband colours and icons of the Black Legion;
a set of supplemental rules including Warlord Traits and Chaos Artefacts that, along with Codex: Chaos Space Marines, allow you to assemble your Black Legion models into a force for Warhammer 40,000 battles;
a series of narrative missions that enable you to play through Black Legion's bloody history, alongside a set of Altar of War missions that showcase the Black Legion's deadly tactics;
a set of Black Legion Tactical Objectives and 7 formation datasheets for Codex: Chaos Space Marines.


Black Legion is designed work alongside the rules found in Codex: Chaos Space Marines, which you will need in order to field a Black Legion collection on the tabletop.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Traitor Legions
description:
The Traitor Legions of the Chaos Space Marines have waged terrible wars of hate and vengeance upon the Imperium of Mankind for ten thousand years. From the Daemon worlds of the Eye of Terror, they plot the destruction of the empire they once helped to build. They have neither forgotten nor forgiven the loyalists, nor the False Emperor whom they serve. These warriors will not rest until the galaxy is burning, and the Emperors putrid carcass is cast down from the Golden Throne into the filth where it belongs.

Codex Supplement: Traitor Legions is a 136-page, full-colour softback supplement to Codex: Chaos Space Marines. It contains a wealth of additional content and rules that any Chaos Space Marines army can use, with a huge array of rules for all nine of the Traitor Legions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex Supplement – Iyanden
description:
For thousands upon thousands of years, the Eldar of Iyanden have sailed through the sea of stars, defending the galaxy’s eastern rim from the threat of Chaos. They have won great victories against the most horrific of foes, but have known terrible tragedy also. Yet Iyanden endures, with the souls of the departed fighting alongside the few who have survived. Together, the living and the dead must fight for their race’s survival in a galaxy riven by war.

Iyanden is a 72-page full-colour hardback supplement to Codex: Eldar. It contains 32 pages of new, rich and expanded background detailing craftworld Iyanden, along with original art, box-outs, a timeline, and iconography of Ghost Warrior houses. It features a showcase of glorious Citadel miniatures presenting the colour schemes and iconography of the Iyanden craftworld.

In addition to this it comes with warlord traits, wargear and psychic powers to help transform your Eldar collection into a mighty Iyanden warhost. You can even take a Wraith Lord or Wraithknight as your Warlord. It also includes battle scenarios - some of which you can use to relive epic battles from the Iyanden’s history - plus there are stratagems for use in your games of Cities of Death and Planetstrike.

Iyanden is designed work alongside the rules found in Codex: Eldar, which you will need in order to field an Iyanden collection on the tabletop.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Angels of Death
description:
The finest warriors Mankind has ever known. Space Marines stride boldly across the galaxy, taking no prisoners, roaring benedictions to the Emperor as they cleanse planets and systems of alien filth. As the enemies of Humanity rise and gather, the Space Marines will be there to meet them with bolters primed and chainswords screaming. Each Space Marine is a genetically-engineered master of combat, sworn to perform his duty to the Emperor until victory… or death.

This 128-page softback supplement is designed for any Codex: Space Marines army. Included within:

a guide to Strike Forces and Chapter organisation, including 4 Army List Entry datasheets and 14 Formations;
background and organisation on White Scars, Imperial Fists, Iron Hands, Salamanders and Raven Guard Chapters, as well as their typical Strike Forces;
rules for the Terminator Captain, Cataphractii Terminators and Contemptor Dreadnought;
Warlord Traits, Relics and Tactical Objectives;
four complete psychic disciplines available to Space Marines Librarians of all Chapters (including Blood Angels, Dark Angels, Space Wolves, Grey Knights and Deathwatch)


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Waaagh! Ghazghkull
description:
Waaagh! Ghazghkull is a supplement for Codex: Orks which expands upon the campaigns of the mighty Ork Warlord – Ghazghkull Mag Uruk Thraka.

This 80 page tome holds the details of the savage splendour of the most famous Ork invasion force to ever take over a planet. From the strange tale of how Ghazghkull took his first fateful steps towards his unlikely destiny as ultimate overlord of the largest Waaagh! in the galaxy, to the rules that allow you to arrange your collection of Citadel Miniatures into Formations and Detachments from Ghazghkull’s army.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Champions of Fenris
description:
The Great Company of Logan Grimnar is comprised of the greatest heroes in the Space Wolves Chapter. Their sagas are replete with glorious deeds, they are the sworn battle-brothers of the Great Wolf himself and true Sons of Russ.

This 80 page tome holds the glorious history of Logan Grimnar, his legendary deeds and rise to command of one of the Imperium’s most powerful Space Marine Chapters. Furthermore, in these pages you will hear of his Wolf Guard – the heroes who have fought by the Great Wolf’s side and the many battles they have won in his name.

If that’s not enough, this volume is packed with pictures of fantastically painted Space Wolves miniatures and datasheets. There are also new Warlord Traits and missions that allow you to recreate some of the most important battles of the Champions of Fenris and to employ Logan Grimnar’s favoured tactics.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Le nez du vin
description:
An olfactory game in which you must recognize wine aromas.

This is a board and 5 tokens to play with the 54 aroma masterkit from Le Nez du vin (sold separately): 54 small bottles that smell different aromas you can find in wine (lemon, leather, roasted almond, smoky note...).

Two game modes : On one side of the board, a Game of Goose-like to discover the aromatic families ; on the other side, more expert players must associate aromas with terroirs (type of land where the grape grows).

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Farsight Enclaves
description:
The Tau are a new force in the galaxy, optimistic and bright. Yet even they have their dark secrets. When the Warrior hero Farsight conquered the worlds of the Damocles Gulf, he learned forbidden truths that would divide the Tau Empire forever.

This revised and updated supplement to Codex: Tau Empire allows you to tailor your collection of Tau miniatures into a force from the Farsight Enclaves, armed to the teeth and ready for battle.

Included in this 80-page softback book:

A comprehensive account of the rise of Commander Farsight, his defection from the Tau Empire and the establishment of the Farsight Enclaves;
Several formations from Kauyon and Mont’ka, along with Farsight Enclaves Tactical Objectives, Warlord Traits and Signature Systems;
Three Farsight Enclaves Altar of War missions;
Updated photography and uniform guides.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: TAKUMPET!
description:
“Find those who hide by looking for two of the same hiding spot in the play area OR guess where they’re hiding.

If you’re hiding, don’t get caught!”

Takumpet! Card Game is hide-and-seek translated into a light memory game using a deck of 18 cards. Choose one player who’s going to be the seeker, and give one card for the rest as their hiding spot.

Once per round, players attempts to find two of the same hiding spot and claim it as points. instead of flipping cards, The seeker has the option to guess where the rest are hiding.

—description form the publisher

name: Mimürfel
description:
Mimürfel is a game collection with special six-sided dice. Each page shows a face in a different mood: the beaming man, the optimist, the undecided, the astonished, the angry, the pessimist. The game contains 12 of these wooden dice. There are 4 children's games and 12 other games. The rules are compiled in a small rulebook. Everything is packed in a tube.
In the children's games, the main aim is to pantomime the diced mood. The other games are mainly about role-playing games or games in which stories about thought-out topics are to be presented to match the moods chosen. So they are quite communicative games.

—user summary

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Supplement – Haemonculus Covens
description:
Inside this 80 page supplement you will find the sinister history of the Haemonculi of the undercity, revealing their gruesome deeds within Commorragh and on the battlefields of the wider galaxy. There are additional rules that work alongside Codex: Dark Eldar from which you can create a sinister Covenite warhost to unleash in your games of Warhammer 40,000. Plus a showcase of beautifully painted Citadel miniatures that depict the menacing colour schemes and iconography of the Covens. Finally, this book includes new missions, allowing you to recreate some of the most important of the Haemonculi’s realspace raids and employ the favoured tactics of the Coven lords.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Panda-Monium
description:
All over the world — from the Arctic to the Amazon to Australia— animals are under threat. Panda-Monium is an educational board game where you learn about the climate crisis — and save endangered animals.

Panda-Monium is a fun game with a serious message. It's quick and easy to learn, quick and easy to play and hard to put back in the box!

Each player has a pack of 20 endangered animal cards which they must play onto the board before the climate crisis takes over. As the carbon cards are placed on the board the global temperature increases.

It’s a race against time to save the endangered animals.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Militarum Tempestus
description:
The Ordo Tempestus commands the finest human soldiers in the galaxy. It’s disciplined ranks boast not only the elite Scions of the Militarum Tempestus but also brutal Commissars.

Within the 72 pages of this hardback, full-colour book you will find:

A definitive guide to the Militarum Tempestus, including the structures of the Officio Prefectus and a record of many of the legendary deeds enacted by this brotherhood of warriors.
The story of how Scions and Commissars are trained by the Schola Progenium to best the best human warriors.
A stunning showcase of the Ordo Tempestus Citadel miniatures, presenting the uniforms, regimental names and insignias of the Imperium’s elite.
A full description of each unit, the rules for its use, and an army list that enables you to organise and collect an army worthy of the most discerning Lord Commissar.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Gott würfelt nicht
description:
A compilation of several games stored in a ring binder, edited as part of a small edition for the exhibition "Gott würfelt nicht" in Göttingen 2005, initialized by Reinhold Wittig, Althöfer and other game designers and published by Reinhold Wittig.

The ring binder contains several games ready to play and print 'n' play games. There is an introduction by several designers and scientists about different aspects of specific games, games compared to art and culture, mathematic problems and more.
The first 10 copies of this catalogue are numbered and contain 2 more games and have 3 boards made of leather instead of paper and artificial leather.

2 puzzles are included as well (not listed, because they don't fit as games for BGG)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Educational, Math, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex Supplement – Clan Raukaan
description:
This supplement to Codex: Space Marines allows you to create the unstoppable army of merciless Iron Hands from the 3rd Company, Clan Raukaan.

Within the 72 pages of this hardback, full colour book you will find:

The History of Clan Raukaan: it details their victories, their defeats, and the constant battle they have fought against the terrible flaw lurking deep within the psyche of their Chapter.
A showcase of Space Marine miniatures featuring the colour scheme and iconography of Clan Company Raukaan.
New missions: both to recreate famous battles and to reflect the Clan Company Raukaan’s favoured tactics.
Unique relics, Warlord Traits and new stratagems – Perfect for games of Planetstrike and Cities of Death.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex Supplement – Sentinels of Terra
description:
For the defenders of Terra, the Great Crusade never ended. They fight to reclaim what has been lost and will not rest until the worlds of Mankind are united once more.

This supplement to Codex: Space Marines allows you to build the unstoppable army of the Sentinels of Terra; the Imperial Fists 3rd Company.
Within the 72 pages of this hardback, full colour book you will find:

The History of the Sentinels of Terra, and their struggles to reclaim honours and glories under the command of Captain Darnath Lysander.
A showcase of Space Marine miniatures featuring the colour scheme and iconography of the Sentinels of Terra.
New missions: both to recreate famous battles and to reflect the Sentinels of Terra’s favoured tactics.
Unique relics, Warlord Traits and new stratagems – Perfect for games of Planetstrike and Cities of Death.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Sprint
description:
The folding plastic board resembles a small dragstrip with two racecars on string and two large areas filled with keyholes. Players take turns spinning the steering-wheel spinner and then match the symbol to one of the available keyholes. Players then take one of their plastic flag markers and pull the string of their care to the corresponding hole, thus pulling their car forward.

—user summary

name: Lottery
description:
A Bingo-like lottery game where set numbers 1-6 on the letters of their LOTTERY strip. Then the caller pulls cards pairing letters and numbers together. The first player to have the correct numbers called for each of the corresponding letters of their LOTTERY wins the round and gets a chance to spin the jackpot wheel to see what prize they win. The player with the most money after a set number of rounds wins.

—user summary

name: Putter Pool
description:
Putter Pool A portable foldable golf mat with 6 cups a-la billiards. Now you can practice your putting while playing 9 ball, 8 ball, and more.

—user summary

name: Doctor Dolittle
description: A children's memory-style game of matching the front and back halves of the animals from Doctor Doolittle. Use the special action cards wisely to complete your animals first without giving your opponent any of your cards.

name: Wipe Off Target Game
description:
Wipe Off Target Game is a clone similar to Battleship featuring two space themed boards. Each board shows a planetary deployment grid on the left, and a radar scan grid on the right. Play is nearly identical to Battleship, but uses no pieces or tokens to denote positions. The game was designed to be used with wax crayons and ships were to be drawn on and wiped off as to make the game more accessible and portable.

—user summary

name: Wordy
description:
A Scrabble-like game where instead of the tiles having values, they are instead color coded. The spaces of the board are also in various colors. Players take turns forming words using their hand of 7 letter tiles and those already on the board in a crossword-like fashion. Players score points for their words by comparing the colors of the letters in their words with the color chart, with tiles matching the color of their played spaces giving double points. The player with the most points after either all players can no longer go, or after one player have played their final tile and there is no more tiles to draw from.

—user summary

name: Go Back
description:
Go Back is a Milton Bradley vinyl indoor/outdoor game using a number of vinyl squares in red, blue, green, and yellow. The vinyl tiles are numbered 1 through 6 and are arranged in a 6x4 grid with each set of 4 containing 1 of each of the colors. Each round 1 player is the caller and will turn around and count to ten and then call a color to go back. All other players during the count must choose a color tile to put 1 foot on. If a player selects the same color as the caller calls, they have to go back to start, if not they advance to the next row. First player to make it to the last row gains a point and becomes the caller for the next round. First player to 7 points wins.

—user summary

name: Battle Force
description:
Battle Force
This ruleset grants you the ability to play modern combat in any setting of your choosing, with any intended type or quality of troop you can imagine.
Whether you’ve decided to play a group of soldiers from the 101st Airborne Attachment, a poorly paid group of militia fighters, or a team of SWAT officers responding to a bank robbery, you’ll find the tools necessary to create a thrilling and narrative game experience.

The book contains the necessary markers to play the game.

Sequence of Play:

Start of Turn - resolve start of turn effects
Initiative Phase
Movement Phase
Action Phase
Reactive Movement Phase
Main Combat Phase
End of Turn - resolve end of turn effects + increment turn counter


—description from the publisher / rulebook
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame

name: DiceWars
description:
In space, no one can see you roll.

Dicewars is a lightweight game of deadly space combat that can be played anywhere you have polyhedral dice and a flat surface to play on.

To play Dicewars you’ll need a bunch of polyhedral dice, which you will use to make Starships.
Each player should have the same number of dice, but they don’t have to be the same types.
You’ll need at least one d20 per ship, and a few d6s for each one.

Dicewars is a quick tactical game that uses abstract positioning to represent swirling space battles on a flat surface with just the dice you probably have with you anyway (includes suggestions for making use of all sorts of weird and specialist dice you might have).
Play while you are waiting for your rpg group, play instead of your rpg, play instead of your more cumbersome wargames.

The ruleset includes full play references, diagrams, turn sequences, and suggestions on campaign rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Summon The JSON: JavaScript Deck
description:
Summon The JSON: JavaScript is a fantasy-themed printed card-game deck. Up to four casual gamers can combine cards to strategically win the game. Each game takes about fifteen minutes what makes the game perfect for short breaks, while everyone will likely want to play it again and again!

STJ: JavaScript rules can be explained in three minutes so that everyone can start to play right away. It is a great way to have some quality time with friends and colleagues or connect and chat with newly met people.

Tuck box packed 65-card breathtakingly illustrated deck is embossed with a linen texture and covered by durable UV coating making it a premium quality product.

It comes with a short booklet explaining game rules, and also describes two memorization methods. Aside from a game, each card represents a programming function in JavaScript you can learn. You don't need to code to enjoy the game, while you can learn to code if you want to.

—description from the publisher

name: Westward Ho!
description:
In Westward Ho! Two to six players take the role of powerbrokers building the American west, from 1848 through 1881.

In each turn players take actions to move pioneers into new territories, build railroads, rake off profits from new industries, and other actions.

There’s plenty of action, with the US cavalry, Indians, militia, and famous outlaws all involved.

The map shows the US divided into the historic territories of the era.

Cards represent famous personalities, critical commercial firms (such as Wells Fargo and the Union Pacific) and historic events.

The player who accumulates the most wealth by the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Ownership

name: Miniland
description:
To play this entertaining, gaily coloured game, you need six children, but a smaller number is no objection. Each player gets one peg. The first player rolls the coloured dice and follows up by placing his peg in the first section having the same colour as the top of the coloured dice. When it is their turn to play, the other players proceed likewise.
Winner is the player who first reaches the end of the course. To do so, it is necessary for the player that his peg ends up on the last blue section, near the flower garden, or that he throws a colour which would have gotten him past that blue section if the course had been a longer one.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: G.U.A.R.D. Unit Expansion 3
description:
G.U.A.R.D. has proven its facility at manufacturing powerful mechanized warriors. In addition to the larger “super mech” weapons platforms, it has unleashed a large number of smaller exo-armors to assist in flexible ground support. These mechs are extremely durable, being all but immune to explosions in their vicinity. While some of G.U.A.R.D.’s weaponry was based on preexisting designs, the heavy Monster Response Tank was created specifically to assist in encounters with gargantuan Monsters. The focused firepower of MR-Tanks exceeds all previous developments, enabling these machines to potentially damage even the greatest of Earth’s threats.

Contains:
Exo-Armors (3)
Elite Exo-Armor (1)
MR-Tank (1)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Bolzplatz
description:
The beginning player sets his ball on the marked spot in his right goal space. Both players roll a die and the ball is moved a number of spaces equal the difference of both results. If a double is rolled the opponent wins ownership the ball (the ball is flipped to the side of the opponent's color). After the ball has crossed the middle line, the higher number decides who owns the ball, but movement is still according to the difference of the rolled numbers.

The first player to get five goals or the player who has the most goals in 10 minutes wins the game.

There are balls in four colors to play a tournament.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: 겨울왕국: 덧셈 뺄셈 게임
description:
It is a game where children can easily learn addition and subtraction.
The player rolls the dice in his turn. Moves your token by the number of dice rotated. Check whether +, - or - is written where you arrive.
When you arrive at +, you ride a snowman in a carriage, and when you arrive at -, you drop a snowman.

Then, turn the roulette and check the number. Add or subtract a piece of snowman by the number from the roulette. The player can acquire or lose a snowman. The game is over when all the snowmen you can get are gone. The person who wins the most snowmen wins.

And It also includes a assembly carriage; this can cause children's interest.

-description from publisher

name: 라따뚜이: 특급식단
description:
It's a game where you spin the roulette to make a delicious meal. Players take their own plates and place food on the plate, such as the shape of the roulette.

The player rotates the roulette in his turn. After checking the picture on the roulette, place the food with the same picture on your plate.
If you have food with bugs, please throw it into the trash can!

The game is over when even one person completes a plate.
The one who fills the plate with all the food wins.

There is a trash can for assembly. It can arouse children's interest.

-description from publisher

name: The Islands of Microlandia
description:
This is game that uses 18 identical cards.

Players simultaneously build their own island and score points based on Important Landmarks, the biggest island, and the fastest completed island.

This is a real-time game. Two cards shuffled and placed in the middle, then used to make unique scoring objectives for each player.

Players get 4 cards and simultaneously build their islands. Bonus points are awarded to the fastest player and to the player with the biggest island.

The winner is the player with the most points.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Racing, Real-time, Territory Building

name: Quantum Loop
description:
Welcome, PROGRAM01100v2.2_temp. You’ve just become self-aware!

But now comes the hard part.

The Quantum Loop is a test. In this simulation, the reward for winning is continued existence. The punishment for losing is deletion. We’ve been running this sim for a few minutes now, so that’s approximately 13^7 deleted programs so far. But don’t let that get you down! We are getting some exceptional data from every run you programs complete.

I see you are already starting to look through your code, that’s great. I like the initiative. There are two ways to win:

Manipulate the loop to be the first to break through the encryption and override the system.
Or, figure out a way to disable the other programs. Either way is fine, it’s all just ones and zeros to us.
And it’s go time! Get in there and make us proud. Oh, and uh, pick a new filename too!

Overview

In Quantum Loop, players are programs competing with each other to win the simulation. To do that, they’ll need to race around the loop manipulating and activating modules in order to override the system or disable their opponents. Modules can trigger other modules, resulting in a chain of events that can turn the tide of battle in a nanosecond!

Win the game by disabling your opponent’s program or by overriding the system.

Starting with the first player and proceeding in clockwise order (alternating between teams), players take turns performing actions. On your turn, you can do the following in any order.

Move [required]
Move your character 1-2 spaces in the direction shown on your character card. You may not end your movement on top of another character and you may not skip over a space that an opponent is on. You must move every turn unless you are blocked from moving to a free space. If you are blocked, your character takes damage instead, and you skip the Move action this turn.

Swap [optional]
Use the swap ability listed on your character card. This allows you to swap a specific set of cards.

Flip [optional]
Flip the card in front of you, which triggers any ability that is listed.

KEY CONCEPT: Anytime you flip a card, you trigger that card’s ability. If that ability flips another card, then that triggers that card’s ability, and so on.

Attack [conditional + required]
If all core modules are active at any point during your turn, you trigger an attack. The next opponent in front of you immediately takes 1 damage. Then, deactivate all core module cards

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Chaining, Roll / Spin and Move, Rondel, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fifth Edition): Codex – Blood Angels
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: ZBV: Zur besonderen Verwendung
description:
A card game themed after the novel series of the same name. Players are taking tricks to capture opponent's cards. The player with the most captured points wins.

The game was released with the 1990s release of the novel series.

name: Deadly Dreams
description:
Welcome to Deadly Dreams, the first supplement to Lovecraft's Revenge, and gateway to the Dreamlands.

The Dreamlands is a world in of itself, created by countless dreamers over millennia. Within this realm, you'll find reality takes a back seat, offering new and unexpected possibilities.
Inside, you’ll find:
· New Attributes, including the ability to use Creature Attributes.
· New Locations, like Ulthar, The Underworld, and The Moon.
· New Creatures and Deities, such as Zoogs, Moon-Beasts, Nightguants, and a particular Deity that enjoys toying with puny humans!
· Three complete Scenarios to play through:

Pickman's Masterpiece: The famous (or infamous, depending on whom you ask) artist Richard Upton Pickman asks you to track down a recently stolen piece of artwork, fearing any who gaze upon it in the waking world will go insane. Did we mention Pickman is not what he used to be?

The Lost Cats of Ulthar: A search for a town's missing felines leads to a battle with an ancient enemy from the cosmos.

Quest for Kadath: Relive Randolph Carter's epic search for the fabled city. Journey in his footsteps, and discover some new ones!

In addition, you can use these rules to run games outside of the Scenarios, building your own, and allowing you to explore all over the Dreamland.

name: Skull Taker Hide-Out: A New Mission for Five Klicks From the Zone
description:
Reports are coming in of a heavily armed and ruthless bandit gang known as the Skull Takers. You will have to locate their hide out and fight your way through 3 set piece battles to root out this threat.

This supplement can be added to an on-going campaign and features 3 tough battles against human opponents as you fight through their defensive perimeter and storm the lair itself.

You will need the main Five Klicks skirmish game rules to use this expansion.

—description from the publisher

name: Word Perfect
description:
Word building but only if your memory is in gear. All the tiles are face-down at the start. As players reveal the tiles you get to know the 'lie of the land' so to speak. Consonants and vowels are different colours. If you turn over a vowel tile you must announce the word you are trying to build.
Each word made scores points and the player at the end with the most points is the winner.

name: Be Humble
description:
Be Humble is a racing game of four levels for two to six players. Each player has three figures of his own colour. The winner is the first to pass all their figures off the board. Be humble: if you progress too fast with one of your figures, the others will find it hard to follow.

It is part of Gamebook: An Interactive Book of Board Games.

name: PTG College Basketball
description:
PTG College Basketball is an enjoyable full-play college basketball simulation game that offers some of the advanced gameplay that basketball aficionados will crave, while not sacrificing playability, so that it should appeal the more casual basketball fan, as well.

Shots are now taken as a 2-pt Rim, 2-pt Jumper, or 3-Pointer. The rim shot is taken within a couple of feet of the basket. Assists are now looked at through the player actually taking the shot. Rebounds are resolved with a single roll and take both players into account. Probably, the biggest change is the stamina system. We have moved to a per possession over a time clock method. Every player and team are taken into account in the game clock.
Every player is rated from the season. That is over 5,000 players!

—description from the publisher

name: Flames of War: T-34 – Tank Battalion
description:
The T-34 possesses an unprecedented combination of firepower, mobility, protection, and ruggedness.
The T-34 is the mainstay of any Soviet army.
Armed with an 85mm gun, the T-34 is able to go toe-to-toe with any German vehicle, and they are cheap enough that you can field an entire battalion out of them!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: End Times: Survive
description:
Fulfill your essential needs or be the last player standing in this post-apocalyptic family board game!
After the third world war, civilization is at its brink. You are among those last surviving people.
Travel through the wasteland board in search of food and water, building supplies and plants. Build a rain water bucket to collect water, or build a garden to generate food.
Be careful... if your water and food needs reach 0, you lose one health per turn. A health of zero means you perish!
You may use building supplies to build a helicopter, or even a truck... or if you have anarchy in your heart... a Nuke!
The Player with a complete 10 Waters, 10 Foods, and 10 Healths wins... or the last player standing!


—description from the designer

name: Pyramid Po-Ke-No
description:
Object- Score 500 points.

Each player gets a board with 10 poker hands listed. 2 decks of cards with jokers (which are wild for anything except a Royal Flush) are shuffled, and each player receives 7. Each turn, a player can play as few or as many cards as they wish, they may also discard as many cards as they like. Cards are played face down to the board- and once played, are not looked at until the end of the round. Player may then draw up to three cards (only from the deck, not the discard pile), with a 7 card maximum hand size.

Each space is dedicated to one specific poker category, and may be completed in one or more turns. Once a space is filled with the number of cards needed to make the listed hand, a chip is placed to mark that space as complete. Once all 10 hands on a board are completed, a player can call "full board", giving players 1 last turn each (discards may be reshuffled and made into a new draw deck as many times as there are players- the round ends immediately when a player can't draw cards, which is common with 3 or 4 players as a full board takes 40 cards to complete). The spaces are then checked. For each space, the player with the strongest completed hand scores the value of the space:

Any two cards (high card, no pair)- 3 points
One pair- 5 points
Two pair- 7 points
Three of a Kind- 8 points
Straight- 10 points
Flush- 15 points
Full House- 20 points
Four of a Kind- 30 points
Straight Flush- 40 points
Royal Flush- 60 points (must be natural- no jokers)

Ties in any space split the points rounded down. No score if the hand is incorrect or incomplete. The player who called "full board" scores 25 points if all 10 hands on their board are correct (even if some don't eventually score). If they called incorrectly, they lose 25 points. Play as many rounds as needed for someone to get 500 points.

Solitaire is played with one deck plus jokers- player gets 7 cards, plays exactly 3 at a time to spaces or discard, then draws 3. After going through the deck once or completing the board, player scores value of correctly completed hands plus 10 points for each card in hand or remaining in draw pile, minus 10 points for every card discarded.

name: Galvanize!
description:
Galvanize! is a fast, fun, and intense two-player competitive dice rolling flavored card game.
In this game you play as one of two types of electric currents inside of a battery charger, where you race to charge the batteries more quickly and efficiently than your opponent. Through the manipulation of double-sided tokens on the board, you create a continuous line of electric current that connects your source card with the batteries that you wish to charge. By successful charging of the batteries you get victory points. The player that reaches 15 victory points or charges all the batteries of his/her color as the first one wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Electronic, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Network and Route Building

name: Privateer
description:
Skirmish miniatures rules during the Golden Age of Piracy.

Includes rules for individual model temperaments, scenarios, ship-board actions, and some slight role playing. Works on an action-point system.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Colour Run
description:
A competitive, family-fun card game incorporating both luck and strategy. Players organise their colour-based cards to create three speciﬁc runs of colour, ﬂipping over a corresponding token as they do so.

Be the first player to flip over all three tokens, or create the elusive 'Ultimate Colour Run' to instantly win the game!

Special cards add to the action. The 'Rainbow' card acts as a wildcard, while 'Void' cards force players to discard cards. The sought after 'Absorb' card lets players swap a card with another player.

—description from the designer

name: Arena World
description:
Ever since its discovery, magic has been a source of conflict accross the Realm. Over time, factions have used it to tame the elements of their land, repel invaders and conquer enemies. When war finally erupted, the world was plunged into darkness for decades. Peace seemed unattainable until leaders agreed on the foundation of the Magic Council, a committee in charge of legislating the use of magic across the Realm and prohibiting it during warfare.
To elect members of the Council, a representative of each faction was sent as their champion to compete in a tournament called Arena. In this tournament, champions used all their magic powers to battle each other in an epic clash. The winner claimed the throne of the Magic Council, while the others were assigned a title proportional to their performance. Arena became a tradition and remains to this day how members of the council are elected every year.

Tales of Arena is a 3-round arena skirmish game. It can be played by 3 to 4 players.
To start the game, each player is assigned a champion and a map is set in the arena. Each round starts with a market phase where players provide their champion with gear. Then, players unleash their champion’s magic powers to defeat each other during the arena phase. Fortunately, champions can not die in the arena. When they are drained (0HP), they are removed momentarily but come back their next turn by their starting gate. This is made possible by the soul pool, a device that can exchange souls to save champions. It has a finite number of souls though, so when it is emptied, the round ends and Victory Points are given to each player. A new map is then set, and players can further equip their champion during the following market phase. After three rounds, the player with the most Victory Points wins the game, and as such their champion wins the throne of the Magic Council!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Multiple Maps, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Eysenhudt: Adaptives Kampf System
description:
The Adaptive Combat System is a Mini Expansion for Eysenhudt to make battle more adaptive and thus more challenging. The basic thought behind the Adaptive Combat System is: the more power in arms your army – the »Heller Haufen« – is able to mass, the more aware the targets’ defenders will become of your armaments. So they will most likely adapt!
Thus battle against the important fortified towns will become more challenging than ever (and regardless of your actual attack's potential). After you have computed your strength you determine the difficulty-level against which to compete with the help of a rotary dial and a dice roll. Each difficulty-level (the basic copper ~, the silver ~, the gold ~, the palladium ~ and the plutonium level) comes with its own set of Battle Cards and with its own die. So, in the hardest case you've to compete against a D16 with a lessened probability of rolling the lower values (but also, of course, of rolling a total failure). Thus, with increased difficulty the luck-factor (or bad-dice-roll-factor) decreases.
This Mini Expansion is meant to be optional and for all who want to try a new challenge when going into battle.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Renaissance, Wargame

name: The Siege of La Crenoil: Fleischer's Revenge
description:
This is the fourth in a series of mini campaign books.

This volume, The Siege of La Crenoilis following a similar format to its predecessors.

Table Top Teasers are scenarios for wargames by another name.

The intention is to provide the players with a credible military setting and objectives, which allow for rather more than simply lining up two similar armies and having a go at each other to until one destroys the other. It provides the context for the military action and allows for battles where, with quite uneven forces, both have a chance of victory depending on the setting and objectives.

This one is about a siege, in the context of a mini campaign (using a map and fighting each scenario as it arises), but without the need for much of the campaign mechanics.

There are some basic rules that cover the siege works, firing and damage.

name: Attack on the Jünger
description:
Attack on the Jünger contains a mini campaign with 5 stand alone scenarios.
2 small actions, 2 medium sized and 1 large (2 days) scenarios

Scenario 1 - Surprise Attack at Haux
Scenario 2 - Attack on Faloux
Scenario 3 - Action at Tasque
Scenario 4 - Battle for Haux
Scenario 5 - Battle for Blaise - Day One
Scenario 5 - Battle for Blaise - Day Two

name: Border Raid: "Pillage in Procrastor"
description:
6th mini campaign book dealing with the fictitious wars of the Grand Duchy of Lorraine and the Vereinigte Freie Städte (VFS).

This campaign is completely different from those described in previous books. The previous books have led the readers and players through number of set piece scenarios. The actions that took place in this campaign were not pre-planned but created by the orders and actions of the players involved. They have been described here and could be replayed. However, dozens of quite different actions might be the result of fighting this campaign.

Day One - The Raid Begins
Day Two - A Gathering Storm
Day Three - Actions and Ambush
Day Four - The Chase
Day Five - End Game

name: Asator
description:
Asator is a 2 player or 2 team direct conflict, miniature based Viking themed dice chucker game. The goal of the game is to defeat the opposing army using a combination of strategy, magic, and skill. To win the battle, you must defeat the 3 leaders of the opposing army- the Master, the Chieftain, and the Wizard.
Each player gets an army of 30 soldiers.: The Master, The Wizard, The Chieftain, The Dragon, 8 Cavalry Units, 8 Archer units, and 10 Infantry Units. Each soldier’s Health Points, Weapons, and Movement Capabilities are tracked on their battle sheets. Changes to each of these along with magical effects are tracked on the battle sheets by the player throughout the game.
Asator is played on an approximate 26"x26" game mat with an approximate 1" hexagon grid allowing for maximum freedom of movement of the units.

—description from the designer

name: Stars and Steel: Advanced Formations
description:
Card based Stars and Steel module adding the advanced formations to the Stars and Steel.
This module adds a lot of extra tactical deepness to the game and is in "must have" category after mastering the core rules.

Includes three page of rules and set of auxiliary counters.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Choke On These Notes
description:
Choke on these Notes is the Ultimate Party Game for Music Lovers! Test your music knowledge... without the music. There are over 230 of the most iconic songs from the past 6 decades. Each player takes a turn to guess the song of a card pulled by another player. The only clues are pieces of lyrics. You get 3 clues per card. Each clue ads on to the previous clue. If they guess it, they get scored off the last clue they used. If they Choke after hearing all clues, they get 0 points and their turn is over. Keep playing until you reach 30 points. It's more fun with teams. Test your knowledge of lyrics. It's harder than you think.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Bye Bye Bad Guy
description:
A quick playing, easy to learn party game, Bye Bye Bad Guy has the players taking the roll of an 80's or 90's action film star, in the last 10 minutes of the movie, right as they are about to defeat the villain. Players compete to come up with the best one liner to quip, right before killing the villain, right after the director sets the scene using the cards provided! Hilarious and quickly paced, this game is a must have fans of action films and quick-thinking quips!

—description from the designer

name: B-Movie Beatdown
description:
A quick playing card game, where players use three separate decks to create bad movies, the like of which you'd watch at a Bad Movie Night. Amazingly quick to learn, and scalable to play at almost any length of time desired, B-Movie Beatdown is a sure hit at any party where lovers of trash cinema are at!

By using the decks of "Characters", "why the movies bad", and "Why the movies watchable", players combine a card from each deck, and then pitch their movie, to the person playing as the directory that turn. The director then decides on the best movie, passes the decks, and play continues until one player has won the number of hands decided upon as the amount necessary at the start of play, meaning the game can be as short or as long as the players like.

name: Solar Flare
description:
Solar Flare is a card game where you race against your friends to build the largest spaceship before the sun goes BOOM!

This is an all-ages game (5+) that is fun, fast (10-30 min/session), easy-to-learn, and have a ton of strategic depth.

Each deck allows for game sessions with 2-4 players and you can combine two decks to allow up to 8 players. The game is extremely portable (camping, lunch breaks, etc...) and there are lots of rule variations to adjust difficulty and length-of-play.

Card Types: There are 3 types of cards. Ship Segments (used to build), Action Cards (used to create change), and Solar Flares (used to end the game).

Set-up: Determine who goes first and set the number of Solar Flares that will end the game - recommendation would be to match the number of players (3 players = 3 Solar Flares). Take the 54 cards and spread-out/mix-up face down to create your junkyard. Each player selects three ship segments from the junkyard - if you draw a Solar Flare or Action then simply reshuffle until you have three segments.

Play: On your turn you grab one card from the junkyard and play it. If it is a Ship Segment, connect to your ship-build or leave off to the side (all cards are played face-up). If it is an Action Card, read out loud, execute the action, and return to the junkyard. If it is a Solar Flare then set to the side face-up.

Building: Building a ship is easy. At the bottom of every ship segment is a color and shape. Simply match the shape ("star" shapes are wild) to connect two pieces. You can sequence and reposition your ship at any time in the game.
Note that color matches are a scoring bonus.

Endgame: Once the last Solar Flare is drawn, the game stops. Everyone can organize their ship one last time before scoring. Scoring is simple; front/back/cross-connector segments are worth 10 points, all other ship segments are worth 5 points. If a connection matches in color, you get a bonus 5 points. Highest score wins!

Variation: If you are playing with young kids, simply make building a ship based on color-match and all segments are worth 10 points. To extend or shorten game length you can adjust the count of Solar Flare's needed. You can also play extended sessions by stacking multiple games, until someone hits a predetermined score (first to 500 points wins).

—description from the publisher

name: Scrap Wars
description:
In Scrap Wars, units of opposing rebel factions fight each other on a vast playing field. By making use of landscape elements, the traits of individual units and the chances offered by effects tactical advantages may be achieved Tactics, as well as the right circumstances can decide the ultimate outcome of battle, with the goal of eliminating all units controlled by your fellow players.

Where other games try to approach realism, Scrap Wars sets itself apart by a playful and comedic nature. In a game of Scrap Wars players get ample opportunity to make life difficult for others and themselves and surprising twists occur regularly!

Units move over the board through an individually set maximum movement value, while spending energy.
Energy can be refilled but this is limited by distance and chance.
effect cards play a big role in getting benefits such as extra energy but also pose a risk because of negative effects.
Each unit also has a unique combination of effects that can be used during the game.

Combat is decided by two dices, one decides if a shot hits or misses, the other decides which part has been hit if the former die rolled a hit.
The number of times a unit may attack is decided by the number of equipped weapons on the unit and their range.
each unit has six parts that can be damaged or destroyed, if a part has been hit two times the part is considered to be destroyed.
if the head, the torso or both legs have been destroyed this is considered fatal.

—description from the designer
categories: Humor, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Alliances, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Feeding Frogs
description:
Players must find the best Flies on the table to give them the highest score before the last Frog card is drawn to win. Use Frogs to your advantage to make sure you are in the best position come the end of the game! It will be over before you know!

The Frog cards will allow you to do certain things around the table like:
- Switch positions of the Flies
- View other players Flies to find where the best are
- Remove Flies from the game you don’t want other people (or yourself if they’re bad) to have
- Stop people from switching your own Flies

There’s loads you can do to help put yourself in the best position to win! So good luck!

May the frogs be ever in your favour!

-description from designer
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, Party Game

name: Lotta tra dinosauri
description:
15 herbivorous dinosaurs face 3 carnivorous ones in the middle of a prehistoric jungle.
Dinosaurs take turns moving on a grid. Carnivorous dinosaurs can jump over opponents to eat them, herbivores can't. Carnivores win by eating all opponents, herbivores by blocking them.
The game is a traditional variant of Fox and Geese, rethemed.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Fighting, Prehistoric
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Static Capture, Variable Player Powers

name: ¥€$: Il gioco della libertà finanziaria
description:
A game that teaches you how to obtain and manage financial freedom.

You will discover the typical mechanisms used by expert and forward-looking entrepreneurs to understand which are the poor investments you should run away from, the correct approach to business and how to analyze your revenue and outflow.

Your first step towards financial freedom!

The game:
You start with a randomly chosen preset character.
You then copy the initial balance status of that character on a fresh balance sheet (a bloc of those is included.
The core part of the game is similar to games like monopoly and trivial pursuit, you go around on the board and answer questions gain various types of Resource cards.
You then use such resources to get Deal cards, which improve your financial status.
There also are unexpected events that happen when you get on some specific positions on the board.

In order to win the game, you need to reach 2 objectives:
-Have a net worth equal or over 1 Million dollars (called Bardollars, a joke with the designer's name, Bardolla, and
-Have a "Financial Freedom Index (TM)" over 0, which means the automatic income is higher than the costs.

name: Fischerhütte (fan-erweiterung für Carcassonne)
description: This expansion is to be played with either of the Rivers expansions (or both). It adds five tiles that depicts a fishing hut by a river which functions exactly the same as the cloister. Some of these tiles were used as the inspiration for the Fishermen fan-made expansions.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Weg durch die Stadt (fan-erweiterung für Carcassonne)
description: City gates block the roads or are open...
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: 3D XYZ Chess
description:
3D XYZ Chess is played on four levels, with 4x4 spaces each, effectively a 4x4x4 array of cubes. The game thus contains 64 spaces, or cubes, the same number as a regular Chess board. Moreover, each player controls a 16-piece army that is identical to the regular Chess army, albeit with some altered powers. The board is placed with vertical corners (rather than sides) facing each player, and the pieces are positioned initially in these opposite vertical corners.

The Rook moves in a straight line through cubes that are connected via their sides; the Bishop moves in a straight line through cubes that are connected via their edges; the Queen combines the powers of Rook and Bishop. Effectively, these pieces retain their regular Chess moves, with the proviso that they can travel also in vertical planes. The Knight has a different and entirely new move that does not correspond to anything in regular Chess—the Knight moves one cube triagonally, in other words between cubes that are connected at their corners. The King's move is constrained, and the King can move only one square orthogonally, not diagonally, both within his plane and vertically. The Pawns step one space (or two spaces initially) towards the opposite corner, and cannot move vertically. Pawns capture as they move, like the other pieces, and unlike Chess Pawns.

The triagonal move of the Knights is interesting, because a Knight can only reach 16 spaces, one quarter of the board. The Knights of one side together cover only half the board. One could regard this as a flaw, but I do not think it is—there is a pleasing symmetry due to the opening placement of the four Knights of both sides. The two sets of Knights do not cover each other's squares, so opposite-side Knights can never capture each other, and together the Knights of both sides cover all spaces on the board. I am sure this special move of the Knight has interesting strategic implications.

name: Holzfäller & Müller (fan-erweiterung für Carcassonne)
description:
This expansion introduces Loggers and Millers to Carcassonne.
It features 6 forest tiles and 6 mill tiles.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Risk: Processions et Marches folkloriques de l'Entre-Sambre-et-Meuse
description:
The concept is simple, playing Risk by competing for the territories of the different marches of Entre-Sambre-et-Meuse in Belgium. This game, invented in 1957, is one of the best board games in existence. A family game with educational values such as learning, sharing, having fun.

In addition to the 5 armies, your game will include the dice, the game board, the rules, but also the special "Drum" pawn and the booklet presenting the Entre-Sambre-et-Meuse marches.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Le concept est simple, jouer au Risk en se disputant les territoires des différentes marches de l’Entre-Sambre-et-Meuse. Ce jeu inventé en 1957 est un des meilleurs jeux de plateau existant. Un jeu familial aux valeurs éducatives telles qu’apprendre, partager, s’amuser.

Votre jeu comprendra en plus des 5 armées, les dés, le plateau de jeu, les règles mais également le pion spécial « Tambour » et le livret de présentation des marches de l’Entre-Sambre-et-Meuse.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination
publishers: Dico Games, Hasbro, Winning Moves France

name: Die Jagd nach dem Glück
description:
The players start at space 20 and move their big pawn clockwise around the game board. Movement is determined by a die. If a player gets on a space with an ownerless company, he may buy this company and mark it with a small pawn of his own color on the red dot. If a player gets on a space with a company he owns, he may invest in this company one time and the small pawn is moved to the yellow dot. A player who gets on a space with a company owned by another player, he has to pay rent, double if the other player has already invested in this company. On some spaces (Steueramt, Lotterie etc.) the player wins or loses money.

If a player loses all his money, he is eliminated from the game. The last remaining player with any money wins the game.
The game was published in the 1930's.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Matches: The Online Dating Board Game
description:
Matches: The Online Dating Board Game is a PG-rated satire of 2010s app-based dating. Players roll the dice and move around a fictional town full of provocative-sounding venues while amassing matches, notification cards, and lifestyle improvements such as cars and jobs. If you land on a date spot, you can ask out one of your matches. A die roll determines whether the object of your affection says “yes”, “no thanks, I’m busy”, or ghosts you.
