A string of successful dates wins you the game—but watch out—jealous friends may attempt to undermine your love life by playing sabotage cards on you. Other notification cards that add balance and flavor to the game include “Rideshare” (move directly to any date spot), “Mutual friend vouches for you” (ask out a match even if you don’t meet their lifestyle requirements), “Free trial of premium” (pick up double the matches), and many more.

—description from the designer

name: Friar & Farmhand (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description: King & robber mechanic adapted to fields and cloisters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Hoist Signals Aloft!
description:
Hoist Signals Aloft! is a system for adding unpredictability and limited communication to naval wargames set during the age of sail.
Hoist Signals Aloft! is not a set of stand-alone rules, but rather a communication sub-system to be added to your favorite set of naval rules.
Although designed for Fire As She Bears!, it can be used for any multi-player age of sail rule system.

Most table top battles allow the gamer instantaneous and unlimited communication with his fellow players.
Hoist Signals Aloft! helps place players in the admiral's historic role: attempting to deal with a fluid battle using a fixed and limited signals book.

Using Hoist Signals Aloft! returns the "fog of war" to our tabletop battlefields.
Find out, as 18th and 19th century admirals knew, that there are never enough flags to convey your orders to the fleet. And, that at the critical moment, some captain will misinterpret one of your commands that seemed so clear when the signals officer ran up the flags.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Fire As She Bears!: Battle of Trafalgar Scenario Pack
description:
Trafalgar Scenario Pack

During 1804 and 1805, Napoleon wanted to seize the English Channel for just one week and place a French army on British soil. To do so, the fleets of Spain and France must combine in order to have any chance against the Royal Navy. The British Admiralty, conducting a brilliant campaign of blockade, could not let Napoleon succeed. But the net is never woven as tightly as the Admiralty desires, and the enemy slips out to sea. In the Fall of 1805 Napoleon's fleets are off the coast of Spain and poised to sail against Britain and her allies. But French Admiral Pierre Villeneuve does not know the whereabouts of the British fleet that has been chasing him for months. Where is his nemesis Horatio Nelson? Off the coast of Spain, Villeneuve loses his nerve and orders his combined fleet to reverse course and return to the safety of Cadiz. On this fateful day, in light winds, Nelson has tracked him down.

Designed for play with the popular age of sail game, Fire As She Bears! (2.1), these scenarios place you in either the role of the feared Royal Navy or the beleaguered French and Spanish fleets. Can you change the course of history and turn Nelson's victory into his defeat?

The Battle of Trafalgar Scenario Pack contains...

Four scenarios from the climactic year of 1805:

Calder's Action, 22 July 1805 (15 pages) - 15 British Ships of the Line square off against 14 French and 6 Spanish warships.
Trafalgar, 21 October 1805 (24 pages) - the mother of all naval battles (60 ships).
Collingwood at Trafalgar, hypothetical (3 pages) - what if Vice-Admiral Cuthbert Collingwood had commanded the Royal Navy at Trafalgar?
Strachan's Action, 3 November 1805 (8 pages) - Four British vs. four French. The perfect introductory scenario for "Fire As She Bears! - 2nd Edition".

Each includes a scenario overview, special rules, weather status, victory conditions, ship record sheets, and a set up map.

Special Bonus: Also included in the scenario pack are ten pages of rules modifications for converting FASB2 from a miniatures game, for play as a traditional hex based wargame. There are six pages of revised charts needed for these new hex based rules. This is a great opportunity for traditional boardgamers to experience this popular age of sail game. If you've previously shied away from Fire As She Bears! as a miniatures game, now with the core 2.1 rules and this scenario pack, you can experience this fleet level wargame.

To go along with this, we've included two 8.5" x 11" pages of full color "print and play" ship silhouette counters (80 different ships, each rated for FASB2). Designed to complement the hex based rules, these counters are ideal for those who don't have a fleet of miniatures or those who want to get into action quickly.

This pdf weighs in with over 60 pages of rules, scenario data, and play aids. We've broadened the horizons of the Fire As She Bears! system by including hex play, as well as, bringing together scenarios recreating one of the most dramatic years in naval history. We hope you enjoy our efforts.

These rules and scenarios are designed for play with the 2nd Edition of Fire As She Bears! Ownership of that rule system is necessary for the full enjoyment of the Battle of Trafalgar Scenario Pack. The optional signaling system "Hoist Signals Aloft!" is not necessary for play (but we hope you'll use it anyway to get the feel of commanding a fleet at sea during the age of sail).

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: EXOH
description:
Do battle across the shattered Nexus as one of 8 different Warbands. The mad King Archial has shattered the Nexus. A place of magic that exists outside of time and space. He hopes to draw on the universe's life energy, called Source, to reverse the events of the past that led to the destruction of his kingdom.

EXOH is a card based tile laying game that mixes combo based card battle mechanics with abstract tile laying. Players deal damage to their opponents by creating Battle Lines on the game’s 4x3 grid called the Nexus. These Battle Lines are formed by summoning Heroes unique to each player’s premade Warband deck of 16 cards. Each Hero in a player’s deck is unique and has abilities that activate when they are summoned or at the start of each turn they are on the Nexus. Knowing when and where to summon your Heroes is crucial to getting the most out of each card in your deck. Players must balance making and blocking Battle Lines with using their Heroes to collect Source, the resource needed to cast spells and summon additional Heroes. Running low on source could mean you end if you don’t have the resources to block your opponent.

EXOH is a head to head game for 2 players or 4 in teams of 2 on an expanded Nexus Board The first player to KO their enemies leader wins the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Pokémon Master Trainer: Expansion Pack
description:
ポケットモンスター ポケモンボードゲーム 拡張パック

This Official Expansion Pack include the new character cards, Pokemon,item cards and event cards. And improvement on fighting against Team Rocket.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Put It In The Bank
description:
Early version of a flicking game from the 1930s. You move your flipper along the path on your side of the board. When landing on certain spots you can try to flick your flipper into the 3D pop-up bank building the center of the board.

—user summary

Two to four may play the game.

There are 16 wooden flippers, four each red, blue, yellow and green. Each player selects his color and chooses a corner of the board.

To start, spin to determine the order of play, the highest number being first.

In turn, each player places a flipper on the starting point on his portion of the field, spins, and moves the flipper accordingly. Each player remains in his own part of the field. As soon as a flipper comes to rest on a spot marked "bank" the player tries to flip the piece into the bank building. If he fails, he must start all over again with that piece. If the flipper goes through the bank building to another part of the board, he must also start again.

The object of the game is to get all four pieces (flippers) into the bank, the first one succeeding being the the winner.

—description from the rulebook

name: Adventure Game Starter Set: The Fighter's Fury
description:
Box blurb:

"ADVENTURE GAME STARTER SETS are a complete introduction to the hobby of Fantasy Adventure Gaming, all in one box. Each ADVENTURE GAME STARTER SET contains ten paintable plastic action figures in the standard 25mm size, a set of non-toxic water-based paints with instructions and brush, and a complete set of fast, playable rules for playing out your own fantasy adventures. Even the gaming die is included. (For two or more players, ages 10 and up)."

Each contains two leaflets, one containing the rules and adventure; the other, a painting guide for the miniatures. Though each game has a unique background story and series of encounters, the rules of play are identical. On the last page of the rules leaflet is a promotion for Heritage's soon-to-be-released (at that time) RPG, Swordbearer.

Gameplay consists of running two characters through a series of four encounters (combats). Each side in a combat takes turns. During a turn, all characters on the active side fight, then all characters on the active side may use magic, pick up or throw things, or run away.

Fighting is resolved by cross-indexing the roll of a six-sided die with the letter code of the attacker's weapon (A, B, C or D) on a table corresponding to the defender's armor (which may be light, medium, or heavy) in order to find how much damage, if any, was done to the defender.

The miniatures aren't necessary to play, and aren't even mentioned in the game rules.

The Fighter's Fury - "the adventures of a young knight and his friend as they do battle with Goblins, foul Orcs, a huge Troll, and an evil Baron in a quest to avenge the death of the young knight's father."

name: Adventure Game Starter Set: The Cleric's Quest
description:
Box blurb:

"ADVENTURE GAME STARTER SETS are a complete introduction to the hobby of Fantasy Adventure Gaming, all in one box. Each ADVENTURE GAME STARTER SET contains ten paintable plastic action figures in the standard 25mm size, a set of non-toxic water-based paints with instructions and brush, and a complete set of fast, playable rules for playing out your own fantasy adventures. Even the gaming die is included. (For two or more players, ages 10 and up)."

Each contains two leaflets, one containing the rules and adventure; the other, a painting guide for the miniatures. Though each game has a unique background story and series of encounters, the rules of play are identical. On the last page of the rules leaflet is a promotion for Heritage's soon-to-be-released (at that time) RPG, Swordbearer.

Gameplay consists of running two characters through a series of four encounters (combats). Each side in a combat takes turns. During a turn, all characters on the active side fight, then all characters on the active side may use magic, pick up or throw things, or run away.

Fighting is resolved by cross-indexing the roll of a six-sided die with the letter code of the attacker's weapon (A, B, C or D) on a table corresponding to the defender's armor (which may be light, medium, or heavy) in order to find how much damage, if any, was done to the defender.

The miniatures aren't necessary to play, and aren't even mentioned in the game rules.

The Cleric's Quest - "the adventures of a young cleric (holy man or woman) as he (or she) dons armor and weapons to fulfill a holy quest - a journey which brings him (or her) into combat with animated Skeletons, a pair of Hell hounds, a female Demon, and a fearsome Devil."

name: Warhammer 40,000 Apocalypse (Collector's Edition)
description:
Warhammer 40,000 Apocalypse Collector's Edition comes with every single item necessary to run games of Apocalypse and includes:

A faux, green leather Rule Book.
A copy of Pluvian's Fighting Formations (WWII style format)
A full set of index cards for every army available at the time of publication (Factory Sealed)
Warzone Pandorax and Armageddon, both in a hand-stitched, field-manual format.
A full deck of Armageddon Cards (Factory Sealed)
A fold-out game stat screen that doubles as a litho, featuring the legions of Chaos (art-work scan pictured)


The Collector's box itself is a veritable work of art itself. With a faux inlaid wood exterior, featuring iconography of the Holy Imperium.


A gray and black leather faux wood display boxed version of the rules for 40K Apocalypse 6th edition limited to 1500 copies. The rules themselves are in a smaller print bound in a green leather. Multiple other contents therein as well for reference and cards.
categories: Book, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: I-Scream
description:
Take turns putting one scoop on the cone. If one of you spills the scoops or get caught when the cone pops you're out. Play until one player is left.

DESCRIPTION IN 1982 LAKESIDE CATALOGUE:
DON’T GET CAUGHT WHEN THE CONE GOES POP! Push down on the cone to set the timer. Then pile on chocolate, vanilla and straw¬berry scoops. But be sure you put the cherry on before the cone goes pop! For any number of players, ages 3 to 7. Comes in its own l-Scream tub and includes cone with built-in timer (no batteries required), 9 scoops and cherry.

name: Samurai Skirmish Wargame Rules
description:
These rules are designed to allow small skirmishes using Japanese warriors and peasants in the period from the rise of the Samurai till 1868 when the honorific was banned.

The system is meant to give a game where a reasonable facsimile of reality is seen, together with the possibility of characters appearing with the attributes of the legendary heroes of Japanese myth and legend.

Order of Play:
Play is Alternate between sides.
Each players turn consists of:

Move, Shoot, Load etc all figures in your force.
Any figures in Melee fight with the enemy figures in contact.
Check morale if needed.
categories: Medieval, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Space-Opoly
description:
While we’re all spinning around in this fascinating galaxy, play to rule the universe! You could even own Mother Earth! And as you play, flip over the deeds and learn something about each cosmic element you own. Buy favorite celestial bodies and increase your rent by collecting Stars and trading them in for Orbs.

Sounds easy enough until your launch fails, or you hear a tiny hiss in your space suit, or worse yet- you’re sent to the Black Hole and you’re lost in space for three turns! Grab your token and Advance to the sun! Who knows! You may soon be the first human on Saturn…or you may be abducted by aliens!

Choose traditional play or 1-hour version.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: 我們都是模範生 We Are The Best!
description:
Be polite to teachers in school!

In your turn you have to face up 1 card in front of you.


If you see some one: Be the first one say Hi to principal, director, or other teachers. If you are the last one say hi, you'll get minus points.



If you see activities in the class: Be the first one to act related actions.


If you are the first one act right action, you'll get card as victory point.

The player with most cards is the winner
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Rise: A Tale of Kingdoms
description:
Rise: A tale of kingdoms is a competitive board game. You step up as the new ruler of your kingdom. Everything seems quiet at the beginning. You want to be a good ruler and do your best for your kingdom.
But you are surrounded by neighbors, and each of them wants to be the most powerful king in the region. They attack you, try to rob you by unfair trades, and crush your kingdom down. You need to fight back or your kingdom will fall down ingloriously.
Develop your kingdom's resources or harm your opponents by playing a combination of certain cards. There are several advanced rules which can be mixed up together and play the game the way you like it.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Economic, Print & Play
mechanics: Command Cards, Hand Management, Matching, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Tales of the Fabulist: Fantasy Deck
description:
Tales of the Fabulist is an interactive fiction device, a party game, an improvisation system, a drinking game, an ice-breaker at retreats, and an excellent gift for the young and old. You don't have to be William Shakespeare to have a great time making sh*t up regaling your loved ones with a fabricated fable. Here's how easy it is:

After the decks are shuffled and cards are dealt, The Fabulist begins by introducing the characters in the context of a grand quest upon which the characters will embark. The Fabulist has sixty seconds to weave the beginning of the tale, then play rotates clockwise. The next player selects a plot twist (PT) out of their hand and places it on the included playmat in the next open PT space. That player continues the story for 30 seconds, working in the words or phrases on the newly played card into the story. When the time runs out, draw a new plot twist card. Play continues clockwise. The lucky person who places the final plot twist card has sixty seconds to wrap up the story as best they can.

Now that the fable has ended, everyone gets to suggest a "Moral of the Story". The player with the funniest moral wins the quest card. If your group is competitive, the person with the most quest cards at the end of the session wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Monmouth: Brandywine 3.0 Map only Expansion
description:
Monmouth is desperate rearguard action from the American Revolution at the end of the Philladelphia Campaign.

Brandywine Expansion

You must have our Brandywine 3.0 game to play this!

You can also play this with our Standard Blocks.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game

name: Vessel Runners
description: In Vessel Runners, you are tasked with building an automated delivery ship. Each round, you’ll gain the favor of various crew members to help you outfit your ship. Survive meteor showers and ward off pirates to ensure a safe delivery of goods! Players score points by delivering cargo. The player with the most points at the end of 14 rounds is the winner!

name: Mountain Bike Downhill
description:
Mountain Bike Downhill is a mountain bike racing micro-game that uses only 9 cards and a handful of dice and tokens.

Bikers have to manage their exhaustion levels as they pedal downhill, all while watching what their opponents are doing. This all happens through a simultaneous bidding mechanic that sees players spending their biker's Exhaustion levels in order to get the best Speed Dice and go faster.

To recover from accumulated Exhaustion levels, players can Rest. Clever timing of the Rest action is key to victory as bikers can coast downhill without pedaling, but lose your energy in an uphill stretch and you'll be in trouble! Like in a real bike rally, it's not simply sheer effort that wins the race, but most intelligent use of energy!

Mountain Bike Downhill was first designed as an entry to the 2020 9 Card Game Print and Play Design Contest.

name: Novus Crusade
description:
Introducing Sundered Vault's latest game line, Half Hour Heroics, lead first by 'Novus Crusade!
This system is designed to be flexible, fast, and fun, allowing for customization and quick gameplay!
Novus Crusade is set in a techno-medieval future, filled with space knights, space gremz, and many other soon-to-be-released races!
The book is full color, and comes with the following goodies!


Setting Material on the Techno-Medieval future of Novus Crusade!
Complete Rules of Play, so easy you can play and have a blast today!
Some Sample Lists to use right away!
Lovely miniatures for all listed troops, and color variants for each Variant Faction! Or you can use your own!
Lovely tokens and markers for all orders and traits!


THE GAME PLAYS LIKE:

Everything in the game is based around a single target number, and we use D6s!
You build a force with points! Troops are single characters or squads!
You upgrade troops and their weapons with Traits, which add some neat bonuses and modifiers.
The profile for troops and weapons is very simple, and is based on how it modifies or penalizes the base target number!
Commanders can give orders that make things much cooler, or easier!
There are different mission types, including blasting everything, holding an area, and wave defense!
Variant Forces/Factions who have slight modifications to how the play, and the colored minis to play them!


A great game to relax with your pals or introduce younger folks to tabletop wargaming!

—description from the publisher
categories: Medieval, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: The Horus Heresy: Book Six – Retribution
description:
The Horus Heresy Book Six - Retribution is the sixth book in the Horus Heresy series by Forge World. It covers the Shadow Wars of the Heresy: actions by the Knights-Errant, Shattered Legions, and Blackshields.

The Horus Heresy Book Six - Retribution continues the unfolding saga of the Horus Heresy. As the fires of total war consume entire worlds and whole Legions clash, away from the front lines the Knights-Errant are abroad too, penetrating the warp storms that afflict the entire galaxy as they carry out a mission bestowed upon them by the very highest authority on distant Terra. The Shattered Legions pursue bloody vengeance against the hated Traitors, who in turn seek to hunt the Loyalist survivors down no matter where they might seek refuge. Blackshields — orphaned or outcast Legiones Astartes who have renounced their Legions and obscured their heraldry - harbour their own objectives, alone in the darkness, sometimes aligned with the Traitor cause, sometimes the Loyalist, but just as often for their own unknowable ends.

This book explores the unseen Shadow Wars that raged across the entire galaxy as betrayed Legiones Astartes mounted bitter campaigns against their former brothers, determined that if death was to be their fate, their betrayers would share it. This tale is told across five chapters, describing five very different Shadow Wars of the Age of Darkness. Also included are a detailed campaign system and a set of special Shadow Wars missions, enabling players to undertake their own series of linked battles fought between the types of forces explored throughout the book.

The Horus Heresy Book Six - Retribution is a lavishly printed, leather bound book. Its 297 pages contain a myriad of new rules, including those for combining Space Marines of several different Legions into a Shattered Legion force, and new Legiones Astartes rules for the Dark Angels, Blood Angels and White Scars Legions.

Rules are also included for the heroic and elite Knights-Errant, the renegade Blackshields, and numerous new Rites of War for each Legion. In addition to this, unit entries are included for new consul types, heroes and war machines of the Legiones Astartes, including the Legion Mastodon Heavy Assault Transport and Dreadnoughts of the Leviathan pattern and Contemptor-Cortus class. The Mechanicum also gain new characters and units including Anacharis Scoria and the Arlatax class Battle-automata.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: What a Wheelie
description: What a Wheelie pits individual chariots or small squadrons against one another in freewheeling combat. Each vehicle rolls a number of dice each turn that determine what options it has for movement and combat.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Battle Force: The Scorpion's Lair
description:
Scorpion's Lair suplement is a Narrative Campaign for the miniature's skirmish game, BATTLE FORCE.
Play as the UN forces, or troops loyal to the International Terrorist, the Red Scorpion, in this thrilling 4 mission 'learn to play' campaign.

A default BATTLE FORCE is included along with blank unit rosters and templates.

The main rule book is required for play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Battle Force: Behind the Front
description:
In the early morning hours of June 6th, 1944, the Allied forces initiated a massive counter offensive in Europe – Code Named “OPERATION OVERLORD”. At dawn, nearly 157,000 men, 200,000 assorted vehicle assets and over 11,500 aircraft descended upon Normandy in an attempt to free the French people from Nazi occupation, and to gain a foothold in Europe that would eventually lead them all the way to Berlin.

Amongst those numbers a few elite groups of men managed to achieve nearly impossible feats of heroism and valor, saving countless Allied lives in the process. The Missions contained within this book let you play as several of those elite units. Can you repeat history? Roll the dice and find out…

Inside you'll discover new rules for Night Fighting, Tank Operations, Mortar fire, and much more!

Assemble your BATTLE FORCE and tackle the 6 exciting missions contained within!

Play as members of the 101st Airborne Division, 1st British Airborne Division, 2nd Ranger Battalion and Royal Commandos!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Wald (fan-erweiterung für Carcassonne)
description:
This is the first expansion which introduced forest elements to Carcassonne.
The 36 tiles have it own artwork. Means that they don't fit perfect to the rest of the Carcassonne world.
There are no known rules. So you can make your own rules or use the rules of another forest expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Pejuang Promo
description:
Pejuang Promo is a game based on luck with guessing, dice rolling, taking token in the bag and choose a random card. The player acts as an impulse buyer on an event held by the department store at 6 weeks but still pay attention to finances.

The game is played for 6 rounds, where each round of the first player will be determined again. then each player alternately buys items with promos obtained, and players can use character effects to enhance the chances of getting good items. The player with the highest points wins and becomes the best "hedoner".]
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Market, Push Your Luck, Trading

name: Großer Preis von Europa
description:
The game was published in the late 1930's.

Up to 6 motorcycles compete at the racetrack Hohenstein-Ernstthal (Sachsenring). Movement is determined by two dice. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach the finish line after six rounds wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Eisenbahn (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description: There are no "ending" for the railroads, and this expansion does not fit with the medieval Carcassonne theme.

name: Das Pit-Spiel
description:
Each player gets 12 game coins and has to get his pawn from start to finish (Pit-Schlaraffenland). The first player to do so wins the game and half of the game coins in the cash box. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players, often by loosing or winning game coins.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Beyond the Sea
description:
Beyond the Sea is a tactical combat roguelike deck-builder, with light survival, base building and role-playing mechanics, set in a persistent fantasy world. Players take on the role of an adventurer, exiled from their homeland, they journey to the new world beyond the sea. Working together players travel the world clearing out locations, from treacherous swamps to abandoned cities. In the process they will enhance their character with new abilities learnt by defeated foes and training with NPC's. They will also build a new home, that serves as a hub for characters to return to in-between scenarios, this home can also be developed and allows the characters to advance their attributes.

This is an open-ended adventure game, designed to be played over many sessions. Before each scenario, similar to a “Choose Your Own Adventure” book, players will choose where and how the story continues. They then build and prepare their characters for that journey. Scenarios are cooperative, where players will fight against automated foes that use a unique card system to determine their actions and skills. These Scenarios are played on large maps with many enemies.

Each player has their own deck, and building and optimizing this deck is part of the game. You start each of your turns by drawing up a number of cards to your hand, and you'll play them all in any order you choose. Cards can be skills, actions, abilities or generated resources. Used cards are placed in a face up discard pile, and when you need to draw a card and your decks empty, you shuffle your discard pile to form a new deck. As players progress through the world, they will acquire new cards to add to their hand and each player's deck and strategy's will develop as the game unfolds. After finishing a scenario, players return to their home to upgrade, swap cards, reconfigure their party and choose their next destination on the world map.

In Beyond the Sea, players create their own goals through the choose your own adventure story elements. Characters can also be taken into other players worlds where they will be able to share information about specific skill, NPC and trainer locations.

—description from designer

name: Truppenaufmarsch (fan-erweiterung für Carcassonne)
description: Bring your followers to troop assembly points and conquer.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Nochmal neue Landschaftskarten (fan-erweiterung für Carcassonne)
description: 6 new landscape tiles to Carcassonne with new feature configurations. No new rules and no new mechanics.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Landschaftskarten die Dritte (fan-erweiterung für Carcassonne)
description: 16 new tiles with new configurations which are missing in the base game and expansions. No new feature are introduced, so you can play them easily without new rules.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Chess But Way Cooler
description:
Chess But Way Cooler is an addon to the game of a chess. Its chess cards that let you mastermind new moves for your chess pieces. Challenge your friends to a chess game that’ll keep them guessing. Whenever you take an enemy piece, your opponent gets a card. Play your way to victory by swapping pieces, summoning pawns, and more.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle, Sports

name: Sex Hotel
description:
You and your partner are visiting the famous "Sex Hotel". Distracted by the titillating activities of the other hotel guests, you have lost sight of each other completely. Which room is your playing partner in?

A two-player game of uncovering pictures to find a scene matching the picture chosen by your opponent. They will have to answer questions throughout the game to give you clues as to the acts depicted on their cards.

This game is intended for adults only.

Players secretly pick from a selection of sex scenes at the beginning of the game. The same selection of scenes are arranged behind a series of shutters.
On their turn, the player rolls a die to pick a window in the hotel, which they can "peep" through by uncovering a quarter of it. Cards depicting various sex acts are hidden behind the windows.
The die roll also allows the player to ask their opponent a question from those listed in the rulebook that reveal part of their sexual history or desires in relation to their chosen room.
Once a room is entirely revealed, the player takes the key for the room and can also pick that room as their guess for the location of their opponent.
The winner looks at their collected rooms and picks one of them as the basis of their consequent fervent coupling with their opponent.

name: Dragon Rider Slayer (fan expansion for Carcassonne: The Princess & The Dragon)
description: An unofficial expansion to Carcassonne: The Princess and The Dragon. Includes 15 tiles with Dragon Slayers, Dragon Riders, and Ice Trolls under bridges. A fun little fantasy expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Episode 1 – Gastronomie: La Réunion
description:
Card game to play with family or friends.
On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

Each set of 33 cards is supplied in a plastic box, convenient for storing your quiz and protecting it during transport.


Jeu de cartes à jouer en famille ou entre amis.
Sur chaque carte, devinez la bonne réponse à l’aide de 3 indices.

Chaque jeu de 33 cartes vous est fourni dans une Boite plastique, pratique pour ranger votre quizz et le protéger lors des transports.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia

name: Werewolf Party
description:
Werewolf Party is a social deduction game inspired by Werewolf/Mafia. Players will get a random role that belongs to either team werewolf or team village(sometimes a third party). Werewolves can kill a player at night, the entire village can cast out a player by majority vote during the day. Villagers must cast out all the werewolves to win. Werewolves must kill enough villagers so that the remaining villagers cannot outvote werewolves. Third party roles must defeat both werewolves and the village in order to win. Except the normal villagers and bunny, each role comes with a special skill, and players shall make the most of their skills.

/Cards/
Werewolf: Wolf King, Werewolf, White Wolf, Red Wolf, Nightmare, Femme Fatale;
Villagers: Seer, Witch, Hunter, Werewolf, Villager(normal), Trouble Maker, Secret Admirer, Merchant, Guardian, Knight, Hypnotist, Thief, Priest
Third Party: Cupid, Bomber, Fool, Vampire;
Zoo Madness Mode: Bunny, Rooster, Bear, Penguin;

+ Judge (moderator) + blank cards.

/Rules/
--A game with more than 9 players will have a first round of election of a Sheriff. Players who do not run for Sheriff get to vote. Elected Sheriff not only has 1.5 voting power, but also controls the order of the day time discussion. When sheriff dies, sheriff can pass the badge to another person.
--Winning Condition for games with 9+ players: if werewolves kill all the normal villagers, or kill all the villagers with special skills, the werewolves win.

-description from designer

name: SkyTech
description:
SkyTech - a game family about combat operations in near-planetary spaces of the distant future, in the most dangerous part of them - the area of low heights.
Players are expected by dashing squadrons of roaring skytes - flying combat vehicles of the galactic outskirts and their fearless pilots, heavy anti-aircraft gun fire and the frightening slow pace of walking tanks, devastating bombing raids and the approaching screech of combat missiles, the heroic fatality of aimed rams and the highest tension of pilots at the moment of ejection!
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Pirate Coast (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description: This expansion by Hawkinsssable features 15 Coast Tiles, 13 River Tiles (almost none of which can be found in existing Rivers expansions), 4 pirate logo tiles (or separate printable pirate logos to add to existing base game tiles), and a little 2-tile pirate island to help keep track of your pirate meeples. It also features an additional optional 19-tile expansion of all-new tiles which mix in functionality from other CarcassonneCentral expansions such as Mountains, Forests and Wells.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Libertad! A Blitzkrieg Commander Supplement for the Spanish Civil War 1936-1939
description:
Libertad! is a supplement for the popular Blitzkrieg Commander IV wargames rules, focussing on the Spanish Civil War from 1936-1939.

Written by Mark Fry and Rob Anderson, Libertad! contains 23 new army lists for the various factions present in this conflict, plus 5 historical scenarios complete with maps by Henry Hyde, as well as new rules for Line Commanders, Street Barricades, Molotov Cocktails and more.

A copy of Blitzkrieg Commander IV is needed to use this supplement.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: NEUROGOL: El fútbol ciencia
description:
Neurogol is a football simulation which can be played by two people or by two teams of two players each.

Each team has 11 players on the field, plus five substitutes (there are also other modes with fewer players). Each player has a defined position. Depending on the positions, the players have different movement options, which are those of chess pieces. The goalkeeper moves like the king, the forward like the queen, etc.

On each turn, a team can move the ball up to three times (less if the opponent intercepts it), trying to move it into the opponent's goal.

name: Dyadic
description:
You have been transported to the Dyadic, a parallel world where strange, nocturnal beasts with glowing eyes hunt you out at night. You must collect the right resources in order to re open the portal and return home.

The game is played in rounds, with each round consisting of a Day phase and a Night phase. In the Day phase, the three dice are rolled to determine what resources are available and the players draft cards based on the resources. In the Night phase any cards not drafted are flipped over to reveal the monsters and the dice are re-rolled to determine the strength and health of the beasts. The players then fight off the monsters to survive.

The rounds continue until a player has collected the correct set of cards.

Dyadic is a game for 2 to 3 players.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Peli und Pelinchens Reise um die Welt
description:
The players start at space 1 (Zoo), the first to reach space 191 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bodosan-Spiel
description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 50 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battlefield: Space
description: The third game in the "Battlefield" series expands the game to the stars. Each of two players has a deck of 72 cards which represent an alliance of space fleets from several alien races. The two sides differ in the fleets and their capabilities, but the forces are equal in their effectiveness through combinations of powers and tactics. Deploy your warships to the battle coordinates, assign your available reinforcements, and deal with the anomalies that can occur in the depths of space. Winners go on to fight in future encounters, while the losers are blown to oblivion. Through a series of skirmishes, each space force will be reduced to their most powerful fleets, and will finally meet in a glorious battle for supremacy in the galaxy!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Player Elimination

name: Iron Pirate: The Swashbuckling Train Race
description:
Iron Pirate - The Swashbuckling Train Race is a worker placement, race against the board, semi co-operative game that plays 2-4 (Solo mode being investigated) in approximately 45-90 minutes.

Gather resources from the sea locked islands by sailing the Njall Sea. But watch out for those pesky pirates looking to steal your hard earned resources. Try your luck at "Liars Dice" in the Tavern and walk away with a handful of coins, or maybe you might lose?

Fancy fighting those pirates? Why not buy yourself a cannon or two to upgrade your ship before blasting them out of the water

Work together to complete the track before Watkins Railway or face losing out on that big contract.....

All this, and more, in Iron Pirate - The Swashbuckling Train Race

On your turn, you must first place a worker (Phase 1) on an available slot (In the first round, this will only be the mainland). Each player places one worker each in turn before repeating again. In round 1, you start with 2 workers each.
Do you try your hand in the tavern to gain coins? Do you go to market to buy resources? Do you upgrade your ship at the shipwright? Do you load your worker onto your ship

Once all workers are placed, any one who has boarded their ship may now sail their ship the relevant number of spaces (after round 1, this will only be 1 space as upgrades do not take effect until the end of the round). Each player who is on a ship will state which number sea region they wish to move to and then activate the pirate deck the required number of times dealing with any action points on the card(s).

Phase 3 is where workers return back to your player boards

Phase 4 is where your ships are upgraded, more pirates are added to the board and the round marker moves along

The game ends after 10 rounds and the player with the most points wins. However, if the board wins, I.E, if you don't complete the railway before the board does, then you are only playing for pride.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Network and Route Building, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Resource to Move, Semi-Cooperative Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement

name: Taiping Era: Commanders
description:
This booklet is a supplement to Taiping Era.

It contains the commander cards for all of the commanders in Taiping Era, plus extras such as "Chinese" Gordon, the Commanders of British forces in the 1840 Opium War, as well as blanks for players to create their own.

“Taiping Era” is a set of wargame rules for fighting land battles in the turbulent middle years of the 19th century.
Commanders are represented in the game by a model figure, as in most tabletop wargames. However, each commander can have unique abilities, so that he performs differently on the battlefield to all other commanders.
Commanders are allocated at both Army and Divisional level and their abilities are adjusted to take their relative levels of seniority into account.
The Commander’s abilities can be summarised on small cards, to be placed with the figure or held at the back of the board for reference. Cards for many of the armies covered by the rules are given in this small document, together with blanks for the user to complete themselves.

—description from the publisher and rulebook
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Flock of Sheep
description:
Ages 6+

A game where sheep leave their pen and then flock together. Your goal is to end up with the most sheep of your color.

There are 12 2x2unit tiles (called "sheep") comprising 2 sets of reversible tiles with black sheep on one side and white sheep on the other, having Black: White ratios of {6:1, 5:2, 4:3, 3:4, 2:5, 1:6).

One set black-up is randomly mixed with the other set white-up and then randomly dealt out in a ring enclosing the 9 central points of a go board, forming a pen.

Movement
On a turn, Sheep always move a distance of exactly 5, and if not forming a flock, they then flip over. They are allowed one change of direction per move.

The game has two phases: 1) Dispersing from the pen, 2) Flocking together.

1) Dispersing from the pen,
During the Dispersing phase, priority is given to moving sheep that have the most length of shared edges. The sheep must move to reduce the total length of connections, and the number of touching corners. The Dispersing phase ends when no sheep are touching each other.

2) Flocking together.
During this phase, the sheep may move next to one another. When they end up sharing more than a corner with other friendly sheep, they form a flock and are not required to complete the turn with is flip. Flocked sheep no longer move and may not be flipped.

It is not allowed to repeat board positions during play (for example by returning a piece that the other player just moved)

The game ends when all the sheep are in Flocks.

Note: Many thanks to Dale Walton for all of his suggestions and concise wording of the rules.

-description from designer
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Square Grid

name: BUNGEE
description:
Bungee is a patented dexterity game for homes, bars and pubs. Inspired by human-sand timers, darts, pong, dice and more, Bungee games allow you to relax with friends and family, while enjoying shared-sporty suspense!

Players aim to score points or gain important game tokens. Win conditions vary based on the rule set players select.

Bungee is a dexterity component with endless possibilities.

Try it and see what game bounces back at you!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Race, Real-Time, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Variable Set-up

name: Wajes Fußballschach!
description:
This is a soccer simulation with programmed movement. After all playing figures have been alternately placed on the game board each player notes down 3 moves for his figures on his game chit. The moves are executed alternately. The team leading the ball begins. After the players have executed their moves, 3 new moves are noted down and so on. If the opposing player gets possession of the ball, the remaining movements are void and the players write down three new moves.

The figures move up to 5 spaces (3 if they lead the ball) in any direction.

The player with the most goals after a prearranged time wins the game.

—user summary

name: Trivial Pursuit: La Grande Guerre 1914 - 1918 – Liège
description:
This is the mini edition of The Great War 1914-1918 of the famous game Trivial Pursuit.

In this edition, 330 questions for adults, and 330 more designed for the youngest.

The goal remains to be the first to fill in his pie chart by correctly answering the 6 categories of questions and obtaining the corresponding triangles.



A l’occasion de la commémoration du centenaire de la Première Guerre Mondiale, la Province de Liège a prévu de nombreuses activités pour entretenir le souvenir de cet évènement. Mais, comment transmettre l’Histoire d’une nation, et de cette crise internationale spécifique, aux générations futures ? Nous avons relevé ce challenge en personnalisant un Trivial Pursuit qui valorise cet héritage historique.
Cette édition thématique du troisième jeu le plus vendu au monde, spéciale « La Grande Guerre 1914 -­‐ 1918 » est l’occasion de parcourir les 330 questions qui sont réparties en 6 catégories. Les aspects géographiques sont abordés , de même que les personnes qui ont joué un rôle important, ainsi que les armes et le matériel utilisé, et surtout le rôle exemplaire de Liège dans la Grande Guerre.
Le célèbre jeu Trivial Pursuit rime avec savoir et connaissances, tout en étant ludique. Il est le support idéal pour illustrer le conflit historique qu’est la Première Guerre Mondiale !
categories: Party Game, Trivia, World War I
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Trivial Pursuit: Mons – Capitale européenne de la culture
description:
A Trivial Pursuit about the city of Mons in Belgium.
Created in 2015 on the occasion of the year of culture in the city.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Dico Games, Hasbro, Winning Moves France

name: Drott
description:
Drott is a chess like game played on a 13x13 hnefatafl board. Two opposing armies vie for victory via one of three win conditions. Either: 1. Defeat the opponent's king. 2. March the king into the castle (the center square) or 3. Invade conquer the opponent's fort. (the starting squares of the pieces).

Drott is designed to create local battles that will later impact the whole board. Therefore no pieces can move across the whole feature. Each piece is also used only once, and has unique movement. Fights are therefore dynamic and exiting.

Drott means king in old norse, and the game is lightly themed to fit the old kings of the north. The names of the pieces are, bowman, skjolding (pawns), berserker, spearman, wolf, elf, hunter, dwarf and king.

A special feature of Drott is that pieces diagonally aligned cannot be passed through, but there are two open flanks on the side. Due to the three winning conditions, draws are extremely unlikely to happen.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, King of the Hill, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid

name: Ship Deck
description:
Game for kids that reward good deeds while pretending to do cruise ship activities in this board game.

The game requires players to get to the pool with the most tokens. There are numerous onboard activities to be enjoyed.

HOW TO PLAY

Players choose a pawn and put it into the pawn stand. Place the cards and tokens next to the ship. Each player flicks the spinner, which determines where to go.
When players land on a card space, they pick a card. 3. Once all players are in the pool, all players count their tokens. The player with most tokens wins the game.

name: Beggar's Banquet
description:
Most people in Medieval Europe suffered in abject poverty, many driven to begging in the streets, their survival at the mercy of the passing nobility. In this game, players take on the role of lowly beggars, visiting village sites in search of sustenance and working the passing nobility for largess. Players can chose to exploit their own infirmities, or visit the cathedral in hopes of a miracle. During this struggle for survival, beggars must also avoid the stern eye of the village constable patrolling the streets. The winner is the player who can acquire the most alms to survive in the harsh world for another day.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Income, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Track Movement, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Bonnets, Bustles, and Boots
description:
In the late 19th century, families and friends would gather in their parlors to play games. It was an aspect of their social life and a stage for the strict etiquette of the day. This three-handed card game would have been perfect for the Victorian courting sensibilities, played by a young couple and their chaperone. By playing your cards carefully you will gain cards that will contribute to your final score. However, you can decide to use a scoring card to win a different (and perhaps better) card. A very light, unique game for three that can be played almost anywhere by anyone, depicting the latest fashions of the 1880s. Remember the "good old days."

—description from the designer

name: Trivial Pursuit: Waterloo et la Route Napoléon
description:
The Trivial Pursuit Waterloo and the Route Napoléon, on the occasion of the bicentenary of the epic Battle between Napoleon and Wellington!

330 questions and answers on the theme of Waterloo and Napoleon's road.


Le Trivial Pursuit Waterloo et la Route Napoléon, à l'occasion du bicentenaire de la Bataille épique opposant Napoléon à Wellington !

330 questions et réponses sur le thème de Waterloo et la route de Napoléon.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Rhums & Cocktails
description:
The Conficulture Quiz is your new card game to play with family or friends. On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

Discover the techniques and specialties "Rums & Cocktails" while having fun.

If a player/team gets the correct answer with the first clue, they keep the card and get 2 more random cards. If they get the answer after the second clue, they received the card plus 1 random card. If they get it after the third clue, they keep just that card.

Game end can be when a team acquires a certain number of points (cards) or when the deck is depleted. Player/team with the most points, wins.


Le Quizz Conficulture est votre nouveau jeu de cartes à jouer en famille ou entre amis. Sur chaque carte, devinez la bonne réponse à l’aide de 3 indices.

Partez à la découverte des techniques et spécialités « Rhums & Cocktails » en vous amusant.

Vous êtes plutôt adepte de l’apéro ? Retrouvez immédiatement l’épisode : « Rhums & Cocktails »
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia

name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Episode 2 – Tradition: La Réunion
description:
Card game to play with family or friends.
On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

This deck focuses on the heritage of the island of la Réunion.

If a player/team gets the correct answer with the first clue, they keep the card and get 2 more random cards. If they get the answer after the second clue, they received the card plus 1 random card. If they get it after the third clue, they keep just that card.

Game end can be when a team acquires a certain number of points (cards) or when the deck is depleted. Player/team with the most points, wins.

Each set of 33 cards is supplied in a plastic box, convenient for storing your quiz and protecting it during transport.


Jeu de cartes à jouer en famille ou entre amis.
Sur chaque carte, devinez la bonne réponse à l’aide de 3 indices.

Ce jeu met l'accent sur le patrimoine de l'île de la Réunion.

Chaque jeu de 33 cartes vous est fourni dans une Boite plastique, pratique pour ranger votre quizz et le protéger lors des transports.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia

name: The Balkan Naval War
description:
The Balkan Naval War is a mini campaign covering the naval side of the Balkan Wars of 1912-13 in the Black Sea, the Aegean and the Mediterranean.

The campaign has been written with LFG's Broadside and Salvo quick play rules in mind, but is adapable to any set of pre-dreadnought or WW1 naval rules.

Also included is a brief history of the naval campaign, the Broadside and Salvo fast play pre-dreadnought rules and a complete set of ship data in Broadside and Salvo format, allowing the campaign to be fought out over a weekend or a few club nights.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: No Way!
description:
No Way! is best described as the game of bluff, lies and surprise. You win by a combination of conning your way to victory and sniffing out the bluffs and downright lies of other players. You'll learn some weird and wonderful 'facts' along the way, but to win in this game it's not what you know... it's the way that you tell it.

You can choose to tell the truth (often stranger than fiction)or try to lie with a straight face. Select from the wacky but oddly believable falsehoods on the card, or take the plunge with a Double Bluff entirely of your own invention... that could double your points. Fortune favours the brave. The winner is the first to reach the 25-point target.

—description from the publisher

name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Episode 2 – Tradition: La Guadeloupe
description:
The Conficulture Quiz is a card game to be played with family or friends. On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

Discover the TRADITION of the "Guadeloupe" destination while having fun.

If a player/team gets the correct answer with the first clue, they keep the card and get 2 more random cards. If they get the answer after the second clue, they received the card plus 1 random card. If they get it after the third clue, they keep just that card.
