categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia

name: Greyhounds Profi-Spiel
description:
Greyhounds Professional game for "old hands".
This variant allows the bookmaker to set the winning and entry rates for the race himself. The space quotas cannot be changed.
These flexible win and run-in odds give the bookmaker more opportunities to better influence racing and betting events. He can prove particularly "strong" dogs with low betting odds.

name: Fearless Creatures
description:
Fearless Creatures is a lightweight, fun (yet kinda silly) battle game between creatures that might not always get a chance to battle in real life. It's also meant to be educational, as in "What is this creature?" or "Where is this place?" and then you can learn more about them. The game is best played in small groups of 2-4 people, ideally a family setting that spans generations. Fearless Creatures is a print-on-demand card game.

A dice battle game between fearless creatures. Use action cards to play creatures from your hand, battle with any creatures that are in play, and draw cards. Each creature's ability are described on the card. Roll battle dice. Collect victory tokens when you send creatures to the discard pile. The player with the most victory tokens wins.

All creatures have unique descriptions and capabilities. Lots of creatures have the ability to band together (as herds, swarms, pods, flocks, etc.) and when they are banded together they battle as a group. Damage to creatures that band together is still determined by a creature's individual strength. It is possible possible for a large group of creatures to cause a lot of damage, but also to take a lot of damage that is applied to more than one creature in the group.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Jollywood
description:
You are a film producer and become rich by making films and releasing them to the public. But you have to compete with other producers in the cut-throat entertainment business.

The purpose of the game is to build a tableau of several films, each consisting of a series of production cards. There are Genre, Script, Director, Actor, Staff, Prop, and Location cards. You need a Genre or Script card, a Director, one or more Actors, and one or more Staff to complete a film, which you can then release by closing it off with a special Release card.

The players have their own decks of cards. On your turn, after taking one card from your deck, you may buy 1 or 2 additional cards from any deck or discard pile and then, if you want, play 1 or 2 cards from your hand. At the end of each turn, you then receive box office money earned by your released films and pay the ongoing costs of your open productions. In case of need, you may borrow money that you will have to return with interest at the end of the game.

Instead of adding cards to your productions, you can discard them to get instant cash or to interfere with other players’ productions. The game ends when a player releases a pre-determined number of films. After a final scoring and the distribution of awards to the best producers, the player with most money wins.

The current version of Jollywood includes four genres: Science Fiction, Thriller, Historical, and War.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Aarcana Inquisitions
description:
Aarcana Inquisitions, is a game of necessary cooperation and occasional, strategic back stabbing. Players will quickly find that it is a matter of life and death to work together to survive the hunt that they have been tasked with but when bills are tallied, only one player can be the best.

Each player will come to the table with an entirely unique custom character that has taken on a bounty against a randomly generated scenario and a host of powerful creatures.
Through the course of the game players will keep a running tally of their billable accomplishments and once the objective has been satisfied or all of the players have died a horrible gruesome death, the players will compare their bills to see who is (or was) the best Hunter.

Make no mistake, the monsters in this world will kill you and the Hunter who claimed to be your comrade might do the same. Characters earn their living by taking bounties from different guilds and not all guilds are cut from an honorable cloth. At any time a player may turn their sights on another player if they think it will further their own goals. Some characters may see comparing bills at the end of a hunt as a friendly competition among peers but there are certainly others that see competition as a thing to be eliminated.

There is strength in numbers, and players will need every advantage they can muster against the other-worldly threats to this realm. But how much do you trust the Hunter next to you?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Modular Board, Semi-Cooperative Game, Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Guess Ball
description:
A sponsor marks with erasable markers on the board. The combination must match the challenge levels below:

Level 1. Fill in 4 places with 1 color.
Level 2. Fill in 6 places with 2 color.
Level 3. Fill in 9 places with 3 color.

Next, the sponsor presents the card to the respondent for whom to remember the combination and repeat the scene with beads in 10-15 seconds. Then, Role Exchange. The one who remember that the best wins!

—description from the back of the box

name: Raumdomino
description: The room domino includes a basic set with two series of 8 cubes each. The domino of space is the departure of the domino game from the second to the third dimension. The use of three-color patterned color cubes creates the most amazing buildings with incredible colors and shapes. The basic set includes two series of 8 cubes each in four different color mixes, each with a three-color pattern.

name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Episode 2 – Tradition: La Martinique
description:
The Conficulture Quiz is a card game to be played with family or friends. On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

Discover the TRADITION of the "Martinique" destination while having fun.

If a player/team gets the correct answer with the first clue, they keep the card and get 2 more random cards. If they get the answer after the second clue, they received the card plus 1 random card. If they get it after the third clue, they keep just that card.

Game end can be when a team acquires a certain number of points (cards) or when the deck is depleted. Player/team with the most points, wins.

Your set of 33 cards is supplied to you in a plastic box, practical for storing your quiz and protecting it during transport.

—description from the publisher (translated)


Le Quiz Conficulture est un jeu de cartes à jouer en famille ou entre amis. Sur chaque carte, devinez la bonne réponse à l’aide de 3 indices.

Partez à la découverte de la TRADITION de la destination « Martinique » en vous amusant.

Votre jeu de 33 cartes vous est fourni dans une Boite plastique, pratique pour ranger votre quizz et le protéger lors des transports.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia

name: Histoire des Marrons: Episode 1
description:
The Quiz Histoire des Marrons is a card game to be played with family or friends. On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

You all know the history of slavery and the slave trade, but do you know the history of resistant peoples in the Americas and the Caribbean? The true abolitionists who fought against the slavers and created independent nations at the heart of colonial empires.
Thanks to the HISTOIRE DES MARRONS quiz card game you will learn in a fun way about the life of Negro Maroons.

Each set of 33 cards is supplied to you in a plastic box, practical for storing your quiz and protecting it during transport.


Le Quiz Histoire des Marrons est un jeu de cartes à jouer en famille ou entre amis. Sur chaque carte, devinez la bonne réponse à l’aide de 3 indices.

Vous connaissez tous et toutes l’Histoire de l’esclavage et de la traite négrière, mais connaissez-vous l’Histoire des peuples résistants dans les Amériques et les Caraïbes ? Les véritables abolitionnistes qui luttèrent contre les esclavagistes et créèrent des nations indépendantes au cœur des empires coloniaux.
Grâce au jeu de cartes quiz HISTOIRE DES MARRONS vous allez apprendre de façon ludique sur la vie des Nègres Marrons.

Chaque jeu de 33 cartes vous est fourni dans une Boite plastique, pratique pour ranger votre quizz et le protéger lors des transports.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia

name: Heroes Call
description:
A quasi-cooperative, monster slaying, hero (deck) building, worker placement game for 2-4 players.

In the land of Zug, being a hero is a way of life! Children spend their days training to defeat the monsters that inhabit the surrounding wilderness in seemingly unending numbers. As a right of passage, all young adults must head out in to the wilderness and survive an adventure of epic proportions. Those who return become Heroes and spend the rest of their days telling the tales of the harrowing creatures and near defeat experienced.

You are one such group of young adults, ready to forge your own story! With the help of a few apprentices you will depart the safety and comfort of your village and embark upon an epic adventure.

Defeat the Big Boss and survive to tell your tale! Fail, and fall into obscurity.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Finale Ending, Market, Open Drafting, Semi-Cooperative Game, Worker Placement

name: Phantom Feud
description:
“Ghosts battle it out inside a house by trapping each other behind walls. The last ghost still able to move through the house wins the right to haunt it for all eternity!”

2-players purple and green, ages 8+
Played on a 10x10 square board.
4 pawns (ghosts) to a side in two colors and supply of tile squares divided diagonally in half, green on one side and purple on the other.

Setup
The board starts out empty. Players in turn add a ghost to an empty square until all 4 of their ghosts are on the board.

Play
Green moves first. Turns then alternate.

On a turn, a player moves a ghost in his color in a straight orthogonal or diagonal line across empty squares or through tiles whose friendly side is facing towards the moving ghost ending the move on an empty square. Then, the player must place a tile on an empty square which is on the same straight orthogonal or diagonal line as the destination square of the last moved ghost. A ghost cannot move through tiles whose enemy side is facing towards them nor can they move along the dividing line of a tile or jump over other ghosts.

The last ghost to move wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: CrissCross Hex
description:
CrissCross Hex is an abstract tile-laying game in which the players race across a board consisting of 271 hexagonal cells to pick up victory-point tiles. You win if you have the highest number of victory points at the end of the game.

There are three types of tiles: path tiles that let you move your meeple across the board, point tiles that let you earn victory points, and end tiles. At set-up, the players place their markers at the edge of the board and identify their destinations at the other end the board with the end tiles. The point tiles are placed at random on 12 defined cells of the board.

On your turn, you place path tiles on the board towards your destination and then use them as stepping stones for your marker. While you move your marker, you may also take advantage of paths laid by other players and, when that happens, you may replace already laid tiles with path tiles that have a higher level of connectivity.

When your marker steps onto a point tile, you pick it up and keep it till the end of the game. The game ends when a player reaches her destination after collecting a pre-defined number of point tiles.

CrissCross Hex includes several features that make it more interesting without significantly increasing its randomness:
1. Three pairs of “teleportation” cells let you jump across the board.
2. Secret bonus card make some point tiles more valuable.
3. Action cards let you break some of the rules.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Race, Tile Placement

name: the memory games
description:
An all time classic, the memory or matching card game, is gone wild, with different levels and ways of playing. This game, made with abstract images, is going to challenge your focus and creativity to be able to remember and get the most matching pairs and win the game.

A fun way to train your mind while having fun with friends and family.

Content: 54 cards. 1 Instructions.

How to play:
Players take turns choosing two cards and turning them over, if the cards match the player keeps the pair, and plays again choosing two more cards. If the cards chosen don’t match, once all players have seen the images, the player returns them to the face down position and the next player takes a turn.
All players should watch the cards being turned over in order to memorize the image and location of the cards.
The player with the most matching pairs is the winner.

Levels of difficulty
1.One colour.
Choose a colour, separate the rest of the coloured cards from the game, place the 18 cards face down and play the memory game searching for the 9 pairs.
2. Bi-colour 18.
Select two colours and choose nine different images in each colour, remove the rest of the cards from the game, place the 18 cards face down and play the memory game searching for the 9 pairs of the same image in the two different colours.
3. Bi-colour 36.
Select two colours and all the cards in each colour, remove the rest of the cards from the game, place the 36 cards face down and play the memory game searching for the 9 pairs of the same image and colour.
4. Bicolor 54.
Play with all 54 cards, searching for pairs of the same image and colour.
5. Bicolor mix 54.
Play with all 54 cards, searching for pairs of the same image never in the same colour. Players will score as follows:
Blue - green 5 pt.
Red - blue 3 pt.
Red - green 2 pt.
Same color 1pt
The player with the highest score wins the game.

Other games:
6. Tricolor 27.
Remove half of the pack so that there is only 1 card of each colour and image remaining so you Play the game with 27 cards, choosing 3 cards each turn, try to locate the same image in all 3 colours.

7. Robo trio 27.
This game is played with 27 cards. Take the 9 images in each colour, shuffle and place face down. Players take turns, choosing two cards, once you have located three of a kind shout trio. If you fail to find all three you miss a go. If another player shouts Trio,he may play after the current players turn. When you find a trio, you take another turn. The player with most trios wins the game.

8. Colour Battle.
Playing with all 54 cards, each player or team chooses a colour, making three teams (or three players). Each team must try to find all pairs of their chosen colour before the others. Each team can take pairs of other teams leaving them with less pairs to win the game. Remember everytime you find a pair, you take another turn.

name: Bolt Action: Tank War – US Starter Set
description:
What used to be one of the most numerous tanks during the war, the M4 Sherman saw battle all over the world. Forming the main battle lines for the British, American and filling in Soviet gaps, the M4 Sherman created the standard that tanks needed to beat. Ahead of the front line, use the M18 Hellcat to scout ahead and outmanoeuvre your opponents.

As typical of US doctrine, armoured divisions had a tank destroyer division attached alongside for long-term usage making this bundle ideal for those who choose to be historically accurate. This bundle also gives you a 1000+ point force, which is capable leading a direct assault or supporting the forward units, flexible for any situation on the battlefield.

—description from the publisher's website
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Bolt Action: Tank War – Soviet Starter Set
description:
With over 70,000 units produced the T-34 is famous for its unconventional design. When it arrived early in the war the T-34 became a threat that the German's just couldn't handle. Designed to replace the monster sized KV tank series, the IS-2 was just as big and heavy but was even nastier. Equipped with a massive 122mm gun, its intention was to be a breakthrough tank, demolishing fortifications and clearing enemy positions.

Two brutal armoured platoons come from this starter set, both with the potential to break entire armies. Forming the main battle line would be the IS-2s, with tough armour, a gargantuan 122mm gun and 3 machine guns, you can send this platoon to clear the path for the follow-up task force. Which would be the T-34 Squadron, who have plenty of armour and firepower to sweep away whatever remains.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Bolt Action: Tank War – British Starter Set
description:
American lend-lease allows the British to field the Sherman and British engineers improved these tanks even further, putting it's fire power above most American versions with the Sherman V Firefly, equipped with a 17-pdr cannon which was one of the most deadly anti-tank weapons of the war, capable of tearing through the heaviest of armour.

To match the German heavy tanks toe to toe, the British created the Churchill, one of the heaviest and sturdiest Allied tanks.

This starter set lets you field two armoured platoons, one full of impregnable Churchill tanks which will be at the front of your line taking an enormous amount of punishment, the other provides your tank destroyer capability, with the Firefly reliably taking out any target from over 1,000 m away. Using these two platoons in conjunction with one another creates a mobile platform of deadly, precise and efficient, high-value target destroying, objective holding, break through enemy line must have units for your army!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Ravens of Karnage
description: Fast and easy-to-play rules for gaming fantasy battles in 15mm or 25mm. While designed especially for the land of Karnage and Black Raven Foundry miniatures, the rules will work with any other worlds or figures. Rules cover wizards & magic, creatures, champions, weather, and a points system for fighting battles of orcs, trolls, elves, dwarves and all sorts of other good and evil creations.

name: Die Wälder von Carcassonne V2 (fan-erweiterung für Carcassonne)
description:
The name already reveals it: In this expansion the forest is introduced as a new landscape feature. But Andreas was not satisfied with that, because e.g. with the avenues as new road maps, the pyre or the trees there are some more features.
The design of Andreas was not used for following expansions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Fearless Creatures: B is for Biome Pack
description:
An 18 card set of biospheres that represent individual creatures, groups of creatures, creature capabilities. Some standalone, some interact with other creature cards, and some alter the status of the game.

Expands the base Fearless Creatures card game with more variety and adds an element of mystery.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare

name: Fearless Creatures: Add Players Pack
description:
An expansion pack for Fearless Creatures that adds support for playing games with 3 or 4 players.

Extra cards for herd animals from the base game (and other expansions), plus some cards that are unique to this pack.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare

name: Fearless Creatures: P is for Panda Pack
description: An expansion pack for Fearless Creatures that mostly adds pandas (red panda, giant panda, brown panda, trash panda, panda ant), but also adds some new places and some new creatures.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare

name: Chevrons
description:
2 players Red and Blue

A hexagonal board made up of triangles. A supply of Red chevrons and Blue chevrons and supply of Red and Blue cubes.

Play
Red moves first. Then turns alternate.

On a turn place a chevron in your color on the board along 2 edges that meet at 120 degrees. A chevron cannot be placed so that it is fully or partially inside of a previously enclosed area.

An area of empty cells encircled by edges of both colors counts for the player with the most edges bordering it. Once an area is encircled it is immediately claimed by placing a cube in a player's color within the area. This includes areas that are encircled simultaneously for either player.

The game ends when a player is unable to take his turn.

Scoring
Players count all the triangular cells within their claimed areas.

Open areas (areas not fully encircled) and areas encircled with an equal number of Blue and Red edges are not counted.

The player encircling the greater number of cells is the winner.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement

name: 1,000 Year Beard: The Whisker Wizard
description:
Advanced rules and cards for 1,000 Year Beard. Powerful new player cards allow for more fantastic beard-growing options. The new Pocket cards add varied boosted-actions and let Dwarfs hold an extra card!

PnP files found on record for 1,000 Year Beard

-description from designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Math, Number, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That

name: Der Kraftkönig
description:
The game pieces are black on one side and white on the other side. The starting player sets one piece with his color on top in the center space. This is the powerking (Kraftkönig). Then the players set alternately pieces of their color on the 8 spaces surrounding the powerking (satellites). Then the game spreads to the outer area. Each player may place a piece adjacent to an enemy piece, thereby enclosing a number of enemy pieces between two own pieces. The enclosed pieces (including, should the situation arise, the powerking and his satellites) are turned over to change their color. The game ends when all spaces are occupied.

The players are awarded points for any pieces of their color: 1 point for each piece in the outer area, 9 points for the powerking and 3 points for each of his satellites.

The player with the most points wins the game.

This game is a variant of "Reversi" and was released in booklet format in "Bunkerspiele Heft 2 - Spiele unter Kameraden" with the game board and cut-out game pieces in the back of the booklet.

—user summary

name: Ultreïa! Le Jeu des Chemins de Saint-Jacques-de-Compostelle
description:
Ultreïa!
Be the first to reach Santiago de Compostela as you progress on the pilgrimage routes that cross France and Spain.
In the footsteps of the pilgrims of the Middle Ages, brave the vagaries of the road, and discover the history of St James by answering the questions that mark your journey!

Contents: 5 route boards, 105 questions, 25 Hazard cards, 30 immunity cards, 1 die, 4 pawns, and instructions.

Ultreïa ! Soyez le premier à atteindre Saint-Jacques-de-Compostel
le en progressant sur les chemins de pèlerinage qui traversent la France et l’Espagne.
Dans les pas des pèlerins du Moyen Âge, bravez les aléas de la route, et découvrez l’histoire jacquaire en répondant aux questions qui jalonnent votre parcours !
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Mage Knight Rebellion: Atlantis Guild Army Expansion
description: This is a 8 figure, pre-painted, 200 point Atlantean army plus one random rare figure from the Rebellion (Mage Knight 1st edition) set and a strategy guide for the Atlantean army.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: むうてえこく (Muuteekoku)
description:
The players board a submarine that goes to the bottom of the sea to find an old sunken city. Equipped with the information board and a sonar device, they make their way to the ocean floor. We can only win together.

At the start of the game the clue cards (that show coordinates relative to the start tile) are shuffled and each player receives one and places it face down in front of them. One of the remaining clue cards is placed face up in the middle. This face up card indicates where the entrance to the lost city is. The player who was last at the sea begins. This player receives the sonar map, the start card and four red markers.

When all players have first reached the spot on their clue cards and then the spot with the entrance to the lost city all players have won. If there are fewer than two sea tiles left in the pile, if the submarine was dealt more than six points of damage or if the submarine cannot move the players lose.

A player takes the following three actions during a turn:

1) Repair the submarine:
If the sub has a point or more damage, it can be repaired. To do this, the player takes the topmost sea tile from one pile and take it out of the game. All the damage is repaired.

2) Move the submarine:
The submarine can move onto an adjacent tile that has already been placed.

And finally 3) Use the sonar device, which is the main mechanism of the game:
The player chooses one of the top sea tiles and announces where they would like to place it. The turn player closes their eyes and the other players prepare the box according to the instructions on the sea tile. With the help of wooden clips the lid is placed on top so that the player cannot look inside. The turn player opens their eyes and pull the bell at any speed and marks it on the sonar map with the red stones, which places are vacant in each row and are therefore safe for submarine passage. This action can be repeated using the hourglass scale. However, if this is zero, the player has to rely on the first time. The cover is removed and the sonar card is checked. For wrong markers the submarine receives points of damage. After the sonar task is completed the player can place the tile and it is the next player's turn.
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: Ghosts on Oak Island
description:
You find yourself in an ethereal world of Ghosts. Four Pirates, a Viking, and a Nights Templar are stuck on the Island and need your help. There is a curse keeping them on the island until the treasure is found.

Find the Treasure to set them free, but you need to prove yourself as well. Collect Equipment for their ship so they can sail away in full gear or as much as you can get and in return, they will reward you.

Players will journey around the board collecting equipment, camps, treasures and skills, taking and repairing damage along the way. Use your Skill to traverse the Island digging your way to find small treasures and to the final big treasure.

When a player finds all of the Blue equipment, that player receives a map giving them access to Oak Island by unlocking the secrets of when to approach the island. That player then continues the journey on the island spaces. Be the first player to find the big treasure to end the game, count your victory points to see who wins.
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Ownership, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Victory Points as a Resource

name: yanaginagi
description:
yanaginagi re-implements Oink's 2018 release "TomaTomato" in which players must be able to recite tongue-twisters created from a stack of cards that show the parts of the game's title, such as "nagi", "ya", "yanagi", and "yanaginagi".

A player rolls a die showing how many tiles will be revealed on each player's turn, with the next player needing to recite the words on the card as if it was one long word. Play continues until a player is unable to properly finish the word, at which point the players collect some tiles from the string.

Collected tiles will be combined to earn points for each "yanagi" or "yanaginagi" possible. The player with the most points when the deck runs out wins.

There are also a few special tiles, such as one that reverses the order in which the tiles must be read and one that reads "komugi".

The art in the game is credited to the Japanese musician yanaginagi from whom the game gets its title.

name: L'osti d'jeu: Brocoli
description:
A promo pack of 4 cards released for the weekend of Salon du jeu de société de Montréal in 19 and 20 November 2016.

The cards are added to the deck and play as usual.

name: Motor Psycho Soccer
description:
Get on your bike, grab a ball, flick your brain switch to 'Crazy'...you're about to play Motor Psycho Soccer.
Starting off in the muddy wasteland at the back of an industrial estate your team's sights are set on the luxury stadiums at the top tiers of the sport but it won't be easy. Your rivals all have the same dreams and won't be happy until they have ridden you into the pitch and left their tyre tracks on your back.
All you can do is remount and struggle against the odds until you have glory firmly in a headlock and club it into submission.

Think you're tough enough? Get on the pitch and we'll see...

This is a turn based system with one team going first, moving and taking actions with their whole team, followed by the other team doing the same. The game continues in this manner until a goal is scored and the teams set up again as described in set up.

The length of the match can be decided in advance. You could set a time limit with halves or quarters controlled by a timer, play a set number of turns each before the match ends, or set a goal limit (ie: first time to three goals).

name: Pixel Lincoln: John Wilkes Tooth Promo Card
description:
UnPub 3 Promo Card

Given out during UnPub 3.

Card is a Mini Boss, Power 5

Card Text States:

You done it now. Called down the thunder...a buck 25 pure fury!
Sic Semper Cavities!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme

name: American War of Independence: 1775-1781 – Miniature Game Rule Book
description:
American War of Independence: 1775-1781 – Miniature Game Rule Book
The American war of Independence was fought from 1775 - 1783, eight long years of war.
This started out as a colony of 13 independent states joined together to fight England, one of the most powerful countries in the world.
Campaigns were fought across the northern, middle and southern states before finally becoming the United States of America.

These rules allow you to re-fight the battles of the AWI by forming Companies, Battalions, and Brigades.
You can even command Indian war parties, and conduct raids.
Each unit spends actions to maneuver and fight across the table top, providing a simple command & control system.

While it is easy to play it is difficult to master.

This includes a scenario for Cowpens.

Company - Regimental Level Rules - Using D10’s and a few D6’s.

—description from the publisher

name: Swordpoint: Genghis Khan
description:
Swordpoint Genghis Khan is a campaign supplement for the Swordpoint Ancient & Medieval Rules set.
It provides you with all the information you need to refight the campaigns of the legendary Mongol rules, Genghis Khan!

The book contains three new and six tailored or revised Army Lists plus nine new scenarios.

Mongol 1206AD to 1227AD
Xi XIa 1038AD to 1227AD
Jin Dynasty 1115AD to 1234AD
Kara-Khitai 1132AD to 1218AD
Khwarezmian Emoire 1218AD to 1223AD
Kipchak 1200AD to 1280AD
Georgia 1089AD to 1221AD
Rus 1132 to 1243AD
Volgar Bulgar 965AD to 1241AD


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Swordpoint: Charlemagne
description:
The first Campaign supplement for the SWORDPOINT Rulebook

Refight the campaigns of legendary Frankish King, Charlemagne!

Contains 3 new and 5 extended army lists plus nine new scenarios.

NB You will need a copy of Swordpoint Ruleset to use this book!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Swordpoint: To the Ends of the Earth
description:
Swordpoint To the Ends of the Earth is a Campaign supplement for the Swordpoint Ancient & Medieval Wargames Rule set. It provides you with all the information you need to refight the Wars of Alexander and his Successors.

It includes 5 new army lists, 12 extended or tailored army lists and 10 scenarios.

Army Lists

Philip and the Rise of Macedon
Early Macedonian Army to 359 BC
Reformed Macedonian Army 359 BC to 328 BC

Control of Greece
Greek Alliance Army
Securing the Borders
Thracian Army

Alexander and the Great Persian Adventure
Persian Army

To the Ends of the Earth
Alexandrian Macedonian Army 328 BC to 323 BC
Indian Army

Death of Alexander and the Successor Wars
Antigonos’ Army
Eumenes' Army
Coalition Army

Struggles for Greece
Later Macedonian Army
Greek Army 280 BC to 146 BC

The Gallic Invasion of Greece and Asia Minor
Aetolian League Army

Asia and Egypt: Ptolemy II and the Kingdom of Kush
Ptolemaic Army
Kushite Army

Asia and Egypt: The Seleucid Empire Splinters... ... and Recovers
Graeco-Bactrian Army
Seleucid Army of Antiochos III in 209 B



A copy of Swordpoint Ancient and Medieval Wargames Rules is required to use this book.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Gil et John
description:
Principle: reach the towns listed on the cards that were drawn first while escaping the filter dams thanks to the CRS (Police) card.

Gil et John is a play on word in French on the Yellow Jackets (Gilets Jaunes) protest movement that started in 2018.

Pour avancer, il suffit de jeter le dès et d’avancer d’autant de case que donne le tirage. Tant que la voie est libre le joueur peut avancer son pion en traversant les villes qui n’ont pas de barrages filtrants mais doit s’arrêter avant si un barrage le bloque. (Les villes ne comptent pas pour une case). Bloquer les autres joueurs en plaçant des barrages filtrants sur les villes qu’ils devront traverser pour réaliser leur trajet. Après avoir lancé le dès et avancé son pion, le joueur tire une carte surprise qui peut-être soit un barrage filtrant, soit un CRS. Si c’est un barrage filtrant il peut de suite l’utiliser pour installer un barrage filtrant sur la ville qui lui semble la plus stratégique pour gêner les autres joueurs. Dans ce cas, il montre la carte aux autres joueurs, la replace au fond de la pile surprise d’où il l’a tirée et met un jeton jaune sur la ville de son choix. Si c’est une carte CRS, il la conserve pour l’utiliser en cas de besoin plus tard.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Don
description:
Don is an abstract strategy game, with a little taste of chance.
Each player has 8 dice(4 four D dice and 4 six D dice) at the beginning of the game.
The player who can deliver two dice to the last rank (opponent’s base) is the winner of the game.
The number shown on each die is the number of squars it must move.dice can’t move diagonally.
After each movement players can decide to increase the dice number.

—description from the designer

name: Harry Potter Miniature Game: First Years Lessons Pack
description:
After every student board the Hogwarts Express on platform 9 ¾ for the first time nothing will be the same. First year at Hogwarts will show them a completely new world full of wonders, adventures and magic.


3 Detailed ready to paint & assemble miniatures
3 30 mm bases
3 Character cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Trump The World
description:
Trump The World: Make Parties Great Again!

The goal is simple: You need to beat Trump at his own game by pointing out what is true and what is not.

How to play

One after another, each player picks the card on top of the deck and reads it out loud (to make things even more interesting, try reading the card with Trump’s voice!).
If it is a QUOTE CARD, everyone else has to guess if Trump actually said that quote, or if it is fake news, using their answer card to do so! Every player who has a good answer gets a point.

If it is a TRUMP CARD, everyone has to do what the card asks. If there is a decision to make, the player who has picked the card will act as the judge. Only the player who wins gets a point.
Winning the game: The first player to successfully beat Trump at his own game and to get 10 points wins!

Other ways to play the game:

Drinking game! (18+) : If you want to spice things up, pour yourself a drink and every time you get a wrong answer, drink it!
In teams! : If you are more of a team player, you can form teams of 2 players or more and try to convince one of your friends to act as the game master, who will read every card, and make every decision!

—description from the designer

name: DOS: Defeat O.D.I.N. System
description: An innovative german board game with TCG soul that puts 2-5 hackers in a cyberchallenge for the salvation of their virtual identity
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Moving Multiple Units, Turn Order: Claim Action, Victory Points as a Resource

name: The Race to Utah
description:
Materials
41 Train Cards and 1 Tender Card.
8 coal tokens and 2 black wooden train tokens. And an instruction booklet.

Goal
The player to reach the Promontory Summit in Utah wins the Transcontinental Railroad Race of 1869!

Setup
One player plays along the Central Pacific Line and the other along the Union Pacific Line.

Place one train token next to the card marked Sacramento and the other train next to the card marked Omaha.

Place the Tender card and 8 coal tokens nearby.

Play
Decide who goes first.

Players take turns.

Select a numbered space on the Tender card and cover it with a coal token. Then move your train that many steps.

If the number of spaces that your train stops on is less than your opponents then select another number on the Tender card and cover it with another coal token. Then move your train that many steps.

If the number of spaces that your train stops on is equal to or greater than your opponents, your turn ends.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, American West, Children's Game, Print & Play, Racing, Trains

name: Circino: le Chasseur de Trésors – Destination Puy-de-Dôme
description:
CIRCINO - Goal of the game

The players select 8 "Objective" cards (= 8 communes) and they collect the 8 "Objective" pellets corresponding to these 8 cards. They shuffle them face down then place them on the different chests on the game board.

Each player then collects at random or he chooses 2 "Objective" cards among the 8 selected.

The goal of the game will consist in finding the 2 “Objective” pellets corresponding to his 2 cards then in bringing them back the 1st to Circino in the center of the board ... with as only weapons the dice and his sense of adventure!

In their quest, players will not be alone and can count on the help of members of the Circino family through Bonus Cards.

CIRCINO - But du jeu

Les joueurs sélectionnent 8 cartes "Objectif" (donc 8 communes) et ils récupèrent les 8 pastilles "Objectif" correspondantes à ces 8 cartes. Ils les mélangent faces cachées puis les disposent sur les différents coffres du plateau de jeu.

Chaque joueur récupère ensuite au hasard ou bien il choisit 2 cartes "Objectif" parmi les 8 sélectionnées.

Le But du jeu va consister à retrouver les 2 pastilles "Objectif" correspondantes à ses 2 cartes puis à les ramener le 1er à Circino au centre du plateau...avec comme seules armes le dé et son sens de l'aventure !

Dans leur quête, les joueurs ne seront pas seuls et pourront compter sur l'aide des membres de la famille Circino par le biais des cartes Bonus
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Phoenix Command: High Tech Weapon Data Supplement (Second Edition)
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


This is the second edition of the High-Tech Weapon Data Supplement, and features a number of new weapons, including Scatterpack Handguns and Backpack-fed Flechette Guns, as well as full data covering the improvement of the weapons over a period of 250 years. This supplement is an ideal companion for Heavy Metal, the Power Armor Supplement, and can be used with either Phoenix Command or Living Steel.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Back Of Beyond Skirmish Rules
description:
A set of rules for skirmish games in the Back of Beyond, each player has 8-12 figures ideal for multi player games.

Command forces of Chinese, Russian, Mongolian and loads of other nationalities as well as bandits and archaeologists, could also be used for WW1 and many Inter War encounters as well.

—description from the publisher
categories: Civil War, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Victory at Sea: Mogami 1939
description:
Mogami was the lead ship of her class, which consisted of four heavy cruisers which served in the Imperial Japanese Navy. These were exceptionally large for light cruisers, but were constructed in such a manner as to obey the Washington Naval Treaty of 1922, but could easily be refitted as heavy cruisers by refitting their batteries with twin 8-inch guns. This was completed in 1937.

Mogami served in several engagements during the war, notably at the Battle of Sundra Strait and the Battle of Midway. She met her fate at the Battle of the Surigao Strait on 15th October 1944, where was shelled by USS Portland, collided with a friendly vessel, Nachi, and was subsequently attacked by 17 Avenger torpedo-bombers. It was not long after that, adrift, her crew abandoned her and the ship was scuttled.

This cruiser can also be found in the Battle for the Pacific Victory at Sea starter set.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: USS Indianapolis 1944
description:
A Portland-class heavy cruiser, Indianapolis served as flagship for Admiral Raymond Spruance in 1943 and 1944 as he commanded the actions of the fifth fleet in the central pacific. She was ever-present in supporting the Island Hopping Campaigns of the Marianas and later supported the invasion of Okinawa.

It was Indianapolis in July 1945 which secretly transported parts of ‘Little Boy’, the first nuclear weapon used in combat, to the USAAF base on Tinian. The same month, whilst on training exercises in the Philippines, she was struck and sunk by a torpedo from Japanese sub, I-58. 890 survivors faced four days of exposure, dehydration, saltwater poisoning and shark attacks before rescue, leading to only 316 survivors. This marks the single greatest loss of life from a single ship in the history of the US Navy.

This cruiser can also be found in the Battle for the Pacific Victory at Sea starter set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Kumano 1944
description:
Kumano was of the Mogami-class, which consisted of four heavy cruisers which served in the Imperial Japanese Navy. These were exceptionally large for light cruisers, but were constructed in such a manner as to obey the Washington Naval Treaty of 1922, but could easily be refitted as heavy cruisers by refitting their batteries with twin 8-inch guns. This was completed in 1937.

Kumano served in numerous engagements during the war, tangling with British steamships in the Indian Ocean Raids, supporting the reinforcement of Guadalcanal and escorting “Tokyo Express” convoys. Struck by two American torpedoes from Submarines in November 1944, she was towed to Santa Cruz to enact repairs. However, she came under attack by aircraft launched from the carrier USS Ticonderoga, rolling over and sinking.

This cruiser can also be found in the Battle for the Pacific Victory at Sea starter set.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: USS Northampton 1942
description:
The lead of her class, the USS Northampton was initially classified as a light cruiser because for relatively thin armour but was later reclassified to a heavy cruiser owing to her 8-inch guns. She served in the Pacific theatre as part of USS Enterprises task force, screening the carrier at the Battle of Midway. She later participated in the operations of Guadalcanal.

During attempts to prevent Japanese reinforcements to Guadalcanal, she fought in the Battle of Tassafaronga. Towards the end of this engagement, Northampton was struck by two torpedoes and was sunk, though most of her crew survived and were rescued and picked up by Task Force 67.

This cruiser can also be found in the Battle for the Pacific Victory at Sea starter set.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Furutaka 1939
description:
Furutaka was the lead of her two-ship class of heavy cruiser. She was named for the mountain located on the island of Etajima, off Hiroshima bay, directly behind the Imperial Japanese Navy Academy.

She participated in the Battle of the Coral Sea and the Battle of Savo Island, but met her fate at the Battle of Cape Esperance on 12th October 1942, at the hand of USS Salt Lake City and USS Duncan.

This cruiser can also be found in the Battle for the Pacific Victory at Sea starter set.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: USS Chicago 1942
description:
A Northampton-class vessel, Chicago served in the Pacific during the early years of World War Two. Though surviving attacks by midget submarines in Sydney Harbour and serving in the battle of the Coral Sea and Savo Island in 1942, it was at the Battle of Rennell Island that she was sunk on 30 January 1943, when she was struck by Japanese aerial torpedoes whilst escorting a convoy bound for Guadalcanal.

This cruiser can also be found in the Battle for the Pacific Victory at Sea starter set.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Fubuki-class Destroyers
description:
Fubuki-class are described as the world’s first “modern” destroyer, twenty-four of the class served in the Imperial Japanese Navy. They were built between 1926 and 1933, and despite being decidedly older than some of their adversaries, they remained formidable opponents until the end of the war.

Of the twenty-four vessels, only two survived the war, with eight sunk by submarine, two by mines and many by air attacks. Notably, the Ayanami traded fire with the battleship USS North Dakota during the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal, inflicting severe damage, but was then set upon by USS Washington.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Fletcher-class Destroyers
description:
Designed in 1939, some 175 Fletcher-class destroyers were commissioned between 1942 and 1944, more than any other class of destroyer. They performed every task expected of a destroyer, including anti-aircraft, anti-submarine and more traditional surface-based actions.

They served almost exclusively in the Pacific during World War II, capable of covering the vast distances required by fleet actions. In total, Fletcher-class destroyers accounted for the destruction of 20 Imperial Japanese Navy submarines.
The 'Fletcher-class was considered a successful design and many went on to serve in the Korean War and at Vietnam.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Four Day Weekend
description:
Slacking isn't just a pastime, it's a calling. Four Day Weekend players build card sets detailing the true art of avoiding work. Each set must show a (not very) plausible reason for missing work, the real activity the slacker is pursuing, and one to four methods of attaining the necessities for survival while not working: food, cash, shelter, and transportation.

Players begin each turn with up to five cards in hand, discarding and replenishing before actually playing cards into sets. The discards are placed in front of the player - replenishment cards can be taken from the draw pile or from other players' discard rows. Once the player has five cards, he/she creates and adds to sets.

Points for sets are calculated from base card values, card combination multipliers, and bonus card conditions.

For example, the player might start a new set with the "Fell Off The Roof Again" Excuse. She adds the "Building a Couch Fort" Activity and the "Van Full of Nuns" Transportation card she picked up from another player's discard pile.

Each round ends when at least three complete sets have been created and a player declares "Back to Work-ish." Total up the sets, and the slacker with the most points wins.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Shooting Stars: Wargames Rules for Simulating Space Warfare in the Far Future
description:
Shooting stars

Gaming space battles, the cinematic way!

Fast play space gaming rules, designed for maximum flexibility and minimum hassle, using any old models that you have lying around!

Detailed rulebook and ready ref sheet.

Four example spacefaring Cultures to battle.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Shooting Stars: Around the Table
description:
Around the Table is a supplement book for Shooting Stars the space warfare simulation wargame.

Contains descriptions and ship detail sheets for sixteen new Spacefaring Cultures!

Warning: This is not a complete game. You must have a copy of Shooting Stars to fully utilise this book.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Shooting Stars: Constellation!
description:
Constellation! - a supplement book for Shooting Stars! the space warfare simulation wargame.

Contains descriptions and ship detail sheets for sixteen new Spacefaring Cultures!

Warning: This is not a complete game. You must have a copy of Shooting Stars to fully utilise this book.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Quader
description:
A strategic game for 2 people.

A richly varied three-dimensional game in which the players have to try to build geometric combinations with two-tone double blocks and at the same time tactically thwart the opponent's plans. Since a cuboid with the color of the opponent is automatically placed with each move, there are almost unlimited possibilities of combinations. For the first two moves in game 1 alone 1.400!
There are 5 different ways to play:
1. game: Three blocks of the same color in a horizontal, vertical or diagonal combination of three.
2. game: Four squares of the same color in a vertical, horizontal or vertex combination of four.
3. game: Several horizontal, vertical or diagonal three-way combinations.
4. game: Several cuboids of the same color in a vertical, horizontal or vertex-combination of four.
5. game: Several vertical, horizontal and diagonal three-way combinations like game 1 and several vertical, horizontal and upside-down four-way combinations like game 4.

—user summary

name: Wanderlust: Travel Card Game
description:
Do you love to travel? Do you like planning your vacations? Or you enjoy relaxing getaways. Wanderlust is a card game for everyone. Get a taste of travelling to different countries, explore what each place has to offer and make friends. Win rewards for exploring, planning or simply being the most fun person.

The Wanderlust card game starts like all card games – cards are shuffled and distributed between all the players. The rules mention different numbers of cards which are to be distributed to the players if different numbers of players are playing.

After the cards are distributed — the main objective of the game, making sets starts guiding the players. The unique thing about Wanderlust is the close connect between the story and the game mechanism. Sets need to made — but why, which and most importantly how?

The game has four type of cards. Destination cards, Currency cards, Journey cards and Reward cards. Each of the sets (Explorer, Planner and Fun Person) has a certain sequence of cards specified. This sequence is a mix of Destination and Currency cards or only one of these two kinds of cards.

In the game players collect Currency cards and trade Journey cards to get different Destination and Currency cards. This way different kinds of sets are made and Reward cards are won. The number of sets to be made is finite. The game is over when the Reward cards are over or if the game play gets stuck.

It contains 52 high quality cards and 1 easy-to-understand manual.

-description from designer

name: Mental Morris
description:
Mental Morris is a two player abstract played entirely in the mind. It is however played on a mental board of 3x3 squares with three pieces each. The object is the game is to form a straight line of your pieces, either diagonally or orthogonally. If a player makes an illegal move, the opponent wins.

The board is numbered from top to bottom like a num pad. 1,2,3 on top, 4,5,6 on the next row and 7,8,9 on the final row.

Players initially place their three pieces on free squares by calling out the number of the square where they want their piece to be. After that players call out moves by naming the square of the piece they want to move, and then the square they want their piece to move to. Say it as one number, i.e. "fifty eight", (58). Pieces may move only one space in an orthogonal direction. Pieces may not share a square, and jumping over pieces is not allowed.

—description from the designer

name: Astro Antics
description:
Astro Antics is a space race board game produced in 1961. The game is a simple roll and move of pieces that resemble Mercury capsules of the era.
The object of the game is to be the first to make one full orbit of the earth and return safely. A player can get trapped into a circular path around a spiral Nebula which will delay their progress. Two sets of cards "Orbit Chances" and "Emergency Instructions" are in the game and players must obey the directions if instructed to do so. Some of the instructions like make an ugly face or sing a song are supposed to add fun to the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Best 11 Board Game: Inter
description:
BEST 11 is an official F.C.Internazionale product: an exciting board game during which the participants will have to try to put their very personal Inter line-up into play by choosing the most suitable module and coach, complete the San Siro stadium, recover the economic resources necessary for the management of the company , take advantage of the events in their favor and challenge each other in search of a goal that could change the fate of the game.


BEST 11 è un prodotto ufficiale F.C. Internazionale: un board game avvincente durante il quale i partecipanti dovranno cercare di mettere in gioco una loro personalissima formazione dell’Inter scegliendo il modulo e l’allenatore più adatto, completare lo stadio di San Siro, recuperare le risorse economiche necessarie alla gestione della società, sfruttare gli avvenimenti a proprio favore e sfidarsi alla ricerca di un gol che potrebbe cambiare le sorti della partita.

name: The Polka-Dot Game
description:
The game is played on an 8x8 checkerboard of white and light grey squares.

Pieces consist of Dots in 8 colors - Pink, Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Indigo, Turquoise, and Purple. There are 8 Dots for each color, for a total of 64 pieces.

The two players divide up the Dots however they like so that one player has all of 4 colors, and the other player has all of the of the other 4 colors.

Players take turns placing a Dot on any empty space on the board - with the following restriction: a Dot may not be placed on any square that shares the same row, column, or diagonal of a Dot of the same color.

First player unable to place a Dot on their turn loses.

-description from designer

name: Everbane
description:
Everbane is a role playing card game for 2 to 6 players where each player takes on the role of an epic hero in a cold and unforgiving world . Each hero is battling to be the most notorious hero in the land. Accomplish the most dangerous quests and be the first to get 10 prestige points to win the game. Trick your opponents, steal their loot, duel them & send monster on them. Use any means necessary to take advantage of your adversary.

ACCOMPLISH EPIC QUESTS

Draw a card from the quest pile and reveal it to the other players. Compete with other heroes to be the first to finish the quest. Each accomplished quest will give you prestige points. Be the first to get 10 and become Everbane’s most notorious hero !

TREACHERY & CUNNING

Duel your opponents, steal their card, unleash monsters against them and force them to trade their cards with you. Use any means necessary to take advantage of your adversaries.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Interrupts, King of the Hill, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Commotion
description:
"The Fun, Fast, and Frantic Word Game!"

Players draw a card to determine a random secret. They give give a one-word clues to help other players guess the secret word. If someone does, the guesser and clue giver both score points. When someone reaches 9 points, there is a showdown where that player has a chance to win the game.

The original game was released in 1990. In 2020, a limited number of copies were re-released as the 30th Anniversary Edition, apparently using components discovered in storage from the original game. All copies of the new edition are signed by Edward Carter.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Targeted Clues
publishers: Edward J Carter Games, Spooky Tower Games

name: Trivial Pursuit: Inter – Bite Size
description:
Pocket version of the world famous Trivial Pursuit.
600 questions about the world of Inter Milan Football Club.
Some of these questions will put even the most experienced fans in difficulty!
The game does not require any board and can be carried in its convenient triangular box.
Test your knowledge of the following topics:

Coaches,
League,
Curiosities,
Players,
International Matches,
Victories.


Versione Tascabile del Famosissimo Trivial Pursuit.
600 domande sul mondo del Inter Milano Football Club.
Alcune di queste domande metteranno in difficoltà persino i tifosi più esperti!
Il gioco non richiede alcun tabellone e può essere trasportato nella sua comoda confezione triangolare.
Metti alla prova la tua conoscenza dei seguenti argomenti:

Allenatori,
Campionato,
Curiosità ,
Giocatori,
Partite Internazionali,
Vittorie.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Sports, Trivia

name: ポーション (Potion)
description:
In potion, each player get cards with objectives on them. They will then try to fill a pot with the amount of leaves and cubes needed and take that pot when it's done.

There are two catches, though.
They need to take care of not overflowing the pot with ingredients or else, they will get no point for there objectives.
Also, they need to remember what other players put inside those pots which are not translucent.
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: Operation Cedar Falls: A Black Sun Operational Campaign
description:
On January 8th, 1967 American lead forces jumped off on the largest American ground operation of the Vietnam War. It would last 20 days. The operation had been planned to remove the Viet Cong threat from an area north of Saigon known as the Iron Triangle. This area, only about 155 square km in size, was a major stronghold of the Viet Cong.

This 15 page PDF uses the BLACK SUN skirmish rules in a strictly historical operation led by US Army forces in the Iron Triangle area of Vietnam. It adds larger game play elements to the Black Sun universe. Provided are new Force Cards, New "What the...?!" Cards (ready to be printed and played with) and a three scenario campaign that can be enjoyed by multiple players.It also provides new rules including a Forward Observer and mortar team, starting fires and a Scenario Point objective system to determine the winner of a multi scenario campaign.

This Operational Campaign utilizes Platoon size units for game play and is designed for advanced Black Sun players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: Operation Lift Off: A Black Sun Operational Campaign
description:
This mini-campaign introduces one of the ways that the real world began to interact with the Black Sun event and allows the players to game out this early period of the Black Sun universe story. This mini-campaign will be set during the early period of the Vietnam War and the first scenario represents a secret operation by CIA agents supported by uniformed US ARMY troops and some local hired labour. The Viet Cong troops are indeed moving through the area and attack this target of opportunity.

Forces are then transported to the BLACK SUN event and all kinds of chaos ensues.

This Operational Campaign is intended for use by new players to the Black Sun universe and introduces background and story elements of horror to the players. This three scenario mini campaign includes new Force Cards for many different factions, new "What the...?!" Cards (ready to print and play) and some new advanced rules including veteran warriors. If you were part of the Black Sun Kickstarter you will have many of the troops needed for this game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: Dragon's Gate
description:
The goal of Dragon's Gate is to be the first player to get one of your own Dragons across the board and through the enemy’s gate. (The corner spaces marked with Chinese characters are nominally the posts of the gate.)

A Dragon moves forward by taking a single step, either diagonally or vertically, onto an empty space. A Dragon may also fly (jump) forward over a single friendly Dragon to the empty space just beyond. But it may not fly over an enemy Dragon.

A Dragon captures enemy pieces by withdrawal. This means if a Dragon begins its turn with an enemy Dragon adjacent and just in front of it, it may take a single step backwards, in the opposite direction, to the empty space just behind it.(Imagine a Dragon rearing its head back to breathe fire.) The enemy Dragon is then removed from the board.

In a typical game of breakthrough/attainment there are usually two basic elements: 1. - The player is trying to advance his own pieces across the board. 2. – The player attacks his opponent’s pieces to prevent him from doing the same. Backwards captures is a mechanic that affects both of these simultaneously. You can remove one of your opponent’s pieces only at the cost of delaying your own advancement.

-description from designer

name: For King and Parliament: The Battle of Roundway Down
description:
The TtS! Battle of Roundway Down scenario is a digital download, designed for the TtS! For King and Parliament English Civil War rules, but useful with other rule systems too.
It will suit two to four players. It's a most unusual battle, with the Royalist army consisting almost entirely of horse, heavily outnumbered and attacking uphill. And winning!

The 12 page PDF includes a brief account of the campaign and a reconstruction of the battle. It contains orders of battle for both sides, two alternative deployment diagrams and several images of beautifully painted wargames figures. It can be viewed on a tablet or printed out and bound.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Lee at Antietam
description:
Lee at Antietam is a small wargame on the battle that occurred near Sharpsburg on 17 September 1862.
This game is intended to serve as an introduction to history gaming for younger players while advanced and optional rules provide an enjoyable game for experienced players.

Those who have played our other Civil War games such as Lee at Gettysburg will find many new concepts introduced, making Lee at Antietam closer to the complexity of a 'low complexity' wargame.

Advanced and optional rules based on historical events are included for more experienced players looking for a deeper and more complicated game.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: #URNT
description:
Two monuments, both alike in dignity, in the fair Parthenon where we lay our scene ...

From Ancient Greek break into mutiny…

“Spartan strength is the only way to "URN" the victory!”

Ares’ gravelly voice and stone-cold stare were enough to make anyone tremble. Except for Apollo... who glared back, unwavering.

“Athenian abilities are far better. Brains beat brawn in the end.”

Fortunately, you know that a powerful society consists instead of a balance between sword and wits… between strength and ability... between Spartans and Athenians...

URNT is a simple deck-building game for 2 players of any age. Players begin with six basic Spartans and draft a few other cards and resources to build their starting deck.

On your turn:

1. Collect your wages. You'll receive 5 coins at the beginning of each turn. (If you have hired perpetual BANKERS, you may collect even more coins every turn.)

2. Spend coins to hire Spartans and Athenians to improve your deck. Recruit perpetuals to gain advantages for every turn.

3. Challenge your rival(s) in the AGORA by playing 4 or 5 cards. Your rival(s) must respond to each card you play. Whichever player wins the majority will get one Victory Point.

4. Finally, each player discards the cards that they played into their own personal discard pile and replenishes their hand back up to 5 cards. (If you have hired a perpetual FISHERMAN, you may draw extra cards each time they draw.)

Play continues clockwise until there are no more VP in the supply.

The game comes with the MONUMENTAL expansion. This is a small expansion that adds a new currency- URNS! Spend URNS to construct monuments that trigger powerful actions and multiply your end-game points.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, I Cut, You Choose, Open Drafting

name: BelloLudi: Strategy Game
description:
Welcome to the strategy game by BelloLudi! Nice that you have taken an interest in wargaming. These rules have been developed for people who have no previous experience in wargaming, yet like to play games. BelloLudi designed these rules especially for teambuilding purposes. During our sessions we received feedback that people liked our game, but it was initially too complicated. Now, we have a ruleset of eleven pages, no more than the game of RISK. From page thirteen on, we included some extra rules. You will not be needing them at first, but we can imagine that you would like some variations as your experience grows. Start with that page when you have some battles under your belt.

The game is designed as a multiplayer game but will work just as fine with only two players. The same goes for the number of miniatures involved. We have collected huge armies over the years but, as you are new to the game, you’ll probably do not. Do not fear! The army structure that is presented in this writing, can be easily adapted to the number of miniatures that you have available. Albeit that a large army look suitably impressive. Hopefully, playing the game will encourage you to create your own armies.

This rules-set simulates battles in the period of 1700 to 1900, the age which historians call the long 19th century. Units were drawn up in line in order to maximise the effect of their weaponry. The musket, the type of gun that the troops were supplied with, was only accurate on short distances. During a volley all muskets were fired simultaneously at the same target. Off course, this required iron discipline of the men. Soldiers of that age were drilled to fight formed up into line formation and to march in columns. During the game, your troops will do likewise.

In an ideal scenario the enemy was pinned in place by fire of artillery, the threat of cavalry or the fire of infantry. Once the enemy was pinned, other units could deliver the coup de grace. Tactics were therefore based on teamwork. Not only within a brigade, but also between brigades, or even armies. Every unit would have its own specific task and if they executed their tasks in unison, success was often achieved. The aim is not to annihilate the enemy unit to the last man, but to inflict so much damage, indicated by chips, that morale is brought down and the unit will become shaken or will run away in panic and removed from the table top. By a clever combination of movement and shooting, dashing cavalry charges and carefully positioned artillery pieces, this can be achieved. The tactics are based on teamwork. Not only within a brigade, but also between brigades and as such, the whole army.

Your role will be that of a brigadier in a nineteenth century army. Should more players be available, one of you will play the part of Commander-in Chief or general. Should any disagreement arise concerning the rules, we suggest you roll a dice. The one who rolls the highest number has it right, for now.

—description from publisher

name: Covid
description:
Covid is a funny, strategic card game about our struggle to self-isolate. It's a game everyone should have at home as a laughable reminder of the craziness that went on in the Covid era.

There are two ways to win, either become immune by collecting Vaccine tokens or eliminate other players by giving Infection tokens.

There are 108 cards containing stories and pictures of the strange things that people have done during the pandemic.

On your turn, you read your card aloud, choose who you will play it on and assign the token(s) in accordance to what the card instructs.

Infection cards usually have stories of the unbelievable and sometimes stupid things people have done, like cutting holes in masks to breathe better, or suggesting we inject disinfectant to control the spread. They are played on other players to give Infection tokens.

Vaccine cards have stories of the more heroic or mundane things that we have had to do, but have all done them anyway, like having a wine tour in your house or doing YouTube workouts to curb the iso-snacks. They are played on yourself to gain Vaccine tokens.

Strategic cards are used to block Infections by wearing a mask or social distancing, or they can be used to create havoc by forcing opponents to only use specific cards.

Then there is Bat Soup, the card that started it all. Bat Soup gives an Infection that keeps spreading each round until someone, anyone removes it with a Vaccine card.

The required amount of tokens to eliminate a player with Infection tokens or win outright with Vaccine tokens is always equal to the amount of active players.

Five players requires five tokens, four = four, etc. If a player is eliminated the required tokens is now one less. This can result in a domino effect and remove all your opponents at once or even accidentally take yourself out!

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That

name: C'est bon à savoir! Le grand jeu de la Culture Générale
description:
Be the first one on the finish line by answering general culture questions (science, history, geography,arts...) and taking on challenges (sing, mimic, draw...)

C'est bon à savoir! Un jeu familial,
1 400 questions et défis de culture générale par le détour malicieux de la littérature !

name: Best 11 Board Game: Roma
description:
Best 11 Board Game: Roma football box game!
Buy players, deploy them, challenge whoever you want, manage your team.
The goal of the game is to complete the formation of 11 players, your BEST11.
Play your event cards, surprise your opponents, hire the manager, complete the stage and achieve victory.


Best 11 Board Game: Roma
Compra i giocatori, schierali, sfida chi vuoi tu, gestisci il tuo team.
Obiettivo del gioco è completare la formazione di 11 giocatori, i tuoi BEST11.
Gioca le tue carte avvenimento, sorprendi i tuoi avversari, ingaggia l'allenatore, completa lo stadio e otterrai la vittoria.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Roma – Bite Size
description:
Pocket version of the world famous Trivial Pursuit.
600 questions about the world of AS Roma.
Some of these questions will put even the most experienced fans in difficulty!
The game does not require any board and can be carried in its convenient triangular box.
Test your knowledge of the following topics:

Coaches,
League,
Curiosities,
Players,
International Matches,
Victories.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Sports, Trivia

name: Indian Mutine-era: A Supplement for "Taiping Era"
description:
Indian Mutine-era is a supplement for Taiping Era which enables those rules to be used for fighting battles on the tabletop from the 1857/8 revolt in India.

It is not a complete set of rules, and requires Taiping Era in order to play.

The supplement contains rule amendments, a set of linked scenarios and a QRS.

—Description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Blood Red Skies: Lockheed F-80C Shooting Star Squadron
description:
A single seat fighter-bomber, the Lockheed F-80C was a later production version of the P-80, the original designation denoting pursuit. However, with changes to the American system of designation in 1947, the Shooting Star would be re-designated as a ‘F’, a fighter. The Shooting Star was designed in fewer than 6 months around the British Halford H.1 (Goblin) engine and first flew in 1944, with P-80s flying under combat conditions in Italy the next year.

By the time of the Korean war, the aircraft was considered somewhat obsolete, but was at the forefront of the initial sorties across ‘MiG Alley’, of which 1500 flights were made in the first four months alone. It was on November 8th 1950 that a Shooting Star claimed the first MiG-15 shot down, in one of first ever instances of jet-to-jet combat.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Puzzle Board Chess
description:
The standard chess board has been broken up into 16 tiles (plus 1 extra) of four squares each. Now, a big part of the strategy is how to lay your tiles and deploy your pieces to best achieve checkmate.

The puzzle tiles create chasms and gaps that change the dynamic of chess. Each player gets 8 puzzle board tiles. An extra neutral piece is placed on the table first.

The players randomly choose who goes first and take turns adding their puzzle tiles to the game board. If necessary, place one of your chess pieces on your tiles to avoid confusion about who placed which tile. After the board is completed and all tiles connect, arrange your chess pieces on your tiles where you think they work best for your strategy and the landscape of the battlefield. Whoever placed the first tile is the first to move a piece to begin a game.

Pieces move as they do in a standard game, EXCEPT:

There are no PAWNS. They don’t work on this kind of board.
Since KNIGHTS can jump, that means they can jump over gaps in the board. But they must still move in the classic “L” shape and be able to land on a physical square.
Even for tiles that don’t connect by tabs, if their corners adjoin, BISHOPS may be able to cross from one piece to the next.


—description from the publisher

name: Blood Red Skies: Grumman F9F Panther Squadron
description:
The F9F Panther was Grumman’s first production jet fighter, used extensively during the Korean War. It proved one of the United States Navy’s first successful carrier-born jet fighters and was the first jet fighter to be used by the Blue Angels aerobatics display team.

The F9F would remain the primary US Navy and USMC jet fighter and ground-attack aircraft of the Korean War, flying around 78,000 sorties in total. The Panther claimed the first US Navy aerial victory of the war claiming a prop-powered Yak-9 in July 1950.

In one little-known instance, a single Panther shot down four Mig-15s in a single 35 minute period, a unique feat for pilot Lt Royce Williams. This is in spite of the Panther’s relatively poor speed when compared to the nimble MiGs.

Other notable pilots of Panthers in Korea include first man on the moon, Neil Armstrong (who in fact bailed out during a combat mission when his aircraft was brought down by wire strung out across a valley), as well as fellow astronaut John Glenn and baseball star Ted Williams.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Quizz Toulouse
description:
Quizz Toulouse: 106 cards, 530 questions to learn everything about the pink city!

For each question, 5 clues, increasingly easy.
The fewer clues the player uses to answer, the more points he will earn.

Whoever wins the most points at the end of the game will be chosen the best Toulousain in the group!


Quizz Toulouse: 106 cartes, 530 questions pour tout savoir sur la ville rose !

Pour chaque question, 5 indices, de plus en plus faciles. M
oins le joueur utilisera d'indices pour répondre, plus il gagnera de points.

Celui qui gagnera le plus de points à la fin de la partie sera désigné le meilleur Toulousain du groupe !

name: Mount Topia
description:
Moun Topia is strategic card game that takes place in the dangerous mountain range in the Kingdom of Doomtopia in the shadow of the parallell universe of Earth.

The mountain is known for huge deposits of unique and valuable minerals, and therefore mining is the work of power. Mount Topia is by far the richest mountain area, containing treasures like diamonds, sapphire, gold and rare gemstones.

For decades different Clans from all parts of Doomtopia have fought to conquer the mountains and take control over the resources, battling it out to conquer the 5 Mine fields in the Northern area of Mount Topia.

Place the 36 Mine field cards in a 6x6 system on the table with the Mine Signs facing up. Mine field name and description is on the back side of these cards, and hidden at the start point.
