There are two different types of “Mine signs“ cards that matches - so there are 18 of each version.

You pick one Mine sign card and then choose a matching card either vertical, horisontal or diagonal.
This becomes your mining route. When you turn these two cards, you will find the mining field information that you need for deciding which clan workers you shall choose to get the best team to extract and collect the most treasures on this mining route.

The clan that collects the most treasures from the Mine fields has won the game.

name: Zig
description:
Zig is a game of cards and cubes for three to five players in which each player is attempting to acquire sets of colored cubes to score points. The card play is unique in that a pair of "Zag" cards is played to a mat in such a way that a connection is made between verbs, numbers, and colors. These combinations result in the exchange of cubes, and aside from a point value, these cubes can be used to purchase additional cards, thereby forming new connections in the next round. Can you utilize the available "Zigs and Zags" effectively to gain more points than your opponents? You have only nine turns to find out!

—description from the publisher

name: Ophidian 2360: Promo Pack 3
description:
This promo pack contains 3 Gladiators, 3 Minions, 1 Quick-Hit & 2 Pumps

014 Mark of Xan
015 NecroTek Mangler
016 Assault Drone
017 Anima L1/L2
018 Dark Scry L1/L2
019 Stinger L1/L2
020 Helix Striker
021 Steel Blitz
022 Sutama's Core

name: A Penchant For Potion
description:
2-4 alchemists compete to match the most potions by shape in their apothecary. Discard cards from your hands to perform to perform actions such as breaking other player's potions, drawing cards, adding broken potions from the discard, and much more. Can you brew a win against opposing alchemists?
Gameplay Rules
-Separate the potions from the Action Cards
-Shuffle the deck of 40 potion cards and pass out 6 cards to each player (this is your hand), then place the remaining cards facedown in a reachable area; this is the deck
-Pass out 1 Action Card to each player
-The player who most recently watched a movie about magic goes first
-Each player can perform up to as many actions as they can (except breaking potions and preventing breaking potions) by discarding cards from their hand (this will be listed on the Action Card)
-When a player uses a Placement action, set the Potion facedown in front of you; this area is known as the Apothecary (a player can have as many potions as possible in their Apothecary)
-When your turn ends, draw 2 cards (there is no hand limit)
-The player who can match 5 of the same potion shapes in their Apothecary wins OR the player with the most matching potion shapes in their potion shape sets (see Note section) in their Apothecary when the deck has expired twice wins.

-description from designer
publishers: Meet Me At The Table Games

name: Crazy Atomic Windup Robots
description:
A tactical opponent for miniature wargames.

Crazy Atomic Windup Robots is a card deck to imbue a solitary game opponent with a strategy and to animate the maneuver, organization, and attack of its units.

The rules feature a deck of 90 cards that aid the solo player, cooperative players, or gamemaster in a miniature wargamer. If your dissatisfied with your own meta thinking during solo play, randomness of dice bots, or use of flow charts then consider trying out this deck. You will need to track the opponent’s units, follow prompts to evaluate criteria, and draw cards to determine the opponent’s reaction. We think this deck will help preserve your sense of uncertainty and maintain your wargaming immersion.

Included are cards for two decks and a series of event cards. The first is the General Reaction deck that directs the opponent at the start of the game and in the face of uncertainty. The second is the Enemy Visible that will direct opponent when its units are in contact with your units. Finally, the Event cards will help customize play as you want to change your game.

The rules are designed for a simple assessment criterion. A simple sample game is provided in the instructions with a walk through of three full turns.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Take Me Home
description:
Help an animal from a zoo back to its natural habitat. This is a charming children's game with an environmental and animal conservation theme. It teaches children the shape of the world and its continents, different means of travelling and places where certain animals live.

The aim of the game: In zoos all over the world animals are being bred in captivity in order to re-populate the areas where these species live in the wild. What the players have to do is transport the animals from the different zoos to their natural habitats and set them free.

Play is completed with a roulette wheel, animal, and transport cards on a board with specific routes which must be matched to the type of transport.

—user summary
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Exploration, Transportation, Travel

name: Grand jeu du Tour de France
description:
To go around the Tour while having fun, here is the official game of the Tour de France!
Take your turn, with your family and on a stage, the most popular summer sporting event in France!

Find with this family game a friendly atmosphere and everything that has made the success of the Tour de France for more than 100 years: the sport, the performances, but also the knowledge of France and its rich heritage that the event gives us ( re) discover.
You will progress on the plateau, 21 key stages to score points, become the yellow jersey and win the Tour de France on an ideal course traced by the Aso and punctuated with questions putting you to the test !!!

The goal of the game:
Wear the yellow jersey upon arrival on the Champs-Elysées.

Gameplay:
To finish the yellow jersey, you have to total the most points.
Each step puts you to the test with the questions that the luck of the dice will designate you.

How to score points?
Depending on the type of question, the number of points is not always the same, it varies from 1 to 3.

Categories:
1. The runners: bio - prize list - nicknames - managers - feats of arms - sponsors - teams
2. The stages: passes - descents - turns - arrivals - towns - first times - the essentials - legendary editions
3. The race: jerseys - organization and organizers - records - strategy - classification - equipment
4. Culture: expressions and slang - tour personalities - journalists - writers - artists - politicians - the media - audience - historical events
5. La France du Tour: history - geography - heritage - gastronomy
6. On top / Failure: challenges and bonuses or penalties

name: Le Grand Jeu du Tour de France
description:
Le Grand Jeu du Tour de France
A game for all Tour de France lovers.

Become a Tour champion for a game and escape the peloton by answering the "Tour" questions and the "France" questions, divided into three categories:

Sprint (all players can answer)
Time Trial (15 or 30 seconds to give a series of answers)
Breakaway (the player is the only one to answer).


Along the way, find the heroes who wrote the legend of the Great Loop, relive their exploits and put your name on the prize list by showing yourself up to the challenges offered by our 21 "Stages" boxes!

name: Cataclysm: Battle Scenarios – Volume X: A Panzer Korps Module
description:
PANZER KORPS BATTLE SCENARIOS Volume X is the Tenth in a series of Scenario books designed specifically for the PANZER KORPS WWII Rules System.
16 ready to play Scenarios featuring larger and more challenging scenarios with maps & Force Groups.
Scenarios included:

A Savage Storm: Breakout at Mtzensk ‘41
Battle for the Uryv Bridgehead ‘42
Battle for Aprilia ‘44
Clash of Armor ’44
Battle for Kecskemet ‘44
Battle of Dnov ‘41
Relief of Stalingrad ‘42
Bremoncourt ‘44
Siege Of Hong Kong ‘41
Kharkov ‘42
Nordic Fist ‘41
Battle of Le Cateau ‘40
Operation Grozny ‘42
Operation Zitadelle ‘43
Last Panzer Victory ‘45
Operation Epsom ‘44


—description from the publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Xeno-Force: Rulebook
description:
Xeno-Force pits mankind’s finest marines against alien threats in a scenario driven fast play skirmish game.
Battle your way past tough alien horrors to complete your mission.
Play games in your favourite sci-fi universe with this flexible and detailed system.
Xeno-Force is a scenario driven game. It is about using your games to tell interesting stories and building those stories.

This unique semi-cooperative game means you and your friends work together in a team against a single alien opponent to accomplish your objectives, but also compete to gain the most glory and honour.

Jump straight into the action with pre-generated characters and scenarios, or play as a longer campaign game, linking missions together to develop your own engaging story.

Xeno-Force rulebook includes:


Detailed but straight forward game rules with lots of examples
Three introductory scenarios with more on the website
Full campaign and character development and advancement rules
Six difference character classes with unique combat styles
Tons of weapons, equipment and abilities
Nine Xenotypes ( “Bugs” and “Cyborgs” etc.); pick one that suits your model collection
Rules for vehicles


Full Advancement Rules:

Xeno-Force allows you to advance your characters from mission to mission using a very thorough and detailed advancement system. Watch your characters grow in strength and develop through campaigns. Specialise them in different styles of combat so each one can become genuinely unique.


Use for RPGs:

Xeno-Force works really well to support RPG games to run tactical missions when the players "call in the cavalry"


Full Support:

The game is fully supported online, with missions and aliens published on the website.


Community:

Please join in the community and share your experiences, questions and scenarios. The more players who join in the better.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Locked Adventures: Der magische Fall II
description:
After you have solved the riddle of the mysterious magical sleep, it quickly becomes clear to you: You now have to find Albert. But what is really hidden behind the call for help
Potions Master? Follow his magical trail and you will become London from one
get to know a completely new perspective. But hurry because you are not them
The only ones who are on Albert's heels. The time is running!

name: Message in a Bottle
description: Four bottles with messages are underway. On their trip they have to survive several whirlpools. You have to pay attention, if you want to know what has made it to the end!

name: Unity: Veteran Infantry of Unified Space – For Renegade Scout 2nd edition
description:
Unity: Veteran Infantry of Unified Space is the first supplement for Renegade Scout 2nd edition introduces Veteran troops to your games.

This adds a new squad type for use in the Army Builder, along with notes on how they are incorporated into the normal section structure of your army. Veteran squads have a diverse array of weapons and access to additional abilities, making them perfect for that special, cool squad of miniatures you have or for kit-bashing a grim-faced squad of survivors.

The supplement also adds the option to add a veteran squad leader to most existing squads of infantry, adding a bit of personal touch as the wise old "Sarge" leads the fresh recruits into battle.

Finally, expanded background material helps put the new rules in context within the Unified Space setting.

The ..of Unified Space series is intending to be a series of small, bite-sized expansions for Renegade Scout 2nd edition, adding new content and options to the game system, expanding the universe and generally increasing the amount of fun to be had.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Lottori
description:
By a lake, in the garden, by the sea or in the forest - there's lots to discover in the company of these two elves. You must look carefully and memorize the motif in order to find the right tile to place on the the right board. Four beautifully illustrated scenes make up this lotto game that can be adapted for different age groups.
An adventurous journey with the elves! A fun lotto game for 1-4 children, 3 years an up.

name: Alphabeto
description:
Who can say their ABC festest?
Children learn the alphabet in the twinkling of an eye. There is a clearly recognizable motif for each letter. In addition you can practice german reading.

name: Fantastico
description: Bords of a feather flock together, and the idea of Domino Fatastico is just a simple: You have to place two identical mofifs next to each other. Played alone or with others, hardly any other game is as versatile and variad as Fantastico. Younger players will love looking at the carefully chosen images and to describe them before starting to play. And for older children, there are amusing variations thyt guarantee exitement.

name: The Square Watermelon Game
description:
Equipment consists of a 7x7 board and watermelon shaped pieces in Green and Red. There are 24 pieces of each color.

The board starts off empty. Green goes first. For his first move, Green is not allowed to place any piece in the center space.

Players take turns placing a piece on any empty space. They are attempting to form squares using their tokens to mark the 4 corners of the square. Squares can be any size and any orientation. Which sometimes makes them difficult to perceive. It is possible for a single piece to complete the corners of several different squares.

After a player sets a piece, they check to see if any new squares were formed. They make note of how many and keep a running total. A player is given a reasonable time to count up all the new squares, and then the next player may take his turn. If a player spots any new squares after the other players sets a piece, that player loses those points.

After the last piece is set, the scores are tallied. High score wins.

-description from designer

name: Pippi Langstrumpf: Absolut knifflig!
description: This is a tricky game for smart kids! They need to arrange 9 cards in a square so that all figures look correct. At the end, you should see a picture of Pippi Longstocking, Mr. Nilsson and the little uncle.

name: Vario Tino
description: The dwarf Tino and his frieds love colours. They each like to dress in one colour, and that should be different from everybody else's. Item for Item, they collect their clothes - mostly from the nice clean ones hanging on the washing line. The search for the right colour is made more exiting because it can only be seen when a foil is laid over the item of clothing. Now, from the three basic colours ther are many more mixed colours.

name: Pippi Langstrumpf: Südsee-Wirbel
description: A cool jump & run game with Pippi and her friends.

name: Castelino
description:
A magnificent feast is to be held at the great royal palace. All of you, princes and princesses, from all corners of the kingdom, are invited! But hurry, because everyone has to gather the in the palace grounds before the king himself arrives.

The main focus of this game is on the recognition and matching of the basic colours and an early understanding of rules.

name: Pizza Fiesta
description:
The aim of this game is to top your pizza base with all the correct ingredients first. There is another game variant where you'd need to be the first one to collect four pizza cards as quickly as possible.
Pizza fiesta contains many more variants - all of them fun to play and at the same time requiring full attention and responsiveness!

name: XXL-Candy
description: Concentrazion and quick reactions are needed here. This exciting game of sweets promotes powers of observation and colour combination recognition.

name: Raupenalarm
description: Every year Moritz and his friends can hardly wait until the delicious apples are finally ripe in Grandma's garden. However, the caterpillars are as impatient as them. As soon as the apples fall off the trees, a race begins and Moritz and his friends need a bit of luck to win!

name: Ritter Trenk: Burgbau zu Hohenlob
description: Stake the cards as high as you can! The castle will become a powerful fortress in this way. But be careful, the higher it gets, the more probable it is that the castle will collapse...

name: Muffelfurzwildes Wettrennen
description: The turtle overtook the snail! It's important that you put your cards in a good order so that your animals are the first ones!

name: Neun Freunde
description: Many friends want to come to the gathering in the middle of the board. But some start too late, some are stopped by the other players and some are removed from the game. The gathering starts, when nine friends are there!

name: Vines in Bloom
description:
Vines in Bloom is a tile-laying game with the goal of growing and branching your vine to have the most flowers in bloom by the end of the game.

As vines grow, they will split and compete for space on the board. When vines get entangled, your blossoms might get eliminated and removed from the game.

Grow your vine strategically to maximize the number of blossoms you get, balancing how much you want to grow and how many blossoms you want to keep safe, instead.

The game can be played from 1 up to 4 players.

Gameplay:
- Your goal is to grow and keep the most blossoms by the end of the game.
- Two tiles from your hand must be passed to the next player. You can use the rest to grow your vine.
- By branching, you gain blossoms, while also getting more connection points for future tiles.
- As the board fills, competing vines converge and can remove other player's blossoms.
- Single blossom tiles keep a blossom safe from removal, but also prevent that branch from growing further.
- Triple blossoms earn an extra point, give protection, and increase the number of tiles you can place each turn.
- At the end of your turn, draw tiles back up to your hand limit.

-description from designer

name: Boston Against The World: Sports Trivia Game
description:
Boston Against the World is the sports trivia game for Boston's biggest sports fans.
Take turns against one or more players -- or better yet, make teams -- to see who can come up with answers from each card's list of Boston or World sports trivia. It's the perfect gift for EVERYONE who grew up following Boston sports, with questions that every sports fan can relate to!

Players roll custom dice to determine category — Boston or World — and how many answers they’ll need to score points.

First player or team to 21 wins.

name: Häschen würfeln
description: The players role the 2 die one after the other and wipe off the cute bunnies they throw.

name: Wilderness Survival School
description:
A game of survival and exploration, for 1 - 4 players (ages 10 and up), by Steadman Watson

As a student of the Vildhall School of Wilderness Survival, you and your friends learn valuable survival skills. Now it is time to put those skills to the test on a wilderness adventure. Grab your pack, fill your canteen, check your compass and let’s head out on an adventure!

The objective of Wilderness Survival School is to make it back to town with the highest Karma score, which represents how well each player’s adventure went overall.

Each player holds cards representing the courses they have completed, which enable specific feats of outdoor survival. There are four foundation course feats available to all players: Fire Making, River Fording, Route Finding, and Shelter Building. In addition, each player selects two elective feats. Feats are not always successful, and players roll dice to determine how they did.

Before setting out on an adventure, each player fills their Day Pack with various supplies, keeping in mind the equipment requirements for chosen feats.

Each player has their own scorepad to track their vital statistics. Every player starts with the same amount of Health Points, Energy, and Karma. Health Points is the capacity to absorb damage, Energy is the capacity to take actions, and Karma is the sum of a player’s actions, both good and bad.

Each day is broken down into 6 turns, which are tracked using a turn tracker. Turns 1 - 4 are in the daylight, while turns 5 and 6 are at night. Movement and feats are undertaken during the day, while the night is used to recover Energy.

As players move, they will explore nearby terrain (moving meeples) and gradually expand the map. The map is composed of hexagon tiles; new tiles are placed by the players using simple rules and the map is different each time the game is played. Moving through the wilderness is how players will have wildlife encounters, locate additional food and water, and eventually find the way back to town.

The game ends as soon as all players make it back to town. Once everyone is back, the players tally up their Karma (including any of the secret objectives found on the foundation feat cards).

Whoever has the highest Karma score wins!

—description from the desinger
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Map Addition, Variable Set-up

name: The Brady Bunch Game
description:
Player spins and moves along his path according to the number they spun. When a player comes to an obstacle on his trail, he must pit it up and go to the red space on his trail and throw the obstacle into the trash barrel. Once the trail is clear, the player picks up his numbered tent and according to the spinner on his turn, advances toward his campsite. He must spin the exact number to land on his campsite. The winner is the first player to get his tent to his campsite.

Content: Gameboard, 6 playing pieces, bases, 16 obstacles, 4 plastic tents, spinner, rules sheet.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Princess
description: The princesses want to avoid that, so the game is therefore about getting all the princesses home to the castle so they can prevent the dragon from ruining the party. Princesse is a new exciting adventure game where players must complete the tasks together. Ride the princesses home to the castle without bumping into the fire-breathing dragon. You win or lose together. The game teaches participants about cooperation through simple rules and simple game mechanisms. Can you work together and help the princesses back to the castle before it's too late?

name: The One
description:
The personality card game that answers the question everyone wants to know but no one wants to ask, "Which ONE am I in the group?" Get together with some friends and find out what you really think of each other.

The One is the ultimate game to test your friendship group. How well do you really know each other? What stories are hidden deep within that are bursting to come out? Allow this game to help that process.

Are you a plus or a minus?
Are you a bonus or a burden?
Which ONE are you?

Each card has a different personality. Some are positives and some are negatives. Players discuss who best suits 'THE ONE' on each card and must agree on ONE player to receive that card. Every card must be given and there is no limit on the amount of cards a player can receive. When all the cards have been handed out, the player with the highest score is the winner - THE ONE!

—description from the designer

name: Banditti
description: Where is the loot hidden? Sausage in the bedroom? Money in the bathroom? Each player receives a robber's house complete with floors, side walls and roof parts for a total of three floors and five loot chips of one color, which he can distribute in his rooms. You roll the dice: For each thrown robber sack you can ask a fellow player a yes / no question about an object; for two or three you can always ask the same player or a different player every time. For a gift as a result you can ask for an item from a player. If you have asked or requested correctly, you receive the chip and place it on your robber's bag. Whoever has collected any five items wins.

name: Got Grits?
description:
You and your pardner find yourselves having a little disagreement. Before you know it, you’re out under the high noon sun on dusty mainstreet, near 20 paces apart, half the town out watching and a mighty silence in the air.

“Alright,” you say, and spit in the dust, “let’s figure this’n out.”

Only natural you’re both real twitchy about now. You’re putting moves on each other, fake draws, designed to rile each other up like a scorpion in a bedroll.

Draw your hands simultaneously, with digits in some arrangement as to signify a 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5.

The player whose number is 1-2 higher will win that round and score a point.

1 beats 4,5
2 beats 5,1
3 beats 1,2
4 beats 2,3
5 beats 3,4

These points are your nerve, or grit. The player with the best nerve will make the best shot, naturally.

The time o’ reckoning comes along when both players throw matching digits.

So do the math, the player with the most grits makes a clean shot.

You decide, do you put a warning into their shoulder or hamstring n’ set their noodle straight, or whistle it real close past their ear like a mosquito or, hell, clean through the top of their hat -that’ll surely send them hightailing out over the arroyo.

Either way it seems that settled things and you figure you’ll both be close as ever, until the next time anyhow.

—description from the designer

name: Dicetroy the Castle
description:
Greetings, noble Castellan Ruler to Dicetroy the Castle. As a Castellan, you have many obligations to your family’s name - build castles, protect them, earn treasure, and deliver prosperity to your people. You do this by wisely utilizing the resources your subjects provide as well as waging war on your rivals and attacking their castle and accumulating the most treasure to be the mightiest Castlan Ruler of them all!

Dicetroy the Castle is a dice rolling, matching, stacking, and smashing resource management and dexterity battle game for 2 players.

BASICS OF PLAY

Each player selects 1 Castelan Ruler player screen/backsplash and 20 dice of one color. To prepare for the CULTIVATE phase of each round players will set their screen in front of their battle zone.

CULTIVATE
Flip the 90-second timer (you may choose to play “Peasant mode” and exclude the timer and have the Cultivate Phase be untimed).

From behind their Castellan screen, each player rolls all 20 of their six-sided dice at the same time then sorts, allocates, and places dice from dice that have at least one or more matching values. Unmatched dice and dice that you had no use for or dice that did not get placed before time runs out are returned to your dice pool or "Banished". these are failed farmers and craftsmen who didn't deliver on their promised goods.

PROSPER
Unveil your kingdom! Lift your Castellan screen and place it behind your castle.

DECREE!
Certain Castellan abilities trigger and resolve. State these abilities to your Rival.

PROFIT!
Claim your treasure! Calculate how much treasure you earned and increase your Treasure die accordingly.

WAGE WAR!
Determine which player will attack first by comparing the combined outcome of your Knight dice then alternate attacking each other until a player runs out of boulders or a player is raided making sure to clear all castle rubble in between attacks. After attacking has ended Fortify by either repositioning or clearing dice inside the Castle Zone, adding them back to your dice pool.

When Fortifying all layers must be completed before continuing to build on a castle. All Dice but those remaining in the Castle zone and the Treasure die are returned to that player’s dice pool.

For each completed layer of your Castle still standing after the war has ended, earn 1 Treasure. The first player to end a round with 20 Treasure is the lord of the land and the winner of the game!

THAT IS THE END OF THE AGE! (one round)

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, City Building, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Matching, Random Production, Re-rolling and Locking, Stacking and Balancing, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types, Zone of Control

name: Color Shapes Match
description:
Round of the player


Insert a card from your hand in a place a place up, down, right, left or diagonals from another card on the table.
Do the same with the second card in your hand.
If you want, take a card from the table in your hand and place it in the same way.
Get a card from the table that has in its center the shape and color of a shape that has been completed on the table. You can do the same thing as many times as you want if the condition exists.
Place the cards you won in front of you and draw 2 new cards from the deck. That's where your round ends and then the player on the left plays.

name: Arawn
description:
Object: Capture the opponent's King

The game is played on an 8x8 board. The pieces consists of 1 King and 8 Warriors for each side.

How a Warrior moves varies depending on the number of Warriors for its side that are left on the board. The less Warriors you have, the more powerful they become.

8 - Steps forward (in the 3 - diagonal & straight - forward directions)
7 - Steps diagonally
6 - Steps orthogonally
5 - Slides diagonally
4 - Slides orthogonally
3 - Slides diagonally + steps orthogonally
2 - Slides orthogonally + steps diagonally
1 - Slides orthogonally + slides diagonally

The King moves by stepping orthogonally and diagonally.

Captures are mandatory and are done by replacement, like Chess.

—description from the designer

name: Top Trumps Quiz: FC Schalke 04
description:
QUIZ Schalke 04 “Blue and white, how I love you”

Prove your passion now with the QUIZ Schalke 04!
All information about the club and its players is brought together here.
So kick off and let's go! If your greatest passion is soccer and you don't miss a game of the Royal Blues, then we have just the right thing for 2 players or teams from 6 years of age. Because in this QUIZ your memory will be put to the test twice with a total of 500 questions.
In the first round, each player or team draws five cards. Read the first question out to you one at a time. If only one of you has the correct answer, he receives the card. If both are correct, it continues until one answers the question incorrectly. If both players or teams do not know the answer to the first question or answer all five questions correctly, the cards land in the middle. Now you continue with the next card and if you can answer the question correctly while your opponent is wrong, you will receive the stack of cards from the middle. Whoever has collected three cards wins the first round. In the second round you shuffle the ten cards you have already played, distribute them again among you and play the cards again. If your little head is not only an absolute ace in the header, but was also able to remember most of the first round and collect three cards again, you win the game.

name: Electric Orchard
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

name: Flames of War: Tiger Tank Platoon
description:
The Tiger tank has such a reputation amongst Allied tankers, that any tank that held up their advance became a ‘Tiger’.

With armour capable of stopping nearly all Allied anti-tank rounds, and a gun that penetrates Allied tanks with ease, its reputation is well deserved.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Bagels
description:
A common defense strategy in Checkers is to keep a piece on the edge of the board so it can not be jumped. This game is played on an edgeless board - a torus. That means all pieces are equally exposed to capture. The top and the bottom of the game board are considered to be connected, as well as the two sides with each other, forming a donut - or bagel - shaped playing field.

A secondary effect of playing on a torus is there is no need for Kings. A piece leaving one edge of the board will simply be re-entered at the appropriate space on the other edge.

Object: Capture all your opponent's Bagels by jumping over them, or stalemate the opponent so he has no moves.

The two sides are known as Plain and Pumpernickel.

Bagels move one square diagonally forward, but may capture in any of the five non-retreating directions - vertically, diagonally forward, or sideways. Jumping over a piece captures it. Capturing is mandatory, and you must keep jumping and capturing as long as it is possible, taking the maximum number of pieces.

-description from designer

name: ARS BELLUM: Extension Hellènes
description:
ARS BELLUM: Hellenes Extension

The Hellenes expansion contains

1 scenario booklet to play the battles of:
Potidea (432 BC),
Spartolos (429 BC),
Olpae (426 BC),
Amphipolis (422 BC) and
Délion (424 BC)

1 board of 108 counters representing Athenian, Spartan and Theban armies as well as two armies of mercenaries or Greek allies
3 A4 cards and 1 A3 card


Requires ARS BELLUM base module

L'extension Hellènes contient

1 livret de scénarios pour jouer les batailles de
Potidée (432 av JC),
Spartolos (429 av JC),
Olpae (426 av JC),
Amphipolis (422 av JC) et
Délion (424 av JC)

1 planche de 108 pions représentant les armées athéniennes, spartiates, thébaines, et deux armées de mercenaires ou alliés grecs
3 cartes A4 et 1 carte A3


Nécessite le module de base d'ARS BELLUM
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Kulturspillet
description:
A trivia game with 18 categories. Questions have a Danish bias. Played in up to six teams.

On your turn you answer a question in one of the categories of the square you are on. If you answer correctly, you roll the die and advance on the board.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Die Eroberer (fan Expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
... and the time came when the rival princes of Carcassonne became more and more power-hungry and strove with all means for the crown of the dominion.
So they invented new ways of protecting their cities and weakening those of their opponents; they built longer roads and conquered farms than all the princes before them.
They did not even shy away from occult powers - despite their Christian cathedrals.
A new, dark age had dawned...

This expansion introduces the following features to Carcassonne:
- field path
- infinite crossing
- oracle
- siege
- watch tower
- ruin
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Rock Band Fights Evil
description:
Rock Band Fights Evil is the next game project from Pocket Option Games. In this game, players control a rock band attempting to escape demons from Hell, or the demons tracking down the cheapskates trying to skip out on their deal with the devil. It is a diceless 2-player game played on a hex map, involving movement and strategic placement of playing pieces.

Rock Band Fights Evil is a simple diceless game, with no luck or chance elements.

Setup - The Hell player places one demon in each hex that is not a corner (three hexes per map edge). The Rock Band player places the relic in the center of the map. He then places one member of the rock band in each hex adjacent to the relic, so that the band surrounds the relic.

Goal - The Rock Band player's goal is to move the relic off any map edge. The Hell player's goal is to get past the rock band and destroy the relic.

Turn Sequence - The Rock Band player chooses one token and moves that rocker any number of hexes in a straight line up to its Move trait. Under most circumstances, rockers cannot enter occupied hexes. After that rocker moves, he may attack. Each token has a unique method of attacking and defeating opponents, e.g. "kill each adjacent demon that has no Hell tokens next to it." When that rocker's move and attack have been resolved, play proceeds to the Hell player. The Hell player's turn sequence is identical to the Rock Band player's.

Move: Different pieces have different Move values, so the humans have to stay on their toes. Some people are a little quicker than others. We all had that one kid in school who always ended up on our team, but never could pull his own weight. For most of my childhood, I was that kid. Also, demons tend to be a lot quicker than humans. Life's like that.

Attack: After a unit moves, it can then Attack. This is a diceless act that depends entirely on the positioning of your unit.

Win Condition: The rockers are trying to retrieve a relic that they intend to use to free themselves from their contract. I won't ruin the surprise; read the books! Anyway, if the rockers can move the relic off the map, they win! If the demons ever are able to maneuver into a position to destroy the relic, they win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points

name: MetalSkies
description:
Do you love epic space battles and cool miniatures? Strategy with a small element of chance thrown in to keep you on your toes? Strive for galactic dominance amongst the stars, in MetalSkies.

Designed for 2-4 players. Set-up time takes less than 10 minutes with a player reaching victory in 1-2 hours. Each player commands their own impressive armada that includes: Battleships, destroyers, bombers, and fighters.

You’ll begin by positioning your fleet strategically across an expansive star map before waging war for limited resources across each star lane. Set-up time takes less than 10 minutes with a player reaching victory in 1-2 hours.

To help you manage your forces, you’ll receive your own fleet card where you can track your ships, their armor, and their payloads. Start things off by framing your strategy around the player action cards you’ve been dealt and the natural advantages the star lanes provide. From there, choose from a variety of game-play tactics that fit your own command style. Sit back and search for valuable scrap, dig in behind flack barriers, or charge forward with your capital ship as you send nukes hurdling towards your enemies. Become a master of these elements, adapt, and survive, for only one can reach ultimate glory!

MetalSkies comes with four complete fleets of WWII-meets-Battlestar Galactica-themed miniatures, action and event cards, fleet management cards, gameplay tokens, multiple star charts, and finally, instructions that you can read in less than 20 minutes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Moving Multiple Units, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Set-up

name: Temple of Caelum
description:
Temple of Caelum is a 2-4 player competitive RPG strategy game. Join the quest for ascension and play as both a Hero and Demon Princess to explore the forgotten temple, summon your demonic minions, cast harrowing spells, and battle the primordial Demon King in a final showdown.


Choose from 7 different Heroes to play
Choose from 4 unique Demon Princesses - each with their own deck of 32 spell cards
Summon your demon minions to attack and block your opponents from progressing
Battle the evil Demon King and claim victory!


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Race, Role Playing

name: Les clés de Fort Boyard
description:
Les clés de Fort Boyard: 4 keys for a safe, for the gold perhaps.
Trials, puzzles, but watch out for tigers!
Go for it, guess, be skilful with your hands, observe and bluff !
Logic, skills, astuteness!
A thrilling chase between the players.
Wealth is at the end of the feat!

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Les clés de Fort Boyard: 4 clés pour un coffre, pour la fortunes peut-être.
Des épreuves, des enigmes mais attention aux tigres !
On fonce, on doit deviner, être adroit de ses mains, observateur et bluffeur !
La logique, l'adresse, l'astuce!
Une course poursuite haletante entre les joueurs.
La richesse est au bout de l'exploit !

—description from the back of the box
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Bluffing, Deduction, Trivia

name: How Does Your Garden Grow
description: A simple game that teaches basic addition and subtraction using flowers (addition) and caterpillars (subtracion)

name: El lepe: Juegos autopista
description: A racing game where you advance the more words you say from different categories in a given time. Whoever gets to the finish line first wins.

name: VI-hunter
description: The more viruses you capture, you can be the best VIRUS HUNTER! Collect the most virus cards including super-virus by matching cards on both ends any row. You can use vaccines to remove virus.

name: Constellations: The "Add to 34" Space Age Noughts and Crosses Game
description:
Constellations is based on the magic number square devised in the 15th century by Albrecht Durera in which each row and column and long diagonal sum to 34. Other patterns of four squares also sum to 34. These are called "Constellations".

Each round, players take turns placing markers on the board until one of them has markers covering the four points of a constellation.

The card with that constellation on it is awarded to the winner of the round. If it is the top card of the deck, then the game is over. Otherwise, players play another round. Most cards and points at the end of the game wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Pattern Building, Score-and-Reset Game, Sudden Death Ending

name: ARS BELLUM: Extension Carthaginois
description:
Expand your prospects for glory with ARS BELLUM game expansions.
In this expansion, find the Carthaginian army and the troops of the First Punic War
Counters, Cards, a dice, the victory is in your hands!

The Carthaginian extension contains:

1 scenario booklet to play the battles
Agrigentum (261 BC),
Adys (255 BC)
Bagradas (255 BC)

1 board of 54 pawns representing the Carthaginian army during the First Punic War
3 A3 cards


Requires the base module of ARS BELLUM

—description from the publisher (translated)

Elargissez vos perspectives de gloire avec les Extensions du jeu ARS BELLUM
Dans cette extension, retrouvez l'armée carthaginoise et les troupes de la Première Guerre punique
Les pions, les cartes, un dé, la victoire est entre vos mains !

L' extension Carthaginois contient:

1 livret de scénarios pour jouer les batailles
d'Agrigentum (261 av JC),
d'Adys (255 av JC),
de Bagradas (255 av JC)

1 planche de 54 pions représentant l'armée carthaginoise durant la Première Guerre punique
3 cartes A3


Nécessite le module de base d' ARS BELLUM

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Impractical Jokers: Box of Challenges
description:
400 game cards, challenges, awkward scenarios & accessories.

Think you’ve got what it takes to be one of the Jokers? Now’s your chance to put yourself to the test with the Impractical Jokers game. Whether you like pulling off undercover challenges on friends or just laughing at hilariously awkward card combinations, this game has something for you. Phase 1: Mess with unsuspecting friends and family. Phase 2: Match uncomfortable scenario cards with hysterical action cards. Phase 3: The Punishment.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: ARS BELLUM: Extension Perses
description:
Expand your prospects for glory with ARS BELLUM game expansions.
In this expansion, find the Persian army and its multitude of troops.
Counters, cards, a dice, the victory is in your hands!

The Persians expansion contains

1 scenario booklet to play the battles of
Thymbrée (547 BC),
Marathon (490 BC),
Plataea (479 BC)

1 board of 108 pawns representing the army of the Achaemenid Persians
1 A4 card and 1 A3 card


Requires ARS BELLUM base module, Hellenic Expansion and Lydian Army Supplement

—description from the publisher (translated)

Elargissez vos perspectives de gloire avec les Extensions du jeu ARS BELLUM
Dans cette extension, retrouvez l'armée perse et sa multitude de troupes
Les pions, les cartes, un dé, la victoire est entre vos mains !

L' extension Perses contient

1 livret de scénarios pour jouer les batailles de
Thymbrée (547 av JC),
Marathon (490 av JC),
Platées (479 av JC)

1 planche de 108 pions représentant l'armée des Perses achéménides
1 carte A4 et 1 carte A3


Nécessite le module de base d'ARS BELLUM, l' Extension Hellènes et le Supplément d'armées Lydiens

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: You Know You are African When...
description:
How many times have you been asked if you speak African?
How many times have you rolled your eyes when the insect in the "feed children in Africa" commercial appears?
Or when a friend who has never left the continent has a British accent?
What is the first thing that you think of when you hear these words: African parents, a black cat, Nigeria, South Africa, Kenya, Egypt?

This is a pretty straightforward game.
Each round, a rotating dictator (decision maker) reads a Question card and citizens (players) answer with the best fitting or funniest Answer card in their hand.
The dictator reads the Answer cards aloud and decides who wins each round. A new round starts and a new dictator takes over.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: How Nigerian Are You?
description:
The First Nigerian Trivia Game!

Get ready to go down memory lane in an exciting team game that tests your knowledge of Nigeria’s History & Historical Figures, Entertainment (music, sports, etc.) and Riddles.

In the box : over 400 questions + hints, answers, a sand timer and a game guide.

Sixty-second rounds require quick thinking and strategizing. Team planning is encouraged to decide when to use your delegation powers and whom to delegate to.

Pick a side to play (low or high difficulty.)
Use a hint if you need one, but you’ll only get half of the points.
Successfully complete Hammer questions to significantly bump your team’s score.

Not Nigerian or don’t know much about Nigeria?
This is a great way to learn!
The timekeeper and scorekeeper roles give you the opportunity to participate and learn.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia

name: Jollof Wars
description:
The West African Party Game!

Your favorite game formats and words that represent you in one game!!

In the box : over 450 words, a sand timer, a game guide and a mini West African overview.

The goal is to get your team to say the word on the card. Sixty-second rounds require quick thinking.

Choose a color to play and flip the cards so that the color you have chosen faces down.
The color you choose to play determines how you will play the game:

Red: Describe the word by using 1 word and gestures (how will you describe Shaku Shaku?)
White: Describe the word by using no more than 5 words (how will you describe Kofi Annan?)
Green: Describe the word by explaining however you would like to (how will you describe Useless?)
Yellow: Describe the word by singing or rapping (how will you describe Akon or Makossa?)


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Combat: The Thrill of Combat – The Power of Command
description:
Combat is a set of wargame rules for World War II, inspired by several other rules such as Rapid Fire, Bolt Action, and Flames of War. The main objective is to provide an easy-to-learn regulation, but don’t forget the realism and historical accuracy.

Main features:
1 - Rules developed for different scales, from 6mm to 20mm, at Squad level.
2 - Valorization of the chain of command.
3 - An original system of randomized movement of units that are out of the chain of command - a system that can also be easily adapted for solo play.
4 - Range definitions in centimeters and hexagons, allowing games on maps without markings and on maps with hexagonal grids.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Blobs
description:
Blobs is played on the lines and intersections of a 12x12 grid; players take it in turn to draw "blobs" encircling one to four adjacent intersections.

The board is initially seeded with two to four one-point blobs per player (depending on player count). After that a player places a new blob by drawing a "stem" along a grid line from one of their existing blobs, at the end of which a new blob is placed. The shorter the stem, the larger the new blob.

When no players can play the game ends. The blobs score based on their sizes and the player with the most points wins.

name: Crokey
description:
Crokey is a board game version of croquet. The board is a grid with each square representing approximately nine square yards of space. There are holes into which metal hoops are inserted, and the hoops hold plastic clips to designate order.

There are three versions of the game in the rules: Sequence Crokey which is based on Golf Croquet, Crokey, which is based on Association Croquet, and Error Crokey which introduces a luck element.

The game was apparently self-published by the designer under the name "Tactical Games."

name: Head Cases
description:
A party game about clever psychological deduction, and acting absurd. For each round one player is the Doctor, and all others are the Patients.

Each round, Patients draw two cards and choose one to act out, discarding the other.

Each Patient makes a short statement about their card (preferably in character) without saying any of the text written in red on the card.

The Doctor may ask each Patient two follow up questions, which they must answer (again preferably in character).

The Doctor then tries to diagnose the Patients. If they are correct, the Patient scores points equal to the number shown on the card by placing it face up in front of them. If they are wrong, the Doctor loses 1 point which is shown by placing the card face down in front of the Doctor.

After all players have been the Doctor once, the player with the highest score wins.

-description from designer

name: Klimasvin
description:
Klimasvin (Danish for "climate pig") is a game about limited resources. Players fill up the map with their pieces. Whoever has most luxury points at the end of the game wins - unless someone has been forced to place one of their pieces so it extends out of the map. In this case, the winner is the player who has the fewest luxury points at the end of the game.

—user summary

name: ATS: Cambrai 1 – Armoured Fist 1917
description:
ATS: Cambrai 1 – Armoured Fist 1917 is a Great War historical module in the CAMBRAI Series.

The largest Great War historical module ever produced.

It includes 5 sheets of counters,7 scenarios, special rules and historical map.

This is not a complete game: ownership of the ATS Rulebook 2014 is required, plus small and large markers.
Provides all the combat counters you need to play.

NOTE: VERY LIMITED PRINT RUN
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: That's a You Problem
description:
That's a You Problem is a casual card game for 2-8 players where you solve the problems in the world.

Collect resources to solve environmental and social problems, and get points by solving them, the first player to reach 15 points is the winner... but be careful, your friends could use special cards to stop you and mess your game.

At your turn, you get to draw one card for free and 2 actions, you could use your actions to play resources, trade cards with players, draw an extra card, discard problems, play special cards. Solving problems is always FREE!

—description from the designer

name: Celestial Checkers
description:
An ancient Chinese folk tale recounts that the Jade Emperor once held a feast to which he invited all the animals of the forest. Only twelve showed up. To reward his guests, the Jade Emperor announced that he would name a year of the Zodiac after each. The animals were all duly honored. But then the question of order arose. The Ox, the brawniest of all the animals but also the most dull-witted, insisted he should be first due to his tremendous strength. The Rat, puniest of all the animals but also the most cunning, argued he should be first due to his keen intelligence. The other animals, who possessed both strength and intelligence in varying degrees, soon joined the quarrel. Some sided with the Ox, saying that strength was more important than intelligence. Others sided with the Rat, saying intelligence was more important than strength. While still others wavered back and forth. So to settle the matter, the Rat proposed a contest.

This game uses the twelve animals of the Chinese Zodiac. Each animal possesses its own unique combination of strength and intelligence. During the first phase, strength is crucial; in the second phase, intelligence is valued.

The board starts off empty. The players alternately place their pieces on their sides of the board. Each piece must be placed on the unoccupied yellow spaces within their first three rows. The direction a piece is facing indicates which player it belongs to. After each player has placed all their twelve pieces, the game can begin. North, for having gone second during the set-up stage, gets to move first.

An animal can not capture an animal stronger than itself. The animals are ranked in strength, from strongest to weakest: 12. Ox, 11. Tiger, 10. Dragon, 9. Horse, 8. Dog, 7. Goat, 6. Pig, 5. Snake, 4. Rooster, 3. Monkey, 2. Hare, 1. Rat.

When an animal reaches the far rank, it is removed to the side and scored according to its intelligence. The animals are ranked in intelligence, from smartest to dumbest: 12. Rat, 11. Hare, 10 Monkey, 9. Rooster, 8. Snake, 7. Pig, 6. Goat, 5. Dog, 4. Horse, 3. Dragon, 2. Tiger, 1. Ox. As can be seen, an animal's intelligence is in inverse proportion to its strength. In other words, the weaker the animal the more valuable it is and vice-versa.

Other than this, normal Checkers rules apply. Pieces can only move diagonally forward, either by sliding to an adjacent empty square or by jumping over an enemy piece to a vacant square on the other side. Jumping over a piece captures it. Capturing is mandatory, and you must keep jumping and capturing as long as it is possible.

When one player is unable to make a move, by either having no more pieces left on the Checkerboard, or by having all his pieces blocked from movement, the game ends and the player with the higher score wins.

Incidentally, through prudent and skillful play the Rat was able to easily defeat the brute efforts of the Ox. On the Chinese Calendar, the Year of the Rat is first, and Year of the Ox second to this very day.

name: Seeds of Plenty
description:
Seeds of Plenty is a card game developed by Ko-Kee Games LLC for 2-5 players aged 8 and older 104 cards. Though the game was originally designed to be played within a family environment with very young players to adult ages it can be equally engaging for adults or youth to play the game by themselves.

The objective of the game is to be the first player to place vegetable plants in planter bins and fend off potential attackers that would uproot these vegetables. The first player to last one entire round with three planter bins still containing vegetables is the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: Disciples the Game
description:
Start a cult! Perform ridiculous rituals, collect disciples and forget your morals in this fun global strategy tabletop game.

Disciples is an easy-to-learn tabletop game, where you are a cult leader who collects disciples and sets up tents and temples around the world. The first player to build three temples wins.

You start by using your intuition to pick the 2 cards that decide your cult's name and rules. For example "Angels of the Gold Hive" or " Infinite Crown of Serpents". There are 144 possible combinations of cults. On each turn you roll, move across the map, perform your peculiar ritual, collect new disciples, tempt fate with the Cards of Consequence and built your tents and temples in various cities around the world.

There will be lots of laughs, surprises and turns of fortune. Luck meets strategy. You may get arrested or sued for your shady behavior. If you think you're winning, you probably won't. The game takes about 30 - 60 min.

This game is rated for ages 17+. Cult leaders are typically inappropriate. Fun for gamers and civilians alike.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Acting, Area Movement, Command Cards, Roll / Spin and Move

name: D4 Dungeon: An OSR Dungeon Crawl RPG
description:
D4 Dungeon is a light dungeon crawl and a love-letter to old-school RPGs. It includes all the maps you’ll need to play, four character cards for the greedy Tomb Robbers under your control, a Doom Clock to mark the hour of your ultimate demise, and the rules in a printer-friendly PDF.

The pyramid of Krug lies in the deep mists of the Valley of Bones, drifting in and out of reality as the tides of magic ebb and rise. Four determined tomb robbers have climbed the pyramid’s many black steps to reach the ancient tomb’s pinnacle, and the great door of bone.

Beyond the grim door’s threshold lie the many mysteries and horrors of the pyramid. Those who overcome them may discover great treasures, or a horrible end. Beware, for the pyramid’s power will work for and against you.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Ziggurat: The Secret of Four Epigraphs
description:
With smart actions, rewrite the Ziggurat wall epigraphs according to your goal and discover the secret of 4 ziggurat epigraphs sooner than other players by creating the desired patterns. To win, you need a variety of strategies and precise memory.
In Ziggurat: The Secret of Four Epigraphs, players use their hands to change the cards on the ground to make different patterns to complete their goals. Each player has unique goals but make other players' goals will give you diamonds. They help you to win sooner.
There is 52 epigraph cards whit different backs. also 13 goal cards and 9 diamond tokens.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Kaiju Kaos: Sinister Scarecrows – Named Characters
description:
Kaiju Kaos – Sinister Scarecrows Stat Cards, Set 01

30 Named Characters including:

AHAB
BONESYLVANIA JACK
BONESYLVANIA PATCH
BRAUM
BUNYAN
CAPT. BIX MAX
CAPT. HALFMOON
CARVER
CRANE
CROWBREAKER
CRUSOE
FEATHERTOP
GALEUX
GAUNTFIELD
HALLOWEEN JACK
HOKKAIDO
KUEBIKO
LEMAX
OZ
PUMPKIN HEAD
RAG & TAG
RAGGED MOLLY
ROOK
SILAS MURPHY
TACKLE STRIKE
TAPS
TREJO
WACKO JACKO
WHITE GHOST
WORZEL

16 Unnamed Characters including:

Assault Rifle Sharpshooter
Assault Rifle Trooper
Hatchet Specialist
Hatchet Trooper
Machete Specialist
Machete Trooper
Pitchfork Specialist
Pitchfork Trooper
Scythe Specialist
Scythe Trooper
Speargun Sharpshooter
Speargun Trooper
Brawler
Melee Combat Trooper
Fast-Moving Skeleton
Slow-Moving Skeleton

2 new Specialized Burst Weapons including:

GAUNTFIELD’S Enchanted Bag of Bones
HALLOWEEN JACK’S Lantern Bomb
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Face Factor
description:
Face Factor is a party game where players act out different scenarios using only their head and facial expressions. Players then guess which scenario is being acted out. Face Factor is for ages 17+ and may include funny suggestive content. Face Factor game was created and written by Liza Salta in 2020.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Giant Monster Invasion!
description:
A table-top wargame for 2 or more players. It’s all about giant monsters, big cities, monsters in big cities, monsters thrashing big cities…you get the jist of it. The core rules are less than a dozen pages, and there’s also a bare-bones rules-lite version of it. Regular updates with new monster packs, some expansion packs, and so on.

Honoring cinema’s greatest giant monsters!

—description from the publisher

Giant Monster Invasion! is a simple tabletop miniatures wargame intended for use with 5" - 7" models (adaptable to 3" - 4" models). The play area is constructed using available terrain and buildings. Figures are given in-game attributes and abilities based, primarily, on appearance and/or notoriety. A "monster point" mechanism is used to achieve team equality. Play proceeds in player turns (2 or more teams are allowed), taken sequentially. Rules primarily deal with monster movement and attacks. Play continues until a single team remains. Several advanced, optional rules are included.

—user summary
mechanics: Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Pasapalabra Junior
description:
Based on a TV game show shown on Spanish television, based on the original British format "The Alphabet Game".

Each team has to guess secrets words. The game objective is to obtain the major number of seconds in the different tests and use them in the last test PASPALABRA. This last test is a countdown where each team has to guess a word beginning with every letter of the alphabet and the team wins if they successfully complete the alphabetical track before their accumulated time runs out.

name: Starcraft: Tactical Miniatures Combat
description:
Starcraft: Tactical Miniatures Combat is a game of skirmish-based combat set in the Starcraft Universe. This game was created by Neuicon and Sean Daniels, and play-tested over a period of time. The rules are fun, exciting and very simple to understand. If you have ever played Dungeons and Dragons Miniatures or Star Wars Miniatures, then you should know what to expect.

-description from the publisher

The game is a fan-created, tabletop miniatures implementation of the universe of the eponymous video game. Starcraft: Tactical Miniatures Combat has been published in two editions; the 2nd edition contains refinements and some additional options. The game assumes players will have sufficient "Starcraft" miniatures to represent all units. Play proceeds in turn order until one team remains. Units are allocated by points; units are based on the videogame.

—user summary
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers

name: SpellCaster
description:
SpellCaster is a magical and physical combat game for two or more players. Each player is represented by a Spell Caster, a warrior mage trained in the ways of combat and magic, skilled in powerful martial arts techniques and armed with a complete arsenal of spells. The goal is to defeat all others players and remain the last spell caster alive. SpellCaster uses ordinary playing cards, but is no ordinary card game as it combines hex/grid map strategy. Since the game uses poker cards, generic playing pieces and any plain hex or grid map it is easy to play and easy on the budget, unlike most any other collectible trading card game. SpellCaster uses a unique system of card combinations in preparing and casting spells.

—description from the publisher

SpellCaster requires at least two players, but accomodates more. Play requires a partially-stripped pack of French cards, tokens, and either a hex or a grid map. Play takes place in turns, played in sequence order. Player abilities during a turn partially are determined by card draw. Players attempt to eliminate other players by "casting spells" or making "attacks". The winner is the sole player remaining. Two expansion products were planned but not published.

—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Skull Crusher
description:
Skull Crusher is a game for anyone who...has a pile of half painted plastic and metal miniatures taunting him from the shelf...Skull Crusher is a fantasy skirmish wargame that has no illusions about itself. It's full rules fill a whole four pages. It has no "pseudo-historical" backstory. It's probably family friendly as long as it isn't played while drunk. It welcomes all fantasy miniatures into play, regardless of origin, base, or painted condition.

-description from the publisher

Skull Crusher is a lightweight, tabletop miniatures wargame for two teams. Opposing armies contains units purchased from a points pool. Individual units are equipped with "whatever can actually be seen" - and such equipment adds to the point cost of the unit. Attacks are made with whatever type of equipment the unit has, including mêlée or ranged attacks. Play proceeds in turns, with players alternating. Unit movement is performed in inches - if the play area is using terrain, it must be navigated around. Units receiving enough damage are removed from play. The game is won by the player who is not eliminated.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Deadlands Expansion
description: The Deadlands minor terrains are black and ivory. By giving up a maneuver attempt, you can add these to any terrain (ivory matches all colors). That adds black to the terrain color for your army only! 4 dice in this set, 1 of each type.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Lone General
description:
We all like games, but the problem is most of them can't be played alone. And war games are the worst, because they have long set-up times, in addition to needing at least two people and a lot of pieces...So, lets make a war game to play by yourself.

-description from the designer

Lone General is a solitaire wargame. The game assumes suitable unit figures are available. The print-and-play rules provide a method of determining and distributing enemy units (all pre-defined), then having those units act/react from among established options. Every game involves four armies and six fronts, offering multiple starting positions. The game uses fairly simple rules to support movement, terrain, morale, rallying, and various other standard components of wargaming.

The game, fully developed in under 24-hours for a time-restricted design competition, has a few rough edges.

-user summary

name: Terror Town RPG
description:
Terror Town RPG is a simple solo game wherein all rules of gameplay are included in a single character sheet. In the game, the player takes the role of a person trapped in the evil Terror Town, a ghost town whose legend claims a corrupt mayor sacrificed the souls of his entire town in order to gain power and eternal life in a dark dimension of pure evil. Now, the town exists in three different worlds at once: Our World, Grey World, and Dark World. In our world, you will find weapons and other useful items. In Dark World, you will find twisted monsters out to kill you. In Grey World, you will find both. Can you survive the survival horror challenge of Terror Town? Will you escape the doomed town, defeat it’s diabolical mayor, or just end up falling victim to it’s many monsters? The answer awaits you... in Terror Town.

—description from the publisher

Despite its name, Terror Town RPG is not a role-playing game. The procedural, solitaire game is played in a series of turns, each turn presenting a challenge to overcome. If successful, a random die roll determines what the next turn will bring. The player starts with two pools of points - Escape and Life - which vary during play. Escape points are used to avoid certain situations; Life points are depleted by failure. If Life ever reaches zero, the game is lost - otherwise the game ends in success when the player escapes Terror Town.

The print-and-play game rules are presented in tiny typeface on a single page of paper; three pages of cut-out tokens also are provided.

—user summary

name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Dracolem Champion Promo
description: This promotional die is an alternate version of the Draco-Champion, the Special Action Icon 'Major Gate' has been replaced with the SFR Inc. company logo. A Draco-Champion is the Heavy Melee Champion of the lost Dracolem species. Before they suddenly vanished from Esfah the Dracolem were sentient alloy based golems created in ancient times by the Gnomes to mimic and improve the native Dragonkin beasts. The Draco-Champion is packed full of special action icons which deal both powerful melee attacks against your opponents as well as save against damage done to it!
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Elemental Relic
description:
RELICS

Relics are large, non-elemental, metalic six-sided items. These ancient items are created from Eldrymetallum, a metal not native to Esfah.

Relics adhere to the same rules as items, described above, with two exceptions:
- As Relics are non-elemental, any unit may carry and use a Relic.
- A Relic is considered to be two items for the purposes of how many items a unit can carry and use.

Elemental Relic
- When rolled with an army, the Elemental Relic icon indicates which element units must contain to be affected by the relic. The SFR Logo contains all elements and ivory.
- Multiple Elemental Relics in an army may cancel each other. Elemental Relics that roll the same element have no effect on that roll. Note that the SFR logo matches all elements.

Elemental Relic
During any non-maneuver roll, X health-worth of matching units in the army carrying this relic may be re-rolled once, ignoring the previous result, OR, you may recruit or promote X health-worth of matching units from your DUA to the army carrying this relic. Results may be split between recruiting, promoting, and re-rolling in any way you choose. Any promotions happen all at once.

name: Thinkers: Причина и Следствие
description:
Set #4: "Cause and Effect" of the Thinkers series of board games will allow children of primary school age to learn to draw logical conclusions in various non-standard situations. The skills obtained as a result of the game will not only increase social adaptability but also lay the foundation for further personal development. Most of the items on the cards in this set are short stories that tell the background of a fact. The players are asked to determine exactly why this or that consequence took place, and what was its cause. Here are just a few examples of the 100 tasks that players will have to solve in this set:

- In which country are only men citizens?
- In the English city of Bradford, there is the only farm in the world where samples of woolen fabrics are delivered from all UK textile factories. Who is bred on this farm?
“What is the use of a tape recorder of a tiger's growl at Bombay Airport?
- In the American state of Arizona, they began to protect the desert from thieves. They steal something without which the desert is threatened with desolation and devastation. what is taken out of the desert?
- Walter Scott said: "Both the crystal and the heart would not be so valuable if ..."

Any number of participants can play the Thinkers board game, but if there are a large number of players, it would be advisable to split into teams. The teams, in turn, take one card with the task, which indicates the topic, difficulty, i.e. the number of victory points, and the task itself. After that, all team members jointly begin the discussion. The complexity of the tasks varies from one to five points, so the developer recommends to allot from 3 to 15 minutes to find solutions, respectively. The team can check the correctness of its answer on the reverse side of the card, then move on to the next team. At the request of the participants, the game can last for a certain time or end immediately after one of the teams scores a predetermined number of points.

name: UkeSeme!: Sono Uke o Semeru no wa Ore da
description:
UkeSeme! is a game themed around BL (boys' love, IE male x male romantic) manga themes and tropes. It is a quick-playing, simple game. Players hold cards with different archetypal BL character types-- Idol singer, high school student, butler, etc-- and take turns pairing them together. Players then discuss why they feel this pairing of characters works, and scenarios with them, to try to convince the judge to accept the pair. Alternatively, there is no single judge, and the group votes instead, but the rules are otherwise the same.

—user summary

name: Festival!
description:
In days of yore, the dreariness and difficulty of daily living was interrupted by celebrations filled with feasting and festivity. Your goal is to collect cards and build sets of percussion and melodic instruments, female and male choirs, and to finish in first place at the yearly festival. Watch out for opponents stealing your performers and being left off the stage. Oh, and dragons.

Festival! is a musical, set-building game for the entire family. Like most Tamed Beast Games, it is a high-player count game, with up to 7 players.

Gameplay:

In turn, players move one adjacent location on the map (Palace, City, Village, and Country) collecting Ensemble cards to form sets. Cards may be played and scored in the City, while Palace cards add bonuses and special powers. Four times per game there is a festival at which players may move onto a stage and get bonus Finale cards. The fourth festival signals the end of the game and the Festival Finale. Finale card points are added to points scored throughout the game and a winner declared. They are encouraged to sing a victory song.

name: Persephone
description:
In the traditional, diagonal form of Checkers, pieces are restricted to playing on a single color of the checkerboard. Thus it is possible to play two games simultaneously on the same board. The first game is played on the Dark squares, and the second game on the Light squares.

Also, the conventional way of playing two games simultaneously is that the player makes a move in the first game, then another move in the second game. However, in 'Persephone' the player picks between either of the two games in which he wants to move a piece. Captures still take precedence over any other move. So a player is forced to make a capture on a particular side of the board if possible.

A player wins when he manages to capture all of his opponents pieces that are on the same color of the checkerboard - either all the Light pieces or all the Dark pieces. With two games at once, the chances of a draw are greatly reduced. If one of the games is undecided, the other game can still be resolved for the win.

The two sides are Iron and Gold. Instead of pieces being referred to as Men and Kings, they are known as Maidens and Queens.

Other than this, the game follows the rules of Spanish Checkers. This is played very much like Anglo-American Checkers, the main difference is that the Queen has a more substantial move along any number of vacant squares, including ones beyond a captured piece. Captures are mandatory. If a player has a choice of captures he must take the greater number of pieces.

name: Waste Diggers: Animal Companions for Five Klicks From the Zone
description:
With this expansion pack for Five Klicks From the Zone you can add an animal companion to your squad. The Waste Digger is a dog..lizard...thing.. that thrives in the wasteland and gives you both the opportunity to employ a new, somewhat unusual type of squad member and to convert and paint a fun model.

On the battle field, the Waste Digger is perfectly suited to zip forward and chew up wayward enemies or to rush in to help someone in trouble. Just watch out, as they are fairly vulnerable to fire.

This is an expansion and requires a copy of Five Klicks From the Zone to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Turf War! Gangland Violence During Prohibition
description:
Turf War: Gangland Violence during Prohibition is a tabletop wargame of gangsters and gun molls.
Each player is the boss of a gang of hardened criminals intent on taking over the Turf of their rivals.
The game can be played stand alone, but includes a comprehensive campaign system that includes Turf, Income, Injury, Experience, Gang building and more.

The core game play mechanics revolve around using your gangsters dice pools appropriately to gain your objectives. All dice rolls are opposed rolls looking for a Target Number, the model with the most successes wins.
However, use your dice pool carefully so you do not run out of key dice when you need them most!

Welcome to the mean streets of Turf War.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Gotta Get Outta This Space
description:
Gotta Get Outta This Space is a print, play and post game for 1-4 players.

You're each stuck on a planet in the robot apocalypse, and one of the last human ships has just arrived in a nearby solar system!

To play, you'll have to print, find or make components for the game.

You'll then guide a spaceship through a few solar systems, with the goal of picking you up and Getting Outta This Space.

As the ship gets improved and damaged, you’ll change the board game components in front of you, writing on some pieces, destroying others, and making new ones with whatever materials you have on hand.

Once you've finished (assuming you do, in fact, get outta this space), you'll pack up the game and send it to someone else, who'll then do the same.

Together, you might just be able to stay alive and out of reach of the new robot overlords!

—description from the designer

name: Flames of War: Dietrich's Ghosts
description:
The dust got into everything.
Feldwebel Unger tied his handkerchief tighter across his nose and mouth, knowing it would make little difference, he could already feel the grit against his teeth.
His platoon was sweeping across the steppes of the Eastern Ukraine, chasing the broken remnants of many Soviet armies.
His Panzer IV had made it through a harsh winter and savage Red Army attacks around Kharkov, but now they were pushing back.

—description from the publisher

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Suicide Squad
description: Contains 6 detailed resin figures and character cards for the DC Universe Miniature Game. Includes Bronze Tiger, Deadshot, Deathstroke, Katana, Killer Croc, and Killer Frost.

name: 矩陣謎語 (Lost in the Grids)
description:
矩陣謎語 (Lost in the Grids) was released as part of the 2020 Taiwanese convention "150 Boardgame Con" where games sell for 150 TWD, roughly $5 USD.

The game consists of a limited deck of cards, with suits visible on the back; some player tokens; and some magnifying glass tokens.

The players' goal is to arrange the cards into a grid such that no suit or rank is duplicated in a row or column. On a turn, a player may choose to use the magnifying glass tokens to peak at a card in the grid or a players hand; then, they must play two cards, one face up and one face down, and can play them into the grid or aside.

At the end of the game, all cards are flipped face up and any cards in a row or column which share a suit or rank are removed. Players earn positive points for cards remaining in the grid and unused tokens, and lose points for cards removed from the grid. The players can then compare their score to a rubric to see how well they did, from "No comment." to "Psychic!"
