mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Grid Coverage

name: Rugby Sevens: the Game
description:
A two-player tabletop game, based on Rugby Sevens. The game is primarily card-based, with dice used for kicking options.
Gameplay involved players taking turns to use an action, which can be to bring a player into the area of play, pass, run, tackle, etc. They players have individual ability values that affect their performance.
There are General Play cards that are collected and used through the game to enhance gameplay.
The game includes set play options for Rucks, Scrums, and Lineouts.

—description from the publisher

name: Brexit: Dead in a Ditch – Independence Day expansion
description:
This expansion for the Brexit: Dead in a Ditch game adds another party: a coalition of Independence Parties. This new party replaces the Minor Parties (LibDems and Brexit Party) from the base game for a 5 players experience.

In this expansion, the Main Parties must fight together against the risk of seeing the United Kingdom implode because of Brexit. Can they put their grudges on the side in order to save their country ? Or can they turn this new player in a political weapon to see their vision of Brexit succeed ?

—description from the designer

name: Blurt!: Sports Game
description:
The Big Idea

Quick! Name the martial art and Olympic sport where one tries to throw or pin an opponent? If you said judo you're ready to join the Blurt! Sports team. Players take turns reading sports-themed clue cards aloud and racing to blurt out the correct answer first, tracking points on a magnetic scoreboard. With 450 sports clues to choose from, the game is never the same!

Psst...They're Learning!
Exercises ability to recall facts
Encourages quick thinking skills
Promotes good sportsmanship and social skills
Cut to the Chase
NEW Sports edition of best-selling Blurt!(R) - over 1 million sold!
Fast-paced rapid recall board game for all ages, perfect for family game night and parties
Includes 75 double-sided cards (450 clues!), 4 magnetic score chip pieces, magnetic score board, and guide
For 3 or more players

—description from the publisher
categories: Educational, Party Game, Sports, Trivia, Word Game

name: 1. FC Köln Quiz
description:
1. FC Köln quiz!

The combination of card and dice game contains 302 questions in six levels of difficulty.
On a roll of "one", answer the easy question, "1", but only score one point.
On a roll of "six", answer the more difficult question "6", but the correct answer is rewarded with six points.


Contents: 62 playing cards with 302 questions (1,208 possible answers)



Hier gibt es nun ein abendfüllendes 1. FC Köln-Quiz!

Die Kombination aus Karten- und Würfelspiel enthält 302 Fragen in sechs Schwierigkeits-Stufen.
Würfel ich eine "Eins", muss ich die leichte Frage "1" beantworten, bekomme aber auch nur einen Taler.
Würfel ich eine "Sechs", ist die Frage "6" zwar schwer, die richtige Antwort wird aber mit sechs Talern belohnt.

name: Prophet Without Honor
description:
In early September 1925, two separate military disasters rocked the United States: a bungled flight during which three Navy seaplanes failed to make it from the West Coast to Hawaii; and, the loss of the Navy's first helium-filled airship and prized treasure, USS Shenandoah and 14 of its crew while flying over the Midwest on an ill-advised public relations tour.

Were these accidents?

Or were they the "result of the incompetency, the criminal negligence, and the almost treasonable negligence of our national defense by the Navy and the War Departments?”

One man would sacrifice his career to take-on the Army, the Navy and the White House to answer these questions.

Blood was on someone's hands and unless something changed, more aviators were going to die in the “old flaming coffins."

Prophet Without Honor, is a courtroom showdown between an officer with a radical idea versus the military establishment keen to remind the world a prophet is without honor in his own home.

In this 2-player card and dice development game, you, as the prosecution or defense, must convince a military tribunal that American aviator, Colonel William (Billy) Mitchell, is guilty...or innocent.

The game begins in the courtroom where Colonel Mitchell of the Army Air Service is being tried for his alleged violation of the 96th Article of War, a catchall provision of military law that would decide if his incendiary, public remarks brought discredit upon the military service.

Players will draft and play cards which will help them strengthen their case with the jurors and recruit them to their side and find overwhelming evidence for or against the accused.

In the longest and most controversial court martial in US history (October 28-December 17, 1925), will the evangelist of Airpower be vindicated?

Or will the nation remain vulnerable to emerging enemies and have to wait 17 years for his predictions to be proven true...at Pearl Harbor.

This is a standalone game. It is volume 2 in the Trial Series by Green Feet Games (previous Volume includes Unforgiven: The Lincoln Assassination Trial).

America was built by people like Mitchell who questioned the status quo and believed that there was always a better way...that would fundamentally change how a nation secures its interests and projects military power.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simulation, Tug of War

name: Spiralo Shamrock
description:
This game is played on a board of concentric rings divided into spaces. Each space has a symbol (heart, diamond, spade, or shamrock).

Each player has four pieces which they enter in the outer ring and attempt to move to the center. Pieces are moved by die roll. Landing on an opposing piece sends it back to the start.

When a piece lands on a symbol which is covered by a piece on a different space, this forms a "pair" and entitled the moving piece to move inwards to the next circle. If this forms another pair it may move again.

name: Best 11 Board Game: AC Milan
description:
Best 11 Board Game: AC Milan football box game!
Buy players, deploy them, challenge whoever you want, manage your team.
The goal of the game is to complete the formation of 11 players, your BEST11.
Play your event cards, surprise your opponents, hire the manager, complete the stage and achieve victory.


Best 11 Board Game: AC Milan
Compra i giocatori, schierali, sfida chi vuoi tu, gestisci il tuo team.
Obiettivo del gioco è completare la formazione di 11 giocatori, i tuoi BEST11.
Gioca le tue carte avvenimento, sorprendi i tuoi avversari, ingaggia l'allenatore, completa lo stadio e otterrai la vittoria.

description:

Buy players, deploy them, challenge whoever you want, manage your team.
The goal of the game is to complete the formation of 11 players, your BEST11.
Play your event cards, surprise your opponents, hire the manager, complete the stage and achieve victory.

name: Best 11 Board Game: U.C. Sampdoria
description:
Best 11 Board Game: U.C. Sampdoria football box game!
Buy players, deploy them, challenge whoever you want, manage your team.
The goal of the game is to complete the formation of 11 players, your BEST11.
Play your event cards, surprise your opponents, hire the manager, complete the stage and achieve victory.


Best 11 Board Game: U.C. Sampdoria
Compra i giocatori, schierali, sfida chi vuoi tu, gestisci il tuo team.
Obiettivo del gioco è completare la formazione di 11 giocatori, i tuoi BEST11.

name: Battle of Adrica: Expansion
description:
The Battle of Adrica is a dice rolling, area control, resource management and soldier elimination game where players take on the role of commanders in charge of their battalion as they are tasked to secure different location in Adrica based on the natural resources in the region.

It was inspired by a make-believe world of what could have happened if the Berlin Conference for the scramble of Africa was not peaceful among the colonials.

Please note: This is a stand-alone game from the previous base-game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Kill Steal, Move Through Deck

name: Best 11 Board Game: Bologna FC
description:
Best 11 Board Game: Bologna FC football box game!
Buy players, deploy them, challenge whoever you want, manage your team.
The goal of the game is to complete the formation of 11 players, your BEST11.
Play your event cards, surprise your opponents, hire the manager, complete the stage and achieve victory.


Best 11 Board Game: Bologna FC
Compra i giocatori, schierali, sfida chi vuoi tu, gestisci il tuo team.
Obiettivo del gioco è completare la formazione di 11 giocatori, i tuoi BEST11.
Gioca le tue carte avvenimento, sorprendi i tuoi avversari, ingaggia l'allenatore, completa lo stadio e otterrai la vittoria.

name: The Game of Presidents
description:
The deck of cards consists of an "A" and "B" card for each of the 27 presidents included. The A card has the dates of his presidency, his political party and his birth and death dates; the B card lists a varying number of significant events of his life or his presidential terms.

Some cards have two presidents on them, presumably because they wanted to include all of them up to the current one at the time of manufacture (Herbert Hoover) while preserving the 54-card deck.

—user summary

name: Pays de Rennes: Le Jeu !
description:
Le Jeu du Pays de Rennes is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.
Nearly 1000 written and visual questions deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current affairs or famous people which marked the Pays de Rennes.


Le Jeu du Pays de Rennes est un jeu de société original, local et convivial basé sur le principe des questions – réponses.
Près de 1000 questions écrites et visuelles traitent de sujets aussi variés que l'Histoire ou la géographie, le patrimoine, les traditions locales, l'actualité ou les personnages célèbres qui ont marqué le Pays de Rennes.

name: Breakthrough: Tanks
description:
Breakthrough is a strategy game where two tank armies fight each other. The goal of the game is to be the first to reach the other end of the board (break through the enemy’s frontline). It has some similarity to Checkers, but the strategy is completely different.

Each team consists of the following units:
2 heavy tanks
4 tank destroyers
10 medium tanks

The game is played with 1:200 scale models. A blue German army fights against a green Soviet one.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Feindbild: Das Kartenspiel
description:
The world is very confusing. It's good if you then have a clear picture of the enemy! Stage your image of the enemy with the right campaign for the right target group and clear away the image of the enemy in a politically correct manner.

"Feindbild" ("Enemy stereotype") - this is a unique game concept in which the fun of the game scratches the satire. The game can be explained in a few minutes. But you can play it for years. Provided, of course, that our enemy stereotypes do not change by then.

Every player gets a target group to work for. Then five images of the enemy are laid out. And then it is important to stage the enemy images with the right media campaign in such a way that the anger of your own target group begins to boil. And that's about it. Isn't it nice when card games can be explained so easily?

As enemy images there are the bad Russians, the classic terrorists, the scruffy social parasite, the greedy pharmaceutical industry and the corrupt European politician. And of course many more. The target groups are the conservatives, the left and the right and of course the totally confused aluminum hat wearers. And as campaigns there is the regulars' table, the focus on television and the daily press. And of course the satirical portals themselves. That closes the circle.

As is usual with card games, you have to spend money on "Feindbild" in order to play it. Yes, we live in evil capitalism. Another enemy image. The game consists of 106 cards, which consist of 18 enemy images, 8 target groups and 80 campaigns. And there are also instructions for use.

name: Ambush!: A Fast-Paced Game of Strategy and Sacrifice
description:
Ambush is a fast-paced, fantasy-themed strategy card game with exciting, dynamic gameplay centered around a cast of colorful characters with different abilities. Ambush seeks to provide the perfect blend of thrilling action and intense strategy in a game where the tide of battle can be turned in the blink of an eye! Take control of your personal castle and craft the perfect army of goblins, wizards, and knights to attack your opponents and defend your own walls from harm. The goal of the game is to be the last castle standing at the end of the hectic free-for-all.

To do this, players will need to plan and strategize for the Ambush phase, where any card played in the game so far is up for grabs in a mad scramble that has a chance to be triggered at the start of every player’s turn. Having the speed and reflexes to grab the best cards first, as well as remembering where the best cards are on the field will be critical in obtaining the upper hand over other players.

Ambush was created as a project for a USC Games class in the fall of 2019 by Michael Ford, Brendan Tighe, Masato Lin, and Tongwei Dai. The team saw some incredible potential in the game, and in the Spring of 2020,a portion of the group reformed and set out to publish and sell the game with the help of USC faculty and developers from other board game start-ups.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Memory, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Rulebreaker
description:
The main rule is to follow the rules, but to win you’re probably going to have to break them! REBEL WITH A CAUSE...be the first to discard all the cards in your hand. As many as you want. As fast as you want. All you have to do is lay them in numerical order...subject to the RULES. You see, as you play, your discards are always subject to certain RULES. Chance upon a RULEBREAKER card, and shake things up with a new RULE! Are you winning? Are you losing? Always too soon to tell.

—description from the publisher

name: The Museum Village 19th Century Americana Tour Game
description:
A roll and move game for two to four people.The goal is to strategically move your pawns such that they share specific spaces in order to gain a souvenir card. This is done by rolling one die on your turn and moving one of your two pawns. The path recreates that of Old Mmuseum Village of Smith's Clove, a mile west of the Village of Monroe, NY., opened in 1950. The game ends when all pawns have reached the end of the path. The player with the most tickets is the winner.

—user summary

name: The Cannabis Trip: The Chilled Spliff Rolling Game
description:
The first player throws the dice and moves onto the board starting at the central YELLOW HUB SPACE.
Players travel in a clockwise direction around each leaf in any order they wish and when they have collected all five spliffs they make their way to the BIG SPLIFF SPACE.
Whichever player arrives there first with all five spliff cards, forming a complete spliff is the winner.

name: Inventor Gadgets
description:
A card based party game where you combine object and feature cards to create a wacky new invention. You then pitch your invention to the group in hopes to advance your invention to the next round.

Each round you can play the role of the inventor, the buyer, and the marketing agent. During each role you may contribute an additional function, a slogan/catch phrase, or market to a specific target audience.

Each successful contribution may award you royalty money.

In the end the inventor with the most investment capital wins.

A wacky, multi-player party game of outlandish on-the-spot creativity.

name: Passport To The Hood Volume_01
description:
The 1st of 3 volumes.
The game that highlights stereotypes of urban culture, says everything that you hear behind closed doors and reflects on how you grew up.
You are ready to play this game if you know:
1) What to do when you see people run
2) A New Yorker’s favorite word
3) What snitches get
4) What the PJ’s mean
5) What not to do at a cookout.
The objective of the game is to not lose points by predicting what answers the opposing teams will select.

Comes with 4 Passports, a gold box, 78 trivia cards (categories: THUG Life (8), Entertainment (20), Lifestyle (42), History (8)).

Instructions:
Pick a host responsible for reading cards and keeping score. Form three or more teams and give them one set of A, B, C, D Decision cards.
Teams show Decision cards at the same time.
Cards with Facts (24) have answers captured in bold. Cards with Majority Vote (54) can only have one A, B, C, D answer. Teams that tie on Majority Vote cards don’t lose a point.
The majority vote determines the answer.
All of the above is not a valid answer.
Teams start with 10 points and lose a point for incorrect answers. The last team with points wins and gets a Passport To The Hood.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Passport To The Hood #Trap Edition
description:
The 2nd of 3 volumes.
Funny – AF no artificial flavors or colors.
The game that highlights stereotypes of urban culture, says everything that you hear behind closed doors and reflects on how you grew up.
You are ready to play this game if you know:
1) The type of car dope boys drive
2) What to do if you get hit in school
3) How many times to reuse chicken grease
4) How to play spades
5) How to survive prison.
The objective of the game is to not lose points by predicting what answers the opposing teams will select.
Comes with 4 Passports, a pink box, 78 trivia cards (categories: Trap (21), Entertainment (26), Lifestyle (23), History (8)), plays up to 24 people.

Instructions:
Pick a host responsible for reading cards and keeping score. Form three or more teams and give them on set of A, B, C, D Decision cards.
Teams show Decision cards at the same time.
Cards with Facts (32) have answers captured in bold. Cards with Majority Vote (46) can only have one A, B, C, D answer. Teams that tie on Majority Vote cards don’t lose a point.
The majority vote determines the answer.
All of the above is not a valid answer.
Teams start with 10 points and lose a point for incorrect answers. The last team with points wins and gets a Passport To The Hood.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Passport to The Hood #Feds Watching
description:
The 3rd of 3 volumes.
The game that highlights stereotypes of urban culture, says everything that you hear behind closed doors and reflects on how you grew up.
You are ready to play this game if you know:
1) The best song to start a fight in the club
2) The first thing people do when they get out of jail
3) The type of car to get racially profiled in
4) What’s the best HBCU.
The objective of the game is to not lose points by predicting what answers the opposing teams will select.

Comes with 4 Passports, a blue box, 78 trivia cards (categories: Feds Watching (18), Entertainment (12), Lifestyle (45), History (3)).

Instructions:
Pick a host responsible for reading cards and keeping score. Form three or more teams and give them one set of A, B, C, D Decision cards.
Teams show Decision cards at the same time.
Cards with Facts (24) have answers captured in bold. Cards with Majority Vote (54) can only have one A, B, C, D answer. Teams that tie on Majority Vote cards don’t lose a point.
The majority vote determines the answer.
All of the above is not a valid answer.
Teams start with 10 points and lose a point for incorrect answers. The last team with points wins and gets a Passport To The Hood.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Roach Party
description:
Roach Party is a fun party board game that mimics the lifestyle of an everyday pot smoker. What many may not know is this game has been around for a long time and you really never hear anything about it.

It was originally released in 1979, right after Cheech & Chong’s first movie, Up in Smoke. Roach Party was sold in head shops when they began popping up in the 80’s. It had great success, sold thousands of copies and was even featured in High Times Magazine. All was good until feds started raiding the shops and merchandise was seized, thus resulting in the disappearance of this really awesome stoner game.

The object of the game is to be the first player to accumulate a COMPLETE STASH. This is done by collecting all four of the ROACH CARDS. These include the BAGGIE, PAPERS, FIRE, and SUPPLIER cards.
Lastly you must acquire the funds to pay your supplier. Once you have all four cards and the funds required pay your supplier, you are the winner of Roach Party.

name: The Story Of My Life: A Trivia Game For Women
description:
The Story Of My Life: A Trivia Game For Women

A fun-filled journey highlighting the social, personal and cultural experiences that cultivate the life stories of women.

Play this game and find out what stories you have in common with your friends.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: The Powers That Be
description:
The time is now for dark secrets to come to light. The world is in chaos and only an elite few know the truth behind the scenes. There is an invisible and powerful force working in the shadows, manipulating the masses to control our world.

Playing as a global elite ruler in 2020, in this hybrid, deck-building / worker placement game, you must first build your cabal by acquiring assets. Then, use your best strategy to attack your enemies and successfully stage events on the global scale. Your goal is to stay invisible, while gaining power over the masses using your best strategy and card based, dice battles.

The winner is the first player to enter the "eye in the triangle" with 13 power points, where you rule the world and no one knows you exist.

The board works like a clock from above, with three dice rolled simultaneously to move the 3 main Board Pieces. The lower level of the board contains the assets, the middle level holds the special cards and the top, zodiac level is for pyramid activation, betting and scoring.
Do you have what it takes to reach the top
of the pyramid and become, The Powers That Be?

—description from the designer
categories: Economic, Educational, Modern Warfare, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Betting and Bluffing, Connections, Dice Rolling, Moving Multiple Units, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Turn Order: Role Order, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Glyffiti
description:
Glyffiti is a tile placement game where each player takes the role of an aspiring spellcaster. They work together to cast a city-wide megaspell, while competing to ensure the spell fits their secret agendas.

Players take turns doing one of three actions: Drawing a glyph tile from the bag, playing a glyph tile to the board, or removing a glyph tile from the board. Each glyph has a primary and secondary element, of the classical fire, water, air, earth, or spirit.

At the beginning of the game, each player receives three agenda cards, of which they choose one to keep. This card lists how the player will score at the end of the game. They will gain points for some element types, and lose points for others. Score is based on what elements are present in the outer five spaces when all ten spaces are filled.

-description from designer

name: Bluffy Pirates
description:
Bluffy Pirates is an extremely fun, highly competitive, strategic party game, suited for groups from 4 to 6 people. The game is usually full of good (and bad ) emotions, as two main key aspects are timing and, as the name suggests, bluffing.

Each round, players fight each other for one of the many different magical treasures. During one's turn, the player has two choices: either play a card with a symbol of the treasure of the round, or skip the turn, waiting for better opportunities, or simply missing the necessary card to play. Players take turns clockwise, deciding on the best strategy to win the treasure. Once a player holds a treasure for an entire turn, he gets to take it back to his ship and gains its special effect. The game is over, once a player collects 4 different treasures.

The best part of the game is when you feel like a mastermind, like you've outsmarted all of your friends. While everyone was fighting for the treasure, you were waiting for the perfect moment to strike. Just when one of your friends was about to take the treasure back to his ship, you laugh at his face and curb his expectations, by taking the treasure into your own hands. You feel ecstatic, you are about to win the game. And just at the moment when you think that you had it in the bag... One of your friends starts laughing at your face and you very well know, what's about to come.

name: World At War 85: We Shall Hold
description:
We Shall Hold is the third volume in the World At War 85 series of games depicting fast and furious platoon-level combat. The game series is set in 1985, in an alternate history of World War III, when the Warsaw Pact armies storm across the border of East Germany in a powerful attempt to seize West Germany and the whole of Free Europe.

Covering even more battles on the North German Plain as well as parts of southern West Germany, We Shall Hold includes playing pieces for NATO nationalities forward-deployed toward the border between East and West Germany, or in the second line in southern Germany. NATO units are included representing the Belgian, Dutch, Canadian, and West German armies. Opposing them are units of two of the nations of the Warsaw PACT: the East Germans and the Soviet juggernaut, both deploying vast numbers of tanks and infantry in an attempt to overwhelm NATO’s lines.
Fight hypothetical battles using the stalwart Leopard-C1s and Scimitars of the 4th Canadian Mechanized Brigade Group. Deploy and maneuver Leopard-1s, Scimitars, and Milan-2 armed Jeeps of the Belgian Army. Fiercely defend against hordes of Warsaw PACT armor on the North German Plain using the deadly Leopard-2s of the Dutch Army. Assault the line with long-ranged East Germans T-72 tanks, supported by BMP-2 infantry fighting vehicles, armed with deadly Spandrel anti-tank guided missiles. Mass your Soviet attacking forces for a breakthrough using T-80 main battle tanks, more BMP-2s, Engineers for assault, and self-propelled 120mm mortars.

We provide the scenarios, but YOU are IN COMMAND.

The World At War 85 system features a unique combat system that involves die rolls by both attacking units and defending units, which keeps both players engaged throughout the game. Die rolls are compared and hits are applied quickly, as all the information you need to fight your units is on the counters. No combat results table is necessary. Initiative, random formation activation and turn length; direct, indirect, opportunity and anti-aircraft fire; fire and movement, assault, and close air support; all are integrated smoothly into a fast, easy to play system.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Kamikaze Nanobots
description:
Kamikaze Nanobots is a strategic, multi-player, hyper-aggressive, shoot ’em up board game. Carnage and self-destruction are actively encouraged in pursuit of victory.

The aim of the game is to destroy your opponent’s MOTHERSHIP whilst protecting your own.

Players attack and defend using SHIPS filled with NANOBOTS. SHIPS can perform different ACTIONS depending on the number of NANOBOTS onboard.

A player loses the game when a single SHOT hits their MOTHERSHIP’S core.

The game is available to print (3d printer and desktop printer needed).

—description from the designer

name: Thieves' Dilemma
description:
Who's got the money? Who can you trust?

A heist is going down. Thieves want the loot, though it’s safer if their partner is holding the bag. Guards want to recover the loot and get more glory if they recover it themselves. And a detective just wants to know who did it.

This fast-paced game is full of twists and turns just like your favorite heist movie. The gameplay is similar to Love Letter but without any player elimination. You always have one character card and one object card—on your turn you might gain information or even switch characters.

—description from the designer

name: Quiz OM
description:
Do you think you know everything about Olympique de Marseille and you want to challenge your friends on your knowledge of the only French club that is European champion?

This quiz box is made for you!

More than 500 questions divided into 250 cards - answers on the back - are available to play at all levels and at all ages!
Compete against your friends and family and demonstrate the extent of your knowledge about OM: the players, the matches, the managers, the coaches, the anecdotes, the highlights of the club's life, etc ...


Vous croyez tout connaître sur l'Olympique de Marseille et vous voulez défier vos amis sur vos connaissances du seul club français champion d'Europe ?

Cette boîte à quiz est faite pour vous !

Plus de 500 questions réparties en 250 cartes - les réponses sont écrites au dos -, sont proposées pour jouer à tous les niveaux et à tout âge !
Affrontez vos amis et votre famille et démontrez l'étendue de vos connaissances au sujet de l'OM : les joueurs, les matchs, les dirigeants, les entraîneurs, les anecdotes, les moments forts de la vie du club, etc...

name: Pays de Caen: Le jeu
description:
The game of the Pays de Caen.
From Ouistreham to Argences, from Evrecy to Troarn, discover the country of Caen while having fun.
Nearly 550 questions and photos on various themes such as geography, heritage, history, famous people, current affairs, traditions but also charades and riddles.

And "junior" questions for children, 7+


Le Jeu du Pays de Caen.

De Ouistreham à Argences, de Evrecy à Troarn, découvrez le pays de Caen en vous amusant.
Jeu de société original, local et convivial, à découvrir entre amis ou en famille..
Partez de votre commune et redécouvrez votre territoire en vous amusant.
Près de 550 questions et photos sur des thèmes variés tels que la géographie, le patrimoine, l'histoire, les personnages célèbres, l'actualité, les traditions mais aussi des charades et des devinettes.

Et pour les enfants à partir de 7 ans, des questions "junior".

name: Coach and Play
description:
Coach and Play Football
Deal 6 cards to each player and place the rest into 2 piles
The first player to get rid of all his/her cards wins one round
Win 4 Rounds to finish the game and be the champion
Win extra round by collecting 5 players of your team.

Gameplay
Each player places the logo of his team in front of him. The dealer chooses the direction of play (e.g. clockwise). Each player is dealt 6 cards and the remainder of the cards is placed into 2 draw piles. It is forbidden for each player to hide the back of his/her cards. After each round the winner is the dealer and starts the game.

The dealer turns over a top card from one of the 2 piles to begin a discard pile. This is the starting card. The dealer must match this card by playing the same COLOR, same NUMBER, same TEAM or same SPECIAL card. If the player wants to pass or is unable to play, he/she must pick up one card from any pile. This card can be played, or another or the player can pass.

It is possible to play several cards at the same time, if they have same number, same team or same symbol (special cards), regardless of the color(s). It is therefore possible to play combination of number and teams.

Each player can collect his/her 5 players in front of him. It counts as a played card. It is possible to place several players at the same time. These cards are not shuffled at the end of the round, each person keeps his/her own players.

The first to collect his/her 5 players wins one round but it continues if the player still has cards in hand.
If 5 players are collected, all cards are shuffled including all collected cards from each player.

—description from the publisher

name: Mint Tin Monster Mash
description:
A royal rumble of epic proportions in a small package.

1 - 4 players will take some magnificent creature creations and battle them against each other. You must manage your energy reserves and mutate your creatures to survive. A simple but strategic dice rolling system will see you through to victory.....or defeat!

On a turn a player will Draw a Card and Receive an energy, then they may play any combo of two actions, play a monster, play a boost or receive an energy. After every three rounds players will battle their monsters in the arena.

The game ends when a player has defeated and collected three opponents monsters.

When you have vanquished your foes pack the game back up into it's tin and put it in your pocket!

—description from the designer

name: Escale à Amiens
description:
Roll dice and move your pawn throughout the city of Amiens from space to space.
The goal is to be the first player to complete a schedule of activities (find accommodation, a restaurant to eat, go shopping, etc.) before arriving at the "town hall" space.
The players also have banknotes to practice all their activities.
It's up to them to manage their expenses properly in a similar way as monopoly ...
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: De Boca en Boca
description:
Be the first one to complete your start !
De Boca en Boca is a Trivia Game with questions about one of Argentina's Greatest Soccer Team.
Pick questions among 5 themes:

History
Half plus one
campaigns
who's who
potpourri
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Avanti
description:
Avanti is played on a 8x8 grid. Each player has 16 plastic cylinders on the rows nearest them, but one is in their opponent's color and one has a pawn standing on top. The object of the game is to get your pawn to your piece that starts on your opponent's side of the board, but it can only move on the cylinders.

The cylinders move by jumping over one or more cylinders of the same color, and an opposing cylinder at the end of a line can be captured by landing on it. You can also move the opposing goal cylinder on your side of the board.

name: Ajax competitiespel
description:
Ajax competitiespel is played on a board representing a football pitch with the famous 4-3-3 Ajax formation.
The goal is to be the first one to assemble the complete team on the board, as well as a trainer:

4 defenders
3 midfielders
3 attackers
1 keeper
1 trainer


3000 (easy to hard) questions about the Ajax Amsterdam.

name: The Down Mail
description:
Roll and move your train through a number of stations and signal points and complete the journey before the other players.

A beautiful example of a basic game from the early 20th century.

name: Aggression
description:
Most abstract strategy games are played with a single, central goal in mind, or sometimes a secondary goal. For example, in Chess it is to checkmate the King, in Checkers it is to eliminate all of the opponent's pieces or force a stalemate. Aggression is different in that it has several possible goals in play simultaneously. All the pieces move and capture the same as one another. Complexity of play is achieved by having a unique win/loss condition tied to each separate piece type. Players must juggle the demands of multiple goals and adjust strategies throughout play.

Pieces have two kinds of movement, a March or a Lunge. A March is a sliding move in a straight line any number of empty squares, like a Chess Queen. A Lunge is a capturing move. The piece jumps over an adjacent enemy piece to a vacant square on the other side. Only one piece can be captured on a turn. Multiple jumps are not allowed.

The game is played on a 7x8 board. On each player's back row, the central space is marked with a flag.

The Blue player goes first. Each player begins with a Scout in hand. On their first turn, a player moves forward one of his Infantry pieces. Then he drops his Scout on any empty square on the board, as long as it is not under attack. After that, each player makes two moves per turn. First moving one of his regular pieces, then moving his Scout.

The Scout and the General are both defensive pieces and have the further restriction of not being allowed to move to a space where they can be attacked. Since there are two moves involved each turn, it is permitted to move the General to a space where it may be jumped by an enemy piece, as long as the Scout immediately moves behind the General to guard it.

The piece types and their winning conditions are:

Scout: [Blockade] A Scout requires freedom of movement to do its job. If a player is able to trap or capture the opponent's Scout so that it has no legal move on its turn, the player wins.

Infantry: [Elimination] If all seven units of the opponent's Infantry are captured, the player wins.

Sapper: [Arrangement] Sappers seek to construct a fortification within enemy territory. 'Enemy territory' is defined as the four rows on the opponent's side of the board. A 'fortification' is three Sappers connected in a row, horizontally or vertically. Diagonally does not count.

Saboteur: [Traversal] A Saboteur seeks to blow up the enemy's Regimental Headquarters. The HQ is the central space located on a player's back row, and is marked with a flag. The player wins if he is able to move the Saboteur safely across the board and on to the opponent's Regimental Headquarters square.

General: [Checkmate] The player wins if they are able to checkmate the opponent's General. As in Chess, if the player's General is in Check, then the player on their next move must get their General out of check, if possible.

—description from the designer

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Justice League
description:
The Justice League is an elite metahuman team, comprising Earth's greatest super heroes. Founded by Batman and Wonder Woman, they are dedicated to protecting the world as the first line of defense against terrestrial, extra-terrestrial, inter-dimensional and supernatural threats.

Contains 5 resin figures and character cards for the Universe Miniatures game based on the movie. Contains Aquaman, Batman, Flash, Superman, and Wonder Woman.

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Justice League Dark
description:
The Justice League Dark is an organization of heroes with uncanny powers, dedicated to protecting the world from mystic and supernatural threats. When conventional super heroes are at a loss to combat the weirdest magical threats, the Justice League Dark venture where others fear to tread...

Includes 7 resin figures and character cards to include the Justice League Dark to the DC Universe game. Includes Black Orchid, Constantine, Deadman, Etrigan and Jason Blood, and Zatanna.

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Batman Villains
description: Includes 6 resin figures and character cards to include Gotham's most powerful villains to the DC Universe game. Includes Bane, Clayface, R'as Al Ghul, Riddler, Scarecrow, and Solomon Grundy.

name: G'Zoink: Expansion 01 – The Dingdom of the Dong
description:
A New Locale with 15 Giggities and 10 new Lowdowns.

The Dingdom of the Dong is the first in a series of exciting expansions for the incredibly fun and easy to learn G'Zoink game.

It introduces a new locale and 10 new lowdown cards to the great giggity gigging gallivant.

—description from the designer

name: Lucca on a Roll
description:
Promotional roll & write game created for the 2020 edition of the Lucca Comics & Games fair, to be included into the "goods bag" provided to attendees of the Campfire events.

The game simulates a visit to the Lucca Comics & Games fair: by optimizing the use of five dice roll results, players have to visit the different areas of the fair:
- The Games stands
- The Comics stands
- The Japan Town area
- The exibitions
- The Movie and TV area

In addition, spending time walking on the Lucca walls provides additional points and bonuses.

The game is played over eight rounds and each session is about 20 minutes long. It can be played solo or against any number of players, provided each of them have a copy of the game sheet. A single set of 5 dice is used, regardless of the number of players.

Designed by award-winning game designer Stefano Castelli and illustrated by Alan D'Amico.

name: Hexinos
description:
A tile placement game for all ages, this intuitive-to-play and fast moving game involves pattern (tile edge) matching and spatial recognition. The game is played with six-sided tiles, each edge having either one, two, three or four pips.

Usually a 2-4 player game, Hexinos can be played by five player (six is unwieldly and its too long between turns).

All players start each turn with two tiles (hidden from the other players). On their turn the player places one of those two tiles onto the game table, matching at least one edge of their six sided tile to a tile edge already on the game table. That placement is immediately scored (see below), the player retrieves another tile from the facedown tilepile and then the player to their left takes their turn. Play continues until all tiles have been placed.

There are two ways of scoring Hexinos tile placement: Basic and Advanced. Basic can be used with younger kids or just to make the game play go a bit faster.

Basic scoring is super basic - if the player matches:

+ one edge of their tile to one edge of a tile already on the game table: score one point

+ two edges of their tile: score three points

+ three edges of their tile: score six points

+ four edges of their tile: score ten points

+ five edges of their tile: score fifteen points

+ all edges of their tile - the "perfect match": that player wins immediately.

Advanced scoring requires both addition and multiplication:

+ one edge of their tile to one edge of a tile already on the game table: score one point for each pip on that matching edge of the player's tile (e.g. if the matching tile edge has three pips, its three points (not six))

+ two edge match: count total pips on the matching edges of the players tile, then multiply that by two

+ three edge match: count total pips on the matching edges of the players tile, then multiply that by three

+ four edge match: count total pips on the matching edges of the players tile, then multiply that by four

+ five edge match: count total pips on the matching edges of the players tile, then multiply that by five

For both Basic and Advanced scoring - if the placed tile closes off an empty tile space (called "bridging"), the placing player scores as usual for the edges that match, then a bonus of six points for each empty hex that has been closed off.

A note about younger players:
As long as the player can hold and place the tiles, Hexinos can be played at any age. For younger players it encourages both pattern matching and spatial recognition - seeing their tile with an edge with 2 pips next to a 3 pip edge, but does that match what is on the tiles already on the table, or is the 2 & 3 "backwards"? And with the basic scoring system, kids easily grasp the benefit of "more edges matching is better" without needed to know addition or multiplication.

-description from designer
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Party Game

name: Inferno and Glory
description:
A quick playing set of fleet action level Renaissance naval rules covering the period 1450 to 1600, allowing large scale battles such as Lepanto and Prevesa to be completed in a couple of hours or less.
They have been written with 1/2400 scale models based in groups or stands, with each stand representing 5 to 10 ships.
A range of suitable 3D models are available for free download to accompany the rules.
Bookkeeping is minimal, using simple markers to indicate ship damage and crew casualties.
Data for over 30 different broad ship types and ten different fleet lists are included, covering the major fleets and city states of the Mediterranean.

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Top Trumps Quiz: The Celtic Football Club
description:
Are you a Celtic fan?
Can you identify how many players have scored more than 200 goals for the team?
Can you remember specific games from European campaigns?
Travel back to the origins of Celtic FC via the pinnacle of Europe in May 1967 and right up to today's star players.
Test your Bhoys knowledge to see if you come top of the table.

With 500 questions to answer, it's great for the whole family, whether you want a quick game on the go or to spend some time seeing how much you really know!
With a Top Trumps twist at the end to test your memory, can you remember what you learned just moments ago?

Key Details:

Quizzical fun with a Top Trumps Twist.
Entertaining educational card game loved for bringing your favourite subjects to life including questions on the Lisbon Lions, stadium and legendary players and managers.
500 puzzling and captivating questions that will test your knowledge and memory.
Easy-to-carry plastic case means there are no limits on gameplay.
Prepare to outsmart your opponents, discover new and exciting facts and duel your way to becoming the Top Trump.

name: Escale au Touquet Paris-Plage
description:
The game "Escale au Touquet Paris-Plage" is the ideal game to have a good time with family and friends.

Roll dice and move your pawn throughout the the seaside resort of Le Touquet from space to space.
The goal is to be the first player to complete a schedule of activities (find accommodation, a restaurant to eat, go shopping, etc.) before arriving at the "town hall" space.
The players also have banknotes to practice all their activities.
It's up to them to manage their expenses properly in a similar way as monopoly ...
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Escale à Berck sur Mer
description:
Roll dice and move your pawn throughout the seaside resort of Berck sur Mer from space to space.
The goal is to be the first player to complete a schedule of activities (find accommodation, a restaurant to eat, go shopping, etc.) before arriving at the "town hall" space.
The players also have local banknotes to practice all their activities.
It's up to them to manage their expenses properly in a similar way as monopoly ...
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Multiplicity
description:
Multiplicity is a pure placement abstract strategy game.

The game starts on an empty hexhex board. White moves first, after which turns alternate. Moving is compulsory.

1. The restricted placement phase

White starts by placing one stone on the empty board. From that point on players take turns to:

Place a stone on a cell adjacent to the last stone placed by the opponent, and ...
... place a stone on a cell that has only vacant cells as neighbors.

When the player to move cannot make the second placement of their turn, their turn ends, the restricted placement phase ends, and the free placement phase begins.

2. The free placement phase

Now players take turns placing one stone on any vacant cell.

The game ends when the board has only 1 empty cell remaining. (Now each player has placed the same number of stones.)

The player with the highest score wins. A player's score is the product of the sizes of all his groups. Ties are rare but possible.

Several games by Christian Freeling use this "one bound, one free" placement protocol, which he began exploring in 2012.

name: After School Ghost Club
description:
When the Ghost Club dares you to go into the abandoned school, you accept. After all, as a member of the Ghost Club yourself you don’t want to look like a coward. So, after stepping through the front doors, you quickly realize you’re locked inside! It seems the only way to get the doors open again is to capture the ghosts whose energy is keeping them shut!

One player takes the role of the student while the other takes the role of the ghosts. The goal is different for both. The student is trying to escape the school after capturing enough ghosts. The Ghost is trying to reduce the Student to 0 Health or bar them from ever escaping the school again!

Perfect for fans of horror anime and games such as Corpse Party, Fatale Frame, Ghost Hunt, and more!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Print & Play

name: Terror in the Theater
description:
Dear Detective,

If you are receiving this letter, it is because I am dead. Dark forces beyond anything you can imagine have converged upon me and taken my life from me . . . or perhaps something worse.

I have seen horrors beyond what the normal human mind can comprehend. Strange yellow mists that swirl in the streets, actors dressed in robes who have no face, and a looming figure standing on the stage of Arkham Theater--waiting just beyond some unseen veil to come into our world.

It has taken all of my willpower simply not to go insane.

I’ve been investigating a strange underground society in the theater district of Arkham. They claim to be a thespians society, an acting club, but I know for a fact they are a cult--a cult hellbent on bringing doom to our world. This is the very thing I was trying to prevent.

Now . . . it is up to you to stop them once and for all.

Tonight, they are putting on a play . . . a horrific performance that is the final rites to summon The King in Yellow. The play must be performed in complete darkness for the summoning to work.

Go to Arkham Theater. Light every lantern in the damn building to keep them from finishing that play. Get evidence to reveal their evil scheme once and for all!

Sincerely,

A Friend

P.S. For heavens sake, keep those damn lanterns lit!

Terror in the Theater is a Roll+Write role-playing game of Horror Investigation set in 1920s New England. You, the detective/investigator, are following the pleas of a dead friend to check out the theater in the town of Arkham. It is there you will find the horrors you need to face.
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Dice, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: There is Something in the House!
description:
As a lifelong member of the Tokyo police force, you have seen and investigated many horrific things. However, nothing left you as disturbed or shaken as the house. . . The house was one of your very first investigations after being promoted to Detective. An elderly woman who lived there disappeared for months, inciting a missing person investigation, only to have her turn up a year later in the empty home . . . her head removed. You never did figure out where the woman vanished to in all those months, and you never figured out who killed her. All you know is that after you stepped foot in the house, your life took a turn for the worse. Your wife died, your home burned down, and things never seemed to get better. Now, near retirement and severely alcoholic, you are determined to go back to the house and figure out just what is going on in there once and for all. Somehow, however, you know that whatever is living there . . . it is evil.

There is Something in the House is a simple Roll+Write inspired by Japanese horror media. It is a miniature print and play-style board game with storytelling elements where you take on the role of a retiring police detective. All you need is the 2 game sheets, a pencil, and some dice.

Turn down the lights, turn on some spooky music, and play by candlelight!
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Paper-and-Pencil, Re-rolling and Locking, Role Playing

name: Pulp City: Cold War
description: Pulp City expansion adding two new factions, Supreme Alliance and Red Republik.

name: Adventura
description:
There are countless wonders around the world, each with its own peculiarity, such as treasures, artifacts and also sinister mysteries. In Adventura, you are an explorer in search of emotions and to discover the greatest secrets in the world.
Adventura is an exploration game for 1 to 4 players. The game mainly follows the roll and write mechanics. Divided by turns, each player can choose to explore a location, travel to another location or perform actions such as shopping, improving their team and equipment.
The goal is to earn the highest score by finding all the hidden treasures on the maps.

—description from the designer

name: MixClay
description:
Sculpting Party Game of mixing the shapes defined by keywords to create your unique piece in clay and guessing other players mixes.

Imagine wild mixes: Bread+Cat , Pretzel+Eiffel Tower
and etc..

Players secretly chooses two keywords from different cards in their hand, and try to the best of their abilities and creativity to create one single sculpture in clay that mixes the shapes of chosen keywords. Players use their hands and sculpting tool to sculpt the piece.

Then, players try to guess other players keywords by looking at other players sculptures.

You gain points by creatively mixing the shapes, people correct guessing your keywords and by guessing other players keywords. Keywords have different levels of difficulty.

—description from the designer

name: Flottenspiel
description:
The game board is divided into four sections, one for each player. The players have to get as many of their four ships as possible from space 1 to space 24 to win the game. Movement is determined by a number die and a special die. The special die decides which of the four ships is to be moved: L= Linienschiff, T= Torpedoboot, K= Kreuzer, S= Schulschiff, blank (2x)= no ship.

If a ship gets on a space with an image wich is already occupied by an enemy ship in another section, this enemy ship has to begin from space 1 again.

Whenever two ships get on the same numbered space, they constitute a bockade and the player gets two coins from each other player.

On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. On space 24 the ship is destroyed and is eliminated from the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Nur nicht aufregen
description:
The players have to get their 4 meeples (or as many as possible) from space A to space 100. Movement is determined by a die. If a meeple gets on a space occupied by another player, the later has to return his meeple to the home area.

On the roll of a 6 or by reaching space 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80 or 90 another meeple may move from a home space to Space A or from Space A onto the race track.

If a player gets on spaces 17, 33, 67 or 83 the meeple gets arrested. Only on the roll of a 5 a meeple may leave an arrest cell.

A meeple getting on space 50 is in prison and stays there for the reminder of the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gioco Delle Tre Oche
description:
A children's boardgame printed in Italy during WWII. It seems that it was printed around the time of the Italian armistice. It is presumably produced in the areas of Italy occupied by Fascist forces as the three geese in the title are America, Britain and USSR and the board appears to give you advantages for landing on Axis themed spaces. It seems to be a roll and move game and the playing pieces and dice are printed next to the board for cutting and assembling. The aim of the game is to reach the center of the board where victory is achieved by the loyal Italian Fascist forces.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Quadrato
description:
Each player has 12 (small edition) or 18 (large edition) game pieces. In turns the players place one of their pieces on the game board, trying to occupy all four corners (yellow dots)of any square. When all pieces are set, movement begins. Movement is one space in any direction.

If a player completes a square, he may capture any opponent piece not being part of a completed square ant put it in the center of his new square. Pieces that are part of a square may not be moved for the reminder of the game.

The first player to complete 4 (or 6 with the large edition) squares wins the game.

—user summary

name: Fliegender Holländer
description:
The players start with 10 ships (plastic tokens) each at their starting spaces. Movement is determined by 2 dice. The result of both dice may be used for one ship or the result of each die for another ship. The players may chose to bring a new ship into play or move a ship already on the board.

The ships may be placed on empty spaces or on top of ships of the same color but never on top of enemy ships. If a ship gets on a space with a single enemy ship, the enemy ship is taken from the board and has to start anew. A single ship can't be taken, when it is protected by friendly ships on the space directly behind it.

If a ship gets on an unprotected stack of enemy ships, only one enemy ship is taken from the board, the rest are set back according the roll of one die for each ship.

The game ends when all 16 spaces in the center of the board are occupied. The player with the most ships in the center spaces defeats the Flying Dutchman and wins the game. Ships that sail past the center spaces have to complete their journey and then start again.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Seekrieg-Spiel "Gilling"
description:
Each player commands a fleet of 12 ships (4 Linienschiffe, 3 Kreuzer, 5 Torpedoboote). One player represents England, the other Germany. Each ship stars in a harbor of its country.

Each turn the players may move two of their ships a number of spaces according to their type in any direction.

If enemy ships meet in the same space, combat is settled according to number and types of the involved ships.

The game ends when one player has lost his entire fleet. The other player wins the game.

—user summary

name: Hyper Bloom
description:
Hyper Bloom, a.k.a. ハイパーブルーム is a board-building game in which the game board is created anew by players over the course of each game.

On a turn, you move your token on the board to gain magic power from the spaces you cross, then you use this power to install magic circles on desired locations. When you move into your own magic circles, your piece accelerates, moving farther and ideally netting you even more magic power so that you can set up ideal future moves in this luck-free, perfect information game.

You also want to collect victory points as you move around the board, but you need to have a balance between scoring and creating an ideal board situation or else other players will accelerate past you to steal points away.

Hyper Bloom includes twenty special magic circle cards, each with a unique power, and if you wish, you can play with eight of them in a game to create a new playing environment. The game also includes rules for team play when you have four players.

name: Ecliptic: The Lord of the Zodiac
description:
Ecliptic is a 2-player tactical game where one has to manage simultaneously astrological cards and polyhedral dice.
The game includes 72 playing cards representing the 12 zodiacal signs, each one in 6 different colors and astronomical symbols (sun, moon, star, galaxy, planet, comet).
Each player has a set of polyhedral dice: D4, D6, D8, D10, D12, D20.
There are also 12 neutral bicolor cards that have to be set in-line to form the Zodiac line. This line separates the two sides, white against blue.
The goal of the game is to obtain the largest number possible of consecutive signs or of a same symbol. The principle is to put down a pair of cards of same sign in order to be allowed to place a third card on his side of the Zodiac.
It is permitted to place a sign on the line only if it is different from the ones which are already on its side. If the opponent has already placed a card there, then a battle is engaged to determine which player will keep that sign.
For the battle, both players secretly choose a die among their available dice. The dice are thrown and the winner is the player obtaining the highest score. The used dice are then put away.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Auction Web
description: Auction sales aren't fair, someone’s got to be the winner among 5 organizations that takes 15 - 25 minutes to play. In Auction Web, players take on roles as powerful leaders of 5 mysterious organizations seeking to bid successfully on properties with in-game cryptocurrency Litcoins. Every Litcoin comes with a Lowball ability, which adds blending strategy and twist to the gameplay. In order to win, you must be ready to read the next steps of your rivals and analyze their strategy. While on the surface it seems like a simple "high card wins" game, most cards have secondary effects that trigger upon a loss, so clever timing and card play tend to be the name of the game. On top of that all properties provide a unique benefit, and certain combinations provide additional points as well, so players will find they have multiple routes to victory. Variety in properties, their combinations and its trigger effects provide a lot of replayability and add depth to the game play. Your trial membership entitles you to 14 LitCoin credits to get you started. Best of luck and remember our motto: No refunds!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Selection Order Bid, Set Collection

name: Tapatiometro
description:
Tapatiometro is a boardgame about the city of Guadalajara in Mexico.

Along 36 spaces, players (or teams) advance by rolling a dice and answering questions.
Every five squares, players will find a space called Sweet or Savory. If you fall there, you will have to choose one of the two categories.

Questions are about local places, people, artists, athletes, food and anecdotes of the city of Guadalajara as well as the state of Jalisco.

Memory and knowledge of the city will help you win.
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition Picardie
description:
Discover or rediscover the region of Picardy in 1800 questions by playing with the new Trivial Pursuit rules which will allow you to win a marker triangle on all the squares of the board.

Content: 1 board, 300 question-answer cards, 2 card boxes, 1 die, 6 pie charts, 36 colored marker triangles.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Voyage: The Last Refuge
description:
In Voyage, a captivating board game, you will take on the role of the advanced AI system and sole overseer of a monumental seedship, you are entrusted with the last slumbering members of an unknown and now extinct species. Your objective is to navigate the vastness of space on an epic quest to discover a new, suitable homeworld. This challenging voyage will span thousands, if not tens of thousands of years, filled with uncharted territories, precarious resource management, and thematic events that will put your strategic acumen to the ultimate test.
Throughout this solo play experience, you'll need to make critical decisions by utilizing card overlay to carefully construct routes and manage scarce resources to ensure the ship's survival and the preservation of its most precious cargo, your passengers. As the ship's AI, you will be the sole guiding force in this desperate struggle for existence. The cosmos holds both untold opportunities and potential hazards that will shape the destiny of the enigmatic populace you carry.

Can you persevere through the daunting trials of space, endure the trials of time, and lead this solitary seedship to a new home amidst the unforgiving cosmos? The fate of an entire species rests solely in your hands in Voyage.
categories: Dice, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Events, Push Your Luck, Variable Set-up

name: Credo
description:
Credo was a board used for playing a variety of different abstract games, primarily two-player games adapted for three players although two-handed versions could be played on it as well.

The board came with a booklet which in addition to Chess gave rules for many Draughts/Checkers variants, Nine Men's Morris, Reversi/Othello, Chinese Checkers, Halma, and other games.

name: SuperTmatik Quiz Benfica
description:
SuperTmatik Quiz Benfica, a test of knowledge on Benfica's athletes, titles, historical facts, curiosities and much more.
Each card contains questions of different levels and a letter (S U P E R T).
Each player tries to answer questions faster than his opponent(s).
The first player to complete the "SUPERT" before his opponent(s) wins.

Each deck includes 54 cards; 378 questions and their answers; 4 degrees of difficulty. Instructions in Portuguese

SuperTmatik Quiz Benfica, um verdadeiro teste aos seus conhecimentos sobre o Glorioso (atletas, títulos, factos históricos, curiosidades e muito mais). Cada baralho inclui 54 cartas; 378 perguntas e respectivas respostas; 4 graus de dificuldade. Instruções em Português

name: Tac-Tile Choss
description:
Tac-Tile Choss is Japanese dialect which is used at Hokkaido, Aomori and other north areas of Japan. It means touch, feel or finger.

"Choss" is a matching game with shapes and colors playable using only your sense of touch, sight is not required. Everyone, whether they are sighted or sight impaired, can enjoy playing together with equal footing.

Close your eyes, play the game and have fun conversation with everyone through the game.

The touch based components
There are 25 Tac-Tile tile pieces in the game. There are only 4 colors, pink, white, black, blue. But to help distinguish between the colors each color has a different touch pattern on the tile piece. e.g. the pink tile has 2 gems which protrude like braille, and the blue tiles have 3. Each Tac-Tile is enclosed in a wooden cap, and is played on a wooden board with indents to fit each cap.

How to Play:
All the pieces are placed face-down in the middle of the table.
On a player's turn they draw a piece and try to match it with any they have in their hand.
If they get a match they can reveal it or wait until they get a better match.

How to win
Points are award to matching the same shaped tiles, or bonus points are award if the shape and colors match.
If they match 3 different shapes of the same color they can earn the most points.

is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.
Nearly 1000 written and visual questions including 100 "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as History or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Pays de Cornouaille.

Questions relating to all the municipalities in the territory:

Haut Pays Bigouden: Pouldreuzic, Gourlizon, Guiler-sur-Goyen, Landudec, Peumerit, Plogastel-Saint-Germain, Plonéour-Lanvern, Plovan, Plozévet, Tréogat
Pays Bigouden Sud: Combrit, Le Guilvinec, Île-Tudy, Loctudy, Penmarc'h, Plobannalec-Lesconil, Plomeur, Pont-l'Abbé, Saint-Jean-Trolimon, Treffiagat, Tréguennec, Tréméoc
Quimper Community: Ergué-Gabéric, Guengat, Plogonnec, Plomelin, Plonéis, Pluguffan, Quimper
Fouesnantais country: Bénodet, Clohars-Fouesnant, La Forêt-Fouesnant, Fouesnant, Gouesnac'h, Pleuven, Saint-Evarzec
Pays de Châteaulin Porzay: Cast, Châteaulin, Dinéault, Ploéven, Plomodiern, Plonévez-Porzay, Port-Launay, Quéménéven, Saint-Coulitz, Saint-Nic, Trégarvan
Glazik country: Briec, Edern, Landrévarzec, Landudal, Langolen,
Cap Sizun: Audierne, Beuzec-Cap-Sizun, Cléden-Cap-Sizun, Confort-Meilars, Esquibien, Goulien, Mahalon, Plogoff, Plouhinec, Pont-Croix, Primelin.
Pays de Douarnenez: Douarnenez, Poullan sur mer, Pouldergat, Le Juch, Kerlaz
Pays de Quimperlé: Arzano Bannalec, Baye, Clohars-Carnoët, Guilligomarc'h, Locunolé, Mellac, Moëlan-sur-Mer, Querrien, Quimperlé, Rédené, Riec-sur-Belon, Saint-Thurien, Scaër, Tréméven, Le Trévoux
Pays de Concarneau Cornouaille: Concarneau, Elliant, Melgven, Nevez, Pont-Aven, Rosporden, Saint-Yvi, Tourc'h, Trégunc
+ the municipalities of Locronan and Ile de Sein

name: The Eldritch Mines
description:
It’s the 1920s. You are a private investigator and you’ve been hot on the trail of a local cult looking to awaken a great Elder Demon. You’ve tracked them to an abandoned mine outside of town. You’ll need to act quickly if you want to stop the horrific ritual and close the gate to the Elder Realm before the demon comes through.

The Eldritch Mines is a single page Roll + Write RPG using the Delve12 system - a simplistic game system that utilizes a 12 Sided Dice.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Maze, Print & Play
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Le Grisbi
description:
Le Grisbi is a friendly, family-friendly card game whose references immerse you in the world of French cinema, each game combining luck and strategy!

With easy intergenerational references, anyone can play.

And why not end up watching the films mentioned together? But the winner chooses!

1 deck of 53 cards will allow up to 5 players to play,
2 decks, up to 9
etc...

Le Grisbi is made up of 53 game cards and 3 double-sided rule cards.
The 53 cards in the game are divided into 2 categories:

40 numbered cards (4 series of cards ranging from 1 to 10)
13 special cards (with super powers)


Game play:

Each player starts with 3 cards face down in front of them covered with 3 cards face up and 3 cards in their hand. The rest of the cards serve as a draw pile.

The first player begins by putting on the table one or more cards of the same value located in her hand. At this point she must draw the number of cards sufficient to have at least three cards in her hand. The next player must put one or more cards of equal or greater value than the previous number card and draw accordingly and so on. If he cannot play or if tactically he finds it more interesting, the player recovers the game pile and starts a new pile. As long as there is a draw pile all players must have at least 3 cards in hand. Otherwise a player can say "Grisbi" and designate the person who does not have 3 cards in hand and this person will have to recover the game pile. The player who said "Grisbi" starts playing again.

Once the draw is completed, players play all the cards they have in their hand. When it is done, the player can recover his new deck by taking the cards face up located in front of him. He plays as before until he has no more cards.
Then, on the third phase, the player, when it is his turn, turns over a card face down at random and places it on the pile. If the played card remains in the rule, the game continues and it is up to the next player. If the placed card does not respect the rule, the player takes the playing pile back into hand and must get rid of it before moving on to the next face down card.

The first to get rid of all his cards wins and the game ends when there is only one player left.
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Island Hunters TCG
description:
Island Hunters is a trading card game of Monsters, Items, Resources and more! Almost all current cards have an keyword that effects the game in someway.

It is a fun, strategic deck-building game for two, where players use their deck of 60 cards and battle one another. Players race to gain Island Essence in hopes to release their ELITE cards onto the board! Be the first person to destroy the enemy's Health Totem and walk away knowing you can conquer any island.

—description from the designer

name: Mit Ach und Krach gibt's doch ein Dach
description:
It's a rainy day in the woods. The imps (players) take turns to place their tokens onto the game board. The goal is to build a roof by occupying all three spaces that form a red or blue triangle. If a player completes a roof, he may remove an opponent token from the board. When all tokens are placed, the players move 1 token by one space each turn. To move between red and blue spaces is only possible via the greeen space in the center of the board. Any token moving onto the green space has to leave it next turn.

The first player who has only two tokens left, loses the game.

name: Unity: Anti-Tank Weapons of Unified Space – For Renegade Scout 2nd edition
description:
Unity: Anti-Tank weapons of Unified Space is the second supplement for Renegade Scout 2nd edition, it expands the range of vehicle and anti-vehicle options available in the game:

3 new weapon traits (Melt, Guided, Ammo)
2 new vehicle modifications (Target selector, Deflection field packs)
4 new weapon systems.
New ammunition types for mortars, rocket launchers, main guns and auto cannon.
As well as brief flavor text detailing anti-tank fighting in Unified Space.


The "..of Unified Space" series is intending to be a series of small, bite-sized expansions for Renegade Scout 2nd edition, adding new content and options to the game system, expanding the universe and generally increasing the amount of fun to be had.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Trivial Pursuit: Rhône-Alpes
description:
